abandon /əˈbændən/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to stop doing an activity before you have finished it từ bỏ, đầu hàng, không làm nữa dù chưa xong
Ví dụ:
  • The game was abandoned at half-time because of the poor weather conditions.
  • They had to abandon their attempt to climb the mountain.

abdomen /ˈæbdəmən/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the part of the body below the chest that contains the stomach, bowels, etc vùng bụng

abdominal /æbˈdɑːmɪnl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
connected with the the part of the body below the chest (Thuộc) Bụng; ở bụng.
Ví dụ:
  • abdominal pains

abduct /æbˈdʌkt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to take somebody away illegally, especially using force [synonym] kidnap Bắt cóc, cuỗm đi, lừa đem đi
Ví dụ:
  • He had attempted to abduct the two children
  • The company director was abducted from his car by terrorists.

abductor /æbˈdʌktər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a person who abducts somebody Người bắt cóc, người cuỗm đi, người lừa đem đi
Ví dụ:
  • She was tortured by her abductors.
  • It is thought that the woman might have known her abductor.

abide /əˈbaɪd/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(formal) to accept and act according to a law, an agreement, etc (+ by) Tôn trọng, giữ, tuân theo, chịu theo; trung thành với
Ví dụ:
  • You'll have to abide by the rules of the club.
  • We will abide by their decision

ability /əˈbɪləti/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the physical or mental power or skill needed to do something Năng lực, khả năng (làm việc gì) (Số nhiều) Tài năng, tài cán.
Ví dụ:
  • She had the ability to explain things clearly and concisely.
  • She's a woman of considerable abilities.

abolish /əˈbɑːlɪʃ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to officially end a law, a system or an institution bãi bỏ, huỷ bỏ
Ví dụ:
  • This tax should be abolished.
  • I think bullfighting should be abolished
  • National Service was abolished in the UK in 1962.

absence /ˈæbsəns/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the fact of somebody being away from a place where they are usually expected to be Sự vắng mặt, sự nghỉ (học), sự đi vắng; thời gian vắng mặt, lúc đi vắng.
Ví dụ:
  • The decision was made in my absence (= while I was not there).
  • We did not receive any news during his long absence.
  • Unbeknown to me, he'd gone and rented out the apartment in my absence.

absent /ˈæbsənt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
not in the place where you are expected to be, especially at school or work Vắng mặt, đi vắng, nghỉ.
Ví dụ:
  • John has been absent from school/work for three days now.
  • If a child is absent, the teacher notes it down in the class register.

absorb /əbˈzɔːrb/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to take something in, especially gradually Hấp thu
Ví dụ:
  • Plants absorb carbon dioxide.
  • In cold climates, houses need to have walls that will absorb heat.
  • Towels absorb moisture.
  • The drug is quickly absorbed into the bloodstream.

abstract /ˈæbstrækt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
existing as an idea, feeling, or quality, not as a material object Trừu tượng Khó hiểu.
Ví dụ:
  • Truth and beauty are abstract concepts

abstract art /ˈæbstrækt 'ɑrt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
It has colour, lines and shapes (form), but they are not intended to represent objects or living things Often the artists were influenced by ideas and philosophies [1] [Nghệ thuật Trừu tượng] là trào lưu hội họa đầu thế kỷ 20, vào những năm 1910 đến 1914 Nghệ thuật trừu tượng không thể hiện đối tượng một cách hiện thực như mắt nhìn thấy mà biểu thị những ý nghĩ, cảm xúc của nghệ sĩ về một vài nét nào đó của đối tượng

abuse /əˈbjuːs/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to use something for the wrong purpose in a way that is harmful or morally wrong to treat someone cruelly or violently lạm dụng, lộng hành Lăng mạ, sỉ nhục, chửi rủa.
Ví dụ:
  • She is continually abusing her position/authority by getting other people to do things for her
  • If you abuse your body now, you'll pay the price when you're older.
  • Several of the children had been sexually/physically/emotionally abused.

abuzz /əˈbʌz/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to befilled with noise and activity Đầy tiếng rì rầm, ồn ào Đầy những hoạt động
Ví dụ:
  • When we arrived, the party was in full swing and the room was abuzz.
  • The air was abuzz with military helicopters.

acclimatise /əˈklaɪmətaɪz/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to get used to a new place, situation or climate (Từ hiếm,nghĩa hiếm) Thích nghi khí hậu. Thích nghi với môi trường.
Ví dụ:
  • Arrive two days early in order to acclimatize
  • It takes many months to acclimatize to life in the tropics
  • We haven’t got acclimatized to village life yet.

accommodate /əˈkɑːmədeɪt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to give what is needed to someone Đáp ứng nhu cầu của ai đóCung cấp, cấp cho, kiếm cho ai đó thứ họ cần
Ví dụ:
  • The new policies fail to accommodate the disabled.
  • We always try to accommodate (= help) our clients with financial assistance if necessary.

accommodation /əˌkɑːməˈdeɪʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
somewhere to live or stay, often also providing food or other services chỗ trọ, chỗ ăn chỗ ở
Ví dụ:
  • There's a shortage of cheap accommodation (= places to live)

accompany /əˈkʌmpəni/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to happen or appear with something else Đi theo, đi cùng, đi kèm, hộ tống. Phụ thêm, kèm theo.
Ví dụ:
  • strong winds accompanied by heavy rain
  • The text is accompanied by a series of stunning photographs.

accomplished /əˈkɑːmplɪʃt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
skilled;very good at a particular thing; having a lot of skills Được giáo dục kĩ lưỡng, có đầy đủ tài năng; hoàn hảo, hoàn mĩ, tài hoa, (về nhạc, hoạ, nữ công, )
Ví dụ:
  • She's a very accomplished pianist/painter/horsewoman.
  • He was accomplished in all the arts.

account /əˈkaʊnt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to explain the reason for something (+ for) Giải thích (cho).
Ví dụ:
  • The poor weather may have accounted for the small crowd

accuracy /ˈækjərəsi/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the state of being exact or correct; the ability to do something skilfully without making mistakes sự đúng đắn, sự chính xác; độ chính xác
Ví dụ:
  • We can predict changes with a surprising degree of accuracy

accurate /ˈækjərət/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
correct, exact, and without any mistakes đúng đắn, chính xác, xác đáng
Ví dụ:
  • We hope to become more accurate in predicting earthquakes.

accuse /əˈkjuːz/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to say that somebody has done something wrong or is guilty of something Cáo buộc, buộc tội, kết tội; tố cáo
Ví dụ:
  • to accuse somebody of murder/theft
  • She accused him of lying.

achievable /əˈtʃiːvəbl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(of a goal, status or standard) that can be reached, especially by making an effort for a long time Có thể đạt được, có thể thực hiện được
Ví dụ:
  • Profits of $20m look achievable.
  • Before you set your targets, make sure that they are achievable.
  • opposite unachievable

acquire /əˈkwaɪər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to get something Được, giành được, thu được, đạt được, kiếm được.
Ví dụ:
  • He acquired the firm in 2008.
  • I was wearing a newly/recently acquired jacket.
  • I seem to have acquired (= have got although I don't know how) two copies of this book.
  • He has acquired a reputation for being difficult to work with.

acquisition /ˌækwɪˈzɪʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the act of getting something, especially knowledge, a skill, etc Sự giành được, sự thu được, sự đạt được, sự kiếm được. Cái giành được, cái thu nhận được.
Ví dụ:
  • The acquisition of huge amounts of data has helped our research enormously.
  • Language acquisition (= learning a language without being taught) starts at a very young age.

acquit /əˈkwɪt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to decide and state officially in court that somebody is not guilty of a crime [opposite]convict Tha bổng, tha tội, tuyên bố trắng án
Ví dụ:
  • The jury acquitted him of murder.
  • Both defendants were acquitted.
  • She was acquitted on all charges.
  • He was acquitted on the grounds of insufficient evidence.

acre /ˈeɪkər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a unit for measuring an area of land; 4 840 square yards or about 4 050 square metres Mẫu Anh (khoảng 0, 4 hecta)
Ví dụ:
  • 3 000 acres of parkland
  • a three-acre wood

actor /ˈæktər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
someone who pretends to be someone else while performing in a film, play, or television or radio programme Diễn viên (kịch, tuồng, chèo, điện ảnh ); kép, kép hát Nam diễn viên.
Ví dụ:
  • "Who's your favourite actor?" "Robert de Niro
  • "
  • He is certainly the finest actor in Hollywood today
  • As an actor he could communicate a whole range of emotions.

actress /ˈæktrəs/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a female actor Nữ diễn viên, đào hát
Ví dụ:
  • She's the highest-paid actress in Hollywood

acupuncture /ˈækjupʌŋktʃər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a Chinese method of treating pain and illness using special thin needles which are pushed into the skin in particular parts of the body (Y học) Thuật châm cứu
Ví dụ:
  • Acupuncture has been practised in China for thousands of years.
  • I’m having acupuncture for a bad back.

acute /əˈkjuːt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
An acute pain or illness is one that quickly becomes very severe (Y học) Cấp tínhBuốt, gay gắc, kịch liệt, sâu sắc.
Ví dụ:
  • acute abdominal pains

adapt /əˈdæpt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to become familiar with a new situation Thích nghi (với môi trường ).
Ví dụ:
  • It took me a while to adapt to the new job

adaptation /ˌædæpˈteɪʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the process of changing to suit different conditions Sự thích nghi.
Ví dụ:
  • the adaptation of desert species to the hot conditions

addict /ˈædɪkt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a person who cannot stop doing or using something, especially something harmful Người nghiện
Ví dụ:
  • a drug/heroin addict
  • a gambling addict
  • I'm a chocolate/shopping addict.

addiction /əˈdɪkʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the need or strong desire to do or to have something, or a very strong liking for something Thói nghiện. Sự ham mê, sự say mê.
Ví dụ:
  • cocaine addiction
  • He is now fighting his addiction to alcohol.

addictive /əˈdɪktɪv/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
making you cannot stop doing/using it gây nghiện
Ví dụ:
  • Tobacco is highly addictive
  • The problem with video games is that they're addictive.

adequate /ˈædɪkwət/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
enough or satisfactory for a particular purpose Đủ, đầy đủ
Ví dụ:
  • Have we got adequate food for 20 guests?
  • I didn't have adequate time to prepare.
  • It's not a big salary but it's adequate for our needs

adjacent /əˈdʒeɪsnt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(of an area, a building, a room, etc ) next to or near something Gần kề, kế liền, ngay sát bên cạnh
Ví dụ:
  • Our farm land was adjacent to the river.
  • There is a row of houses immediately adjacent to the factory.

adjust /əˈdʒʌst/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to change something slightly, especially to make it more correct, effective, or suitable Sửa lại cho đúng, điều chỉnh Chỉnh lý, làm cho thích hợp.
Ví dụ:
  • If the chair is too high you can adjust it to suit you.
  • As a teacher you have to adjust your methods to suit the needs of slower children.

administrative /ədˈmɪnɪstreɪtɪv/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
connected with organizing the work of a business or an institution (Thuộc) Hành chính, (thuộc) quản trị. (Thuộc) Chính quyền, (thuộc) nhà nước.
Ví dụ:
  • administrative affairs — công việc nhà nước, công việc quản lýadministrative power — chính quyền
  • Your responsibilities will be mainly administrative.

adolescence /ˌædəˈlesns/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the time in a person’s life when he or she develops from a child into an adult (= puberty) Tuổi dậy thì, tuổi teen
Ví dụ:
  • Adolescence brings about major changes in a young person’s body.
  • She had a troubled adolescence
  • yet another novel about the joys and sorrows of adolescence

adolescent /ˌædəˈlesnt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a young person who is developing into an adult Người thiếu niên.
Ví dụ:
  • He looked uncomfortable, like a self-conscious adolescent who's gone to the wrong party.
  • I'm looking after six adolescents for a week.
  • She doesn't understand the emotional problems of adolescents.

adopt /əˈdɑːpt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
[[child]]to take somebody else’s child into your family and become its legal parent(s) Nhận làm con nuôi[[method/attitude]]to start to use a particular method or to show a particular attitude towards somebody/something bắt đầu sử dụng một phương pháp mới bắt đầu có một thái độ mới
Ví dụ:
  • to adopt a child
  • All three teams adopted different approaches to the problem.
  • He's adopted a remarkably light-hearted attitude towards the situation.

adulthood /əˈdʌlthʊd/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the part of someone's life when they are an adult Tuổi khôn lớn, tuổi trưởng thành
Ví dụ:
  • a child reaching adulthood
  • Her childhood problems persisted into adulthood
  • People in England legally reach adulthood at 18
  • Responsibility, I suppose, is what defines adulthood.

advance /ədˈvæns/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
before the time that is expected; before something happens Trước, sớm.
Ví dụ:
  • It's cheaper if you book the tickets in advance
  • People were evacuated from the coastal regions in advance of the hurricane.

advanced /ədˈvænst/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
having the most modern and recently developed ideas, methods, etc Tiên tiến, tiến bộ, cấp tiến
Ví dụ:
  • advanced technology
  • advanced industrial societies

advantageous /ˌædvənˈteɪdʒəs/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
good or useful in a particular situation [synonym] beneficial Có lợi, thuận lợi
Ví dụ:
  • A free trade agreement would be advantageous to both countries.
  • The lower tax rate is particularly advantageous to poorer families.

adventurous /ədˈventʃərəs/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(of a person) willing to take risks and try new ideas; enjoying being in new, exciting situations Thích phiêu lưu, thích mạo hiểm, phiêu lưu, mạo hiểm Liều lĩnh.
Ví dụ:
  • For the more adventurous tourists, there are trips into the mountains with a local guide.
  • Many teachers would like to be more adventurous and creative.

advertisement /ˌædvərˈtaɪzmənt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(informal ad) (also British English, informal advert) a notice, picture or film telling people about a product, job or service Sự quảng cáo; bài quảng cáo (trên báo, trên đài )
Ví dụ:
  • Put an advertisement in the local paper to sell your car.
  • She scanned the job/property advertisements in the paper.

advocate /ˈædvəkət/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a person who supports or speaks in favour of somebody or of a public plan or action Người chủ trương; người tán thành, người ủng hộ
Ví dụ:
  • He's a strong advocate of state ownership of the railways
  • an advocate for hospital workers

aesthetic /esˈθetɪk/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
concerned with beauty and art and the understanding of beautiful things made in an artistic way and beautiful to look at (Thuộc) Mỹ học, thẩm mỹ Có óc thẩm mỹ, có khiếu thẩm mỹ; hợp với nguyên tắc thẩm mỹ.
Ví dụ:
  • an aesthetic appreciation of the landscape
  • Their furniture was more aesthetic than functional.

aesthetics /esˈθet̬. ɪks/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
​the formal study of art, especially in relation to the idea of beauty Mỹ học.

affect /əˈfekt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to have an influence on someone or something Làm ảnh hưởng đến, làm tác động đến; chạm đến.
Ví dụ:
  • Farmers and market gardeners have been badly affected by the drought

affection /əˈfekʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a feeling of liking or love for a person or place (Thường + towards, for) Lòng yêu thương, sự yêu mến, tình cảm, thiện ý.
Ví dụ:
  • Children need lots of love and affection.
  • He didn't show his wife any affection.
  • She was held in deep affection by all her students.

age /eɪdʒ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a particular period of history thời đại, thời kỳ
Ví dụ:
  • the Victorian age
  • the modern age
  • the age of the computer

aggravate /ˈæɡrəveɪt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to make an illness or a bad or unpleasant situation worse [synonym] worsen Làm trầm trọng thêm, làm nặng thêm, làm nguy ngập thêm, làm xấu thêm
Ví dụ:
  • Pollution can aggravate asthma.
  • Attempts to restrict parking in the city centre have further aggravated the problem of traffic congestion.

aggression /əˈɡreʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
feelings of anger and hatred that may result in threatening or violent behaviour sự hung hăng, sự hiếu chiến, sự kích động, cơn tức giận
Ví dụ:
  • Does your dog show aggression towards any strangers or just towards men?
  • You have to learn to control your aggression in order to avoid serious conflict.

aggressive /əˈɡresɪv/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
angry, and behaving in a threatening way; ready to attack Hay tấn công, gây sự, gây gỗ, gây hấn, hung hăng, hùng hổ
Ví dụ:
  • Men tend to be more aggressive than women.
  • If I criticize him, he gets aggressive and starts shouting.

agriculture /ˈæɡrɪkʌltʃər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the science or practice of farming Nông nghiệp
Ví dụ:
  • The number of people employed in agriculture has fallen in the last decade.
  • 50% of the country’s population depends on agriculture.

airy /ˈeri/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
with plenty of fresh air because there is a lot of space Thoáng khí, thông khí, thoáng gió, lộng gió.
Ví dụ:
  • The office was light and airy.
  • Dry the seeds in a cool, airy place.

alarming /əˈlɑːrmɪŋ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
causing worry and fear đáng báo động, đáng lo ngại
Ví dụ:
  • alarming news
  • Beijing air pollution soars to alarming levels

alcohol /ˈælkəhɔːl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
drinks such as beer, wine, etc that can make people drunk rượu, bia, đồ uống có cồn
Ví dụ:
  • I could smell the alcohol on his breath

algae /ˈælɡiː/ or /ˈældʒiː/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
very simple plants, such as seaweed, that have no real leaves, stems or roots, and that grow in or near water (Thực vật học) Tảo

allergy /ˈælərdʒi/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
difficulty digesting certain foods and having an unpleasant physical reaction to them dị ứng thức ăn
Ví dụ:
  • an allergy to wheat
  • a wheat allergy

alternate /ˈɔːltərnət/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
with first one thing, then another thing, and then the first thing again Xen kẽ, xen nhau, luân phiên nhau, thay phiên.
Ví dụ:
  • a dessert with alternate layers of fruit and cream
  • Stretch up 30 times with alternate arms as a warm-up exercise.

alternative /ɔːlˈtɜːrnətɪv/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a thing that you can choose to do or have out of two or more possibilities Sự lựa chon (một trong hai). Con đường, chước cách.
Ví dụ:
  • We can agree to their terms or else pull out of the deal completely: those are the two alternatives.
  • We had no alternative but to fire Gibson.
  • There is a vegetarian alternative on the menu every day.

alternative fuel /ɔːlˌtɜːrnətɪv ˈfjuːəl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
fuel that can be used instead of fossil fuels such as coal and oil, and instead of nuclear fuel những nguồn “nhiên liệu xanh” để thay thế cho xăng dầu có nguồn gốc từ hoá thạch

altogether /ˌɔːltəˈɡeðər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(used to emphasize something) completely; in every way Hoàn toàn, hầu, hẳn Nhìn chung, nói chung; nhìn toàn bộ. Cả thảy, tất cả.
Ví dụ:
  • The train went slower and slower until it stopped altogether.
  • It was an altogether different situation.
  • I’m not altogether convinced, I’m afraid.

ambitious /æmˈbɪʃəs/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
tham vọng, đặt ra kỳ vọng cao
Ví dụ:
  • the government’s ambitious plans for social reform
  • Jogging every morning? That’s very ambitious, isn’t it?

amend /əˈmend/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to change a law, document, statement, etc slightly in order to correct a mistake or to improve it Sửa đổi, thay đổi (văn kiện pháp lý); bổ sung (chỗ thiếu sót, sai lầm trong một văn kiện )
Ví dụ:
  • MPs were urged to amend the law to prevent another oil tanker disaster.
  • In line 20, "men" should be amended (= changed) to "people".

amused /əˈmjuːzd/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
thinking that somebody/something is funny, so that you smile or laugh thấy buồn cười, thấy vui
Ví dụ:
  • She was very amused by/at your comments.
  • Janet was not amused (= she was annoyed or angry).

analogue /ˈænəlɔːɡ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(of a clock or watch) showing the time using hands on a dial and not with a display of numbers dùng cơ chế cơ học, không phải điện tử (VD đồng hồ cơ)
Ví dụ:
  • analogue watch

anatomy /əˈnætəmi/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the structure of an animal or a plant cấu trúc giải phẫu cơ thể
Ví dụ:
  • the anatomy of the horse
  • human anatomy

ancient /ˈeɪnʃənt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
of or from a long time ago, having lasted for a very long time Xưa, cổ
Ví dụ:
  • the ancient kingdoms of Mexico
  • People have lived in this valley since ancient times.

antibiotic /ˌæntibaɪˈɑːtɪk/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
containing or using a substance, for example penicillin, that can destroy or prevent the growth of bacteria and cure infections Thuốc kháng sinh
Ví dụ:
  • I'm taking antibiotics for a throat infection
  • Some types of antibiotic are used to promote growth in farm animals.

anticipation /ænˌtɪsɪˈpeɪʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
in preparation for something happening sự chuẩn bị trước, sự tiên liệu trước
Ví dụ:
  • She bought extra food in anticipation of more people coming than she'd invited

anxiety /æŋˈzaɪəti/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the state of feeling nervous or worried that something bad is going to happen Mối lo, mối lo âu, mối băn khoăn; sự lo lắng.
Ví dụ:
  • Waiting for exam results is a time of great anxiety

anxious /ˈæŋk. ʃəs/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
feeling worried or nervous Áy náy, lo âu, lo lắng, băn khoăn
Ví dụ:
  • He seemed anxious about the meeting
  • Parents are naturally anxious for their children.

apparatus /ˌæpəˈrætəs/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a system of organs in the body (Sinh vật học) Bộ máy.
Ví dụ:
  • the sensory apparatus

apparel /əˈpærəl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
clothing, when it is being sold in shops/stores Quần áo, y phục
Ví dụ:
  • The store sells women's and children's apparel

apparent /əˈpærənt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
easy to see or understand [synonym] obvious rõ ràng, bày tỏ ra ngoài, thấy rõ ra ngoài Rõ rành rành, hiển nhiên, không thể chối cãi được.
Ví dụ:
  • It was apparent from her face that she was really upset
  • It soon became apparent to everyone that he couldn't sing.

appeal /əˈpiːl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to attract or interest somebody
Ví dụ:
  • It's a programme designed to appeal mainly to 16 to 25-year-olds.
  • I think what appeals to me about his painting is his use of colour.

appealing /əˈpiːlɪŋ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
attractive or interesting Lôi cuốn, quyến rũ
Ví dụ:
  • The idea of not having to get up early every morning is rather appealing (to me).
  • Brightly coloured packaging made the pens especially appealing to children
  • opposite unappealing

appetite /ˈæpɪtaɪt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the feeling that you want to eat food cảm giác thèm ăn
Ví dụ:
  • The walk gave me a good appetite.
  • Don't spoil your appetite by eating between meals.
  • He suffered from headaches and loss of appetite.

appliance /əˈplaɪəns/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a device, machine, or piece of equipment, especially an electrical one that is used in the house, such as a cooker or washing machine Đồ thiết bị, trang thiết bị, dụng cụ
Ví dụ:
  • electrical/household appliances
  • They sell a wide range of domestic appliances—washing machines, dishwashers and so on.

appraisal /əˈpreɪzl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the act of examining someone or something in order to judge their qualities, success, or needs Sự đánh giá; sự định giá
Ví dụ:
  • He had read many detailed critical appraisals of her work.
  • She was honest in her appraisal of her team's chances.

appreciate /əˈpriːʃieɪt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to recognize how good someone or something is and to value him, her, or it Biết thưởng thức, biết đánh giá Đánh giá đúng, đánh giá cao, hiểu rõ giá trị.
Ví dụ:
  • His talents are not fully appreciated in that company
  • There's no point buying him expensive wines - he doesn't appreciate them.

appreciation /əˌpriːʃiˈeɪʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the act of recognizing or understanding that something is valuable, important, or as described Sự đánh giá đúng, sự đánh giá cao, sự hiểu rõ giá trị. Sự biết thưởng thức, sự biết đánh giá.
Ví dụ:
  • She shows little appreciation of good music.
  • Children rarely show any appreciation of/for what their parents do for them
  • These flowers are a token of my appreciation of/for all your help.

approach /əˈproʊtʃ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a way of dealing with somebody/something a way of doing or thinking about something such as a problem or a task Cách tiếp cận, phương pháp giải quyết (một vấn đề)
Ví dụ:
  • She took the wrong approach in her dealings with them.
  • The school has decided to adopt a different approach to discipline.

appropriate /əˈproʊpriət/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
suitable, acceptable or correct for the particular circumstances Thích hợp, thích đáng.
Ví dụ:
  • Jeans are not appropriate for a formal party.
  • Now that the problem has been identified, appropriate action can be taken.
  • Is now an appropriate time to make a speech?

apt /æpt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
suitable or right for a particular situation Thích hợp, đúng, phù hợp Chuẩn không cần chỉnh
Ví dụ:
  • a particularly apt description/name/comment

aquatic /əˈkwætɪk/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
connected with water Sống ở nước, mọc ở nước. (Thể dục,thể thao) Chơi ở dưới nước (ví dụ bóng nước ).
Ví dụ:
  • aquatic sports
  • aquatic plants/life/ecosystems

archeological /ˌɑːrkiəˈlɑːdʒɪkl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
involving or relating to archeology liên quan đến khảo cổ học
Ví dụ:
  • archeological excavations/evidence

archeologist /ˌɑːrkiˈɑːlədʒɪst/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
someone who studies the buildings, graves, tools, and other objects of people who lived in the past Nhà khảo cổ.
Ví dụ:
  • The site of the temple was discovered by a group of amateur archaeologists

archeology /ˌɑːrkiˈɑːlədʒi/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the study of the buildings, graves, tools, and other objects that belonged to people who lived in the past, in order to learn about their culture and society Khảo cổ học.
Ví dụ:
  • Daniel is very interested in history and archaeology, and often visits historic sites

architect /ˈɑːrkɪtekt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a person whose job is designing buildings Kiến trúc sư.
Ví dụ:
  • The house was designed by architect Louis Kahn

architectural /ˌɑːrkɪˈtektʃərəl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
connected with architecture liên quan đến kiến trúc
Ví dụ:
  • architectural features
  • architectural drawings/plans

architecture /ˈɑːrkɪtektʃər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the art and study of designing buildings môn kiến trúc, kiểu kiến trúc
Ví dụ:
  • to study architecture

capital /ˈkæpɪtl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the most important town or city of a country, usually where the central government operates from Thủ đô, thủ phủ.
Ví dụ:
  • Australia's capital city is Canberra
  • Cairo is the capital of Egypt.

capital punishment /ˌkæpɪtl ˈpʌnɪʃmənt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
punishment by death án tử hình (=death penalty)
Ví dụ:
  • Public opinion was in favour of bringing back capital punishment

capsule /ˈkæpsuːl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a small container with medicine inside that you swallow (Dược học) Bao con nhộng
Ví dụ:
  • The medicine can be taken in tablet or capsule form.

carbon /ˈkɑːrbən/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a chemical element that exists in its pure form as diamond or graphite, and is an important part of other substances such as coal and oil (Hoá học) Cacbon
Ví dụ:
  • New legislation aims to reduce carbon emissions
  • Iron with a high carbon content

career /kəˈrɪr/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the series of jobs that a person has in a particular area of work, usually involving more responsibility as time passes Sự nghiệp (của một người)
Ví dụ:
  • a career in politics
  • a teaching career
  • What made you decide on a career as a vet?
  • She has been concentrating on her career.

carnation /kɑːrˈneɪʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(a plant with) a small flower with a sweet smell, usually white, pink, or red in colour Hoa cẩm chướng.
Ví dụ:
  • He was wearing a carnation in his buttonhole

carve /kɑːrv/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to make something by cutting into especially wood or stone, or to cut into the surface of stone, wood, etc Khắc, tạc, chạm, đục.
Ví dụ:
  • This totem pole is carved from/out of a single tree trunk.
  • He carved her name on a tree.
  • Some of the tunnels in the cliff are natural, some were carved out (= cut into the rock) by soldiers for defensive purposes.

carving /ˈkɑːrvɪŋ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a shape or pattern cut into wood or stone or the skill of doing this Nghệ thuật khắc, nghệ thuật tạc, nghệ thuật chạm
Ví dụ:
  • wooden/stone carvings

cast-off /ˈkæst ɔːf/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a piece of clothing that the original owner no longer wants to wear quần áo cũ bị bỏ đi, không dùng đến nữa
Ví dụ:
  • She used to wear her sister’s cast-offs

casual /ˈkæʒuəl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
[of work] not permanent; not done, or doing something regularly Không đều, thất thường, lúc có lúc không
Ví dụ:
  • casual workers/labour — người lao công có việc làm thất thường, người lao công không có việc làm cố định
  • Students sometimes do casual work in the tourist trade.
  • They are employed on a casual basis (= they do not have a permanent job with the company).

catastrophe /kəˈtæstrəfi/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a sudden event that causes many people to suffer [synonym] disaster Tai ương, tai biến, thảm hoạ, tai hoạ lớn
Ví dụ:
  • Early warnings of rising water levels prevented another major catastrophe
  • We've had a few catastrophes with the food for the party.

catastrophic /ˌkætəˈstrɑːfɪk/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(of a natural event) causing a lot of damage and suffering [synonym] disastrous causing a lot of problems for people [synonym]disastrous có tínhthảm hoạ, vô cùng thê thảm
Ví dụ:
  • a catastrophic earthquake/flood/wildfire
  • a catastrophic failure/collapse/defeat

cater /ˈkeɪtər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to provide the things that a particular person or situation needs or wants phục vụ nhu cầu của ai hay cái gì
Ví dụ:
  • The club caters for children between the ages of four and twelve
  • She runs a specialist company that caters for people with food allergies.
  • It is a resort that clearly caters for the well-off.

cathedral /kəˈθiːdrəl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a very large, usually stone, building for Christian worship (Công giáo) Nhà thờ chính tòa; nhà thờ lớn

cattle /ˈkætl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
cows and bulls that are kept for their milk or meat Thú nuôi, gia súc
Ví dụ:
  • The farmer grazes cattle on this land in the summer months
  • a herd of cattle

cauliflower /ˈkɑːliflaʊər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a vegetable with green leaves around a large hard white head of flowers (Thực vật học) Cải hoa, hoa lơ, súp lơ
Ví dụ:
  • Do you like cauliflower?
  • two cauliflowers

ceiling /ˈsiːlɪŋ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the inside surface of a room that you can see when you look above you Trần (nhà )
Ví dụ:
  • She lay on her back staring up at the ceiling.
  • a large room with a high ceiling
  • The walls and ceiling were painted white.

celebrity /səˈlebrəti/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a famous person Nhân vật có danh tiếng, người nổi danh
Ví dụ:
  • TV celebrities

censor /ˈsensər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to remove the parts of a book, film/movie, etc that are considered to be offensive, immoral or a political threat (dạng chủ động) kiểm duyệt. (dạng bị động) bị kiểm duyệt cắt đi.
Ví dụ:
  • The news reports had been heavily censored.
  • The book was heavily censored when first published.

censorship /ˈsensərʃɪp/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the act of censoring books, films, etc Công tác kiểm duyệt.
Ví dụ:
  • The government has imposed strict censorship on the press.
  • to take action against institutions practising censorship

certain /ˈsɜːrtn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
firmly believing something; having no doubts Chắc, chắc chắn.
Ví dụ:
  • I feel certain (that) you're doing the right thing

chain /tʃeɪn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a group of shops/stores or hotels owned by the same company chuỗi (cửa hàng, nhà hàng, siêu thị, khách sạn )
Ví dụ:
  • The supermarket chain announced that it was cutting the cost of all its fresh and frozen meat
  • They are not only the world's biggest fast-food chain, but also the industry's trendsetter.

chalk /tʃɔːk/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a type of soft white stone Đá phấn.
Ví dụ:
  • the chalk cliffs of southern England

challenge /ˈtʃælɪndʒ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a new or difficult task that tests somebody’s ability and skill thách thức
Ví dụ:
  • The role will be the biggest challenge of his acting career.
  • Schools must meet the challenge of new technology (= deal with it successfully).

challenging /ˈtʃælɪndʒɪŋ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
difficult, in a way that tests your ability or determination có tính thử thách
Ví dụ:
  • He resigned from the company in order to take a more challenging job.
  • She doesn't find the general knowledge crossword challenging enough.

character /ˈkærəktər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
qualities that are interesting and unusual nét đặc sắc
Ví dụ:
  • a hotel of character
  • I'd prefer an old place with a bit of character.
  • Old books are said to give a room character.
  • As people grow older, their faces acquire more character.

cherish /ˈtʃerɪʃ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to love, protect, and care for someone or something that is important to you trân trọng, yêu thương
Ví dụ:
  • Although I cherish my children, I do allow them their independence.
  • Her most cherished possession is a 1926 letter from F
  • Scott Fitzgerald.
  • Freedom of speech is a cherished (= carefully protected) right in this country.

chew /tʃuː/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to crush food into smaller, softer pieces with the teeth so that it can be swallowed Nhai
Ví dụ:
  • This meat is difficult to chew.
  • You don't chew your food enough - that's why you get indigestion.

childhood /ˈtʃaɪldhʊd/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the period of somebody’s life when they are a child Tuổi thơ ấu, thời thơ ấu
Ví dụ:
  • childhood, adolescence and adulthood
  • in early childhood
  • childhood memories/experiences
  • She had a happy childhood.

chimney /ˈtʃɪmni/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a structure through which smoke or steam is carried up away from a fire, etc and through the roof of a building; the part of this that is above the roof Ống khói
Ví dụ:
  • factory chimneys belching smoke over the town
  • A column of smoke rose from the chimney.

choreograph /ˈkɔːriəɡræf/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to design and arrange the steps and movements for dancers in a ballet or a show Sáng tác và dàn dựng điệu múa
Ví dụ:
  • (figurative) There was some carefully choreographed flag-waving as the President drove by

chronically /ˈkrɑːnɪkli/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(Y học) Mạn, mãn tính, kinh niên.
Ví dụ:
  • a hospital for the chronically ill

chronologically /ˌkrɑːnəˈlɑːdʒɪkli/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
in a way that arranges a number of events in the order in which they happened Theo niên đại, theo thứ tự thời gian.
Ví dụ:
  • The works are arranged chronologically to reveal artistic development over 35 centuries

cinder /ˈsɪndər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a small piece of ash or partly burnt coal, wood, etc that is no longer burning but may still be hot Thanh cháy dở. Xỉ, than xỉ.
Ví dụ:
  • The logs had turned into blackened cinders.
  • a fireplace full of glowing red cinders

circular /ˈsɜːrkjələr/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
shaped like a circle; round Tròn, vòng, vòng quanh.
Ví dụ:
  • a circular building
  • He had round unblinking eyes and a perfectly circular head.
  • The crater was two miles across and roughly circular.

citrus /ˈsɪtrəs/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
fruit belonging to the group of fruit that includes oranges, lemons, limes and grapefruit any of a group of plants that produce acidic fruits with a lot of juice (Thực vật học) Giống cam quít
Ví dụ:
  • The field was planted with citrus trees.
  • Oranges, lemons, limes and grapefruit are types of citrus fruit.

civilization /ˌsɪvələˈzeɪʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the culture and way of life of a society or country at a particular period in time Nền văn minh
Ví dụ:
  • We spent a week visiting the wonders of Ancient Greek civilization.
  • Historians still argue about what causes such a mighty civilization to collapse.

clarify /ˈklærəfaɪ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(formal) to make something clearer or easier to understand Làm rõ, làm cho dễ hiểu hơn
Ví dụ:
  • Could you clarify the first point please? I don't understand it completely.
  • Talking to someone has helped clarify my feelings.

classical music /ˈklæs·ɪ·kəl ˈmju·zɪk/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a form of music developed from a European tradition mainly in the 18th and 19th centuries nhạc cổ điển
Ví dụ:
  • My wife likes classical music but I prefer jazz

claw /klɔː/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
one of the sharp curved nails at the end of each of the toes of some animals and birds Vuốt (mèo, chim). Chân có vuốt.
Ví dụ:
  • Our cat likes to sharpen her claws on the legs of the dining table

cleanse /klenz/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to make something completely clean to make someone or something morally clean or pure làm trong sạch, làm cho tinh khiết
Ví dụ:
  • The mayor has promised to cleanse the city of drug dealers (= to remove them from the city
