Định nghĩa:
clear or obvious without needing any proof Rõ ràng, dứt khoát.
Ví dụ:
  • She has clear-cut evidence that her husband has cheated on her.

clerk /klɜːrk/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a person whose job is to keep the records or accounts in an office, shop/store etc Người thư ký (Từ mỹ,nghĩa mỹ) Người giúp việc bán hàng, nhân viên bán hàng.
Ví dụ:
  • an office clerk

cliff /klɪf/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a high area of rock with a very steep side, often on a coast Vách đá (nhô ra biển)
Ví dụ:
  • We built a house at the foot of a cliff
  • Keep away from the edge of the cliff - you might fall.

climate /ˈklaɪmət/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the regular pattern of weather conditions of a particular place Khí hậu
Ví dụ:
  • a mild/temperate/warm/wet climate
  • the harsh climate of the Arctic regions

climate change /ˈklaɪmət tʃeɪndʒ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
changes in the earth’s weather, especially the increase in the temperature caused by the increase of particular gases, especially carbon dioxide biến đổi khí hậu
Ví dụ:
  • the threat of global climate change

close /kloʊs/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
near in family relationship [opposite] distant Gần, thân, sát.
Ví dụ:
  • close relatives, such as your mother and father, and brothers and sisters

close-knit /ˌkloʊs ˈnɪt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(of a group of people) having strong relationships with each other and taking a close, friendly interest in each other’s activities and problems Gắn bó với nhau (về tình cảm, quyền lợi).
Ví dụ:
  • the close-knit community of a small village

clutter /ˈklʌtər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(a lot of objects in) a state of being untidy sự bừa bãi, lộn xộn (một đống đồ) bừa bãi lộn xộn
Ví dụ:
  • Sorry about the clutter in the kitchen.
  • My desk is covered in/full of clutter.

coast /koʊst/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the land next to or close to the sea bờ biển
Ví dụ:
  • a town on the south coast of England
  • islands off the west coast of Ireland

coastal /ˈkoʊstl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
of or near a coast (thuộc) bờ biển; (thuộc) miền ven biển
Ví dụ:
  • coastal waters/resorts/scenery
  • a coastal path (= one that follows the line of the coast)

coat /koʊt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the hair, wool, or fur covering an animal Bộ lông (thú)
Ví dụ:
  • a dog with a smooth/shaggy coat
  • animals in their winter coats (= grown long for extra warmth)

cognitive /ˈkɑːɡnətɪv/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
connected with thinking or conscious mental processes Liên quan đến nhận thức.
Ví dụ:
  • a child’s cognitive development
  • cognitive psychology
  • They are studying the links between cognitive and linguistic development in young children.
  • This is both a cognitive and an emotional process.

collapse /kəˈlæps/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to fall down suddenly because of pressure or having no strength or support Đổ, sập, sụp, sụp đổ
Ví dụ:
  • The roof collapsed under the weight of snow
  • Thousands of buildings collapsed in the earthquake.

colleague /ˈkɑːliːɡ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a person that you work with, especially in a profession or a business Bạn đồng nghiệp, bạn đồng sự
Ví dụ:
  • a colleague of mine from the office
  • We were friends and colleagues for more than 20 years.

collide /kəˈlaɪd/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(especially of moving objects) to hit something violently Va nhau, đụng nhau
Ví dụ:
  • The two vans collided at the crossroads.
  • It was predicted that a comet would collide with one of the planets.

collision /kəˈlɪʒn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
an accident in which two vehicles or people crash into each other Sự đụng, sự va
Ví dụ:
  • a collision between two trains
  • Stewart was injured in a collision with another player.

colonize /ˈkɑːlənaɪz/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to take control of an area or a country that is not your own, especially using force, and send people from your own country to live there Chiếm làm thuộc địa
Ví dụ:
  • The area was colonized by the Vikings

colony /ˈkɑːləni/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a country or an area that is governed by people from another, more powerful, country Thuộc địa
Ví dụ:
  • Australia and New Zealand are former British colonies

combat /ˈkɑːmbæt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to stop something unpleasant or harmful from happening or from getting worse Đánh nhau, chiến đấu
Ví dụ:
  • measures to combat crime/inflation/unemployment/disease
  • The government is spending millions of dollars in its attempt to combat drug abuse
  • I have to combat this constant desire to eat chocolate.

combustion /kəmˈbʌstʃən/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the process of burning Sự đốt cháy; sự cháy
Ví dụ:
  • Poisonous gases are produced during fossil fuel combustion

comet /ˈkɑːmət/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a mass of ice and dust that moves around the sun and looks like a bright star with a tail Sao chổi

commentator /ˈkɑːmənteɪtər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a person who is an expert on a particular subject and talks or writes about it on television or radio, or in a newspaper Nhà bình luận
Ví dụ:
  • a political commentator

commercial /kəˈmɜːrʃl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(Thuộc) Buôn bán; (thuộc) thương mại; (thuộc) thương nghiệp
Ví dụ:
  • The drug is still being tested and will not go into commercial production for at least two years

commit /kəˈmɪt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to do something wrong or illegal thực hiện hành vi phạm pháp
Ví dụ:
  • to commit murder/adultery
  • Most crimes are committed by young men.

commonplace /ˈkɑːmənpleɪs/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
done very often, or existing in many places, and therefore not unusual bình thường, phổ biến, chẳng có gì là lạ
Ví dụ:
  • Computers are now commonplace in primary classrooms
  • Electric cars are increasingly commonplace.

communicate /kəˈmjuːnɪkeɪt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to exchange information, news, ideas, etc with somebody giao thiệp, liên lạc, truyền đạt thông tin
Ví dụ:
  • We only communicate by email.

communication /kəˌmjuːnɪˈkeɪʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the act of communicating with people sự truyền đạt, sự thông tri, sự thông tin; tin tức truyền đạt
Ví dụ:
  • Speech is the fastest method of communication between people.
  • Doctors do not always have good communication skills.

compact /ˈkɑːmpækt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
smaller than is usual for things of the same kind Nhỏ gọn
Ví dụ:
  • a compact camera
  • The notebook computer is small and compact and weighs only 3
  • 6lb.

company /ˈkʌmpəni/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the fact of being with somebody else and not alone (sự cùng đi; sự cùng ở; sự có bầu có bạn )
Ví dụ:
  • I enjoy Jo's company (= I enjoy being with her).
  • a pleasant evening in the company of friends.

compete /kəmˈpiːt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to try to be more successful or better than somebody else who is trying to do the same as you đua tranh, ganh đua, cạnh tranh, tranh tài
Ví dụ:
  • It's difficult for a small shop to compete against/with the big supermarkets.
  • We can't compete with them on price.

compile /kəmˈpaɪl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to collect information from different places and arrange it in a book, report, or list Biên soạn, sưu tập tài liệu
Ví dụ:
  • We're compiling some facts and figures for a documentary on the subject

component /kəmˈpoʊnənt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a part that combines with other parts to form something bigger Thành phần, phần hợp thành
Ví dụ:
  • The factory supplies electrical components for cars.
  • The course has four main components: business law, finance, computing and management skills

composition /ˌkɑːmpəˈzɪʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the different parts which something is made of; the way in which the different parts are organized Sự hợp thành, sự cấu thành. Cấu tạo, thành phần.
Ví dụ:
  • the chemical composition of the soil
  • the composition of the board of directors
  • the size and composition of an average class

compound /kəmˈpaʊnd/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to make something bad become even worse by causing further damage or problems làm tình hinh tệ đi, làm vấn đề trở nên phức tạp, khó giải quyết hơn
Ví dụ:
  • The problems were compounded by severe food shortages.
  • His financial problems were compounded when he unexpectedly lost his job.

comprehend /ˌkɑːmprɪˈhend/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(formal) to understand something fully Hiểu, lĩnh hội, nhận thức thấu đáo
Ví dụ:
  • The infinite distances of space are too great for the human mind to comprehend
  • He doesn't seem to comprehend the scale of the problem

compromise /ˈkɑːmprəmaɪz/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
an agreement in an argument in which the people involved reduce their demands or change their opinion in order to agree Sự thoả hiệp.
Ví dụ:
  • In a compromise between management and unions, a four percent pay rise was agreed in return for an increase in productivity.
  • The government has said that there will be no compromise with terrorists.

computerization /kəmˌpjuːtərəˈzeɪʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the process of providing a computer or computers to do the work of something (Tech) Điện toán hóa, máy tính hóa
Ví dụ:
  • As industry was modernized by computerization, workers' skills became outdated
  • They've just computerized the whole system.

conceivable /kənˈsiːvəbl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
that you can imagine or believe [synonym] possible Có thể hiểu được, có thể nhận thức được; có thể tưởng tượng được
Ví dụ:
  • It is conceivable that I'll see her tomorrow
  • It's just conceivable (= possible although difficult to imagine) (that) the hospital made a mistake.
  • oppositeinconceivable

conceive /kənˈsiːv/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to form an idea, a plan, etc in your mind; to imagine something Nghĩ, hiểu, quan điểm được, nhận thức; tưởng tượng
Ví dụ:
  • He conceived the idea of transforming the old power station into an arts centre
  • God is often conceived of as male.

concept /ˈkɑːnsept/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a principle or idea khái niệm, quan niệm.
Ví dụ:
  • It is very difficult to define the concept of beauty
  • He can't grasp the basic concepts of mathematics.

conception /kənˈsepʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
an idea of what something or someone is like, or a basic understanding of a situation or a principle Quan niệm, nhận thức Khái niệm.
Ví dụ:
  • People from different cultures have different conceptions of the world.
  • He has absolutely no conception of how a successful business should run.
  • He has no conception of how difficult life is if you're unemployed.

concerning /kənˈsɜːrnɪŋ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
about something; involving somebody/something Về việc.
Ví dụ:
  • He asked several questions concerning the future of the company.
  • All cases concerning children are dealt with in a special children's court.

conclude /kənˈkluːd/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to end a speech, meeting, or piece of writing Kết thúc, chấm dứt ((công việc ); bế mạc (phiên họp) Kết luận.
Ví dụ:
  • She concluded the speech by reminding us of our responsibility.
  • Before I conclude, I'd like to thank you all for coming.

concrete /ˈkɑːŋkriːt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a very hard building material made by mixing together cement, sand, small stones, and water Bê tông
Ví dụ:
  • Weeds were pushing up through the cracks in the concrete.
  • Don't walk on the concrete until it has set.

condemn /kənˈdem/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to criticize something or someone strongly, usually for moral reasons Chỉ trích, chê trách, lên án, quy tội
Ví dụ:
  • The Opposition has condemned the government's proposed tax increases
  • The film was condemned for its sexism.

conduct /kənˈdʌkt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to allow electricity or heat to go through (Vật lý) Dẫn
Ví dụ:
  • Copper conducts electricity, but plastic does not
  • to conduct heat — dẫn nhiệt

conductor /kənˈdʌktər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a substance that allows heat or electricity to go through it (Vật lý) Chất dẫn (điện, nhiệt)
Ví dụ:
  • Metal is a good conductor of heat
  • metals are good conductors — kim loại là những chất dẫn tốt

conference /ˈkɑːnfərəns/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
an event, sometimes lasting a few days, at which there is a group of talks on a particular subject, or a meeting in which especially business matters are discussed formally Hội nghị
Ví dụ:
  • a conference on women's rights
  • They frequently hold conferences at that hotel.
  • I'm speaking at/attending a conference next week.
  • Should I book the conference room for the meeting?

confirm /kənˈfɜːrm/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to prove that something is true Xác nhận; chứng thực.
Ví dụ:
  • His guilty expression confirmed my suspicions

conflict /ˈkɑːnflɪkt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a situation in which there are opposing ideas, opinions, feelings or wishes; a situation in which it is difficult to choose Sự xung đột, sự tranh giành, sự va chạm
Ví dụ:
  • The story tells of a classic conflict between love and duty.
  • Her diary was a record of her inner conflict.
  • Many of these ideas appear to be in conflict with each other.

conjecture /kənˈdʒektʃər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a guess about something based on how it seems and not on proof Sự phỏng đoán, sự ước đoán
Ví dụ:
  • The truth of his conjecture was confirmed by the newspaper report
  • There's been a lot of conjecture in the media recently about the marriage.

connection /kəˈnekʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the state of being related to someone or something else Sự liên quan, sự liên lạc, mối quan hệ; sự chấp nối.
Ví dụ:
  • The connection between smoking and heart disease is well known.
  • They're sisters? I knew their surname was the same, but I never made (= thought of) the connection.

connotation /ˌkɑːnəˈteɪʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
an idea suggested by a word in addition to its main meaning Nghĩa rộng; ý nghĩa, hàm ý (của một từ)
Ví dụ:
  • The word ‘professional’ has connotations of skill and excellence
  • The word "lady" has connotations of refinement and excessive femininity that some women find offensive.

conquer /ˈkɑːŋkər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to take control or possession of foreign land, or a group of people, by force Chinh phạt, chinh phục, chế ngự
Ví dụ:
  • The Normans conquered England in 1066.
  • In 330 BC Persia was conquered by Alexander the Great.

conscious /ˈkɑːnʃəs/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(of actions, feelings, etc ) deliberate or controlled (hành động, ý định) cố tình, cố ý
Ví dụ:
  • to make a conscious decision
  • I made a conscious effort to get there on time.
  • a conscious act of cruelty
  • opposite unconscious

consensus /kənˈsensəs/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
an opinion that all members of a group agree with Sự đồng thuận, sự nhất trí
Ví dụ:
  • The general consensus in the office is that he can't do his job
  • Could we reach a consensus on this matter? Let's take a vote.

consent /kənˈsent/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to agree to do something, or to allow someone to do something Đồng ý, ưng thuận, thoả thuận; tán thành
Ví dụ:
  • Very reluctantly, I've consented to lend her my car.
  • My aunt never married because her father wouldn't consent to her marriage.

consequence /ˈkɑːnsəkwens/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a result of a particular action or situation, often one that is bad or not convenient Hậu quả, kết quả.
Ví dụ:
  • This decision could have serious consequences for the industry.
  • Two hundred people lost their jobs as a direct consequence of the merger.
  • He drove too fast with tragic consequences.
  • to suffer/face/take the consequences of your actions

consequently /ˈkɑːnsəkwentli/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
as a result; therefore Do đó, vì vậy cho nên, bởi thế; vậy thì.
Ví dụ:
  • She failed her exams and was consequently unable to start her studies at college

Arctic /ˈɑːrktɪk/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
[only before noun] related to or happening in the regions around the North Pole (thuộc) Bắc cực; (thuộc) phương bắc
Ví dụ:
  • Arctic explorers

arguably /ˈɑːrɡjuəbli/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
used when you are stating an opinion that you believe you could give reasons to support Có thể nói rằng (dùng trước khi nói một câu mình nghĩ mình có bằng chứng cho nó)
Ví dụ:
  • He is arguably the world's best football player.
  • Arguably, the drug should not have been made available.

arid /ˈærɪd/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(of land or a climate) having little or no rain; very dry Khô cằn (đất).
Ví dụ:
  • arid and semi-arid deserts
  • Nothing grows in these arid regions.
  • The pioneers hoped to transform the arid outback into a workable landscape.

arrow /ˈæroʊ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a weapon that is like a long, thin stick with a sharp point at one end and often feathers at the other, shot from a bow Tên, mũi tên
Ví dụ:
  • Robin Hood asked to be buried where his arrow landed
  • a bow and arrowto fire/shoot an arrowThe road continues as straight as an arrow.

arson /ˈɑːrsn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the crime of intentionally starting a fire in order to damage or destroy something, especially a building Sự cố ý gây nên hoả hoạn; sự đốt phá (nhà, cửa )
Ví dụ:
  • A cinema was burned out in north London last night
  • Police suspect arson

arsonist /ˈɑːrsənɪst/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a person who commits the crime of arson Kẻ cố ý gây nên hoả hoạn; kẻ đốt phá (nhà, cửa )

artefact /ˈɑːrtɪfækt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
an object that is made by a person, especially something of historical or cultural interest (Khảo cổ học) Đồ tạo tác
Ví dụ:
  • The museum's collection includes artefacts dating back to prehistoric times
  • The museum has a superb collection of ancient artefacts from Nubia.

artery /ˈɑːrtəri/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
one of the thick tubes that carry blood from the heart to other parts of the body Động mạch, mạch máu
Ví dụ:
  • Blocked arteries can lead to a heart attack

article /ˈɑːrtɪkl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a piece of writing about a particular subject in a newspaper or magazine Bài báo
Ví dụ:
  • Have you seen that article about young fashion designers?
  • There was an interesting article on vegetarianism in the paper yesterday.

artificial /ˌɑːrtɪˈfɪʃl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
made by people, not real giả tạo; giả
Ví dụ:
  • They use rather artificial examples

artist /ˈɑːrtɪst/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a person who creates works of art, especially paintings or drawings Hoạ sĩ Nghệ sĩ.
Ví dụ:
  • Monet is one of my favourite artists
  • an exhibition of work by contemporary British artists

artistic /ɑːrˈtɪstɪk/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
relating to art showing a natural skill in or enjoyment of art, especially being able to paint or draw well (Thuộc) Nghệ thuật; (thuộc) mỹ thuật. Có nghệ thuật; có mỹ thuật, khéo léo.
Ví dụ:
  • the artistic director of the theatre
  • His friends are all artistic - they're painters, musicians, and writers.

ascertain /ˌæsərˈteɪn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to find out the true or correct information about something Biết chắc; xác định; tìm hiểu chắc chắn.
Ví dụ:
  • It can be difficult to ascertain the facts
  • I ascertained that the driver was not badly hurt.

assess /əˈses/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to judge or decide the amount, value, quality, or importance of something đánh giá; ước định
Ví dụ:
  • The insurers will need to assess the flood damage.
  • They assessed the cost of the flood damage at £2,500.
  • Exams are not the only means of assessing a student's ability.

asset /ˈæset/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a useful or valuable quality, skill, or person (Thông tục) Vốn quý, thứ có ích, vật quý.
Ví dụ:
  • Being able to speak a foreign language is a major asset

assignment /əˈsaɪnmənt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a piece of work given to someone, typically as part of their studies or job công việc hoặc bài tập được giao cho ai đó
Ví dụ:
  • I have a lot of reading assignments to complete before the end of term

associate /əˈsoʊsieɪt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to connect someone or something in your mind with someone or something else kết nối, có liên quan với
Ví dụ:
  • I always associate the smell of baking with my childhood

association /əˌsoʊsiˈeɪʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a connection or relationship between people or organizations Sự kết hợp, sự liên hợp Mối liên quan (giữa A và B)
Ví dụ:
  • The cats soon made the association (= made the connection)between human beings and food

asteroid /ˈæstərɔɪd/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
one of many large rocks that circle the sun (Thiên văn học) Tiểu hành tinh, hành tinh nhỏ

astounding /əˈstaʊndɪŋ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
so surprising that it is difficult to believe [synonym] astonishing Làm kinh ngạc, làm kinh hoàng. Làm sững sờ, làm sửng sốt.
Ví dụ:
  • There was an astounding 20% increase in sales.
  • The performance was an astounding success.
  • They can perform astounding mathematical feats in seconds.

astronaut /ˈæstrənɔːt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a person whose job involves travelling and working in a spacecraft Phi hành gia, nhà du hành vũ trụ.
Ví dụ:
  • sending astronauts into space

astronomical /ˌæstrəˈnɑːmɪkl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
connected with astronomy (thuộc) Thiên văn, (thuộc) thiên văn học.
Ví dụ:
  • the Royal Astronomical Society
  • astronomical observations/instruments

atmosphere /ˈætməsfɪr/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the mixture of gases around the earth bầu khí quyển
Ví dụ:
  • These factories are releasing toxic gases into the atmosphere

atmospheric /ˌætməsˈferɪk/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
related to the earth’s atmosphere (Thuộc) bầu khí quyển, (thuộc) không khí
Ví dụ:
  • Plants are the main source of atmospheric oxygen.
  • If atmospheric conditions are right, it may be possible to see this group of stars tonight.

attain /əˈteɪn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to succeed in getting something, usually after a lot of effort Đến tới, đạt tới
Ví dụ:
  • Most of our students attained five ‘A’ grades in their exams.
  • We only consider applicants who have attained a high level of academic achievement.

attention-grabbing UK US

Định nghĩa:
cố tình thu hút sự chú ý
Ví dụ:
  • an attention-grabbing marketing campaign.

attraction /əˈtrækʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
an interesting or enjoyable place to go or thing to do điểm thu hút khách du lịch, thắng cảnh
Ví dụ:
  • Buckingham Palace is a major tourist attraction
  • The main attraction at Giverny is Monet's garden.

audience /ˈɔːdiəns/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the group of people together in one place to watch or listen to a play, film, someone speaking, etc Những người nghe, thính giả; người xem, khán giả; bạn đọc, độc giả
Ví dụ:
  • She lectures to audiences all over the world.
  • The secret to public speaking is to get the audience on your side.

authority /əˈθɑːrəti/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the people or an organization who have the power to make decisions or who have a particular area of responsibility in a country or region nhà cầm quyền, nhà chức trách, nhà đương cục
Ví dụ:
  • The health authorities are investigating the problem.
  • I have to report this to the authorities.
  • the immigration authorities

automate /ˈɔːtəmeɪt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to use machines and computers instead of people to do a job or task Tự động hoá
Ví dụ:
  • The entire manufacturing process has been automated.
  • The factory is now fully automated.

automatic /ˌɔːtəˈmætɪk/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(of a machine, device, etc ) having controls that work without needing a person to operate them Tự động
Ví dụ:
  • automatic doors
  • a fully automatic driverless train

automatically /ˌɔːtəˈmætɪkli/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
without needing a person to operate controls một cách tự động
Ví dụ:
  • The heating switches off automatically.
  • The clock automatically readjusts when you enter a new time zone.

automation /ˌɔːtəˈmeɪʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the use of machines to do work that was previously done by people Sự tự động hoá; kỹ thuật tự động
Ví dụ:
  • Automation meant the loss of many factory jobs.

a walk of life UK US

Định nghĩa:
a person's job or position in society
Ví dụ:
  • She has friends from all walks of life

awash /əˈwɑːʃ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
having an amount of something that is very large or larger than necessary or wanted tràn ngập, nhiều không kể xiết
Ví dụ:
  • The computer market is awash with software for every kind of computer.
  • The village is awash with history, legends and local charm.

a way of life UK US

Định nghĩa:
1 a typical way in which a person or group lives. 2
Ví dụ:
  • the rural way of life
  • Shortages have become a way of life here.

awe /ɔː/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
feelings of respect and slight fear; feelings of being very impressed by something/somebody sự kính trọng, sự ngưỡng mộ, sự choáng ngợp (xen lẫn chút sợ hãi)
Ví dụ:
  • I've always held musicians in awe.
  • As children we were rather in awe of our grandfather.
  • You can't help but stand in awe of (= respect greatly and fear slightly) powerful people.

awkward /ˈɔːkwərd/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
difficult to use, do, or deal with Khó xử, rầy rà, rắc rối
Ví dụ:
  • Some of the questions were rather awkward
  • My car's quite awkward to drive.

babysit /ˈbeɪbisɪt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to take care of babies or children for a short time while their parents are out Giữ trẻ hộ (trong khi bố mẹ đi vắng); trông nom trẻ em.
Ví dụ:
  • She regularly babysits for us.
  • He's babysitting the neighbour's children.

bake /beɪk/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to cook food in an oven without extra fat or liquid; to be cooked in this way Bỏ lò, nướng bằng lò
Ví dụ:
  • I'm baking a birthday cake for Alex.
  • the delicious smell of baking bread

balcony /ˈbælkəni/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
an area with a wall or bars around it that is joined to the outside wall of a building on an upper level Ban công
Ví dụ:
  • We had a drink on the hotel balcony.

ballerina /ˌbæləˈriːnə/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a female ballet dancer Nữ diễn viên ba lê

ballet /bæˈleɪ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a type of dancing where carefully organized movements tell a story or express an idea [countable] a story or work of art performed by a group of ballet dancers Ba lê Vở ba lê
Ví dụ:
  • a ballet dancer
  • By the age of 15 he had already composed his first ballet (= music for a ballet).
  • ‘Swan Lake’ is one of the great classical ballets.

barely /ˈberli/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
in a way that is just possible but only with difficulty in a way that almost does not happen or exist vừa mới, vừa đủ gần như không có
Ví dụ:
  • He could barely read and write.
  • The music was barely audible.
  • She barely acknowledged his presence
  • There was barely any smell.

barren /ˈbærən/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(of land or soil) not good enough for plants to grow on it (đất) cằn cỗi, khô cằn
Ví dụ:
  • a barren desert
  • a barren landscape (= one that is empty, with few plants)

barricade /ˌbærɪˈkeɪd/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a line of objects placed across a road, etc to stop people from getting past Vật chướng ngại (để chặn, phòng thủ)
Ví dụ:
  • Students built a barricade against the police
  • The protesters formed a human barricade.

barrier /ˈbæriər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
an object like a fence that prevents people from moving forward from one place to another rào cản, chướng ngại vật
Ví dụ:
  • The crowd had to stand behind barriers
  • The mountains acted as a natural barrier to the spread of the disease.

basics /ˈbeɪsɪks/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the simplest and most important facts, ideas, or things connected with something (những thứ cơ bản nhất)
Ví dụ:
  • I really must learn the the basics of first aid.
  • This range of books for young children covers basics like the alphabet and numbers.

basis /ˈbeɪsɪs/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the reason why people take a particular action trên cơ sở, vì lý do
Ví dụ:
  • She was chosen for the job on the basis of her qualifications.
  • Some movies have been banned on the basis that they are too violent

beak /biːk/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the hard, pointed part of a bird's mouth Mỏ (chim)
Ví dụ:
  • Birds use their beaks to pick up food

behalf /bɪˈhæf/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
as the representative of somebody or instead of them thay mặt cho, nhân danh
Ví dụ:
  • On behalf of the department I would like to thank you all.
  • Mr Knight cannot be here, so his wife will accept the prize on his behalf.

behave /bɪˈheɪv/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to do things in a particular way [synonym] act Ăn ở, đối xử, cư xử
Ví dụ:
  • he doctor behaved very unprofessionally.
  • They behaved very badly towards their guests.
  • He behaved like a true gentleman.
  • She behaved with great dignity.

behold /bɪˈhoʊld/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to see or look at someone or something Nhìn ngắm, chiêm ngưỡng Thấy, trông thấy.
Ví dụ:
  • The new bridge is an incredible sight to behold
  • Her face was a joy to behold
  • They beheld a bright star shining in the sky.

beholder /bɪˈhoʊldər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a person who sees or observes someone or something Người xem, người ngắm; khán giả. người chứng kiến, người được mục kích.
Ví dụ:
  • the building and landscape can elicit imaginative responses from the beholder

beneficial /ˌbenɪˈfɪʃl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
helpful, useful, or good Có ích; có lợi; tốt.
Ví dụ:
  • A good diet is beneficial to health

bias /ˈbaɪəs/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a strong feeling in favour of or against one group of people, or one side in an argument, often not based on fair judgement (Nghĩa bóng) Khuynh hướng, sự thiên về; thành kiến, thiên vị
Ví dụ:
  • accusations of political bias in news programmes (= that reports are unfair and show favour to one political party)
  • Employers must consider all candidates impartially and without bias.
  • Some institutions still have a strong bias against women.

biased /ˈbaɪəst/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
having a tendency to show favour towards or against one group of people or one opinion for personal reasons; making unfair judgements Có khuynh hướng, thiên về một phía; cóthành kiến, thiên vị
Ví dụ:
  • The newspapers gave a very biased report of the meeting.
  • I think she's beautiful but then I'm biased since she's my daughter.

biodiversity /ˌbaɪoʊdaɪˈvɜːrsəti/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the existence of a large number of different kinds of animals and plants which make a balanced environment Tính đa dạng sinh học
Ví dụ:
  • The mining project threatens one of the world’s richest areas of biodiversity.

biofuel /ˈbaɪoʊfjuːəl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
fuel made from plant or animal sources and used in engines nhiên liệu sinh học
Ví dụ:
  • biofuels made from sugar cane and sugar beet
  • energy from biofuel sources

biological /ˌbaɪəˈlɑːdʒɪkl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
connected with the natural processes of living things (Thuộc) Sinh học.
Ví dụ:
  • the biological sciences
  • Eating is a biological necessity!

biologist /baɪˈɑːlədʒɪst/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a scientist who studies biology Nhà nghiên cứu về sinh vật học.
Ví dụ:
  • She’s a research biologist for a pharmaceutical company

biology /baɪˈɑːlədʒi/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the scientific study of the natural processes of living things Sinh vật học.
Ví dụ:
  • She studied biology at university

bland /blænd/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
not having a strong taste or character or not showing any interest or energy nhạt nhẽo, vô vị
Ví dụ:
  • I find chicken a little bland.
  • Pop music these days is so bland.

blend /blend/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to mix or combine together Trộn lẫn, pha trộn
Ví dụ:
  • Blend the ingredients into a smooth paste.
  • The carpet blends well with the colour of the walls.

blender /ˈblendər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
an electric machine used in the kitchen for breaking down foods or making smooth liquid substances from soft foods and liquids máy xay sinh tố
Ví dụ:
  • Combine the milk and eggs in a blender

blur /blɜːr/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to make the difference between two things less clear, or to make it difficult to see the exact truth about something Làm mờ đi, che mờ
Ví dụ:
  • This film blurs the line between reality and fantasy
  • The line between make-believe and reality became increasingly blurred.
  • She tends to blur the distinction between her friends and her colleagues.

bond /bɑːnd/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a close connection joining two or more people (Nghĩa bóng) mối quan hệ, mối ràng buộc.
Ví dụ:
  • A bond of friendship had been forged between them
  • The agreement strengthened the bonds between the two countries
  • the special bond between mother and child

bonfire /ˈbɑːnfaɪər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a large fire that is made outside to burn unwanted things, or for pleasure lửa trại

boundary /ˈbaʊndri/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a real or imagined line that marks the edge or limit of something Đường biên giới, ranh giới.
Ví dụ:
  • The Ural mountains mark the boundary between Europe and Asia.
  • Residents are opposed to the prison being built within the city boundary.

bow /boʊ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a weapon used for shooting arrows, consisting of a long, curved piece of wood with a tight string joining its ends Cái cung
Ví dụ:
  • To draw (bend) the bow — giương cung

braid /breɪd/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to join three or more pieces of hair or string-like material by putting them over each other in a special pattern Bện, tết (tóc ).
Ví dụ:
  • She braided the horse's tail.
  • a braided leather bracelet/belt

branch /bræntʃ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
one of the parts of a tree that grows out from the main trunk and has leaves, flowers, or fruit on it Cành cây
Ví dụ:
  • She climbed the tree and hid in the branches
  • The fruit on the lower branches was protected from the sun.

brand /brænd/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a type of product made by a particular company Nhãn (hàng hoá), thương hiệu
Ví dụ:
  • Which brand of toothpaste do you use?
  • This isn't my usual brand of deodorant.

break down UK US

Định nghĩa:
to fail,to become very bad [(đồ vật)] hỏng, vỡ vụn [(sự việc, mối quan hệ)] thất bại, sụp đổ, rạn nứt
Ví dụ:
  • Negotiations between the two sides have broken down
  • Her health broke down under the pressure of work.

breathe /briːð/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to take air into your lungs and send it out again through your nose or mouth Hít, thở
Ví dụ:
  • He breathed deeply before speaking again.
  • The air was so cold we could hardly breathe.

breathtaking /ˈbreθteɪkɪŋ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
extremely exciting, beautiful, or surprising hấp dẫn, ngoạn mục
Ví dụ:
  • The view from the top of the mountain is breathtaking.

brick /brɪk/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a rectangular block of hard material used for building walls and houses Gạch
Ví dụ:
  • The chimney was made of bricks.
  • red-brick houses

bright /braɪt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
full of light; shining strongly Sáng, sáng chói Sáng sủa; rạng rỡ, sáng ngời; rực rỡ.
Ví dụ:
  • The rooms were bright and airy.
  • The lights are too bright in here - they're hurting my eyes.
  • A bright star was shining in the East.

brilliant /ˈbrɪliənt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(of light or colours) very bright Sáng chói, chói loà; rực rỡ.
Ví dụ:
  • brilliant sunshine
  • brilliant blue eyes

briskly /ˈbrɪskli/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
quickly
Ví dụ:
  • She walked briskly over to the phone and answered it.
  • The game is selling briskly.

bristle /ˈbrɪsl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a short stiff hair Lông cứng
Ví dụ:
  • hog's bristles — lông lợn

broad /brɔːd/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
including a great variety of people or things rộng, đa dạng (nghĩa bóng)
Ví dụ:
  • a broad range of products
  • a broad and balanced curriculum
  • The magazine covers a broad range of subjects, from sewing to psychology.

broadcast /ˈbrɔːdkæst/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to send out a programme on television or radio Truyền đi rộng rãi (tin tức ); phát thanh, phát sóng
Ví dụ:
  • Radio Caroline used to broadcast from a boat in the North Sea.
  • The tennis championship is broadcast live to several different countries.
  • figurative I'm leaving but please don't broadcast (= tell everyone) the fact.

broadcaster /ˈbrɔːdkæstər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
someone whose job is to speak on radio or television programmes a company that sends out television or radio programmes Người nói chuyện trên đài phát thanh, người hát trên đài phát thanh công ty truyền thông, hãng truyền thông
Ví dụ:
  • He was a famous broadcaster in the 1930s
  • the new Australian rugby broadcaster, Channel Ten

broccoli /ˈbrɑːkəli/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a vegetable with a thick green stem and several dark green or purple flower heads Cây bông cải xanh

budget /ˈbʌdʒɪt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a plan to show how much money a person or organization will earn and how much they will need or be able to spend Ngân sách, ngân quỹ
Ví dụ:
  • We decorated the house on a tight budget (= without much money to spend)
  • The work was finished on time and within budget (= did not cost more money than was planned)
  • They went over budget (= spent too much money).

built-in /ˌbɪlt ˈɪn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
included as part of something and not separate from it Gắn sẵn (vào máy chính, vào tường )
Ví dụ:
  • a computer workstation with a built-in telephone, answering machine and fax
  • All the rooms have built-in cupboards/wardrobes.

bulky /ˈbʌlki/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(of a thing) large and difficult to move or carry To lớn, đồ sộ; kềnh càng
Ví dụ:
  • Bulky items will be collected separately.
  • The key felt bulky in his pocket.

burden /ˈbɜːrdn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a duty, responsibility, etc that causes worry, difficulty or hard work Gánh nặng ((nghĩa đen) & (nghĩa bóng))
Ví dụ:
  • o bear/carry/ease/reduce/share the burden
  • Buying a house often places a large financial burden on young couples.
  • I don't want to become a burden to my children when I'm old.

burgeoning /ˈbɜːrdʒənɪŋ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
developing quickly phát triển rất là nhanh
Ví dụ:
  • The company hoped to profit from the burgeoning communications industry
  • a burgeoning populationburgeoning demand

burglar /ˈbɜːrɡlər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a person who enters a building illegally in order to steal Kẻ trộm đêm; kẻ trộm bẻ khoá, kẻ trộm đào ngạch.
Ví dụ:
  • Burglars broke into the gallery and stole dozens of priceless paintings
  • It was brave of you to chase after the burglar
  • No household security devices will protect you against the determined burglar.

burglary /ˈbɜːrɡləri/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the crime of entering a building illegally and stealing things from it [synonym] housebreaking Ăn trộm đêm; ăn trộm bẻ khoá, ăn trộm đào ngạch.
Ví dụ:
  • Several men were questioned by police yesterday about the burglary.
  • Simpson, aged 19, was convicted on two charges of burglary.
  • The latest crime figures show a sharp rise in burglaries.

burrow /ˈbɜːroʊ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a hole in the ground dug by an animal such as a rabbit, especially to live in Hang (cầy, thỏ, chuột)

burst /bɜːrst/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to break open or apart suddenly, or to make something do this Nổ, nổ tung (bom, đạn ); vỡ (mụn nhọt); nổ, vỡ (bong bóng); vỡ, vỡ tung ra (để); nhú, nở (lá, nụ hoa)
Ví dụ:
  • I hate it when balloons burst.
  • Suddenly the door burst open (= opened suddenly and forcefully) and police officers rushed in.

cable television /ˌkeɪbl ˈtelɪvɪʒn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a system of broadcasting television programmes along wires rather than by radio waves truyền hình cáp
Ví dụ:
  • He works for a cable television company.
  • The office has gone over to cable.
  • This channel is only available on cable

calculator /ˈkælkjuleɪtər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a small electronic device or piece of software for calculating with numbers Máy tính
Ví dụ:
  • a pocket calculator
  • Exam candidates are not allowed to use advanced calculators with database capability.

calendar /ˈkælɪndər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a table showing all the days, weeks, and months of the year Lịch (ghi năm tháng)
Ví dụ:
  • An old calendar for 2012 was still hanging on the wall of her office

calm /kɑːm/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(of the sea) without large waves lặng, không nổi sóng (biển) (of the weather) without windêm đềm, lặng gió (thời tiết)
Ví dụ:
  • a calm, cloudless day

canal /kəˈnæl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a long straight passage dug in the ground and filled with water for boats and ships to travel along a smaller passage used for carrying water to fields, crops, etc. Kênh, sông đào
Ví dụ:
  • The Panama Canal provides a crucial shipping link between the Atlantic and Pacific oceans
  • In order to turn the deserts into fertile and productive land, engineers built an 800-mile canal.

candidate /ˈkændɪdeɪt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a person who is trying to be elected or is applying for a job Người ứng cử. Người dự thi; thí sinh. Người dự tuyển (vào một chức gì).
Ví dụ:
  • There are three candidates standing in the election
  • There were a large number of candidates for the job.

conserve /kənˈsɜːrv/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to use as little of something as possible so that it lasts a long time Giữ gìn, duy trì, bảo tồn, bảo toàn
Ví dụ:
  • Help to conserve energy by insulating your home.
  • Renewable energy resources can help conserve fossil fuels and reduce carbon emissions.

considerably /kənˈsɪdərəbli/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
much; a lot [synonym] significantly một cách đáng kể, lớn lao, nhiều
Ví dụ:
  • The need for sleep varies considerably from person to person.
  • Interest rates on bank loans have increased considerably in recent years.

consolidate /kənˈsɑːlɪdeɪt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to make something stronger so that it is more likely to continue Làm (cho) vững chắc thêm, củng cố
Ví dụ:
  • With this new movie he has consolidated his position as the country's leading director.
  • Italy consolidated their lead with a second goal.

constant /ˈkɑːnstənt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
happening a lot or all the time không ngớt, không dứt, liên miên, liên tiếp
Ví dụ:
  • I have to combat this constant desire to eat chocolate.

constantly /ˈkɑːnstəntli/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
all the time; repeatedly Luôn luôn, liên miên
Ví dụ:
  • Fashion is constantly changing.
  • Heat the sauce, stirring constantly.
  • We are constantly on the lookout for new ideas.

construct /kənˈstrʌkt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to build something or put together different parts to form something whole xây dựng (nhà cửa )
Ví dụ:
  • to construct a new bridge/building
  • The walls are constructed of concrete.

construction /kənˈstrʌkʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the work of building or making something, especially buildings, bridges, etc a building Sự xây dựng tòa nhà
Ví dụ:
  • She works in construction/in the construction industry.
  • The bridge is a marvellous work of engineering and construction.
  • What's that concrete and metal construction over there?

construction site /kənˈstrʌkʃn saɪt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
an area of land where something is being built công trường xây dựng

consultant /kənˈsʌltənt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a person who knows a lot about a particular subject and is employed to give advice about it to other people Nhà chuyên môn; chuyên viên, cố vấn; người cho ý kiến; người được hỏi ý kiến
Ví dụ:
  • a firm of management consultants
  • the President’s consultant on economic affairs

consume /kənˈsuːm/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to use something, especially fuel, energy or time Dùng, tiêu thụ
Ví dụ:
  • The electricity industry consumes large amounts of fossil fuels.
  • 25 per cent of the world’s population consumes 80 per cent of the planet’s resources.

consumer /kənˈsuːmər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a person who buys goods or uses services Người tiêu dùng, người tiêu thụ (hàng hoá, thực phẩm )
Ví dụ:
  • Agricultural companies have failed to convince consumers that GM foods are safe.
  • What the problem comes down to is 'Will the consumer be willing to pay more for a higher quality product?'

consumerism /kənˈsuːmərɪzəm/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the buying and using of goods and services; the belief that it is good for a society or an individual person to buy and use a large quantity of goods and services Chủ nghĩa tiêu thụ, sự tiêu dùng

contact /ˈkɑːntækt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to communicate with somebody, for example by telephone or letter liên lạc
Ví dụ:
  • I've been trying to contact you all day.
  • Witnesses to the accident are asked to contact the police.

contain /kənˈteɪn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to have something inside or include something as a part: Chứa đựng, bao hàm, gồm có, bao gồm
Ví dụ:
  • How much liquid do you think this bottle contains?
  • I lost a file containing a lot of important documents.
  • Try to avoid foods which contain a lot of fat.

container /kənˈteɪnər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a large metal or wooden box of a standard size in which goods are packed so that they can easily be lifted onto a ship, train, etc to be transported Côngtenơ
Ví dụ:
  • a container ship (= one designed to transport such containers)

contaminate /kənˈtæmɪneɪt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to make a substance or place dirty or no longer pure by adding a substance that is dangerous or carries disease Làm bẩn, làm ô uế. Làm nhiễm (bệnh).
Ví dụ:
  • The drinking water has become contaminated with lead.
  • a river contaminated by pollution

contamination /kənˌtæmɪˈneɪʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the process or fact of making a substance or place dirty or no longer pure by adding a substance that is dangerous or carries disease Sự làm bẩn, sự làm ô uế; cái làm ô uế
Ví dụ:
  • radioactive contamination
  • Environmental contamination resulting from human activities is a major health concern.

contemplate /ˈkɑːntəmpleɪt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to think about whether you should do something, or how you should do something [synonym] consider, think about/of Dự tính, trù tính, cân nhắc (có nên làm một việc gì đó hay không)
Ví dụ:
  • You're too young to be contemplating retirement
  • I have never contemplated living abroad.
  • I'm contemplating going abroad for a year
  • They were contemplating a move to California.

contend /kənˈtend/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to say that something is true, especially in an argument [synonym] maintain Dám chắc rằng, cho rằng
Ví dụ:
  • I would contend that the minister's thinking is flawed on this point
  • The lawyer contended (that) her client had never been near the scene of the crime.

context /ˈkɑːntekst/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the situation within which something exists or happens, and that can help explain it Khung cảnh, phạm vi, bối cảnh (Văn học) Văn cảnh, ngữ cảnh, mạch văn.
Ví dụ:
  • This speech needs to be set in the context of Britain in the 1960s.
  • His decision can only be understood in context.
  • What was the context you found the word in?

continual /kənˈtɪnjuəl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
happening repeatedly, usually in an annoying or not convenient way Liên tục, liên miên
Ví dụ:
  • I've had continual problems with this car ever since I bought it.
  • I'm sorry - I can't work with these continual interruptions.

contradict /ˌkɑːntrəˈdɪkt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to say that something that somebody else has said is wrong, and that the opposite is true (of statements or pieces of evidence) to be so different from each other that one of them must be wrong Cãi lại, phủ nhận Mâu thuẫn với, trái với.
Ví dụ:
  • All evening her husband contradicted everything she said
  • The two stories contradict each other.

contraption /kənˈtræpʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a machine or piece of equipment that looks strange một cái máy, một cái thiết bị trông kỳ cục
Ví dụ:
  • She showed us a strange contraption that looked like a satellite dish
  • What's that strange contraption in the garage?

contribution /ˌkɑːntrɪˈbjuːʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
an action or a service that helps to cause or increase something Sự đóng góp, sự góp phần; phần đóng góp, phần gánh vác
Ví dụ:
  • He made a very positive contribution to the success of the project.
  • a significant contribution to scientific knowledge
  • the car’s contribution to the greenhouse effect

controversial /ˌkɑːntrəˈvɜːrʃl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
causing disagreement or discussion Gây tranh luận, gây bàn cãi, nóng bỏng (vấn đề ).
Ví dụ:
  • a controversial plan to build a new road

controversy /ˈkɑːntrəvɜːrsi/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
public discussion and argument about something that many people strongly disagree about, disapprove of, or are shocked by Sự tranh luận, sự tranh cãi Cuộc tranh luận, cuộc bàn cãi, cuộc luận chiến; cuộc bút chiến.
Ví dụ:
  • There was a big controversy surrounding/over the use of drugs in athletics
  • The policy has caused fierce/heated controversy ever since it was introduced.

conversation /ˌkɑːnvərˈseɪʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(a) talk between two or more people sự nói chuyện; cuộc nói chuyện, cuộc chuyện trò, cuộc đàm luận
Ví dụ:
  • She had a strange conversation with the man who moved in upstairs.
  • It's impossible to hold a conversation with all this noise going on!

converse /kənˈvɜːrs/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(formal) to have a conversation with somebody nói chuyện, chuyện trò
Ví dụ:
  • She conversed with the Romanians in French.
  • The two men were conversing on music and opera.

convict /kənˈvɪkt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to decide and state officially in court that somebody is guilty of a crime Kết án, tuyên bố có tội
Ví dụ:
  • a convicted murderer
  • He was convicted of fraud.
  • There wasn’t enough evidence to convict her.
  • opposite acquit

convince /kənˈvɪns/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to make somebody/yourself believe that something is true Làm cho tin, làm cho nghe theo, thuyết phục
Ví dụ:
  • You'll need to convince them of your enthusiasm for the job
  • The experience convinced him that Europe was on the brink of a revolution.

cope /koʊp/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to deal successfully with a difficult situation (+ with) Đối phó, đương đầu.
Ví dụ:
  • It must be really hard to cope with three young children and a job

corporation /ˌkɔːrpəˈreɪʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(abbreviation Corp ) a large business company Công ty cổ phần, tập đoàn
Ví dụ:
  • multinational corporations
  • the Sony corporation

correlate /ˈkɔːrələt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
if two or more facts, figures, etc Có tương quan với nhau
Ví dụ:
  • A high-fat diet correlates with a greater risk of heart disease.
  • The average speed of the vehicles correlates closely with the severity of the accident caused.

correspond /ˌkɔːrəˈspɑːnd/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(with somebody) (formal) to write letters to somebody and receive letters/emails from them Giao thiệp bằng thư từ, trao đổi thư từ
Ví dụ:
  • She corresponded regularly with her former teacher
  • I've been corresponding with several experts in the field.

cosmetic /kɑːzˈmetɪk/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a substance that you put on your face or body to make it more attractive mỹ phẩm
Ví dụ:
  • We sell a wide range of cosmetics and toiletries at a very reasonable price.
  • We’re introducing a new line of cosmetics

cosmic /ˈkɑːzmɪk/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
relating to the universe and the natural processes that happen in it (Thuộc) Vũ trụ
Ví dụ:
  • cosmic dust/radiation

cosmopolitan /ˌkɑːzməˈpɑːlɪtən/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
đa văn hóa, đa chủng tộc, đa quốc gia
Ví dụ:
  • New York is a highly cosmopolitan city.
  • Jamaica is a very cosmopolitan island.

cosmos /ˈkɑːzmoʊs/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the universe, especially when it is thought of as an ordered system Vũ trụ. Sự trật tự, sự hài hoà.
Ví dụ:
  • the structure of the cosmos
  • our place in the cosmos

cosy /ˈkoʊzi/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
comfortable and pleasant, especially (of a building) because of being small and warm Ấm cúng, thoải mái dễ chịu
Ví dụ:
  • This room is nice and cosy in the winter.
  • He showed me into a cosy little room.

cottage /ˈkɑːtɪdʒ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a small house, especially in the country Nhà tranh. Nhà riêng ở nông thôn.
Ví dụ:
  • a charming country cottage with roses around the door
  • They live in an idyllic country/thatched cottage, with roses around the door.

counter /ˈkaʊntər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to react to something with an opposing opinion or action, or to defend yourself against something Chặn lại và đánh trả, phản công lại (đấu kiếm, quyền Anh).
Ví dụ:
  • After the government bombed their camp, the rebels countered with an attack on the capital.
  • When criticisms were made of the school's performance, the parents' group countered with details of its exam results.
  • Extra police have been moved into the area to counter the risk of violence.

counteract /ˌkaʊntərˈækt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to reduce or remove the effect of something unwanted by producing an opposite effect Chống lại, kháng cự lại.
Ví dụ:
  • These exercises aim to counteract the effects of stress and tension

countryside /ˈkʌntrisaɪd/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
land outside towns and cities, with fields, woods, etc. nông thôn, miền quê, vùng quê, địa phương (ở nông thôn)
Ví dụ:
  • The countryside around there is beautiful.
  • Every summer thousands of people flock to the countryside.

craft /kræft/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
an activity involving a special skill at making things with your hands Nghề, nghề thủ công.
Ví dụ:
  • traditional crafts like basket-weaving
  • a craft fair/workshop

craftsman /ˈkræftsmən/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a skilled person, especially one who makes beautiful things by hand Thợ thủ công. Người khéo léo, người có kỹ xảo, người điêu luyện, người lành nghề.
Ví dụ:
  • The plates are painted by our finest craftsmen
  • rugs handmade by local craftsmenIt is clearly the work of a master craftsman.

cramped /kræmpt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
not having enough space or time Chật hẹp, tù túng, không được tự do
Ví dụ:
  • a cramped room/house
  • We have six desks in this room, so we're a little cramped (for space).
  • I have a very cramped schedule.

crater /ˈkreɪtər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the round hole at the top of a volcano, or a hole in the ground similar to this Miệng núi lửa. Hố (bom, đạn đại bác ).
Ví dụ:
  • the huge crater of Vesuvius
  • a bomb crater
  • With a good telescope, you can see craters on the moon.

crave /kreɪv/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to have a very strong feeling of wanting something [synonym] long for thèm muốn, khao khát
Ví dụ:
  • Many young children crave attention
  • She has always craved excitement
  • to crave alcohol/drugs/sweet food/carbohydrates/cigarettes/coffee

craving /ˈkreɪvɪŋ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a strong feeling of wanting something Sự thèm muốn, lòng khao khát.
Ví dụ:
  • I have a craving for chocolate

crawl /krɔːl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to move forward on your hands and knees, with your body close to the ground Bò, trườn.
Ví dụ:
  • Our baby is just starting to crawl.
  • A man was crawling away from the burning wreckage.
  • She crawled under the fence.

credibility /ˌkredəˈbɪləti/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the fact that someone can be believed or trusted Sự tín nhiệm; sự đáng tin
Ví dụ:
  • to gain/lack/lose credibility
  • After the recent scandal, the government has lost all credibility.

credit /ˈkredɪt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to say that someone is responsible for something good Công nhận, cho là (ai đó có công gì đó)
Ví dụ:
  • She is credited with making the business a success
  • The company is credited with inventing the industrial robot.

crevice /ˈkrevɪs/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a narrow crack in a rock or wall Đường nứt, kẽ hở (tường, núi đá)
Ví dụ:
  • Most of the year the insects are hidden in rock crevices

crew /kruː/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a group of people who work together, especially all those who work on and operate a ship, aircraft, etc Toàn bộ thuỷ thủ trên tàu; toàn bộ người lái và nhân viên trên máy bay. Ban, nhóm, đội (công tác ). Bọn, tụi, đám, bè lũ.
Ví dụ:
  • an ambulance/lifeboat crew
  • a TV/film/camera crew
  • The aircraft has/carries a crew of seven.

crime /kraɪm/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
activities that involve breaking the law Tội ác, trọng tội, tội
Ví dụ:
  • an increase in violent crime
  • Stores spend more and more on crime prevention every year.
  • petty/serious crime
  • the connection between drugs and organized crime

criminal /ˈkrɪmɪnl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
someone who commits a crime Kẻ phạm tội, tội phạm
Ví dụ:
  • Today's problem child may be tomorrow's criminal.
  • The police officer told the criminal that he had the right to remain silent.

crisis /ˈkraɪsɪs/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a time of great disagreement, confusion, or suffering Sự khủng hoảng; cơn khủng hoảng
Ví dụ:
  • The country's leadership is in crisis.
  • an economic/financial crisis
  • We have a family crisis on my hands - my 16-year-old sister is pregnant.

crisp /krɪsp/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(of the air or the weather) pleasantly dry and cold mát lạnh, làm sảng khoái; làm khoẻ người (không khí).
Ví dụ:
  • a crisp winter morning
  • The air was crisp and clear and the sky was blue.

critic /ˈkrɪtɪk/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a person who expresses disapproval of somebody/something and talks about their bad qualities, especially publicly Người chỉ trích
Ví dụ:
  • a critic of private health care
  • Her critics say she is leading the party to disaster
  • He's his own worst critic (= he judges himself severely).

critical /ˈkrɪtɪkl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
of the greatest importance to the way things might happen Cấp thiết, tối quan trọng.
Ví dụ:
  • Reducing levels of carbon dioxide in the atmosphere is of critical importance

criticism /ˈkrɪtɪsɪzəm/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the act of saying that something or someone is bad Sự phê bình, sự phê phán, sự bình phẩm, sự chỉ trích. Lời phê bình, lời phê phán, lời bình phẩm, lời chỉ trích.
Ví dụ:
  • The designs for the new mosque have attracted widespread criticism.
  • I have a few criticisms to make about your speech.

criticize /ˈkrɪtɪsaɪz/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to express disapproval of someone or something Phê bình, phê phán, bình phẩm, chỉ trích
Ví dụ:
  • The government is being widely criticized in the media for failing to limit air pollution.
  • We'll get nowhere if all you can do is criticize.

crowded /ˈkraʊdɪd/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
having a lot of people or too many people Đông đúc Chật ních.
Ví dụ:
  • In the spring the place is crowded with skiers.
  • London was very crowded.

crucial /ˈkruːʃl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
extremely important, because it will affect other things [synonym] critical, essential Quyết định; cốt yếu, chủ yếu.
Ví dụ:
  • a crucial factor/issue/decision
  • topics of crucial importance
  • The next few weeks are going to be crucial.

crystal /ˈkrɪstl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
transparent glass of very high quality pha lê; đồ pha lê
Ví dụ:
  • a crystal chandelier/vase
  • Every table had been set with fine china and crystal.

crystal clear /ˌkrɪstl ˈklɪr/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(of glass, water, etc ) completely clear and bright
Ví dụ:
  • crystal clear water

cue /kjuː/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
an action or event that is a signal for somebody to do something dấu hiệu để nhắc ai đó làm gì đấy
Ví dụ:
  • Jon's arrival was a cue for more champagne.
  • I think that's my cue to explain why I'm here.

cull /kʌl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to kill a particular number of animals of a group in order to prevent the group from getting too large (động vật) giết bớt đi để ngăn không cho số lượng gia tăng quá nhiều
Ví dụ:
  • The plan to cull large numbers of baby seals has angered environmental groups

cultivation /ˌkʌltɪˈveɪʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the preparation and use of land for growing plants or crops Sự cày cấy, sự trồng trọt
Ví dụ:
  • fertile land that is under cultivation (= being cultivated)
  • rice/wheat, etc
  • cultivation

cultural /ˈkʌltʃərəl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
relating to the habits, traditions, and beliefs of a society (Thuộc) Văn hoá
Ví dụ:
  • Australia has its own cultural identity, which is very different from that of Britain
  • cultural differences between the two communities

culture /ˈkʌltʃər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the way of life, especially the general customs and beliefs, of a particular group of people at a particular time Văn hoá, văn minh.
Ví dụ:
  • youth/working-class culture
  • She's studying modern Japanese language and culture.

cumulative /ˈkjuːmjəleɪtɪv/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
increasing by one addition after another tích tụ, dồn lại, chồng chất lên mãi
Ví dụ:
  • The cumulative effect of using so many chemicals on the land could be disastrous.

curb /kɜːrb/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to control or limit something, especially something bad Kiềm chế, nén lại; hạn chế. (nghĩa đen)Buộc dây cằm (vào ngựa); điều khiển (ngựa) bằng dây cằm.
Ví dụ:
  • He is someone who finds it difficult to curb his fleshly desires.
  • You really need to curb your spending.
  • The police are trying to curb under-age drinking.

cure /kjʊr/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to make a person or an animal healthy again after an illness Chữa bênh, điều trị
Ví dụ:
  • Will you be able to cure him, Doctor?
  • It is better to prevent rather than cure diseases.

currency /ˈkɜːrənsi/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the money that is used in a particular country at a particular time Tiền, tiền tệ.
Ví dụ:
  • foreign currency
  • You'll need some cash in local currency but you can also use your credit card.

current affairs /ˌkɜːrənt əˈferz/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
political news about events happening now chuyện, vấn đề, tình hình đang diễn ra trong và ngoài nước

curriculum /kəˈrɪkjələm/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the subjects that are included in a course of study or taught in a school, college, etc. (chương trình giảng dạy)
Ví dụ:
  • (British English) Spanish is on the curriculum.
  • (North American English) Spanish is in the curriculum.

curve /kɜːrv/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to move or make something move in a line or shape that bends gradually Cong, uốn cong, bẻ cong, làm vênh
Ví dụ:
  • The road curved around the bay
  • The ball curved through the air
  • His lips curved in a smile
  • A smile curved his lips.

customer /ˈkʌstəmər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a person or an organization that buys something from a shop/store or business Khách hàng.
Ví dụ:
  • one of the shop’s best/biggest customers
  • They know me—I'm a regular customer.

cutting-edge /ˌkʌtɪŋ ˈedʒ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
very modern and with all the newest features tối tân, hiện đại bậc nhất
Ví dụ:
  • cutting-edge technology/research/science/design

cyber /ˈsaɪbər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
involving, using, or relating to computers, especially the internet liên quan đến thế giới mạng
Ví dụ:
  • cybercriminal - tội phạm mạng
  • cyberculture - văn hóa mạng

cycle /ˈsaɪkl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
he fact of a series of events being repeated many times, always in the same order chu kỳ, chu trình, vòng lặp
Ví dụ:
  • the cycle of the seasons
  • They could not break the cycle of harvest failure, food shortage, price increase and misery.

daisy /ˈdeɪzi/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a small flower with white petals and a yellow centre that often grows in grass (Thực vật học) Cây cúc

damage /ˈdæmɪdʒ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to harm or spoil something làm hư hại, làm hỏng, gây thiệt hại, gây tổn hại
Ví dụ:
  • Several vehicles were damaged in the crash.
  • Smoking seriously damages your health.

data /ˈdeɪtə/ or /ˈdætə/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
information that is stored by a computer số liệu, dữ kiện, tài liệu
Ví dụ:
  • The data is stored on a hard disk and backed up on a floppy disk

date /deɪt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to stop being fashionable become old-fashioned Đã lỗi thời, đã cũ; trở nên lỗi thời
Ví dụ:
  • Some James Bond films have dated more than others

dated /ˈdeɪtɪd/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
old-fashioned; belonging to a time in the past Lỗi thời, cũ kỹ, không hợp thời
Ví dụ:
  • Those TV comedies were OK in their day but seem incredibly dated now.
  • These ideas seem a bit dated now.

daunting /ˈdɔːntɪŋ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
making you feel slightly frightened or worried about your ability to achieve something (khó đến mức) làm thoái chí, làm nản chí
Ví dụ:
  • She has the daunting task of cooking for 20 people every day.
  • Starting a new job can be a daunting prospect.

debilitating /dɪˈbɪl·əˌteɪ·t̬ɪŋ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
causing weakness Làm yếu sức, làm suy nhược.
Ví dụ:
  • Strokes are a common debilitating condition of old age

debris /dəˈbriː/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
broken or torn pieces of something larger Mảnh vỡ, mảnh vụn. Vôi gạch đổ nát.
Ví dụ:
  • Debris from the aircraft was scattered over a large area
  • Emergency teams are still clearing the debris from the plane crash.
  • Several people were injured by flying debris in the explosion.

decade /ˈdekeɪd/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a period of ten years, especially a continuous period, such as 1910–1919 or 2000–2009 Thập kỷ, thập niên (thời kỳ mười năm).
Ví dụ:
  • Now entering her fourth decade, the singer is living alone in New York.
  • The past decade has seen a huge rise in the number of broadband users.

decent /ˈdiːsnt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
of a good enough standard or quality Kha khá, tươm tất Tử tế, tốt.
Ví dụ:
  • (informal) a decent meal/job/place to live
  • I need a decent night's sleep

decline /dɪˈklaɪn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(formal) to refuse politely to accept or to do something Từ chối, khước từ, không nhận, không chịu
Ví dụ:
  • I invited him to the meeting but he declined.
  • I offered to give them a lift but they declined.

dedicate /ˈdedɪkeɪt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to give a lot of your time and effort to a particular activity or purpose because you think it is important [synonym] devote Cống hiến, hiến dâng; dành trọn cho
Ví dụ:
  • He has dedicated his life to scientific research.
  • The new president said she would dedicate herself to protecting the rights of the sick and the homeless.

deduce /dɪˈduːs/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to reach an answer or a decision by thinking carefully about the known facts Suy ra, luận ra, suy luận, suy diễn
Ví dụ:
  • The police have deduced that he must have left his apartment yesterday evening
  • Can we deduce from your silence that you do not approve?

deduction /dɪˈdʌkʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the process of reaching a decision or answer by thinking about the known facts, or the decision that is reached Sự suy ra, sự luận ra, sự suy luận, sự suy diễn. Điều suy luận.
Ví dụ:
  • He arrived at the solution by a simple process of deduction
  • If my deductions are correct, I can tell you who the killer was

deep /diːp/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
having a large distance from the top or surface to the bottom very strongly felt or experienced and usually lasting a long time Sâu Sâu xa, sâu sắc, sâu kín, thâm trầm.
Ví dụ:
  • The water's not deep here - look, I can touch the bottom
  • deep respect

define /dɪˈfaɪn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to say or explain what the meaning of a word or phrase is Định nghĩa (một từ )
Ví dụ:
  • In the dictionary, "reality" is defined as "the state of things as they are, rather than as they are imagined to be".
  • Before I answer your question, could you define your terms a little more (= explain what you mean by the words you have used)?

deforestation /ˌdiːˌfɔːrɪˈsteɪʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the cutting down of trees in a large area, or the destruction of forests by people Sự phá rừng
Ví dụ:
  • Deforestation is destroying large areas of tropical rain forest
  • land erosion caused by widespread deforestation

deftly /ˈdeftli/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
in a skilful way Khéo léo
Ví dụ:
  • I threw her a towel which she deftly caught
  • They deftly avoided answering my questions.

delay /dɪˈleɪ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the situation in which you have to wait longer than expected for something to happen, or the time that you have to wait Sự chậm trễ; sự trì hoãn Điều làm trở ngại; sự cản trở.
Ví dụ:
  • Commuters will face long delays on the roads today.
  • We apologize for the delay in answering your letter.

deliberate /dɪˈlɪbərət/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
done on purpose rather than by accident [synonym] intentional, planned Có tính toán, cố ý, chủ tâm.
Ví dụ:
  • a deliberate act of vandalism
  • The speech was a deliberate attempt to embarrass the government.
  • opposite unintentional

delighted /dɪˈlaɪtɪd/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
very pleased rất vui lòng, rất lấy làm mừng
Ví dụ:
  • I'd be absolutely delighted to come.
  • ‘Can you stay for dinner?’ ‘I’d be delighted (to)!’
  • I was delighted that you could stay.

demand /dɪˈmænd/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the desire or need of customers for goods or services which they want to buy or use [opposite] supply nhu cầu (của khách hàng, thị trường, người tiêu dùng)
Ví dụ:
  • to meet the demand for a product
  • There's an increased demand for organic produce these days.
  • Demand is exceeding supply.

demanding /dɪˈmændɪŋ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(of a piece of work) needing a lot of skill, patience, effort, etc Đòi hỏi khắt khe, đòi hỏi nhiều công sức, thời gian, hoặc sự tỉ mỉ
Ví dụ:
  • The work is physically demanding.
  • the most demanding challenge I have ever faced

demographic /ˌdeməˈɡræfɪk/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
data relating to the population and different groups within it (Thuộc) Nhân khẩu học.
Ví dụ:
  • the demographics of radio listeners

demolish /dɪˈmɑːlɪʃ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to completely destroy a building, especially in order to use the land for something else Phá huỷ; đánh đổ, phá dỡ (nhà cửa, v v )
Ví dụ:
  • A number of houses were demolished so that the supermarket could be built
  • The factory is due to be demolished next year.

demonstrate /ˈdemənstreɪt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to show something clearly by giving proof or evidence Chứng minh, giải thích
Ví dụ:
  • These results demonstrate convincingly that our campaign is working
  • His sudden departure had demonstrated how unreliable he was.

den /den/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the hidden home of some types of wild animal Hang (thú dữ); sào huyệt (của bọn cướp)
Ví dụ:
  • a bear’s/lion’s den

dense /dens/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
having parts that are close together so that it is difficult to go or see through Dày đặc, chặt. Đông đúc; rậm rạp.
Ví dụ:
  • dense fog
  • a dense forest

density /ˈdensəti/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the number of people or things in a place when compared with the size of the place Sự đông đúc, sự trù mật. Độ dày, mật độ, độ chặt.
Ví dụ:
  • The area has a high/low population density.
  • We were unable to move because of the density of the crowd.

connected with teeth (Thuộc) răng (Thuộc) nha khoa.
Ví dụ:
  • a dental appointment
  • dental records

Định nghĩa:
the medical study of the teeth and mouth Nghề chữa răng, khoa răng.

departure /dɪˈpɑːrtʃər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the fact of a person or vehicle, etc leaving somewhere Sự rời khỏi, sự ra đi, sự khởi hành.
Ví dụ:
  • There are several departures (= buses, trains, or aircraft leaving) for Paris every day.
  • Our departure was delayed because of bad weather.

depict /dɪˈpɪkt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to represent or show something in a picture or story Vẽ. Tả, miêu tả.
Ví dụ:
  • Her paintings depict the lives of ordinary people in the last century.
  • In the book, he depicts his father as a tyrant.

deplete /dɪˈpliːt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to reduce something by a large amount so that there is not enough left rút sạch, làm cạn kiệt, hút cạn
Ví dụ:
  • Food supplies were severely depleted.
  • If we continue to deplete the earth's natural resources, we will cause serious damage to the environment.

deploy /dɪˈplɔɪ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to use something or someone, especially in an effective way triển khai, ứng dụng, đưa vào sử dụng
Ví dụ:
  • The company is reconsidering the way in which it deploys its resources/staff.
  • My job doesn't really allow me fully to deploy my skills/talents.

depression /dɪˈpreʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the state of feeling very unhappy and without hope for the future Trầm cảm, tuyệt vọng
Ví dụ:
  • She suffered from severe depression after losing her job

derivative /dɪˈrɪvətɪv/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a word or thing that has been developed or produced from another word or thing Hoá học) Chất dẫn xuất. (Ngôn ngữ học) Từ phái sinh.
Ví dụ:
  • ‘Happiness’ is a derivative of ‘happy’.
  • Crack is a highly potent and addictive derivative of cocaine.

dermatologist /ˌdɜːrməˈtɑːlədʒɪst/ UK US

a doctor who studies and treats skin diseases chuyên gia về chăm sóc da
Ví dụ:
  • You’re known as a celebrity dermatologist above all – how did you gain recognition?

despair /dɪˈsper/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to stop having any hope that a situation will change or improve nghĩ là mình đã hết hy vọng, thất vọng, tuyệt vọng.
Ví dụ:
  • Don't despair! We'll think of a way out of this

destination /ˌdestɪˈneɪʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a place to which somebody/something is going or being sent Nơi gửi tới, nơi đưa tới, nơi đi tới.
Ví dụ:
  • popular holiday destinations like the Bahamas
  • to arrive at/reach your destination

deter /dɪˈtɜːr/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to make somebody decide not to do something or continue doing something, especially by making them understand the difficulties and unpleasant results of their actions Ngăn cản, ngăn chặn, cản trở; làm nản lòng, làm nhụt chí, làm thoái chí
Ví dụ:
  • I told him I wasn't interested, but he wasn't deterred.
  • The high price of the service could deter people from seeking advice.

detergent /dɪˈtɜːrdʒənt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a liquid or powder that helps remove dirt, for example from clothes or dishes các hoá chất làm sạch vết bẩn như bột giặt, nước rửa chén, thuốc tẩy quần áo, v v

deteriorate /dɪˈtɪriəreɪt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to become worse trở nên tệ đi, trở nên xấu đi, có chuyển biến xấu
Ví dụ:
  • She was taken into hospital last week when her condition suddenly deteriorated.
  • The political situation in the region has deteriorated rapidly.

determined /dɪˈtɜːrmɪnd/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
wanting to do something very much and not allowing anyone or any difficulties to stop you Nhất định, nhất quyết, quả quyết; kiên quyết
Ví dụ:
  • I'm determined to get this piece of work done today.
  • I'm determined to succeed.

deterrent /dɪˈtɜːrənt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(adj)making somebody less likely to do something (n)something that deters people from doing something (tính từ)Để ngăn cản, để ngăn chặn, để cản trở Làm nản lòng, làm nhụt chí, làm thoái chí. (danh từ)Cái ngăn cản, cái ngăn chặn. Cái làm nản lòng, cái làm nhụt chí, cái làm thoái chí.
Ví dụ:
  • a deterrent effect
  • Tougher prison sentences may act/serve as a deterrent to other would-be offenders.

devastate /ˈdevəsteɪt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to destroy a place or thing completely or cause great damage tàn phá, phá hủy, phá phách
Ví dụ:
  • The bomb devastated much of the old part of the city

devastating /ˈdevəsteɪtɪŋ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
causing a lot of damage and destruction (synonym disastrous) gây tàn phá, phá huỷ, phá phách
Ví dụ:
  • If the bomb had exploded in the main shopping area, it would have been devastating.
  • The drought has had devastating consequences/effects.

develop /dɪˈveləp/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to grow or change into a more advanced, larger, or stronger tự mình phát triển to cause something to grow or change into a more advanced, larger, or stronger phát triển một cái gì đó
Ví dụ:
  • develop (from something) (into something) The place has rapidly developed from a small fishing community into a thriving tourist resort
  • develop something (from something) (into something)She developed the company from nothing.

devise /dɪˈvaɪz/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to invent something new or a new way of doing something [synonym] think up Nghĩ ra, đặt (kế hoạch), sáng chế, phát minh Bày mưu, bày kế, âm mưu, mưu đồ.
Ví dụ:
  • A new system has been devised to control traffic in the city
  • He's good at devising language games that you can play with students in class.

devote /dɪˈvoʊt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to give an amount of time, attention, etc to something dành thời gian, công sức cho việc gì đó
Ví dụ:
  • I could only devote two hours a day to the work

diagnosis /ˌdaɪəɡˈnoʊsɪs/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a judgment about what a particular illness or problem is, made after examining it (Y học) Phép chẩn đoán; sự chẩn đoán; lời chẩn đoán.
Ví dụ:
  • The doctor has made an initial diagnosis

a type of heavy oil used as a fuel instead of petrol/gas dầuđiêzen
Ví dụ:
  • a diesel engine (= one that burns diesel)
  • diesel cars/locomotives/trains

diet /ˈdaɪət/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the food that you eat and drink regularly Đồ ăn thường ngày (của ai) (Y học) Chế độ ăn uống
Ví dụ:
  • to have a healthy, balanced diet
  • the Japanese diet of rice, vegetables and fish
  • to receive advice on diet

Định nghĩa:
person whose job is to advise people on what kind of food they should eat to keep healthy nhà dinh dưỡng học
Ví dụ:
  • “As a dietitian, I support this soda tax,” Vogliano said

difficulty /ˈdɪfɪkəlti/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a problem; a thing or situation that causes problems Sự khó khăn, nỗi khó khăn, nỗi gay go; điều cản trở, điều trở ngại
Ví dụ:
  • She had great difficulty finding a job.
  • People with asthma have difficulty in breathing.

digital /ˈdɪdʒɪtl/ UK US

using or relating to electronic signals and computer technology sử dụng công nghệ điện tử
Ví dụ:
  • a digital camera
  • a digital watch

dilemma /dɪˈlemə/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a situation in which a difficult choice has to be made between two different things you could do tình thế tiến thoái lưỡng nan, tình trạng khó xử
Ví dụ:
  • She faces the dilemma of disobeying her father or losing the man she loves

dim /dɪm/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
not bright Mờ, lờ mờ, tối mờ mờ, không rõ ràng; nhìn không rõ
Ví dụ:
  • the dim glow of the fire in the grate
  • This light is too dim to read by.

diminish /dɪˈmɪnɪʃ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to reduce or be reduced in size or importance Bớt, giảm, hạ bớt, giảm bớt; thu nhỏ.
Ví dụ:
  • The world's resources are rapidly diminishing

dine /daɪn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to eat the main meal of the day, usually in the evening Ăn cơm (trưa, chiều)
Ví dụ:
  • I hate dining alone.
  • We dined by candlelight.
  • He once dined with the president of France.

dinnerware /ˈdɪnərwer/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
plates, dishes, etc used for serving a meal chén, bát, đĩa

dire /ˈdaɪər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
[usually before noun] (formal) very serious Thảm khốc, khốc liệt, tàn khốc; kinh khủng rất nghiêm trọng
Ví dụ:
  • These people are in dire need of help
  • He gave a dire warning that an earthquake was imminent
  • This decision will have dire consequences for local people.

direction /daɪˈrekʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the position towards which someone or something moves or faces Phương hướng, chiều, phía, ngả
Ví dụ:
  • "No, go that way," I said, pointing in the opposite direction.
  • They drove away in opposite directions.

disagreeable /ˌdɪsəˈɡriːəbl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
not nice or enjoyable [synonym] unpleasant Khó chịu, không đẹp, không dễ coi, không dễ nghe
Ví dụ:
  • a disagreeable smell/experience/job
  • a disagreeable young manShe said some very disagreeable things.

disastrous /dɪˈzæstrəs/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
extremely bad or unsuccessful [synonym] catastrophic Tai hại, thảm khốc. Bất hạnh.
Ví dụ:
  • Such a war would be disastrous for the country.
  • This decision will have a disastrous impact on foreign policy.
  • His first attempt was disastrous.

discharge /dɪsˈtʃɑːrdʒ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
Sự tuôn ra, sự tháo ra, sự tiết ra, sự bốc ra, sự đổ ra, sự chảy ra
Ví dụ:
  • The river is diverted through the power station before discharging into the sea
  • The factory was fined for discharging chemicals into the river.

disclose /dɪsˈkloʊz/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to make something known publicly, or to show something that was hidden Mở ra; vạch trần ra, để lộ ra
Ví dụ:
  • The company has disclosed profits of over £200 million.
  • The police have disclosed that two officers are under internal investigation.

disguise /dɪsˈɡaɪz/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to hide something or change it, so that it cannot be recognized Trá hình, cải trang Nguỵ trang (sự việc gì dưới một hình thức lừa dối) Che giấu, che đậy.
Ví dụ:
  • He disguised himself by wearing a false beard
  • She made no attempt to disguise her surprise.
  • My friend rang me up at the office and tried to disguise her voice, but I knew it was her.

dishwasher /ˈdɪʃwɔːʃər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a machine for washing plates, cups, etc Máy rửa bát
Ví dụ:
  • to load/stack the dishwasher
  • Are these glasses dishwasher safe?

disorder /dɪsˈɔːrdər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
an illness that causes a part of the body to stop functioning correctly (Y học) sự rối loạn một chức năng nào đó của cơ thể
Ví dụ:
  • a blood disorder
  • The family have a history of mental disorder.

display /dɪˈspleɪ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to show words, pictures, etc on a screen hiển thị hình ảnh hay văn bản
Ví dụ:
  • The screen will display the username in the top right-hand corner.
  • This column displays the title of the mail message.

disposable /dɪˈspoʊzəbl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(đồ) dùng một lần, có thể vứt đi sau khi sử dụng
Ví dụ:
  • disposable nappies
  • a disposable camera
  • daily disposable contact lenses

disposal /dɪˈspoʊzl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
