the act of getting rid of something, especially by throwing it away sự vứt bỏ, sự thải bỏ
Ví dụ:
  • waste disposal
  • the disposal of hazardous substances

dispose /dɪˈspoʊz/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to get rid of someone or something or deal with something so that the matter is finished vứt bỏ, khử đi,phi tang
Ví dụ:
  • the difficulties of disposing of nuclear waste
  • to dispose of stolen property
  • Radioactive waste must be disposed of safely.

dispute /dɪˈspjuːt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to disagree with something that someone says Bàn cãi, tranh luận
Ví dụ:
  • Few would dispute his status as the finest artist of the period.
  • The circumstances of her death have been hotly disputed.
  • + (that) I don't dispute (that) his movies are entertaining, but they don't have much depth.

disrupt /dɪsˈrʌpt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to prevent something, especially a system, process, or event, from continuing as usual or as expected Làm gián đoạn, cản trở
Ví dụ:
  • Heavy snow disrupted travel into the city this morning

disruption /dɪsˈrʌpʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
an interruption in the usual way that a system, process, or event works Sự ngắt quãng, sự gián đoạn
Ví dụ:
  • It would cause a tremendous disruption to our work schedule to install a different computer system.
  • A crackdown on illegal-immigrant hiring could create widespread workplace disruptions.

dissatisfaction /ˌdɪsˌsætɪsˈfækʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a feeling that you are not pleased and satisfied Sự không bằng lòng, sự không hài lòng, sự không thoả mãn, sự bất mãn.
Ví dụ:
  • She expressed deep dissatisfaction at the way the interview had been conducted

dissertation /ˌdɪsərˈteɪʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a long piece of writing on a particular subject, especially one written for a university degree khóa luận, luận văn
Ví dụ:
  • Ann did her dissertation on Baudelaire

distinct /dɪˈstɪŋkt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
clearly noticeable; that certainly exists Dễ nhận, dễ thấy, rõ ràng Riêng, riêng biệt; khác biệt.
Ví dụ:
  • There's a distinct smell of cigarettes in here
  • His voice was quiet but every word was distinct.

distort /dɪˈstɔːrt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to twist or change facts, ideas, etc so that they are no longer correct or true Vặn vẹo, bóp méo, làm méo mó. Bóp méo, xuyên tạc (sự việc ).
Ví dụ:
  • Newspapers are often guilty of distorting the truth.
  • The article gave a distorted picture of his childhood
  • My original statement has been completely distorted by the media.

distraction /dɪˈstrækʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a thing that takes your attention away from what you are doing or thinking about (thứ gây sao lãng, mất tập trung, làm đứt quãng mạch tư tưởng, công việc đang làm )
Ví dụ:
  • I find it hard to work at home because there are too many distractions.
  • I can turn the television off if you find it a distraction.

distribute /dɪˈstrɪbjuːt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to give things to a large number of people; to share something between a number of people to send goods to shops/stores and businesses so that they can be sold Phân bổ, phân phối, phân phát
Ví dụ:
  • The newspaper is distributed free
  • The organization distributed food to the earthquake victims.
  • The money was distributed among schools in the area.
  • Who distributes our products in the UK?

ditch /dɪtʃ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a long channel dug at the side of a field or road, to hold or take away water Hào, rãnh, mương.
Ví dụ:
  • The car left the road and ended up in a ditch

diversity /daɪˈvɜːrsəti/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
[uncountable, countable, usually singular] a range of many people or things that are very different from each other [synonym] variety sự đa dạng
Ví dụ:
  • the biological diversity of the rainforests
  • a great/wide/rich diversity of opinion

domestic /dəˈmestɪk/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
used in the home; connected with the home or family of or inside a particular country; not foreign or international (Thuộc) Gia đình, (thuộc) việc nhà, nội trợ Trong nước (làm ở) trong nước, nội (đối với ngoại).
Ví dụ:
  • domestic chores
  • domestic market

domesticate /dəˈmestɪkeɪt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to make a wild animal used to living with or working for humans Làm cho hợp thuỷ thổ (cây ); thuần hoá (súc vật)
Ví dụ:
  • Dogs were probably the first animals to be domesticated

domesticated /dəˈmestɪkeɪtɪd/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(of animals or plants) brought under human control in order to provide food, power, or company (đọng vật) đã được thuần hóa, thuần chủng
Ví dụ:
  • These animals are only partly domesticated.
  • domesticated elephants

dominant /ˈdɑːmɪnənt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
more important, strong, or noticeable than anything else of the same type Át, trội, có ưu thế hơn; có ảnh hưởng lớn, chi phối. Thống trị.
Ví dụ:
  • The firm has achieved a dominant position in the world market
  • The dominant feature of the room was the large fireplace.

dominate /ˈdɑːmɪneɪt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to control or have a lot of influence over somebody/something chiếm áp đảo, có ảnh hưởng lớn, có sức chi phối lớn
Ví dụ:
  • He refuses to let others speak and dominates every meeting.
  • They work as a group - no one person is allowed to dominate.

double /ˈdʌbl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to become, or make something become, twice as much or as many Làm gấp đôi, tăng gấp đôi, nhân gấp đôi
Ví dụ:
  • Membership almost doubled in two years.
  • Double all the quantities in the recipe to make enough for eight people.

double-edged /ˌdʌbl ˈedʒd/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(Nghĩa bóng) Hai lưỡi (vừa lợi vừa hại cho mình như dao hai lưỡi) (lý luận )
Ví dụ:
  • She paid me the double-edged compliment of saying my work was "excellent for a beginner
  • "
  • The government's programme to grow cash crops for export is a double-edged sword because it has created a local food shortage.

doubtful /ˈdaʊtfl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
unlikely; not probable Đáng nghi, đáng ngờ; không rõ rệt, không chắc chắn
Ví dụ:
  • It's doubtful if this painting is a Picasso.
  • With her injuries it's doubtful that she'll ever walk again.

downside /ˈdaʊnsaɪd/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a disadvantage of a situation khuyết điểm, điểm yếu
Ví dụ:
  • The downside of living here, of course, is that it is expensive.
  • Unemployment, inflation, and greater inequality are often the downside of a market economy.

drain /dreɪn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a pipe that carries away dirty water or other liquid waste Ống dẫn (nước ), cống, rãnh, mương, máng
Ví dụ:
  • I think the kitchen drain is blocked.
  • She accidentally dropped her ring down a drain in the road.

drastic /ˈdrɑːstɪk/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
extreme in a way that has a sudden, serious or violent effect on something Tác động mạnh mẽ, quyết liệt
Ví dụ:
  • drastic measures/changes
  • The government is threatening to take drastic action.
  • a drastic shortage of food
  • a drastic reduction in their standard of living

drought /draʊt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a long period of time when there is little or no rain hạn hán
Ví dụ:
  • two years of severe drought
  • one of the worst droughts on record
  • The country’s entire grain harvest has been hit by drought.

durable /ˌdʊrəbl ˈɡʊdz/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
goods which are expected to last for a long time after they have been bought, such as cars, televisions, etc Hàng hoá dự kiến sẽ dùng được trong một thời gian dài sau khi đã được mua, chẳng hạn như ô tô, ti vi, v v

dusk /dʌsk/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the time of day when the light has almost gone, but it is not yet dark [synonym] twilight Lúc chạng vạng, lúc tối nhá nhem
Ví dụ:
  • The street lights go on at dusk.
  • I’ve been on the go from dawn to dusk.

dwelling /ˈdwelɪŋ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a house or place to live in chỗ ở, nhà ở
Ví dụ:
  • There is an estimated shortfall of some five million dwellings across the country
  • an application to convert the old barn into a dwelling

dwindle /ˈdwɪndl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to become gradually less or smaller Nhỏ lại, thu nhỏ lại, teo đi, co lại Nhỏ dần đi.
Ví dụ:
  • Support for the party has dwindled away to nothing
  • Membership of the club has dwindled from 70 to 20.

dyslexia /dɪsˈleksiə/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a slight disorder of the brain that causes difficulty in reading and spelling, for example, but does not affect intelligence

earn /ɜːrn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to get money for work that you do Kiếm được (tiền )
Ví dụ:
  • He earns about $40 000 a year.
  • She earned a living as a part-time secretary.
  • She must earn a fortune (= earn a lot of money).

earnings /ˈɜːrnɪŋz/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the money that you earn for the work that you do Tiền kiếm được, tiền lương. Tiền lãi.
Ví dụ:
  • a rise in average earnings
  • compensation for loss of earnings caused by the accident

Earth /ɜːrθ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
/ɜːrθ/ Quả Đất, Trái Đất
Ví dụ:
  • the planet Earth
  • the history of life on earth
  • the earth’s ozone layer
  • The earth revolves around the sun.

eat out UK US

Định nghĩa:
to have a meal in a restaurant, etc rather than at home
Ví dụ:
  • Do you feel like eating out tonight?

ebb /eb/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to become gradually weaker or less [synonym] decrease giảm dần, yếu dần
Ví dụ:
  • The pain was ebbing.
  • As night fell, our enthusiasm began to ebb away.

eclectic /ɪˈklektɪk/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
not following one style or set of ideas but choosing from or using a wide variety không theo riêng một trường phái, xu hướng nào cả mà trộn lẫn, kết hợp đa dạng nhiều cái lại với nhau
Ví dụ:
  • She has very eclectic tastes in literature.
  • His house is an eclectic mixture of the antique and the modern.

eclipse /ɪˈklɪps/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
an occasion when the sun disappears from view, either completely or partly, while the moon is moving between it and the earth, or when the moon becomes darker while the shadow of the earth moves over it Sự che khuất; thiên thực (nhật thực, nguyệt thực)
Ví dụ:
  • a solar/lunar eclipse
  • On Wednesday there will be a total/partial eclipse of the sun.

eco-friendly /ˌiːkoʊ ˈfrendli/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
not harmful to the environment thân thiện với môi trường
Ví dụ:
  • eco-friendly products

ecologically /ˌiːkəˈlɑːdʒɪkli/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
in a way that is connected with the relation of plants and living creatures to each other and to their environment Về phương diện sinh thái
Ví dụ:
  • The system is both practical and ecologically sound

economic /ˌiːkəˈnɑːmɪk/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
relating to trade, industry, and money liên quan đến kinh tế
Ví dụ:
  • The government's economic policies have led us into the worst recession in years

economical /ˌiːkəˈnɑːmɪkl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
using no more of something than is necessary một cách tiết kiệm, một cách kinh tế
Ví dụ:
  • an economical use of space
  • What's the most economical way of heating this building?

economics /ˌiːkəˈnɑːmɪks/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the study of how a society organizes its money, trade and industry môn kinh tế học
Ví dụ:
  • He studied politics and economics at Yale.
  • Keynesian/Marxist economics

economist /ɪˈkɑːnəmɪst/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a person who studies or writes about economics Nhà kinh tế học.
Ví dụ:
  • Many economists expect unemployment to fall over the next couple of months

ecosystem /ˈiːkoʊsɪstəm/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
all the plants and living creatures in a particular area considered in relation to their physical environment Hệ sinh thái
Ví dụ:
  • Islands often support delicate ecosystems that evolved without any need for defence
  • Pollution can have disastrous effects on the delicately balanced ecosystem.

eco-tourism /ˈiːkoʊtʊrɪzəm/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
organized holidays/vacations that are designed so that the tourists damage the environment as little as possible du lịch xanh (không gây hại cho môi trường)
Ví dụ:
  • Eco-tourism is financing rainforest preservation

edition /ɪˈdɪʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a particular form in which a book, magazine, or newspaper is published Loại sách in ra loại sách xuất bản
Ví dụ:
  • the paperback/hardback edition of the dictionary
  • The regional editions of the paper contain specific information for that area.

educated /ˈedʒukeɪtɪd/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
having had a high standard of education; showing a high standard of education Có giáo dục, có học thức
Ví dụ:
  • She seemed intelligent and well educated.
  • the need for a broadly educated workforce

effective /ɪˈfektɪv/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
producing the result that is wanted or intended; producing a successful result Hữu hiệu, có kết quả. Có hiệu lực, có kết quả.
Ví dụ:
  • It's an extremely effective remedy for a headache
  • She's a very effective teacher.

efficient /ɪˈfɪʃnt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
doing something well and thoroughly with no waste of time, money or energy Có năng suất cao, có hiệu suất cao, không lãng phí tài nguyên, thời gian, sức lực
Ví dụ:
  • the efficient use of energy
  • As we get older, our bodies become less efficient at burning up calories.
  • The city's transport system is one of the most efficient in Europe
  • We need someone really efficient who can organize the office and make it run smoothly.

effort /ˈefərt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
physical or mental activity needed to achieve something công sức, sự cố gắng, nỗ lực
Ví dụ:
  • It's a long climb to the top, but well worth the effort

effortless /ˈefərtləs/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
needing little or no effort, so that it seems easy dễ dàng, không đòi hỏi phải cố gắng
Ví dụ:
  • When you watch her dance it looks so effortless.
  • He made playing the guitar look effortless.

eggplant /ˈeɡplænt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a vegetable with shiny dark purple skin and soft white flesh Cà tím

electric /ɪˈlektrɪk/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
full of excitement; making people excited [synonym] electrifying Làm náo động, làm sôi nổi.
Ví dụ:
  • an electric performance
  • The atmosphere was electric
  • The news had an electric effect on the waiting crowd.

electricity /ɪˌlekˈtrɪsəti/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a form of energy that can be produced in several ways and that provides power to devices that create light, heat, etc Điện, điện lực
Ví dụ:
  • The electricity has been turned off.
  • an electricity generating company
  • powered/heated by electricity
  • an electricity bill

elementary /ˌelɪˈmentri/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a school for children between the ages of 4 or 5 and 11 (trường tiểu học)

elephant /ˈelɪfənt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a very large grey mammal that has a trunk (= long nose) with which it can pick things up (Động vật học) Con voi
Ví dụ:
  • Measures must be taken to protect the world's depleted elephant population.
  • In the past eight years, the elephant population in Africa has been halved.

elevated /ˈelɪveɪtɪd/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
higher than normal cao hơn mức bình thường
Ví dụ:
  • elevated highway

eligible /ˈelɪdʒəbl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
having the necessary qualities or satisfying the necessary conditions Đủ điều kiện, đủ tư cách, thích hợp.
Ví dụ:
  • You might be eligible for a grant.
  • Only people over 18 are eligible to vote.

eliminate /ɪˈlɪmɪneɪt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to remove or get rid of something/somebody
Ví dụ:
  • The police have eliminated two suspects from their investigation

elusive /iˈluːsɪv/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
difficult to describe, find, achieve, or remember Hay lảng tránh (người ); có tính chất lảng tránh, có tính chất thoái thác (câu trả lời). Khó nắm (ý nghĩa ).
Ví dụ:
  • Eric, as elusive as ever, was nowhere to be found.
  • the elusive concept of ‘literature’
  • A solution to the problem of toxic waste is proving elusive.

embed /ɪmˈbed/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to fix something firmly into a substance or solid object Ấn vào, đóng vào, gắn vào Khắc sâu vào, ăn sâu vào (nghĩa bóng)
Ví dụ:
  • The bullet embedded itself in the wall.
  • These attitudes are deeply embedded in our society (= felt very strongly and difficult to change).

emerge /iˈmɜːrdʒ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(of facts, ideas, etc ) to become known [synonym] transpire xuất hiện, hiện ra, lòi ra được biết đến
Ví dụ:
  • The facts behind the scandal are sure to emerge eventually.
  • It emerged that the company was going to be sold.

emergence /iˈmɜːrdʒəns/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the fact of something becoming known or starting to exist Sự nổi lên, sự hiện ra, sự lòi ra
Ví dụ:
  • China's emergence as an economic power
  • the island’s emergence from the sea 3 000 years ago

emerging /ɪˈmɝː. dʒɪŋ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
starting to exist mới xuất hiện, mới nổi
Ví dụ:
  • Western governments should be giving more aid to the emerging democracies of the Third World.
  • emergent economies/markets

eminent /ˈemɪnənt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(of people) famous and respected, especially in a particular profession Nổi tiếng, xuất sắc
Ví dụ:
  • an eminent architect
  • an eminent scientist/artist/painter/poet/writer/historian/philosopher/scholar/professor.

emission /iˈmɪʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
[countable] gas, etc that is sent out into the air khí thải
Ví dụ:
  • The government has pledged to clean up industrial emissions
  • carbon dioxide emissions

emit /iˈmɪt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to send out a beam, noise, smell, or gas Phát ra (ánh sáng, nhiệt ), bốc ra, tỏa ra (mùi vị, hơi )
Ví dụ:
  • The metal container began to emit a clicking sound.
  • Sulphur gases were emitted by the volcano.
  • The alarm emits infrared rays which are used to detect any intruder
  • The machine emits a high-pitched sound when you press the button.

emphasis /ˈemfəsɪs/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the particular importance or attention that is given to something Sự nhấn mạnh Tầm quan trọng.
Ví dụ:
  • I think we should put as much emphasis on preventing disease as we do on curing it.
  • Schools here put/place/lay great emphasis on written work and grammar.

emphasize /ˈemfəsaɪz/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to show that something is very important or worth giving attention to Nhấn mạnh. Làm nổi bật (sự kiện ).
Ví dụ:
  • I'd just like to emphasize how important it is for people to learn foreign languages
  • He emphasized that all the people taking part in the research were volunteers.

employ /ɪmˈplɔɪ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to give somebody a job to do for payment Dùng, thuê (ai) (làm gì)
Ví dụ:
  • How many people does the company employ?
  • For the past three years he has been employed as a firefighter.
  • More people are now employed in service industries than in manufacturing.

employment /ɪmˈplɔɪmənt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
work, especially when it is done to earn money; the state of being employed Sự dùng, sự thuê làm (công ). Sự làm công, việc làm.
Ví dụ:
  • to be in paid employment
  • full-time/part-time employment
  • Graduates are finding it more and more difficult to find employment.

enact /ɪˈnækt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to pass a law Ban hành (đạo luật)
Ví dụ:
  • A package of economic sanctions is to be enacted against the country
  • legislation enacted by parliament

enclosed /ɪnˈkloʊzd/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
surrounded by walls, objects, or structures (không gian) khép kín, bị đóng kín, bị vây kín chặt xung quanh
Ví dụ:
  • He doesn't like enclosed spaces

encourage /ɪnˈkɜːrɪdʒ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to persuade somebody to do something by making it easier for them and making them believe it is a good thing to do Khuyến khích, cổ vũ, động viên
Ví dụ:
  • Banks actively encouraged people to borrow money

endangered /ɪnˈdeɪndʒərd/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(used about groups of animals, plants, etc ) at risk of no longer existing có nguy cơ bị tuyệt chủng
Ví dụ:
  • The sea turtle is an endangered species

endemic /enˈdemɪk/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
regularly found in a particular place or among a particular group of people (Sinh vật học) Đặc hữu (loài sinh vật )
Ví dụ:
  • species endemic to (= only found in) Madagascar

endorse /ɪnˈdɔːrs/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to say publicly that you support a person, statement or course of action to appear in an advertisement, saying that you use and like a particular product Xác nhận; tán thành (lời nói, ý kiến ) xác nhận chất lượng được quảng cáo (của món hàng )
Ví dụ:
  • I wholeheartedly endorse his remarks
  • They paid $2 million to the world champion to endorse their new aftershave.

end up UK US

Định nghĩa:
to finally be in a particular place or situation:
Ví dụ:
  • They're travelling across Europe by train and are planning to end up in Moscow.
  • Much of this meat will probably end up as dog food.
  • She'll end up penniless if she continues to spend like that.
  • After working her way around the world, she ended up teaching English as a foreign language.

endure /ɪnˈdʊr/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to experience and deal with something that is painful or unpleasant, especially without complaining có thể kiên nhẫn chịu đựng có thể kiên cường vượt qua (sóng gió, thử thách)
Ví dụ:
  • (formal) a love that endures all things and never fails
  • We had to endure a nine-hour delay at the airport.

energy efficient /ˈenərdʒiɪˈfɪʃnt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
using little electricity, gas, etc : (đồ dùng) tiết kiệm điện/nhiên liệu/năng lượng
Ví dụ:
  • energy-efficient homes/energy-efficient lighting

enforce /ɪnˈfɔːrs/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to make sure that people obey a particular law or rule Bắt tôn trọng, bắt tuân theo; đem thi hành (luật lệ)
Ví dụ:
  • It's the job of the police to enforce the law.
  • It isn't always easy for the police to enforce speed limits
  • The new teacher had failed to enforce any sort of discipline.

enforceable /ɪnˈfɔːrsəbl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(of a law or rule) that somebody in authority can make people obey (Pháp lí) Có thể đem thi hành
Ví dụ:
  • A gambling debt is not legally enforceable
  • The contract may not be legally enforceable if it is not drawn up correctly.

enforcement /ɪnˈfɔːrsmənt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the act of making people obey a particular law or rule Sự thúc ép, sự ép buộc. Sự bắt tôn trọng, sự bắt tuân theo; sự đem thi hành (luật lệ).
Ví dụ:
  • strict enforcement of regulations
  • law enforcement officers

engaged /ɪnˈɡeɪdʒd/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
involved in something đang tham gia vào, có liên quan đến (cái gì đấy)
Ví dụ:
  • They are engaged in talks with the Irish government
  • She's part of a team of scientists who are engaged on/upon cancer research.

engine /ˈendʒɪn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the part of a vehicle that produces power to make the vehicle move Máy động cơ
Ví dụ:
  • a diesel/petrol engine
  • My car had to have a new engine.

engineer /ˌendʒɪˈnɪr/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to design and build something using scientific principles thiết kế và xây dựng
Ví dụ:
  • The car is beautifully engineered and a pleasure to drive

engrossed /ɪnˈɡroʊst/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
so interested or involved in something that you give it all your attention mê mải đến mức quên cả những thứ xung quanh
Ví dụ:
  • She was so engrossed by/in the book that she forgot the cookies in the oven.
  • They were so engrossed in/with what they were doing that they didn't hear me come in.

enhance /ɪnˈhæns/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to increase or further improve the good quality, value or status of somebody/something Làm tăng, nâng cao, đề cao, làm nổi bật (đức tính, quyền hạn ).
Ví dụ:
  • This is an opportunity to enhance the reputation of the company.
  • the skilled use of make-up to enhance your best features

enigmatic /ˌenɪɡˈmætɪk/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
mysterious and impossible to understand completely Bí ẩn, khó hiểu
Ví dụ:
  • The Mona Lisa has a famously enigmatic smile.
  • He left an enigmatic message on my answering machine.

enormous /ɪˈnɔːrməs/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
extremely large [synonym] huge, immense To lớn, khổng lồ.
Ví dụ:
  • an enormous car/house
  • He earns an enormous salary.

enrich /ɪnˈrɪtʃ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to improve the quality of something by adding something else Làm giàu, làm giàu thêm, làm phong phú
Ví dụ:
  • Fertilizer helps to enrich the soil.
  • My life was greatly enriched by knowing her.

ensure /ɪnˈʃɔː(r)/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to make sure that something happens or is definite Bảo đảm. Giành được chắc chắn (cái gì) (cho ai).
Ví dụ:
  • The book ensured his success.
  • Victory ensured them a place in the final.
  • Please ensure (that) all lights are switched off.

entertain /ˌentərˈteɪn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to interest and amuse somebody in order to please them Giải trí, tiêu khiển
Ví dụ:
  • He entertained us for hours with his stories and jokes.
  • The aim of the series is both to entertain and inform.

entertaining /ˌentərˈteɪnɪŋ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
funny and enjoyable Có tính giải trí, hài hước, hấp dẫn, thú vị
Ví dụ:
  • an entertaining story/movieHis books aren't particularly well-written, but they're always entertaining.

enthusiasm /ɪnˈθuːziæzəm/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a feeling of energetic interest in a particular subject or activity and an eagerness to be involved in it Sự hăng hái, sự nhiệt tình
Ví dụ:
  • One of the good things about teaching young children is their enthusiasm.
  • After the accident he lost his enthusiasm for the sport.
  • I just can't work up (= start to feel) any enthusiasm for the whole project.

entirely /ɪnˈtaɪərli/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
n every way possible; completely Toàn bộ, toàn vẹn, trọn vẹn; hoàn toàn
Ví dụ:
  • I entirely agree with you.
  • I'm not entirely happy about the proposal.
  • That's an entirely different matter.
  • The audience was almost entirely female.

entrepreneur /ˌɑːn. trə. prəˈnɝː/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a person who makes money by starting or running businesses, especially when this involves taking financial risks người khởi nghiệp, người tự sáng lập công ty mới
Ví dụ:
  • He was one of the entrepreneurs of the 80s who made their money in property

environment /ɪnˈvaɪrənmənt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the air, water, and land in or on which people, animals, and plants live môi trường tự nhiên (luôn luôn có “the”)
Ví dụ:
  • Certain chemicals have been banned because of their damaging effect on the environment
  • We're not doing enough to protect the environment from pollution.

environmental /ɪnˌvaɪrənˈmentl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
relating to the environment liên quan đến môi trường, về mặt môi trường
Ví dụ:
  • People are becoming far more aware of environmental issues
  • the environmental impact of pollution

environmentally friendly /ɪnˌvaɪrənmentəli ˈfrendli/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(of products) not harming the environment thân thiện với môi trường, không gây hại cho môi trường (sản phẩm)
Ví dụ:
  • environmentally friendly packaging

envisage /ɪnˈvɪzɪdʒ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to imagine or expect what will happen in the future, especially something good Dự tính, vạch ra (kế hoạch ); nhìn trước
Ví dụ:
  • It's envisaged that building will start at the end of this year
  • When do you envisage finishing the project?

equator /ɪˈkweɪtər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
an imaginary line around the earth at an equal distance from the North and South Poles Xích đạo
Ví dụ:
  • The island is twenty degrees south of the equator
  • Indonesia is/lies on the equator.

equip /ɪˈkwɪp/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to provide yourself/somebody/something with the things that are needed for a particular purpose or activity They have been charged with equipping the guerillas with arms
Ví dụ:
  • All the police officers were equipped with shields to defend themselves against the rioters
  • They have been charged with equipping the guerillas with arms.

era /ˈerə/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a period of time, usually in history, that is different from other periods because of particular characteristics or events Thời đại, kỷ nguyên.
Ví dụ:
  • the Victorian/modern/post-war era
  • When she left the firm, it was the end of an era (= things were different after that).

eradicate /ɪˈrædɪkeɪt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to destroy or get rid of something completely, especially something bad [synonym] wipe out Nhổ rễ. Trừ tiệt, triệt hạ, xóa sạch.
Ví dụ:
  • The government claims to be doing all it can to eradicate corruption.
  • The disease that once claimed millions of lives has now been eradicated.

erect /ɪˈrekt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to build a building, wall, or other structure Dựng đứng thẳng, đặt đứng thẳng Dựng nên, xây dựng ((nghĩa đen) & (nghĩa bóng)).
Ví dụ:
  • The war memorial was erected in 1950.
  • The soldiers had erected barricades to protect themselves.

erode /ɪˈroʊd/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to gradually destroy the surface of something through the action of wind, rain, etc ; to be gradually destroyed in this way Xói mòn, ăn mòn.
Ví dụ:
  • The cliff face has been steadily eroded by the sea
  • The rocks have eroded away over time.

erosion /ɪˈroʊʒn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the fact of soil, stone, etc being gradually damaged and removed by the waves, rain, or wind Sự xói mòn, sự ăn mòn.
Ví dụ:
  • the erosion of the coastline by the sea
  • soil erosion

essay /ˈeseɪ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a short piece of writing on a particular subject bài tiểu luận
Ví dụ:
  • For homework I want you to write an essay on endangered species

essential /ɪˈsenʃl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
necessary or needed Cần thiết, thiết yếu, cốt yếu, chủ yếu.
Ví dụ:
  • Water is essential for/to living things

establish /ɪˈstæblɪʃ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to start a company or organization that will continue for a long time Lập, thành lập (công ty, tổ chức) to start having a relationship with, or communicating with another person, company, country, or organization thiết lập (mối quan hệ, liên lạc)
Ví dụ:
  • The committee was established in 1912
  • The school has established a successful relationship with the local community.

estimate /ˈestɪmət/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to guess or calculate the cost, size, value, etc of something Đánh giá; ước lượng
Ví dụ:
  • hey estimate (that) the journey will take at least two weeks.
  • It is estimated (that) the project will last four years
  • It is hard to estimate how many children suffer from dyslexia

estuary /ˈestʃueri/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the wide part of a river at the place where it joins the sea Cửa sông.

ethnic /ˈeθnɪk/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
relating to a particular race of people Thuộc dân tộc, thuộc tộc người
Ví dụ:
  • Conflicts between the different ethnic groups in the country exploded into civil war

ethnicity /eθˈnɪsəti/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a large group of people who have the same national, racial, or cultural origins, or the state of belonging to such a group dân tộc, sắc tộc
Ví dụ:
  • Many factors are important, for example class, gender, age and ethnicity.

eventuality /ɪˌventʃuˈæləti/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
something that may possibly happen, especially something unpleasant Sự việc có thể xảy ra; kết quả có thể xảy ra, tình huống có thể xảy ra
Ví dụ:
  • to be ready for any eventualities — phải sẵn sàng trước mọi tình huống có thể xảy ra
  • We were prepared for every eventuality.
  • The money had been saved for just such an eventuality.
  • In the eventuality of your passport being stolen, contact the embassy at once.

exacerbate /ɪɡˈzæsərbeɪt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(formal) to make something worse, especially a disease or problem [synonym] aggravate làm cho tồi tệ thêm, gia tăng tính nghiêm trọng của vấn đề đổ thêm dầu vào lửa
Ví dụ:
  • His aggressive reaction only exacerbated the situation.
  • This attack will exacerbate the already tense relations between the two communities.

examine /ɪɡˈzæmɪn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to look at or consider a person or thing carefully and in detail in order to discover something about them Khám xét, xem xét, thẩm tra, khảo sát, nghiên cứu
Ví dụ:
  • Forensic scientists are examining the wreckage for clues about the cause of the explosion.
  • The council is to examine ways of reducing traffic in the city centre.
  • The research examined the effects of alcohol on long-term memory.

excavate /ˈekskəveɪt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to dig in the ground to look for old buildings or objects that have been buried for a long time; to find something by digging in this way đào, khai quật
Ví dụ:
  • The site has been excavated by archaeologists.
  • The area has not yet been fully excavated.

excavation /ˌekskəˈveɪʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the activity of digging in the ground to look for old buildings or objects that have been buried for a long time Sự khai quật.
Ví dụ:
  • Further archaeological excavations are now being carried out

excess /ɪkˈses/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
more than is necessary, reasonable or acceptable Sự vượt quá giới hạn, sự quá mức; sự vượt, sự hơn. Số lượng vượt quá, số lượng hơn, thừa ra, số dôi; độ dôi.
Ví dụ:
  • An excess of enthusiasm is not always a good thing.
  • They both eat to excess (= too much).

exclude /ɪkˈskluːd/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to deliberately not include something in what you are doing or considering Không cho (ai ) vào (một nơi nào ); không cho (ai ) hưởng (quyền
Ví dụ:
  • Try excluding fat from your diet.
  • Buses run every hour, Sundays excluded.
  • Women are still excluded from the club.

exclusively /ɪkˈskluːsɪvli/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
for only one particular person, group or use chỉ dành cho, chỉ thuộc về
Ví dụ:
  • The resort caters almost exclusively for a high-society public.
  • Some products are labelled exclusively for indoor or outdoor use.

exercise /ˈeksərsaɪz/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
an activity that is designed to achieve a particular result một biện pháp, một hoạt động, một phương thức làm gì đó
Ví dụ:
  • Staying calm was an exercise in self-control.
  • In the end it proved a pointless exercise.

exhaust /ɪɡˈzɔːst/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
waste gases that come out of a vehicle, an engine or a machine khí thải
Ví dụ:
  • Car exhaust is the main reason for the city's pollution

exhausting /ɪɡˈzɔːstɪŋ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
making you feel very tired Làm kiệt sức, làm mệt lử
Ví dụ:
  • an exhausting day at work
  • Speaking as a mother of four, I can tell you that children are exhausting
  • It's exhausting commuting from Brighton to London every day.

exhort /ɪɡˈzɔːrt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to try hard to persuade somebody to do something [synonym] urge Hô hào, cổ vũ, thúc đẩy. Chủ trương, ủng hộ (sự cải cách gì ).
Ví dụ:
  • The party leader exhorted his members to start preparing for government
  • They had been exhorted to action.

existence /ɪɡˈzɪstəns/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the state or fact of being real or living or of being present Sự tồn tại
Ví dụ:
  • I was unaware of his existence until today.
  • This is the oldest Hebrew manuscript in existence.
  • Pakistan came into existence as an independent country in 1947.
  • a crisis that threatens the industry’s continued existence

exotic /ɪɡˈzɑːtɪk/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
from or in another country, especially a tropical one; seeming exciting and unusual because it is connected with foreign countries Ở nước ngoài đưa vào, ngoại lai (cây cỏ, từ, mốt). Kỳ lạ, kỳ cục; đẹp kỳ lạ.
Ví dụ:
  • brightly-coloured exotic flowers/plants/birds
  • She travels to all kinds of exotic locations all over the world.
  • The fruits sound exotic
  • Do they taste good?

expend /ɪkˈspend/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(formal) to use or spend a lot of time, money, energy, etc Tiêu, tiêu dùng (tiền ). Dùng hết, dùng cạn.
Ví dụ:
  • She expended all her efforts on the care of home and children.
  • Smith had expended large sums in pursuing his claim through the court.
  • Most animals expend a lot of energy searching for food.

expense /ɪkˈspens/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the money that you spend on something Sự tiêu; phí tổn. (Số nhiều) Phụ phí, công tác phí.
Ví dụ:
  • No expense was spared (= they spent as much money as was needed) to make the party a success.
  • He's arranged everything, no expense spared.
  • She always travels first-class regardless of expense.
  • The results are well worth the expense.

expert /ˈekspɜːrt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a person with a high level of knowledge or skill relating to a particular subject or activity Nhà chuyên môn, chuyên gia, chuyên viên
Ví dụ:
  • He's an expert on 15th-century Italian art.
  • My mother is an expert at dress-making (= she does it very well).

expertise /ˌekspɜːrˈtiːz/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
expert knowledge or skill in a particular subject, activity or job Sự thành thạo, sự tinh thông. Tài chuyên môn; ý kiến về mặt chuyên môn.
Ví dụ:
  • We have the expertise to help you run your business.
  • It is difficult to find staff with the level of expertise required for this job.

explicit /ɪkˈsplɪsɪt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
clear and exact Rõ ràng, dứt khoát
Ví dụ:
  • I gave her very explicit directions how to get here.
  • She was very explicit about (= said very clearly and exactly) what she thought was wrong with the plans.
  • I wasn't aware that I would be paying - you certainly didn't make it explicit (= state it clearly).

exploit /ɪkˈsplɔɪt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to use someone or something unfairly for your own advantage lợi dụng
Ví dụ:
  • Laws exist to stop companies exploiting their employees
  • He exploited his father's name to get himself a job
  • She realized that her youth and inexperience were being exploited
  • The opposition parties will always exploit government problems to their own advantage.

exploitation /ˌeksplɔɪˈteɪʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the use of something in order to get an advantage from it Sự khai thác. Sự bóc lột, sự lợi dụng.
Ví dụ:
  • Britain's exploitation of its natural gas reserves began after the Second World Wa
  • the exploitation of children

exploration /ˌekspləˈreɪʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the act of travelling through a place in order to find out about it or look for something in it Sự thăm dò, sự thám hiểm
Ví dụ:
  • the exploration of space
  • oil exploration (= searching for oil in the ground)

explorer /ɪkˈsplɔːrər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
someone who travels to places where no one has ever been in order to find out what is there Người thăm dò, người thám hiểm
Ví dụ:
  • Magellan was a famous 16th-century explorer.

expose /ɪkˈspoʊz/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to show something that is usually hidden to make public something bad or dishonest [synonym] reveal Phơi ra. Phơi bày ra, phô ra; bóc trần, phơi trần, vạch trần, bộc lộ.
Ví dụ:
  • The plaster on the walls has been removed to expose the original bricks underneath.
  • The review exposed widespread corruption in the police force.

exposé /ˌekspoʊˈzeɪ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a public report of the facts about a situation, especially one that is shocking or has been kept secret Sự để lòi ra, sự để lộ ra (chuyện xấu xa, tội lỗi) Bài báo, bài phóng sự phanh phui, vạch trần điều xấu xa, phạm pháp
Ví dụ:
  • Today's newspaper contains a searing exposé of police corruption

exposed /ɪkˈspoʊzd/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
experience something harmful or unpleasant Đặt vào (nơi nguy hiểm ), đặt vào tình thế dễ bị (tai nan ).
Ví dụ:
  • You could be exposing yourself to unnecessary risks when driving alone

express /ɪkˈspres/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to show a feeling, opinion, or fact Biểu lộ, bày tỏ (tình cảm ); phát biểu ý kiên
Ví dụ:
  • Her eyes expressed deep sadness.
  • I would like to express my thanks for your kindness.
  • Words can't express how happy I am.
  • These figures are expressed as a percentage of the total.

extend /ɪkˈstend/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to make something longer or larger to make something last longer Kéo dài (thời hạn ), gia hạn, mở rộng
Ví dụ:
  • to extend a fence/road/house
  • The show has been extended for another six weeks.

exterior /ɪkˈstɪriər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
on or from the outside Ngoài, ở ngoài, từ ngoài vào
Ví dụ:
  • In some of the villages the exterior walls of the houses are painted pink.
  • The exterior lights of the house came on as I approached the door.

external /ɪkˈstɜːrnl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
of, on, for, or coming from the outside Ở ngoài, bên ngoài (hiện tượng )
Ví dụ:
  • the external walls of the house
  • Most news magazines have a section devoted to external affairs (= foreign news)
  • You shouldn't judge people by their external appearances (= what they appear to be like).

extinct /ɪkˈstɪŋkt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(of a type of plant, animal, etc ) no longer in existence Tuyệt giống, tuyệt chủng
Ví dụ:
  • an extinct species
  • to become extinct

extract /ɪkˈstrækt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to remove or obtain a substance from something lấy ra, rút ra
Ví dụ:
  • a machine that extracts excess moisture from the air
  • to extract essential oils from plants

extraterrestrial /ˌekstrətəˈrestriəl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(coming from) outside the planet Earth Ngoài trái đất, ngoài bầu khí quyển
Ví dụ:
  • extraterrestrial beings

extreme /ɪkˈstriːm/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the largest possible amount or degree of something Giới hạn tuyệt đối Cực, thái cực, mức cùng cực.
Ví dụ:
  • I've never witnessed such extremes of wealth and poverty.
  • Most people I know work fairly hard but she takes it to extremes.

fabric /ˈfæbrɪk/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
cloth or material for making clothes, covering furniture, etc Vải ((thường) texile
Ví dụ:
  • silk and woollen fabrics — hàng tơ lụa và len dạ

facility /fəˈsɪləti/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a place, especially including buildings, where a particular activity happens phương tiện, cơ sở, thiết bị để phục vụ cho mục đích gì đó (học tập, thư giãn, công việc )
Ví dụ:
  • shopping/banking/cooking facilities
  • The hotel has special facilities for welcoming disabled people.

fact /fækt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a thing that is known to be true, especially when it can be proved Sự thật
Ví dụ:
  • No decision will be made until we know all the facts.
  • He knew for a fact that Natalie was lying.
  • It's sometimes hard to separate fact from fiction.

factor /ˈfæktər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a part or element that contributes to a result nhân tố
Ví dụ:
  • Heavy snow was a contributing factor in the accident.

factual /ˈfæktʃuəl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
based on or containing facts (Thuộc) Sự thực; căn cứ trên sự thực; thực sự, có thật
Ví dụ:
  • She gave a clear, factual account of the attack to the police

fair /fer/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a large public event where goods are bought and sold, usually from tables that have been specially arranged for the event, and where there is often entertainment Hội chợ, chợ phiên
Ví dụ:
  • I bought a wooden salad bowl at the local craft fair

faith /feɪθ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
great trust or confidence in something or someone Sự tin tưởng, sự tin cậy Niềm tin.
Ví dụ:
  • She has no faith in modern medicine.
  • You'll cope - I have great faith in you.

fame /feɪm/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the state of being known or recognized by many people because of your achievements, skills, etc Tiếng tăm, danh tiếng, danh thơm, tên tuổi
Ví dụ:
  • She first rose to fame as a singer at the age of 16.
  • The town's only claim to fame is that there was once a riot there
  • She went to Hollywood in search of fame and fortune

famous /ˈfeɪməs/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
known and recognized by many people Nổi tiếng, nổi danh
Ví dụ:
  • a famous actress/building
  • Marie Curie is famous for her contribution to science.
  • a city famous for its nightlife

far-flung /ˌfɑːr ˈflʌŋ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
​used to refer to places that are a great distance away, or something that is spread over a very large area: Xa, rộng, trải rộng bao la.
Ví dụ:
  • She has travelled to the most far-flung corners of the world.

fascinating /ˈfæsɪneɪtɪŋ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
extremely interesting and attractive Làm mê, làm say mê, quyến rũ
Ví dụ:
  • The book offers a fascinating glimpse of the lives of the rich and famous.
  • I found the whole movie fascinating.

fascination /ˌfæsɪˈneɪʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a very strong attraction, that makes something very interesting Sự mê hoặc, sự quyến rũ
Ví dụ:
  • London has a fascination all of its own.
  • The fascination of the game lies in trying to guess what your opponent is thinking.

fatal /ˈfeɪtl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
causing or ending in death làm nguy hiểm đến tính mạng, chí tử, làm chết, đưa đến chỗ chết, đem lại cái chết
Ví dụ:
  • This illness is fatal in almost all cases.
  • If she gets ill again it could prove fatal.

fatality /fəˈtæləti/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a death caused by an accident or by violence someone who has died in either of these ways Sự bất hạnh, sự rủi ro, tai ương (con số thương vong)
Ví dụ:
  • Several people were injured, but there were no fatalities.
  • a campaign to reduce the number of fatalities on the roads

fatherhood /ˈfɑːðərhʊd/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the state or time of being a father việc làm cha, cương vị làm cha, thời gian làm cha
Ví dụ:
  • Fatherhood is a lifelong responsibility.

fauna /ˈfɔːnə/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
all the animals that live wild in a particular area Hệ động vật
Ví dụ:
  • While she was in Hawaii, she studied the local flora and fauna
  • (specialist) land and marine faunas

favour /ˈfeɪvər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to support or prefer one particular thing to give an advantage to someone or something, in an unfair way Thích dùng (thứ áo, giày nào đó) hơn các thứ khác cùng loại Ưu đãi, biệt đãi, chiếu cố, thiên vị,ủng hộ (ai)
Ví dụ:
  • I generally favour travelling by night, when the roads are quiet
  • She always felt that her parents favoured her brother.

feasible /ˈfiːzəbl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
able to be made, done, or achieved Khả thi, có thể thực hành được, có thể thực hiện được, có thể làm được
Ví dụ:
  • With the extra resources, the project now seems feasible.
  • It's just not feasible to manage the business on a part-time basis.

feat /fiːt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
an action or a piece of work that needs skill, strength or courage Kỳ công, chiến công Ngón điêu luyện, ngón tài ba.
Ví dụ:
  • The Eiffel Tower is a remarkable feat of engineering.
  • She performed remarkable feats of organization for the company.
  • a feat of arms — chiến công
  • a feat of arcrobatics — ngón biểu diễn nhào lộn điêu luyện

feather /ˈfeðər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
one of the many soft light parts covering a bird’s body lông vũ (của các loài chim)
Ví dụ:
  • a peacock feather
  • a feather pillow (= one containing feathers)

feature /ˈfiːtʃər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a typical quality or an important part of something Nét đặc biệt, điểm đặc trưng
Ví dụ:
  • The town's main features are its beautiful mosque and ancient marketplace.
  • Our latest model of phone has several new features.
  • A unique feature of these rock shelters was that they were dry.

feedstock /ˈfiːdstɒk/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
material that is used in an industrial process Nguyên liệu cấp cho máy để chế biến
Ví dụ:
  • The company has started recycling plastic waste as feedstock in its iron furnaces.

fellow /ˈfeloʊ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(informal, becoming old-fashioned) a way of referring to a man or boy Người, người ta; ông bạn; thằng cha, gã, anh chàng
Ví dụ:
  • He seemed like a decent fellow
  • He's a nice old fellow.

feminine /ˈfemənɪn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
having the qualities or appearance considered to be typical of women; connected with women nữ tính,yểu điệu dịu dàng, bánh bèo
Ví dụ:
  • That dress makes you look very feminine.
  • The current style in evening wear is soft, romantic, and feminine.

femininity /ˌfeməˈnɪnəti/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the fact of being a woman; the qualities that are considered to be typical of women vẻ nữ tính

ferry /ˈferi/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a boat or ship that carries people, vehicles and goods across a river or across a narrow part of the sea phà
Ví dụ:
  • We're going to the Channel Islands by/on the ferry
  • We took the ferry to Calais.

fertile /ˈfɜːrtl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(of land or soil) that plants grow well in Tốt, màu mỡ (đất)
Ví dụ:
  • In order to turn the deserts into fertile and productive land, engineers built an 800-mile canal.
  • Organic farmers don't put chemicals into the soil, but keep it fertile by growing clover and adding manure.

fertilizer /ˈfɜːrtəlaɪzər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a natural or chemical substance that is spread on the land or given to plants, to make plants grow well Phân bón (tự nhiên hoặc tổng hợp)
Ví dụ:
  • organic fertilizer
  • a liquid/chemical fertilizer
  • a bag of fertilizerHe spread fertilizer on the field with a rake.

field /fiːld/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a particular subject or activity that somebody works in or is interested in [synonym] area Lĩnh vực (hoạt động), phạm vi (nghiên cứu)
Ví dụ:
  • famous in the field of music
  • I enjoy meeting people in other fields of business.

filth /fɪlθ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
any very dirty and unpleasant substance Rác rưởi, rác bẩn
Ví dụ:
  • The floor was covered in grease and filth.

fine /faɪn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a sum of money that must be paid as punishment for breaking a law or rule Tiền phạt
Ví dụ:
  • a parking fine
  • Offenders will be liable to a heavy fine (= one that costs a lot of money).
  • Under the new law, motorists face fines of up to £1 000.
  • She has already paid over $2 000 in fines.

firm /fɜːrm/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a business or company Hãng, công ty
Ví dụ:
  • She hired afirmof private detectives to follow him
  • She set up her own softwarefirm.

fivefold /ˈfaɪv. foʊld/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
five times as big or as much Gấp năm lần
Ví dụ:
  • a fivefold rise in share prices

flat /flæt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
uk (us [apartment]) a set of rooms for living in that are part of a larger building and are usually all on one floor Căn phòng, căn buồng, căn hộ
Ví dụ:
  • a block of flats
  • They have a house in the country and a flat in Manchester.

flaunt /flɔːnt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to show something you are proud of to other people, in order to impress them He did not believe in [flaunting] his wealth. She openly [flaunted] herwealth.
Ví dụ:
  • Khoe khoang, phô trương, chưng diện.

fleet /fliːt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a group of military ships commanded by the same person Đội tàu, hạm đội. Đội máy bay, phi đội.
Ví dụ:
  • a fleet of destroyers
  • Nelson destroyed the Franco-Spanish fleet at the Battle of Trafalgar

flexibility /ˌfleksəˈbɪləti/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the quality of being able to change or be changed easily according to the situation Tính linh động, tính linh hoạt
Ví dụ:
  • Computers offer a much greater degree of flexibility in the way work is organized.
  • An overdraft provides increased flexibility but at a higher cost.

flexible /ˈfleksəbl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
able to change or be changed easily according to the situation
Ví dụ:
  • My schedule is flexible - I could arrange to meet with you any day next week
  • Linh động, linh hoạt.

flight /flaɪt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a journey made by air, especially in a plane Sự bay; chuyến bay
Ví dụ:
  • We met on a flight from London to Paris.
  • All flights between New York and Washington have been cancelled due to fog.

flora /ˈflɔːrə/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
All the plants of a particular place or from a particular time in history Hệ thực vật (của một vùng)
Ví dụ:
  • the flora of the Balearic Islands
  • Stone Age flora

flourish /ˈflɜːrɪʃ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to develop quickly and be successful or common [synonym] thrive Hưng thịnh, thịnh vượng, phát đạt; thành công; phát triển, mọc sum sê (cây )
Ví dụ:
  • Few businesses are flourishing in the present economic climate.
  • There was a flourishing black market.

fluctuate /ˈflʌktʃueɪt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to change frequently in size, amount, quality, etc , especially from one extreme to another dao động, lên xuống, thay đổi bất thường
Ví dụ:
  • During the crisis, oil prices fluctuated between $20 and $40 a barrel

fluctuation /ˌflʌktʃuˈeɪʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a situation in which prices, levels or interest rates go up and down Sự dao động, sự lên xuống, sự thay đổi bất thường.
Ví dụ:
  • wild fluctuations in interest rates
  • the constant fluctuation of oil prices

fluency /ˈfluːənsi/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the quality of being able to speak or write a language easily and well sự lưu loát, sự trôi chảy (ngoại ngữ)
Ví dụ:
  • Fluency in French is required for this job.

fluent /ˈfluːənt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
able to speak, read or write a language, especially a foreign language, easily and well (ngoại ngữ) thành thạo, lưu loát, nói/viết trôi chảy
Ví dụ:
  • ‘Can he speak German?’ ‘Yes, he’s fluent
  • ’

fluid /ˈfluːɪd/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
≈(of movements, designs, music, etc ) smooth and elegant [synonym]flowing (chuyển động) mượt mà, thanh thoát, uyển chuyển cứ như là chất lỏng
Ví dụ:
  • (of movements, designs, music, etc
  • ) smooth and elegant
  • synonymflowing

fluidity /fluˈɪdəti/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the quality of being likely to change repeatedly and unexpectedly Tính lưu động; tính linh động (như nước)
Ví dụ:
  • the fluidity of the political situation
  • the fluidity of human behaviour

fluorescent /ˌflʊˈresnt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
Huỳnh quang
Ví dụ:
  • a fluorescent lamp (= one that uses such a substance)
  • fluorescent lighting

foliage /ˈfoʊliɪdʒ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the leaves of a tree or plant; leaves and branches together (Thực vật học) Tán lá, vòm lá
Ví dụ:
  • The dense foliage overhead almost blocked out the sun

following /ˈfɑːloʊɪŋ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
next in time that is/are going to be mentioned next Tiếp theo, sau đó, sau đây
Ví dụ:
  • They arrived on Monday evening and we got there the following day
  • Answer the following questions.

food groups /ˈfuːd ˌɡruːp/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
collections of foods that share similar nutritional properties or biological classifications
Ví dụ:
  • There are five major food groups: carbohydrate, protein, fat, vitamin and mineral

forage /ˈfɔːrɪdʒ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to go from place to place searching for things that you can eat or use đi lang thang đây đó để lục lọi tìm kiếm đồ ăn
Ví dụ:
  • The children had been living on the streets, foraging for scraps.
  • The pigs foraged in the woods for acorns.
  • The chef offers special dishes of wild and foraged foods, including wood pigeon and snails.

forefront /ˈfɔːrfrʌnt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
in an important or leading position in a particular group or activity ở vị trí hàng đầu
Ví dụ:
  • His team is at the forefront of scientific research into vaccines
  • Women have always been at the forefront of the Green movement.

foresee /fɔːrˈsiː/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to know about something before it happens Nhìn thấy trước, dự kiến trước, đoán trước, biết trước
Ví dụ:
  • We do not foresee any problems
  • The extent of the damage could not have been foreseen
  • No one could have foreseen (that) things would turn out this way.

foresight /ˈfɔːrsaɪt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the ability to predict what is likely to happen and to use this to prepare for the future Sự thấy trước, sự nhìn xa thấy trước; sự lo xa
Ví dụ:
  • She had had the foresight to prepare herself financially in case of an accident.
  • The government’s policies show a remarkable lack of foresight.

formerly /ˈfɔːrmərli/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
in the past Trước đây, thuở xưa.
Ví dụ:
  • The European Union was formerly called the European Community
  • I learnt that the house had formerly been an inn.

formulaic /ˌfɔːrmjuˈleɪɪk/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
made up of fixed patterns of words or ideas Có tính cách công thức
Ví dụ:
  • Traditional stories make use of formulaic expressions like ‘Once upon a time…’
  • The text was dull and formulaic.

fortunately /ˈfɔːrtʃənətli/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
happening because of good luck [synonym] luckily May mắn, may thay
Ví dụ:
  • Fortunately, we got home before it started to rain.
  • I was late, but fortunately the meeting hadn't started.
  • Fortunately for him, he was very soon offered another job.

fossil fuel /ˈfɑːsl fjuːəl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
fuel such as coal or oil, that was formed over millions of years from the remains of animals or plants nhiên liệu hoá thạch (dầu mỏ, khí đổt, than đá, v v )
Ví dụ:
  • Carbon dioxide is produced in huge amounts when fossil fuels are burned.
  • Gas is the only fossil fuel without environmental problems.

fountain /ˈfaʊntn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a stream of water that is forced up into the air through a small hole, especially for decorative effect, or the structure in a lake or pool from which this flows Suối nước, nguồn sông Vòi nước, vòi phun (công viên).
Ví dụ:
  • They also sell garden ornaments such as statues and fountains

fraction /ˈfrækʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a small part or amount of something (Toán học) Phân số. Phần nhỏ, miếng nhỏ.
Ví dụ:
  • Only a small fraction of a bank's total deposits will be withdrawn at any one time.
  • She hesitated for the merest fraction of a second.
  • He raised his voice a fraction.

fracture /ˈfræktʃər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
break or crack Bẻ gây, làm gây, làm đứt đoạn Gãy, rạn, nứt.
Ví dụ:
  • A fractured pipe at a steelworks has leaked 20 tons of oil into the Severn estuary

frame /freɪm/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the basic structure of a building, vehicle, or piece of furniture that other parts are added onto khung, sườn, cấu trúc, cơ cấu
Ví dụ:
  • the frame of an aircraft/a car/a bicycle
  • The bed frame is made of pine.

fraud /frɔːd/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the crime of getting money by deceiving people tội lừa đảo chiếm đoạt tài sản
Ví dụ:
  • She was charged with credit card fraud.
  • property that has been obtained by fraud
  • a $100 million fraud

fraudster /ˈfrɔːdstər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a person who commits fraud (in other words,someone who gets money by deceiving people) kẻ lừa đảo
Ví dụ:
  • New measures are needed to prevent fraudsters opening bank accounts with stolen cheques

free press /ˌfriː ˈpres/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
tự do báo chí, tự do ngôn luận trong truyền thông
Ví dụ:
  • How can there be democratic elections without a free press?

freezer /ˈfriːzər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a large piece of electrical equipment in which you can store food for a long time at a low temperature so that it stays frozen Máy ướp lạnh. Máy làm kem.
Ví dụ:
  • Would you put the ice-cream away in the freezer?
  • When you get a build-up of ice in your freezer, you know it's time to defrost it.

frenzy /ˈfrenzi/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a state of great activity and strong emotion that is often violent or frightening and not under control sự điên cuồng, sự hỗn loạn
Ví dụ:
  • in a frenzy of activity/excitement/violence
  • The speaker worked the crowd up into a frenzy.

fresh /freʃ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(of air) clean and cool; found outside rather than in a room trong sạch, tươi mát, mát mẻ (không khí )
Ví dụ:
  • I opened the window to let some fresh air in.
  • fresh mountain air
  • I'm just going out for a breath of fresh air.

fresh water /ˈfreʃwɔːtər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
water that is not salty nước ngọt
Ví dụ:
  • freshwater fish — cá nước ngọt

friendship /ˈfrendʃɪp/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the feeling or relationship that friends have; the state of being friends tình bạn: việc mà mấy người là bạn
Ví dụ:
  • Your friendship is very important to me.
  • Their friendship goes back to when they were at school together
  • Did you form any close/lasting friendships in college?I value her friendship above anything else.

frontier /frʌnˈtɪr/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the limits of what is known or what has been done before in an area of knowledge or an activity Biên giới. Giới hạn (của văn minh, khoa học, etc).
Ví dụ:
  • to push back the frontiers of science (= to increase knowledge of science)the frontiers of science and technology

fruitful /ˈfruːtfl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
producing many useful results [synonym] productive Có kết quả, thành công. Có lợi, mang lợi.
Ví dụ:
  • It was a most fruitful discussion, with both sides agreeing to adopt a common policy
  • The research has proved extremely fruitful.

fruitless /ˈfruːtləs/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
producing no useful results [synonym] unproductive Không có kết quả, thất bại; vô ích
Ví dụ:
  • a fruitless attempt/search
  • Our efforts to persuade her proved fruitless.

fuel /ˈfjuːəl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
kích động hành vi nào đó
Ví dụ:
  • he rapid promotion of the director's son has itself fuelled resentment within the company.
  • The president's speech fuelled speculation that she is about to resign.

fumes /fjuːmz/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
smoke, gas, or something similar that smells strongly or is dangerous to breathe in khí độc, có hại cho sức khoẻ
Ví dụ:
  • exhaust fumes
  • Petrol fumes always make me feel ill.
  • cigar fumes

function /ˈfʌŋkʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to work in the correct way hoạt động, vận hành một cách hiệu quả
Ví dụ:
  • Despite the power cuts, the hospital continued to function normally.
  • Many children can't function effectively in large classes.

functional /ˈfʌŋkʃənl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
designed to be practical and useful rather than attractive hữu dụng, thiết thực
Ví dụ:
  • Bathrooms don't have to be purely functional.
  • The office was large and functional rather than welcoming.

fund /fʌnd/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to provide money for something, usually something official cấp vốn, tài trợ
Ví dụ:
  • a dance festival funded by the Arts Council
  • The museum is privately funded.
  • a government-funded programme

fundamental /ˌfʌndəˈmentl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
forming the base, from which everything else develops căn bản, cơ bản
Ví dụ:
  • It's one of the fundamental differences between men and women.
  • The school is based on the fundamental principle that all children should reach their full potential.

funding /ˈfʌndɪŋ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
money for a particular purpose; the act of providing money for such a purpose vốn, trợ cấp
Ví dụ:
  • There have been large cuts in government funding for scientific research

fur /fɜːr/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the soft thick mass of hair that grows on the body of some animals lớp lông mịn của một số loài thú
Ví dụ:
  • The cat carefully licked its fur

futile /ˈfjuːtl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
having no purpose because there is no chance of success [synonym] pointless Vô ích, không có hiệu quả
Ví dụ:
  • It's completely futile trying to reason with him - he just won't listen.
  • All my attempts to cheer her up proved futile.

futuristic /ˌfjuːtʃəˈrɪstɪk/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
extremely modern and unusual in appearance, as if belonging to a future time như là thuộc về tương lai
Ví dụ:
  • futuristic design

gadget /ˈɡædʒɪt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a small tool or device that does something useful thiết bị
Ví dụ:
  • kitchen gadgets
  • Have you seen this handy little gadget - it's for separating egg yolks from whites.

galactic /ɡəˈlæktɪk/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
relating to a galaxy Thiên văn: (thuộc) ngân hà
Ví dụ:
  • inter-galactic travel
  • A galactic year is the time the galaxy takes to rotate once completely.

galaxy /ˈɡæləksi/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
one of the independent groups of stars in the universe (Thiên văn học) Ngân hà, thiên hà
Ví dụ:
  • scientists observing phenomena in nearby galaxies

gallery /ˈɡæləri/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a room or building that is used for showing works of art, sometimes so that they can be sold Phòng trưng bày, triển lãm
Ví dụ:
  • an art/a picture gallery
  • the National Gallery
  • Visit the photo gallery on our website to see pictures from the event.

game /ɡeɪm/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
wild animals and birds that are hunted for food or sport Thú săn; thịt thú săn
Ví dụ:
  • game birds
  • big game — thú săn lớn (như hổ, sư tử, voi)

gamekeeper /ˈɡeɪmkiːpər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a person whose job is to take care of and breed wild animals and birds that are kept on private land in order to be hunted Người canh rừng không cho săn trộm thú
Ví dụ:
  • There are no houses near, and no people in it except a few gamekeepers: I spent long days in it without meeting a human being

gas /ɡæs/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(uk petrol) a liquid obtained from petroleum, used especially as a fuel for cars, aircraft, and other vehicles: (Từ mỹ,nghĩa mỹ) , (thông tục) dầu xăng
Ví dụ:
  • I'll stop and get some gas - we're running low.
  • a gas tank/pump

gasoline /ˈɡæsəliːn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
= gas (Từ mỹ,nghĩa mỹ) Xăng, dầu xăng
Ví dụ:
  • I fill up the tank with gasoline about once a week.
  • leaded/unleaded gasoline

gaze /ɡeɪz/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to look at something or someone for a long time, especially in surprise or admiration, or because you are thinking about something else nhìn chăm chú
Ví dụ:
  • Annette gazed admiringly at Warren as he spoke.
  • He spends hours gazing out of the window when he should be working.

gender /ˈdʒendər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the physical and/or social condition of being male or female Giới tính.
Ví dụ:
  • gender differences/relations/roles

generate /ˈdʒenəreɪt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to produce or create something tạo ra, sinh ra
Ví dụ:
  • Her latest film has generated a lot of interest/excitement.
  • The new development will generate 1,500 new jobs.
  • Selling food will increase the club's ability to generate revenue/income.

generation /ˌdʒenəˈreɪʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
all the people who were born at about the same time Thế hệ, đời.
Ví dụ:
  • The younger generation smokes less than their parents did
  • There were at least three generations - grandparents, parents and children - at the wedding
  • It's our duty to preserve the planet for future generations
  • This painting has been in the family for generations.

genetically modified /dʒəˌnetɪkli ˈmɑːdɪfaɪd/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(of a plant, etc ) having had its genetic structure changed artificially, so that it will produce more fruit or not be affected by disease (động vật, thực vật) biến đổi gen
Ví dụ:
  • genetically modified foods (= made from plants that have been changed in this way)

geneticist /dʒəˈnetɪsɪst/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a scientist who studies genetics Nhà nghiên cứu về di truyền học, nhà di truyền học

geographer /dʒiˈɑːɡrəfər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a person who studies geography; an expert in geography Nhà địa lý.

geographical /ˌdʒiːəˈɡræfɪkl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
relating to geography, or to the geography of a particular area or place (Thuộc) Địa lý.
Ví dụ:
  • a geographical region
  • geographical features

geography /dʒiˈɑːɡrəfi/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the scientific study of the earth’s surface, physical features, divisions, products, population, etc địa lý học
Ví dụ:
  • a geography lesson/department/teacher/textbook
  • a degree in geography

geological /ˌdʒiːəˈlɑːdʒɪkl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
relating to geology, or to the geology of a particular area or place (thuộc) Địa chất.
Ví dụ:
  • a geological survey/map
  • the complex geological structure of the region

geologist /dʒiˈɑːlədʒɪst/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a scientist who studies geology Nhà địa chất.

geology /dʒiˈɑːlədʒi/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the study of the rocks and similar substances that make up the earth's surface địa chất học
Ví dụ:
  • a geology professor/student/class/department

gesture /ˈdʒestʃər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a movement of the hands, arms, or head, etc to express an idea or feeling Điệu bộ, cử chỉ Động thái, động tác.
Ví dụ:
  • "All this is mine, " she said with a sweeping arm gesture.
  • Since they spoke only Swahili, we used signs and gestures to make ourselves understood.

giraffe /dʒəˈræf/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a large African animal with a very long neck and long legs (Động vật học) Hươu cao cổ
Ví dụ:
  • A full-grown giraffe is 5
  • 5 m tall.
  • The giraffe was killed with a spear that had been tipped with poison.

give way to UK US

Định nghĩa:
to be replaced by something, especially because it is better, cheaper, easier, etc nhường chỗ cho cái gì đó bị cái gì đó thay thế
Ví dụ:
  • In some areas, modern intensive farming is giving way to the re-introduction of traditional methods

glamorous /ˈɡlæmərəs/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
especially attractive and exciting, and different from ordinary things or people lộng lẫy, quyến rũ
Ví dụ:
  • a glamorous woman/outfita glamorous jobShe was looking very glamorous.

glimpse /ɡlɪmps/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a look at somebody/something for a very short time, when you do not see the person or thing completely Cái nhìn lướt qua, cái nhìn thoáng qua
Ví dụ:
  • He caught a glimpse of her in the crowd.
  • I came up on deck to get my first glimpse of the island.
  • Fans crowded the street outside waiting for a glimpse of their hero.

global /ˈɡloʊbl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
relating to the whole world Toàn cầu
Ví dụ:
  • a global catastrophe/problem

globalization /ˌɡloʊbələˈzeɪʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the fact that different cultures and economic systems around the world are becoming connected and similar to each other because of the influence of large multinational companies and of improved communication Toàn cầu hoá
Ví dụ:
  • We must take advantage of the increased globalization of the commodity trading business
  • the globalization of fashion/American youth culture

globally /ˈɡloʊbəli/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
in a way that covers or affects the whole world một cách toàn cầu
Ví dụ:
  • We need to start thinking globally.
  • Locally successful companies must become globally competitive.

goods /ɡʊdz/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
things that are produced to be sold Hàng hoá, hàng
Ví dụ:
  • cheap/expensive goods
  • leather/cotton/paper goods
  • electrical/sports goods
  • perishable/durable goods

gossip /ˈɡɑːsɪp/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
informal talk or stories about other people’s private lives, that may be unkind or not true Chuyện ngồi lê đôi mách, chuyện tầm phào, tin đồn nhảm.
Ví dụ:
  • Don't believe all the gossip you hear.
  • Tell me all the latest gossip!
  • The gossip was that he had lost a fortune on the stock exchange.
  • It was common gossip (= everyone said so) that they were having an affair.

govern /ˈɡʌvərn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to control and direct the public business of a country, city, group of people, etc Cai trị, thống trị, cầm quyền (một nước). Quản trị, quản lý, lãnh đạo (một thành phố, một xí nghiệp); cai quản (gia đình ); chỉ huy (một pháo đài).
Ví dụ:
  • The country has been governed by military regimes.
  • A president needs popular support in order to govern effectively.

grade /ɡreɪd/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
one of the levels in a school with children of similar age Lớp, cấp học
Ví dụ:
  • Sam is in (the) second grade

gradually /ˈɡrædʒuəli/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
slowly, over a long period of time Dần dần, từ từ.
Ví dụ:
  • The weather gradually improved.
  • Gradually, the children began to understand.
  • Women have gradually become more involved in the decision-making process.

granite /ˈɡrænɪt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a very hard, grey, pink, or black rock, used for building (Khoáng chất) Đá granit

grant /ɡrænt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
an amount of money given especially by the government to a person or organization for a special purpose Trợ cấp, đặc biệt là trợ cấp từ chính phủ
Ví dụ:
  • a student/research grant
  • a local authority/government grant
  • They gave/awarded her a grant to study abroad for one year.

grape /ɡreɪp/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a small, round, purple or pale green fruit that you can eat or make into wine Quả nho.
Ví dụ:
  • black/white/red/green grapes
  • a bunch of grapes
  • seedless grapes
  • grape juice

grapefruit /ˈɡreɪpfruːt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a fruit that is like a large orange, but has a yellow skin and tastes less sweet (Thực vật học) Cây bưởi chùm, cây bưởi đắng. Quả bưởi chùm, quả bưởi đắng.

gravitational /ˌɡrævɪˈteɪʃənl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
connected with or caused by the force of gravity liên quan đến trọng lực, lực hấp dẫn
Ví dụ:
  • a gravitational field
  • the gravitational pull of the moon

gravity /ˈɡrævəti/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the force that attracts objects towards one another, especially the force that makes things fall to the ground (Vật lý) Sự hút, sự hấp dẫn; trọng lực; trọng lượng
Ví dụ:
  • Newton’s law of gravity

graze /ɡreɪz/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(of cows, sheep, etc ) to eat grass that is growing in a field to (cause animals to) eat grass Ăn cỏ, chăn thả (súc vật)
Ví dụ:
  • There were cows grazing beside the river
  • The field had been grazed by sheep.
  • The farmer grazes cattle on this land in the summer months.

greenhouse gas /ˈɡriːnhaʊs/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a building with glass sides and a glass roof for growing plants in khí thải nhà kính, đặc biệt là CO2
Ví dụ:
  • any of the gases that are thought to cause the greenhouse effect, especially carbon dioxide

grid /ɡrɪd/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a pattern or structure made from horizontal and vertical lines crossing each other to form squares Đường kẻ ô kiểu bàn cờ
Ví dụ:
  • A metal grid had been placed over the hole to prevent people from falling in.
  • In Barcelona the streets are laid out in/on a grid system.

grocery /ˈɡroʊsəri/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(plural) food and other goods sold by a grocer or at a supermarket (Số nhiều) Hàng tạp hoá và thực phẩm phụ

guarantee /ˌɡærənˈtiː/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to promise that something will happen or exist Hứa bảo đảm, cam đoan
Ví dụ:
  • European Airlines guarantees its customers top-quality service.
  • We cannot guarantee (that) our flights will never be delayed.
  • We guarantee to deliver your goods within a week.

guard /ɡɑːrd/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to protect property, places or people from attack or danger Bảo vệ; gác, canh giữ.
Ví dụ:
  • The dog was guarding its owner's luggage.
  • political leaders guarded by the police
  • You can't get in; the whole place is guarded.
  • (figurative) a closely guarded secret

guilt /ɡɪlt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a feeling of worry or unhappiness that you have because you have done something wrong, such as causing harm to another person cảm giác có lỗi, cảm giác hối lỗi
Ví dụ:
  • He suffered such feelings of guilt over leaving his children.
  • She remembered with a pang of guilt that she hadn't called her mother.

guilty /ˈɡɪlti/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
having done something illegal; being responsible for something bad that has happened Có tội, phạm tội, tội lỗi
Ví dụ:
  • The jury has to decide whether a person is guilty or innocent of a crime.
  • A person accused of a crime is presumed innocent until proven guilty.

guise /ɡaɪz/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the appearance of someone or something, especially when intended to deceive Chiêu bài, lốt, vỏ
Ví dụ:
  • The men who arrived in the guise of drug dealers were actually undercover police officers.
  • The story appears in different guises in different cultures
  • She had been invited to the conference in her guise as a professional counsellor.

gulf /ɡʌlf/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(between A and B) a large difference between two people or groups in the way that they think, live or feel Hố sâu, vực thẳm; [[]] hố sâu ngăn cách
Ví dụ:
  • The gulf between rich and poor is enormous.
  • It felt as if a gulf had opened up between his life and mine.

gum /ɡʌm/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a sticky substance that comes from the stems of some trees and plants nhựa cây

habit /ˈhæbɪt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
something that you do often and regularly, sometimes without knowing that you are doing it Thói quen, tập quán
Ví dụ:
  • I always buy the same brand of toothpaste out of (= because of) habit.
  • I was taught to drive by my boyfriend and I'm afraid I've picked up (= caught) some of his bad habits.

habitat /ˈhæbɪtæt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the natural environment in which an animal or plant usually lives Môi trường sống, nơi sống (của cây cối động vật). Nhà, chỗ ở (người).
Ví dụ:
  • The panda's natural habitat is the bamboo forest
  • The marshes provide a rich habitat for water plants.

hairdryer /ˈherdraɪər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a small machine used for drying your hair by blowing hot air over it máy sấy tóc

halt /hɔːlt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to stop; to make somebody/something stop Cho dừng lại; bắt dừng lại Dừng lại.
Ví dụ:
  • "Halt!" called the guard
  • "You can't go any further without a permit
  • "
  • Production has halted at all of the company's factories because of the pay dispute.

hardwired /ˌhɑːrdˈwaɪərd/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(of computer functions) built into the permanent system and not provided by software (of a skill, quality or type of behaviour) present when you are born and not changing during your life (máy tính) được tích hợp sẵn, không thể thay đổi được (kỹ năng, hành vi, phẩm chất của con người) có sẵn trong não một cách bản năng, không học được và không thay đổi được
Ví dụ:
  • Many aspects of morality appear to be hardwired in the brain.
  • Anxiety is a hardwired response that everyone experiences.
  • There is evidence that we are hardwired to be musical.

harsh /hɑːrʃ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
unpleasant, unkind, cruel, or more severe than is necessary Gay gắt; khe khắt, ác nghiệt, khắc nghiệt, cay nghiệt; nhẫn tâm, tàn nhẫn
Ví dụ:
  • harsh criticism
  • The children had had a harsh upbringing.
  • We thought the punishment was rather harsh for such a minor offence.

haul /hɔːl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to pull something/somebody with a lot of effort Kéo mạnh, lôi mạnh
Ví dụ:
  • The wagons were hauled by horses
  • The car was hauled out of the river
  • fishermen hauling in their nets

hazard /ˈhæzərd/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a thing that can be dangerous or cause damage Mối nguy
Ví dụ:
  • a fire/safety hazard
  • Growing levels of pollution represent a serious health hazard to the local population.

headline /ˈhedlaɪn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a line of words printed in large letters as the title of a story in a newspaper, or the main points of the news that are broadcast on television or radio Hàng đầu, dòng đầu (trang báo); đề mục, đầu đề, tiêu đề. (Số nhiều) Phần tóm tắt những tin chính ở đầu bản tin (nói trên đài ).
Ví dụ:
  • The news of his death was splashed in headlines across all the newspapers.
  • the eight o'clock headlines

hectic /ˈhektɪk/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
very busy; full of activity vô cùng bận rộn, vô cùng hỗn loạn
Ví dụ:
  • to lead a hectic life
  • a hectic schedule

hedgehog /ˈhedʒhɔːɡ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a small, brown mammal with a covering of sharp spines on its back (Động vật học) Con nhím Âu (thuộc loại ăn sâu bọ)

hence /hens/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
for this reason Do đó, vì thế, vì lý do đó
Ví dụ:
  • His mother was Italian, hence his name - Luca.
  • The prime minister was attending the conference, hence all the extra security
  • He's just got a pay rise, hence the new car.

herb /hɜːrb/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a plant whose leaves, flowers or seeds are used to flavour food, in medicines or for their pleasant smell cỏ làm thuốc, dược thảo

herbal /ˈhɜːrbl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
relating to or made from herbs (Thuộc) Cỏ, (thuộc) cây thảo
Ví dụ:
  • herbal tea
  • herbal cigarettes/remedies

herbicide /ˈhɜːrbɪsaɪd/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a chemical that is used to destroy plants, especially weeds Thuốc diệt cỏ

hereditary /həˈredɪteri/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
passed from parents to children Di truyền, cha truyền con nối.
Ví dụ:
  • It is a hereditary title, so Mark Howard will become Sir Mark Howard on his father's death

heritage /ˈherɪtɪdʒ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the history, traditions and qualities that a country or society has had for many years and that are considered an important part of its character Tài sản thừa kế, di sản
Ví dụ:
  • Spain’s rich cultural heritage
  • The building is part of our national heritage.

hibernate /ˈhaɪbərneɪt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(of some animals) to spend the winter sleeping Ngủ đông (động vật)
Ví dụ:
  • The turtle hibernates in a shallow burrow for six months of the year

hibernation /ˌhaɪbərˈneɪʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a state like deep sleep in which some animals spend the winter Sự ngủ đông (động vật)
Ví dụ:
  • to go into/come out of hibernation

hide /haɪd/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the strong, thick skin of an animal, used for making leather Bộ da động vật
Ví dụ:
  • boots made from buffalo hide
  • a black hide belt
  • The hide is tanned for leather.

high-rise /ˈhaɪ raɪz/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(of a building) very tall and having a lot of floors (nhà) cao tầng
Ví dụ:
  • She lives in a high-rise buildingoverlooking the river

hindsight /ˈhaɪndsaɪt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the understanding that you have of a situation only after it has happened and that means you would have done things in a different way Bài học rút ra được sau khi một thứ đã xảy ra, đặc biệt là những thứ mà nếu biết trước, mình đã làm khác đi
Ví dụ:
  • With hindsight it is easy to say they should not have released him.
  • What looks obvious in hindsight was not at all obvious at the time.
  • It's easy to criticize with the benefit of hindsight.

hippopotamus /ˌhɪpəˈpɑːtəməs/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
