a very large animal with short legs and thick, dark grey skin that lives near water in Africa (Động vật học) Lợn nước, hà mã

historian /hɪˈstɔːriən/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a person who studies or writes about history; an expert in history nhà sử học, người viết sử
Ví dụ:
  • Some historians think that history repeats itself.
  • The archive is a goldmine for historians.
  • The book was written by an amateur local historian.

historic /hɪˈstɔːrɪk/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
important in history; likely to be thought of as important at some time in the future Có ý nghĩa lịch sử trọng đại
Ví dụ:
  • historic buildings
  • a historic day/moment
  • In a historic vote, the Church of England decided to allow women to become priests.

historical /hɪˈstɔːrɪkl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
connected with the past connected with the study of history Lịch sử, (thuộc) lịch sử; có liên quan đến lịch sử.
Ví dụ:
  • Many important historical documents were destroyed when the library was bombed.
  • She specializes in historical novels set in 18th-century England.

hobby /ˈhɑːbi/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
an activity that you do for pleasure when you are not working
Ví dụ:
  • Her hobbies include swimming and gardening.
  • I only play jazz as a hobby

hoist /hɔɪst/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to lift something heavy, sometimes using ropes or a machine Kéo (cờ) lên; nhấc bổng lên (bằng cần trục, tời ).
Ví dụ:
  • A helicopter hoisted the final section of the bridge into place.
  • With some difficulty he hoisted her onto his shoulders.
  • I scrabbled for a handhold and hoisted myself up.

hollow /ˈhɑːloʊ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
having a hole or empty space inside Trống rỗng,rỗng tuếch
Ví dụ:
  • The tree trunk was hollow inside.
  • Hollow blocks are used because they are lighter.

homegrown /ˌhoʊmˈɡroʊn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(nghĩa đen) của nhà trồng được (nghĩa bóng) nội địa, không phải ngoại nhập
Ví dụ:
  • She's a homegrown talent.
  • homegrown vegetables

homicide /ˈhɑːmɪsaɪd/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the crime of killing somebody deliberately [synonym] murder Hành động giết người; tội giết người.
Ví dụ:
  • He was convicted of homicide.
  • The number of homicides in the city has risen sharply.

honour /ˈɑːnər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to give public praise, an award or a title to somebody for something they have done tôn vinh, tán thưởng, trao thưởng cho ai vì những đóng góp của họ
Ví dụ:
  • He has been honoured with a knighthood for his scientific work.
  • The town has honoured his bravery by erecting a memorial.

horizon /həˈraɪzn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the line at the farthest place that you can see, where the sky seems to touch the land or sea Chân trời. (Nghĩa bóng) Tầm nhìn, tầm nhận thức, phạm vi hiểu biết.
Ví dụ:
  • The moon rose slowly above the horizon.
  • We could see a row of camels silhouetted on the horizon.

horizontal /ˌhɔːrəˈzɑːntl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
flat and level; going across and parallel to the ground rather than going up and down (Thuộc) Chân trời; ở chân trời. Ngang, nằm ngang.
Ví dụ:
  • horizontal lines
  • (informal) I was so tired, I just wanted to be horizontal (= lying down).

horn /hɔːrn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a hard, pointed, often curved part that grows from the top of the head of some animals, or the hard substance of which a horn is made Sừng (trâu bò ); gạc hươu, nai )
Ví dụ:
  • The male deer grows large branching horns called antlers.
  • The bull lowered its horns and charged straight at him.

hose /hoʊz/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a long tube made of rubber, plastic, etc , used for putting water onto fires, gardens, etc (Số nhiều) Ống nước, vòi nước
Ví dụ:
  • a garden hose
  • a length of hose

hospitality /ˌhɑːspɪˈtæləti/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
friendly and generous behaviour towards guests Lòng mến khách
Ví dụ:
  • Thank you for your kind hospitality.

hospitality industry /ˌhɑːspɪˈtælətiˈɪndəstri/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
businesses such as hotels, bars, and restaurants that offer people food, drink, or a place to sleep ngành công nghiệp nhà hàng, khách sạn, quán bar và các dịch vụ du lịch khác
Ví dụ:
  • They have 40 years of experience in the hospitality industry

host /hoʊst/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to provide the space and other things necessary for a special event tổ chức, đăng cai một chương trình, sự kiện
Ví dụ:
  • Which country is hosting the next Olympic Games?
  • The town has been hosting the annual event for the last 24 years.
  • The Arts Centre is hosting a folk festival this summer.

housing estate /ˈhaʊzɪŋ ɪsteɪt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
an area in which a large number of houses or flats/apartments are planned and built together at the same time khu nhà ở (được quy hoạch và xây dựng đồng thời)
Ví dụ:
  • They live on a housing estate.

hunter /ˈhʌntər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a person who hunts wild animals for food or sport; an animal that hunts its food Người đi săn
Ví dụ:
  • The hunters followed the tracks of the deer for hours.
  • The hunters skinned the deer they had killed.

hunter-gatherer /ˌhʌntər ˈɡæðərər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a member of a society that lives by hunting and collecting wild food, rather than by farming người sống kiểu săn bắn-hái lượm

hurdle /ˈhɜːrdl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a problem or difficulty that must be solved or dealt with before you can achieve something [synonym] obstacle (Nghĩa bóng) Vật chướng ngại
Ví dụ:
  • The next hurdle will be getting her parents' agreement.
  • Well we’ve cleared the first hurdle; let’s see what happens next.
  • We worked hard for three months on the deal only to see it fall at the final hurdle

hybrid /ˈhaɪbrɪd/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(of a vehicle) using two different types of power, especially petrol/gas or diesel ( and electricity (phương tiện giao thông) chạy bằng cả xăng dầu và điện
Ví dụ:
  • a hybrid car/vehicle

hydrogen /ˈhaɪdrədʒən/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a chemical element that is the lightest gas, has no colour, taste, or smell, and combines with oxygen to form water (Hóa học) Hyđrô

hygiene /ˈhaɪdʒiːn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the degree to which people keep themselves or their environment clean, especially to prevent disease Vệ sinh
Ví dụ:
  • Poor standards of hygiene mean that the disease spreads fast
  • In the interests of hygiene, please wash your hands.

hype /haɪp/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a situation in which something is advertised and discussed in newspapers, on television, etc a lot in order to attract everyone's interest quảng cáo rầm rộ (một tình huống trong đó một cái gì đó được quảng cáo và thảo luận trên báo chí, trên truyền hình, vv rất nhiều để thu hút sự quan tâm của mọi người)
Ví dụ:
  • media hype
  • There's been a lot of hype around/surrounding his latest film.
  • I've been put off reading the book by all the hype.

hyperactivity /ˌhaɪpərækˈtɪvəti/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a state in which a person, especially a child, is too active and only able to keep quiet and still for short periods Tính hiếu động thái quá.

ideal /aɪˈdiːəl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
perfect, or the best possible Lý tưởng
Ví dụ:
  • the ideal employer
  • She's the ideal person (= exactly the right type of person) for the job.
  • In an ideal world no one would go hungry.

identification /aɪˌdentɪfɪˈkeɪʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
also ID an official document that shows or proves who you are giấy tờ tùy thân (vd: chứng minh thư, hộ chiếu, thẻ căn cước)
Ví dụ:
  • We were asked to show some identification before the security guards would let us in

identify /aɪˈdentɪfaɪ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to recognize someone or something and say or prove who or what that person or thing is to recognize a problem, need, fact, etc and to show that it exists Nhận ra, làm cho nhận ra, nhận biết; nhận diện, nhận dạng
Ví dụ:
  • Even the smallest baby can identify its mother by her voice
  • You need to identify your priorities.

identity /aɪˈdentəti/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
who a person is, or the qualities of a person or group that make them different from others danh tính, danh tánh, tính danh
Ví dụ:
  • The man's identity was being kept secret while he was helping police with enquiries.
  • I cannot reveal the identity of my source.

idyllic /aɪˈdɪlɪk/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
peaceful and beautiful; perfect, without problems Bình dị, thanh bình, êm ả
Ví dụ:
  • a house set in idyllic surroundings
  • to lead an idyllic existence
  • The cottage sounds idyllic.

ignorance /ˈɪɡnərəns/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
lack of knowledge, understanding, or information about something sự thiếu hiểu biết, sự ngu dốt do thiếu kiến thức
Ví dụ:
  • Public ignorance about the disease is still a cause for concern.
  • They fought a long battle against prejudice and ignorance
  • I hate to admit my ignorance, but how does it work?

ignorant /ˈɪɡnərənt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
not having enough knowledge, understanding, or information about something Ngu dốt, dốt nát. Thiếu hiểu biết.
Ví dụ:
  • Many teenagers are surprisingly ignorant about current politics.
  • We remained blissfully ignorant of the troubles that lay ahead.

illegal /ɪˈliːɡl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
not allowed by the law Không hợp pháp, bất hợp pháp, trái luật.
Ví dụ:
  • It's illegal to drive through a red light.
  • a campaign to stop the illegal sale of cigarettes to children under 16

ill-informed /ˌɪl ɪnˈfɔːrmd/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
knowing less than you should about a particular subject [opposite] well informed thiểu hiểu biết, thiếu thông tin về một chủ đề nào đó
Ví dụ:
  • The public is ill-informed about their legal rights

illustrate /ˈɪləstreɪt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to show the meaning or truth of something more clearly, especially by giving examples Minh hoạ, làm rõ ý (bài giảng bằng tranh, thí dụ )
Ví dụ:
  • The lecturer illustrated his point with a diagram on the blackboard.
  • The exhibition will illustrate how life evolved from water.

imagery /ˈɪmɪdʒəri/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(formal) pictures, photographs, etc Hình ảnh (nói chung)
Ví dụ:
  • satellite imagery (= for example, photographs of the earth taken from space)

imitate /ˈɪmɪteɪt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to mimic, to copy the speech or behaviour, etc of someone or something Bắt chước, làm theo; mô phỏng, phỏng mẫu.
Ví dụ:
  • Some of the younger pop bands try to imitate their musical heroes from the past.
  • They produce artificial chemicals which exactly imitate particular natural ones.

immense /ɪˈmens/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
extremely large or great [synonym] enormous rất lớn, vô cùng lớn
Ví dụ:
  • There is still an immense amount of work to be done.
  • The benefits are immense.
  • a project of immense importance
  • To my immense relief, he didn’t notice my mistake.

imminent /ˈɪmɪnənt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(especially of something unpleasant) likely to happen very soon Sắp xảy ra, (xảy ra) đến nơi.
Ví dụ:
  • He gave a dire warning that an earthquake was imminent.
  • He warned that an enemy missile attack was imminent.

immune /ɪˈmjuːn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
not affected or upset by something miễn được, chống chịu được an toàn (trước cái gì đấy)
Ví dụ:
  • You'll eventually become immune to criticism
  • Few men are immune to her charms
  • Our business is far from immune to economic conditions.

impact /ˈɪmpækt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the powerful effect that something has on somebody/something Tác động, ảnh hưởng
Ví dụ:
  • the environmental impact of tourism
  • Her speech made a profound impact on everyone.

impartial /ɪmˈpɑːrʃl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
not supporting one person or group more than another [synonym] neutral, unbiased Công bằng, không thiên vị, vô tư
Ví dụ:
  • impartial advice
  • A trial must be fair and impartial.

imperative /ɪmˈperətɪv/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
something that is extremely important or urgent Điều cấp bách, khẩn thiết , điều đòi hỏi phải hành động;
Ví dụ:
  • the economic imperative of quality education for all

implication /ˌɪmplɪˈkeɪʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a possible effect or result of an action or a decision tác động, ảnh hưởng có thể có của một hành động, một quyết định
Ví dụ:
  • They failed to consider the wider implications of their actions.
  • The development of the site will have implications for the surrounding countryside.

import /ɪmˈpɔːrt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to bring a product, a service, an idea, etc into one country from another Nhập, nhập khẩu (hàng hoá )
Ví dụ:
  • The country has to import most of its raw materials.
  • goods imported from Japan into the US

impose /ɪmˈpoʊz/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to force someone to accept something to officially force a rule, tax, punishment, etc to be obeyed or received (+ on, upon) Đánh (thuế ); bắt chịu, bắt gánh vác, bắt cáng đáng
Ví dụ:
  • Very high taxes have recently been imposed on cigarettes.
  • Judges are imposing increasingly heavy fines for minor driving offences.
  • I don't want them to impose their religious beliefs on my children
  • We must impose some kind of order on the way this office is run.

impracticable /ɪmˈpræktɪkəbl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
impossible or very difficult to do; not practical in a particular situation Không thể thi hành được, không thể thực hiện được.
Ví dụ:
  • The changes to the tax system proved impracticable as they were impossible to enforce.

imprint /ɪmˈprɪnt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to fix an event or experience so firmly in the memory that it cannot be forgotten although you do not try to remember it to have a great effect on something so that it cannot be forgotten, changed, etc. Ghi khắc, ghi nhớ, in sâu vào, in hằn
Ví dụ:
  • That look of grief would be imprinted on her mind forever
  • The terrible scenes were indelibly imprinted on his mind
  • His work is imprinted with his own personal style
  • He imprints his own personal style on his work.

imprison /ɪmˈprɪzn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to put somebody in a prison or another place from which they cannot escape [synonym] jail Bỏ tù, tống giam, giam cầm. (Nghĩa bóng) Giam hãm, o bế.
Ví dụ:
  • They were imprisoned for possession of drugs.
  • (figurative) Some young mothers feel imprisoned in their own homes.

imprisonment /ɪmˈprɪznmənt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the act of putting somebody in a prison or another place from which they cannot escape; the state of being there Sự bỏ tù, sự tống giam, sự giam cầm. (Nghĩa bóng) Sự giam hãm, sự o bế.
Ví dụ:
  • to be sentenced to life imprisonment for murder

improbable /ɪmˈprɑːbəbl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
not likely to be true or to happen [synonym] unlikely Không chắc, không chắc có thực, không chắc sẽ xảy ra; đâu đâu
Ví dụ:
  • It's highly improbable that Norris will agree.
  • an improbable-sounding excuse

impulse /ˈɪmpʌls/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a sudden strong wish to do something Sự bốc đồng; cơn bốc đồng
Ví dụ:
  • I had this sudden impulse to shout out "Nonsense!" in the middle of her speech
  • He had a sudden impulse to stand up and sing
  • I resisted the impulse to laugh.

inability /ˌɪnəˈbɪləti/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
lack of ability to do something Sự không có khả năng, sự bất lực, sự bất tài.
Ví dụ:
  • Some families go without medical treatment because of their inability to pay

inaccuracy /ɪnˈækjərəsi/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the fact of not being exact or accurate or of having mistakes sự không chính xác, điểm không chính xác (trong tính toán, phát ngôn, v…v…)
Ví dụ:
  • The film is full of historical inaccuracies

inaccurate /ɪnˈækjərət/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
not exact or accurate; with mistakes không đúng, sai, trật, không chính xác
Ví dụ:
  • All the maps we had were wildly (= extremely)inaccurate

incinerator /ɪnˈsɪnəreɪtər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a container which is closed on all sides for burning waste at high temperatures Lò đốt rác.
Ví dụ:
  • a garbage/hazardous-waste incinerator
  • a hospital incinerator

incoherent /ˌɪnkoʊˈhɪrənt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
expressing yourself in a way that is not clear nói không mạch lạc, nói lảm nhảm, nói không ăn nhập vào đâu (người say rượu )
Ví dụ:
  • The talk she gave was incoherent and badly prepared

income /ˈɪnkʌm/ or /ˈɪnkəm/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the money that a person, a region, a country, etc earns from work, from investing money, from business, etc Thu nhập, doanh thu, lợi tức
Ví dụ:
  • They receive a proportion of their income from the sale of goods and services.
  • Tourism is a major source of income for the area.
  • higher/middle/lower income groups

incorporate /ɪnˈkɔːrpəreɪt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to include something as part of something larger kết hợp vào, bao gồm vào
Ví dụ:
  • Suggestions from the survey have been incorporated into/in the final design.
  • This aircraft incorporates several new safety features.

incorporation /ɪnˌkɔːrpəˈreɪʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the act of including something so that it forms part of something; something that has been included in this way sự bao gồm, sự hợp vào
Ví dụ:
  • the incorporation of foreign words into the language

indeed /ɪnˈdiːd/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
used to emphasize a positive statement or answer Thực vậy, thực sự, thực mà, thật mà, quả thực, thực lại là
Ví dụ:
  • ‘Was he very angry?’ ‘Indeed he was
  • ’
  • ‘Do you agree?’ ‘Indeed I do/Yes, indeed
  • ’

indicate /ˈɪndɪkeɪt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to show that something is true or exists chỉ ra, cho thấy
Ví dụ:
  • Record profits in the retail market indicate a boom in the economy.
  • A yellowing of the skin indicates jaundice.

indulgent /ɪnˈdʌldʒənt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
allowing someone to have or do what they want, especially when this is not good for them Hay nuông chiều, hay chiều theo.
Ví dụ:
  • indulgent parents
  • an indulgent smile
  • Mothers tend to be less indulgent towards daughters.

industrialist /ɪnˈdʌstriəlɪst/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a person who owns or runs a large factory or industrial company Nhà tư bản công nghiệp
Ví dụ:
  • He was the son of a wealthy industrialist

industry /ˈɪndəstri/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the companies and activities involved in the process of producing goods for sale, especially in a factory or special area Công nghiệp Ngành kinh doanh; nghề làm ăn.
Ví dụ:
  • trade and industry
  • industry and commerce
  • The city needs to attract more industry.
  • The strike seriously reduced coal deliveries to industry.

inevitable /ɪnˈevɪtəbl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
certain to happen and unable to be avoided or prevented Không thể tránh được, chắc chắn xảy ra, bất khả kháng ((nghĩa đen) & (nghĩa bóng))
Ví dụ:
  • The accident was the inevitable consequence/result/outcome of carelessness
  • When you're working such long hours, it's inevitable that your marriage will start to suffer.

inevitably /ɪnˈevɪtəbli/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
as is certain to happen Chắc hẳn, chắc chắn Không thể tránh khỏi
Ví dụ:
  • Their arguments inevitably end in tears
  • Such a large investment inevitably entails some risk.

inexorably /ɪnˈeksərəbli/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
in a way that cannot be stopped or changed Không lay chuyển được, không thể thay đổi được
Ví dụ:
  • events leading inexorably towards a crisis

inexpensive /ˌɪnɪkˈspensɪv/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
not costing a lot of money Không đắt Rẻ.
Ví dụ:
  • a relatively inexpensive hotel
  • opposite expensive

infant /ˈɪnfənt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a baby or a very young child Đứa bé còn ãm ngửa, đứa bé (dưới 7 tuổi).
Ví dụ:
  • a nursery for infants under two
  • their infant son
  • She was seriously ill as an infant.

infer /ɪnˈfɜːr/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to form an opinion or guess that something is true because of the information that you have Suy ra, luận ra; kết luận, đưa đến kết luận.
Ví dụ:
  • I inferred from her expression that she wanted to leave
  • Much of the meaning must be inferred from the context.

inference /ˈɪnfərəns/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a guess that you make or an opinion that you form based on the information that you have Sự suy ra, sự luận ra. Điều suy ra, điều luận ra; kết luận.
Ví dụ:
  • to draw/make inferences from the data
  • The clear inference is that the universe is expanding.

influence /ˈɪnfluəns/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the power to have an effect on people or things, or a person or thing that is able to do this Ảnh hưởng, tác dụng. Uy thế, thế lực.
Ví dụ:
  • the influence of the climate on agricultural production
  • What exactly is the influence of television on children?

inform /ɪnˈfɔːrm/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to tell someone about particular facts Cung cấp tin tức
Ví dụ:
  • The name of the dead man will not be released until his relatives have been informed.
  • Why wasn't I informed about this earlier?
  • Walters was not properly informed of the reasons for her arrest.
  • + that I informed my boss that I was going to be away next week.

informative /ɪnˈfɔːrmətɪv/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
providing a lot of useful information Cung cấp nhiều tin tức, có nhiều tài liệu. Có tác dụng nâng cao kiến thức.
Ví dụ:
  • This is an interesting and highly informative book
  • The talk was both informative and entertaining
  • Findings suggest that while television is more informative than the press, it is less persuasive.

infrastructure /ˈɪnfrəstrʌktʃər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the basic systems and services that are necessary for a country or an organization to run smoothly, for example buildings, transport and water and power supplies Cơ sở hạ tầng, hạ tầng cơ sở
Ví dụ:
  • The war has badly damaged the country's infrastructure
  • More money is needed to maintain the city's infrastructure.

ingredient /ɪnˈɡriːdiənt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
One of the things from which something is made, especially one of the foods that are used together to make a particular dish. nguyên liệu, thành phần
Ví dụ:
  • If you're making chocolate chip cookies, flour is just one ingredient you'll need.

inhabit /ɪnˈhæbɪt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to live in a place Ở, sống ở (nơi nào) ((nghĩa đen) & (nghĩa bóng)).
Ví dụ:
  • These remote islands are inhabited only by birds

inhabitant /ɪnˈhæbɪtənt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a person or an animal that lives in a particular place Người ở, người cư trú, dân cư.
Ví dụ:
  • the oldest inhabitant of the village
  • a town of 11 000 inhabitants

initial /ɪˈnɪʃl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
happening at the beginning; first Ban đầu, vào lúc đầu, ở đầu
Ví dụ:
  • in the initial stages (= at the beginning) of the campaign
  • My initial reaction was to decline the offer.

injured /ˈɪndʒərd/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
hurt or physically harmed Bị tổn thương, bị làm hại, bị thương.
Ví dụ:
  • He's still conscious but he's fairly badly injured
  • Luckily, she isn't injured.

inn /ɪn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a small hotel, usually in the countryside Quán trọ, khách sạn nhỏ (ở nông thôn, thị trấn).
Ví dụ:
  • The building was a 16th-century inn
  • We had dinner at the inn.

innkeeper /ˈɪnkiːpər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a person who owns or manages an inn, especially in the past chủ quán trọ, chủ khách sạn nhỏ (ở nông thôn, thị trấn).

innocent /ˈɪnəsnt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
not guilty of a crime, etc ; not having done something wrong Vô tội; không có tội
Ví dụ:
  • They have imprisoned an innocent man.
  • She was found innocent of any crime.
  • He firmly believes that she is innocent of the crime.

innovate /ˈɪnəveɪt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to introduce new things, ideas or ways of doing something Đưa vào những cái mới. (+ in) Tiến hành những đổi mới.
Ví dụ:
  • The fashion industry is always desperate to innovate

innovation /ˌɪnəˈveɪʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(in something) the introduction of new things, ideas or ways of doing something a new idea, way of doing something, etc that has been introduced or discovered Sự đưa vào những cái mới. Sáng kiến, điều mới đưa vào, cái mới, phương pháp mới. Sự tiến hành đổi mới, sự đổi mới.
Ví dụ:
  • an age of technological innovation
  • The company is very interested in product design and innovation.

inquiry /ˈɪnkwəri/ or /ɪnˈkwaɪəri/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
an official process to discover the facts about something bad that has happened Sự điều tra, sự thẩm tra; sự thẩm vấn, sự hỏi
Ví dụ:
  • a murder inquiry/enquiry
  • a public inquiry/enquiry into the environmental effects of the proposed new road
  • to hold/order an inquiry/enquiry into the affair

insane /ɪnˈseɪn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
seriously mentally ill and unable to live in normal society Điên, điên cuồng, mất trí
Ví dụ:
  • I sometimes think I'm going insane (= I feel very confused).
  • It would be insane not to take advantage of this opportunity.
  • opposite sane

insect /ˈɪnsekt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
any small creature with six legs and a body divided into three parts (Động vật học) Sâu bọ, côn trùng
Ví dụ:
  • insect species
  • insect repellent (= a chemical that keeps insects away)
  • an insect bite
  • The pesticide is lethal to all insect life.

insight /ˈɪnsaɪt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(into something) an understanding of what something is like sự hiểu biết sâu sắc, sự sáng suốt.
Ví dụ:
  • The book gives us fascinating insights into life in Mexico.
  • I hope you have gained some insight into the difficulties we face.

insoluble /ɪnˈsɑːljəbl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(usually US English [insolvable]) that cannot be solved or explained Không giải quyết được
Ví dụ:
  • The problem seemed insoluble

insomnia /ɪnˈsɑːmniə/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the condition of being unable to sleep (Y học) Chứng mất ngủ.
Ví dụ:
  • to suffer from insomnia

inspire /ɪnˈspaɪər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to give somebody the idea for something, especially something artistic or that shows imagination truyền (cảm hứng, ý nghĩ ); truyền cảm hứng cho (ai), gây cảm hứng cho (ai)
Ví dụ:
  • The choice of decor was inspired by a trip to India.
  • His paintings were clearly inspired by Monet’s work.

instinct /ˈɪnstɪŋkt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the way people or animals naturally react or behave, without having to think or learn about it Bản năng a feeling that makes you do something or believe that something is true, even though it is not based on facts or reason (= intuition) (nghĩa bóng) linh cảm, cảm giác
Ví dụ:
  • maternal instincts
  • Children do not know by instinct the difference between right and wrong.
  • His first instinct was to run away.
  • Her instincts had been right.

institutionalise /ˌɪnstɪˈtuːʃənəlaɪz/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to make something become part of an organized system, society or culture, so that it is considered normal thiết lập một cái gì đó trở thành một phần của một hệ thống, xã hội hoặc văn hoá, khiến nó trở nên bình thường

insurmountable /ˌɪnsərˈmaʊntəbl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(of difficulties, problems, etc ) so great that it cannot be dealt with successfully Quá lớn không thể vượt qua được (vấn đề, khó khăn, )
Ví dụ:
  • This small country is faced with an insurmountable debt.
  • They were now faced with seemingly insurmountable technical problems.

intake /ˈɪnteɪk/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the amount of food, drinks, etc that you take into your body
Ví dụ:
  • high fluid intake
  • to reduce your daily intake of salt

intend /ɪnˈtend/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to have a plan, result or purpose in your mind when you do something Có ý định, có mục đích
Ví dụ:
  • I fully intended (= definitely intended) to pay for the damage
  • Somehow I offended him, which wasn't what I'd intended.

intense /ɪnˈtens/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
very great; very strong [synonym] extreme Mạnh, có cường độ lớn Mãnh liệt, dữ dội
Ví dụ:
  • intense heat/cold/pain
  • The President is under intense pressure to resign.
  • the intense blue of her eyes
  • intense interest/pleasure/desire/anger

intensify /ɪnˈtensɪfaɪ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to become greater, more serious, or more extreme, or to make something do this Làm tăng cao lên, tăng cường. Làm sâu sắc thêm, làm mạnh thêm.
Ví dụ:
  • The fighting in the area has intensified sharply

intensive farming /ɪnˌten. sɪv ˈfɑːr. mɪŋ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a way of producing large amounts of crops, by using chemicals and machines làm nông trên quy mô lớn, với rất nhiều máy móc và hóa chất công nghiệp (phân bón, thuốc trừ sâu hại, v v )
Ví dụ:
  • The use of intensive farming can damage the environment

intent /ɪnˈtent/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the fact that you want and plan to do something Ý định, mục đích
Ví dụ:
  • I spent half the morning on the phone, which wasn't really my intent.
  • It was not his intent to hurt anyone.
  • She was charged with possessing weapons with intent to endanger life.

intentional /ɪnˈtenʃənl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
done deliberately [synonym] deliberate, intended Có ý định trước, được định trước, có ý, chủ tâm
Ví dụ:
  • Did you leave his name out by accident or was it intentional?
  • She felt she was a victim of intentional discrimination.

interaction /ˌɪntərˈækʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the act of communicating with somebody, especially while you work, play or spend time with them sự tương tác
Ví dụ:
  • the interaction between performers and their audience
  • There's not enough interaction between the management and the workers
  • Language games are usually intended to encourage student interaction
  • The play follows the interactions of three very different characters.

interactive /ˌɪntərˈæktɪv/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
that involves people working together and having an influence on each other Có sự tương tác, ảnh hưởng lẫn nhau, có sự tác động qua lại
Ví dụ:
  • The school believes in interactive teaching methods

interference /ˌɪntərˈfɪrəns/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
noise or other electronic signals that stop you from getting good pictures or sound on a television or radio (Rađiô) Sự nhiễu

interior /ɪnˈtɪriər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
[only before noun] connected with the inside part of something [opposite] exterior Ở trong, ở phía trong
Ví dụ:
  • interior walls

internal /ɪnˈtɜːrnl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
existing or happening inside a person, object, organization, place, or country thuộc về bên trong Ở trong, nội bộ (tập thể)Trong nước (quốc gia)
Ví dụ:
  • He sustained injuries to his arms, legs, and several internal organs.
  • The bank conducted its own internal investigation into the robbery.
  • The government warned its neighbours not to interfere in its internal affairs.

interview /ˈɪntərvjuː/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a formal meeting at which somebody is asked questions to see if they are suitable for a particular job, or for a course of study at a college, university, etc Cuộc phỏng vấn; bài phỏng vấn
Ví dụ:
  • a job interview
  • to be called for (an) interview
  • He has an interview next week for the manager's j

intimacy /ˈɪntɪməsi/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the state of having a close personal relationship with somebody sự thân mật, sự gần gũi
Ví dụ:
  • It was obvious from their intimacy that they had been good friends for many years

intimate /ˈɪntɪmeɪt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to let somebody know what you think or mean in an indirect way Gợi cho biết, gợi ý
Ví dụ:
  • He has already intimated to us his intention to retire
  • She has intimated that she will resign if she loses the vote.

intricate /ˈɪntrɪkət/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
having a lot of different parts and small details that fit together tinh xảo, chi tiết, tỉ mỉ
Ví dụ:
  • intricate patterns
  • The watch mechanism is extremely intricate and very difficult to repair.

intrude /ɪnˈtruːd/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to go into a place or situation in which you are not wanted or not expected to be Xâm phạm, xâm nhập Vào bừa; không mời mà đến.
Ví dụ:
  • I'm sorry to intrude, but I need to talk to someone.
  • legislation to stop newspapers from intruding on people’s private lives
  • to intrude into a place — đi bừa vào một nơi
  • to intrude upon someone's privacy — xâm phạm đến đời sống riêng tư của ai

intrusion /ɪnˈtruːʒn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(formal) the act of entering a place which is private or where you may not be wanted Sự xâm phạm, sự xâm nhập
Ví dụ:
  • She apologized for the intrusion but said she had an urgent message
  • His phone call was a welcome intrusion into an otherwise tedious morning.

intrusive /ɪnˈtruːsɪv/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
too noticeable, direct, etc in a way that is disturbing or annoying quá tọc mạch, quá xâm lấn sự riêng tư (của người nổi tiếng, của nhân vật được đưa tin, v v )
Ví dụ:
  • intrusive questions
  • The constant presence of the media was very intrusive.

invaluable /ɪnˈvæljuəbl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
extremely useful [synonym] valuable Vô giá
Ví dụ:
  • The book will be invaluable for students in higher education.
  • The research should prove invaluable in the study of children's language.

invasion /ɪnˈveɪʒn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the fact of a large number of people or things arriving somewhere, especially people or things that are disturbing or unpleasant xâm lược (theo nghĩa bóng)
Ví dụ:
  • the annual tourist invasion

invasive /ɪnˈveɪsɪv/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
moving into all areas of something and difficult to stop lan tràn khắp nơi, chỗ nào cũng thấy có mặt, không biết tránh đi đằng nào được

invent /ɪnˈvent/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to design and/or create something that has never been made before Phát minh, sáng chế
Ví dụ:
  • Who invented the steam engine?
  • I wish mobile phones had never been invented!

investigate /ɪnˈvestɪɡeɪt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to examine a crime, problem, statement, etc carefully, especially to discover the truth Điều tra
Ví dụ:
  • The FBI has been called in to investigate.
  • (informal) ‘What was that noise?’ ‘I'll go and investigate
  • ’
  • Police are investigating possible links between the murders.

investigation /ɪnˌvestɪˈɡeɪʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the act or process of examining a crime, problem, statement, etc carefully, especially to discover the truth Cuộc điều tra, sự điều tra
Ví dụ:
  • a criminal/murder/police investigationShe is still under investigation
  • The police have completed their investigations into the accident.

investigative journalism /ɪnˌves. tɪ. ɡə. t̬ɪv ˈdʒɝː. nə. lɪ. zəm/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a type of journalism that tries to discover information of public interest that someone is trying to hide báo chí điều tra
Ví dụ:
  • Conspiracy is a popular subject for investigative journalism

irrelevant /ɪˈreləvənt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
not related to what is being discussed or considered and therefore not important không liên quan (đến vấn đề đang bàn luận), không quan trọng
Ví dụ:
  • These documents are largely irrelevant to the present investigation.
  • Making a large profit is irrelevant to us - the important thing is to make the book available to the largest possible audience.

irreparable /ɪˈrepərəbl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(of a loss, injury, etc ) too bad or too serious to repair or put right Không thể đền bù lại được; không thể sửa lại được
Ví dụ:
  • to cause irreparable damage/harm to your health
  • Unless the oil spill is contained, irreparable damage will be done to the coastline.

irreplaceable /ˌɪrɪˈpleɪsəbl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
too valuable or special to be replaced quá quan trọng đến mức không thể thay thế được
Ví dụ:
  • These pictures are irreplaceable
  • Most of the porcelain you see in the display cabinets is irreplaceable
  • No one's irreplaceable in the workplace.

irresponsible /ˌɪrɪˈspɑːnsəbl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
not thinking enough or not worrying about the possible results of what you do vô trách nhiệm, không nghĩ đến hậu quả hành động của mình
Ví dụ:
  • It would be irresponsible to ignore these warnings
  • It would be irresponsible to ignore the situation.

irreversible /ˌɪrɪˈvɜːrsəbl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
that cannot be changed back to what it was before Không thể đảo ngược lại; không thể thay đổi được
Ví dụ:
  • Smoking has caused irreversible damage to his lungs
  • an irreversible change/decline/decision

isolate /ˈaɪsəleɪt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to separate something from other things with which it is connected or mixed Cô lập. (Y học) Cách ly.
Ví dụ:
  • A high wall isolated the house from the rest of the village.
  • They tried to isolate (= find) the cause of the problem.

isolation /ˌaɪsəˈleɪʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the fact that something is separate and not connected to other things Sự cô lập. (Y học) Sự cách ly.
Ví dụ:
  • geographical isolation
  • an isolation hospital/ward (= for people with infectious diseases)

issue /ˈɪʃuː/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
an important topic that people are discussing or arguing about Vấn đề (đang tranh cãi, đang kiện cáo ); vấn đề chín muồi (có thể quyết định).
Ví dụ:
  • environmental/ethical/personal issues
  • As employers we need to be seen to be addressing (= dealing with) these issues sympathetically.

itinerary /aɪˈtɪnəreri/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a detailed plan or route of a journey kế hoạch hành trình
Ví dụ:
  • The tour operator will arrange transport and plan your itinerary
  • Visits to four different countries are included in your itinerary.

job satisfaction /ˌdʒɑːb ˌsætɪsˈfækʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the good feeling that you get when you have a job that you enjoy cảm giác hài lòng, thoả mãn với công việc lòng yêu nghề

job security /ˈdʒɑːb sɪˌkjʊr. ə. t̬i/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
sự có công ăn việc làm ổn định
Ví dụ:
  • Job security is the probability that an individual will keep their job; a job with a high level of job security is such that a person with the job would have a small chance of becoming unemployed

joint /dʒɔɪnt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
belonging to or shared between two or more people Chung (giữa hai hay nhiều người)
Ví dụ:
  • a joint bank account
  • The project was a joint effort between the two schools (= they worked on it together).

journalism /ˈdʒɜːrnəlɪzəm/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the work of collecting, writing, and publishing news stories and articles in newspapers and magazines or broadcasting them on the radio and television Nghề làm báo, nghề viết báo.
Ví dụ:
  • My son's planning to go into journalism

journalist /ˈdʒɜːrnəlɪst/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a person whose job is to collect and write news stories for newspapers, magazines, radio or television Nhà báo.
Ví dụ:
  • The journalist asked the minister how he viewed recent events

journalistic /ˌdʒɜːrnəˈlɪstɪk/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
connected with the work of a journalist (liên quan đến) Báo chí; (liên quan đến) nghề nhà báo.
Ví dụ:
  • journalistic skills
  • his journalistic background

judge /dʒʌdʒ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a person in a court who has the authority to decide how criminals should be punished or to make legal decisions Quan toà, thẩm phán
Ví dụ:
  • a High Court judge
  • a federal judge
  • The case comes before Judge Cooper next week.
  • The judge sentenced him to five years in prison.

junior /ˈdʒuːniər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
low or lower in rank ; younger Ít tuổi hơn; ít thâm niên hơn; ở cấp dưới.
Ví dụ:
  • junior employees

jury /ˈdʒʊri/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a group of members of the public who listen to the facts of a case in a court and decide whether or not somebody is guilty of a crime (Pháp lý) Ban hội thẩm, ban bồi thẩm
Ví dụ:
  • members of the jury
  • to be/sit/serve on a jury
  • The jury has/have returned a verdict of guilty.
  • the right to trial by jury

justifiable /ˌdʒʌstɪˈfaɪəbl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
existing or done for a good reason, and therefore acceptable [synonym] legitimate (nói về hành động) có thể hiểu được, có lý do chính đáng, hợp lý, chính đáng
Ví dụ:
  • Her actions were quite justifiable in the circumstances.

justifiably /dʒʌstɪˈfaɪəbli/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
for a good reason, and therefore in a way that is acceptable [synonym] legitimately (trạng từ) một cách hợp lý, một cách chính đáng
Ví dụ:
  • The university can be justifiably proud of its record

justify /ˈdʒʌstɪfaɪ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to give or to be a good reason for to show that somebody/something is right or reasonable có lý do chính đáng cho việc gì đó biện hộ được cho hành động gì đó (là chính đáng)
Ví dụ:
  • I can't really justify taking another day off work.
  • How can they justify paying such huge salaries?Her success had justified the faith her teachers had put in her.

keen /kiːn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
very good or well developed Sắc sảo; tinh, thính
Ví dụ:
  • a keen sense of smell
  • keen intelligence — trí thông minh sắc sảokeen eyes — mắt tinhkeen ears — tai thính

keyboard /ˈkiːbɔːrd/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the set of keys for operating a computer or typewriter, or the set of letters that you can click on to write on a smartphone or tablet bàn phím
Ví dụ:
  • an electronic keyboard
  • The keyboard plugs in at the back of the computer.

keypad /ˈkiːpæd/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a small set of buttons with numbers on used to operate a telephone, a television or an electronic device bàn phím điện thoại, điều khiển, tivi,

kidnapper /ˈkɪdnæpər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a person who takes somebody away illegally and keeps them as a prisoner, especially in order to get money or something else for returning them Kẻ bắt cóc
Ví dụ:
  • The kidnappers are demanding a ransom of $1 million

kidnapping /ˈkɪdnæpɪŋ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the crime of taking somebody away illegally and keeping them as a prisoner, especially in order to get money or something else for returning them Sự bắt cóc để tống tiền
Ví dụ:
  • He admitted the charge of kidnap.
  • the kidnapping of 12 US citizens

kindergarten /ˈkɪndərɡɑːrtn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the first year of school, for children aged five ( =a nursery school) Lớp mẫu giáo, vườn trẻ.

label /ˈleɪbl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
Dán, đính nhãn vào vật nào đó
Ví dụ:
  • The parcel was clearly labelled "Fragile".
  • If you spend any time in prison, you're labelled as a criminal for the rest of your life.

laboratory /ˈlæbrətɔːri/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a room or building used for scientific research, experiments, testing, etc Phòng thí nghiệm
Ví dụ:
  • research laboratories
  • a computer laboratory
  • Laboratory tests suggest that the new drug may be used to treat cancer.

labourer /ˈleɪbərər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a person whose job involves hard physical work that is not skilled, especially work that is done outdoors Người lao động chân tay, lao công
Ví dụ:
  • an agricultural labourer
  • a farm labourer

labour force /ˈleɪbər fɔːrs/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
all the people who work for a company or in a country [synonym] workforce (Kinh tế học) Lực lượng lao động
Ví dụ:
  • a skilled/an unskilled labour force
  • An increasing percentage of the labour force is now unemployed.

labour-saving /ˈleɪbər seɪvɪŋ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
designed to reduce the amount of work or effort needed to do something được thiết kế để làm giảm nhẹ sức lao động, tiết kiệm sức lao động
Ví dụ:
  • modern labour-saving devices such as washing machines and dishwashers

laden /ˈleɪdn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
heavily loaded with something (literary) full of something, especially something unpleasant chứa đầy cái gì đó
Ví dụ:
  • passengers laden with luggage
  • The trees were laden with apples.
  • He always comes back from France laden with presents for everyone
  • The table, as always, was laden with food.

landmark /ˈlændmɑːrk/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a building or place that is easily recognized, especially one that you can use to judge where you are cột mốc (một tòa nhà, công trình lớn, dễ nhận biết và có thể dùng để định hướng)
Ví dụ:
  • The Empire State Building is a familiar landmark on the New York skyline

landscape /ˈlændskeɪp/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a large area of countryside, especially in relation to its appearance phong cảnh, thắng cảnh
Ví dụ:
  • the woods and fields that are typical features of the English landscape
  • an urban/industrial landscape

language barrier UK US

Định nghĩa:
A barrier to communication between people who are unable to speak a common language. rào cản ngôn ngữ (khó khăn tạo ra do khác biệt về ngôn ngữ)
Ví dụ:
  • Zhao wasn't able to enjoy himself in Germany because of the language barrier

large-scale /ˌlɑːrdʒ ˈskeɪl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
involving many people or things, or happening over a large area trên quy mô lớn
Ví dụ:
  • We must improve our response to large-scale natural disasters

launch /lɔːntʃ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to send something such as a spacecraft, weapon, etc into space Ném, phóng, quăng, liệng (tên lửa; lời đe doạ )
Ví dụ:
  • to launch a communications satellite
  • to launch a missile/rocket/torpedo

law-abiding /ˈlɔː əbaɪdɪŋ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
obeying and respecting the law Tôn trọng luật pháp, tuân theo luật pháp
Ví dụ:
  • law-abiding citizens

lawyer /ˈlɔːjər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a person who is trained and qualified to advise people about the law and to represent them in court, and to write legal documents Luật sư Luật gia.
Ví dụ:
  • I want to see my lawyer before I say anything

leading-edge /ˌliːdɪŋ ˈedʒ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
in the most important and advanced position in an area of activity, especially technology [synonym] cutting edge tối tân, hiện đại bậc nhất
Ví dụ:
  • leading-edge technology

leaflet /ˈliːflət/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a piece of paper that gives you information or advertises something tờ rơi, tờ truyền đơn
Ví dụ:
  • Demonstrators handed out leaflets to passers-by.
  • A leaflet about the new bus services came through the door today.

lean /liːn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
thin and healthy gầy, mảnh khảnh, thon gọn
Ví dụ:
  • She waslean and fit

lecture /ˈlektʃər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a formal talk on a serious subject given to a group of people, especially students Bài diễn thuyết; bài lên lớp; bài thuyết trình; bài nói chuyện.
Ví dụ:
  • We went to a lecture on Italian art.
  • Who's giving the lecture this afternoon?

lecturer /ˈlektʃərər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a person who teaches at a university or college (giảng viên đại học)
Ví dụ:
  • He's a lecturer in French at Oxford.

legal /ˈliːɡl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
connected with the law (liên quan đến) pháp luật. allowed or required by law Hợp pháp, theo pháp luật.
Ví dụ:
  • the legal profession/system
  • to take/seek legal advice
  • Is abortion legal in your country?

leisure activity /ˈliːʒər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
what you enjoy doingwhen you are not working or studying

level /ˈlevl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a floor in a large building tầng
Ví dụ:
  • The library has three levels, with a conference centre at ground level.
  • The exhibition is on level three of the building.

liable /ˈlaɪəbl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to belikely to do something Có khả năng bị; có khả năng xảy ra
Ví dụ:
  • We're all liable to make mistakes when we're tired.
  • The bridge is liable to collapse at any moment.

life imprisonment /ˌlaɪf ɪmˈprɪz. ən. mənt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the punishment of being put in prison for a very long time without an arranged time for release or, in the US, until death án tù chung thân (= life sentence)

lifelong /ˈlaɪflɔːŋ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
lasting or existing all through your life (suốt đời)
Ví dụ:
  • Her lifelong ambition had been to learn how to fly.
  • He has been a lifelong supporter of the club.

life-threatening /ˈlaɪf θretnɪŋ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
that is likely to kill somebody Nguy hiểm đến tính mạng, có thể làm chết người; hiểm nghèo
Ví dụ:
  • His heart condition is not life-threatening.
  • Aid workers are having to deal with very difficult, sometimes life-threatening situations.

lift /lɪft/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a device like a box that moves up and down, carrying people or goods from one floor of a building to another Thang máy
Ví dụ:
  • Take the lift to the sixth floor

lily /ˈlɪli/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a large white or brightly coloured flower with petals that curl back from the centre There are many types of lily hoa huệ tây; hoa loa kèn
Ví dụ:
  • tiger lilies

limestone /ˈlaɪmstoʊn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a type of white stone that contains calcium, used in building and in making cement Đá vôi.

limit /ˈlɪmɪt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to stop something from increasing beyond a particular amount or level [synonym][ ]restrict Giới hạn, hạn chế
Ví dụ:
  • measures to limit carbon dioxide emissions from cars
  • The amount of money you have to spend will limit your choice

lineage /ˈlɪniɪdʒ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the members of a person's family who are directly related to that person and who lived a long time before him or her Nòi giống, dòng, dòng giống, dòng dõi
Ví dụ:
  • She's very proud of her ancient royal lineage
  • a French nobleman of ancient lineage

linger /ˈlɪŋɡər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to continue to exist for longer than expected to stay somewhere for longer because you do not want to leave; to spend a long time doing something Nấn ná, lần lữa, chần chừ, nán lại Kéo dài.
Ví dụ:
  • The faint smell of her perfume lingered in the room
  • She lingered for a few minutes to talk to Nick.

linguist /ˈlɪŋɡwɪst/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
someone who studies foreign languages or can speak them very well, or someone who teaches or studies linguistics Nhà ngôn ngữ học Người biết nhiều thứ tiếng.
Ví dụ:
  • She's an excellent linguist.
  • I'm afraid I'm no linguist (= I find foreign languages difficult).

linguistic /lɪŋˈɡwɪstɪk/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
connected with language or the study of language (Thuộc) Ngôn ngữ, (thuộc) ngôn ngữ học.
Ví dụ:
  • I'm particularly interested in the linguistic development of young children

link /lɪŋk/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to make a connection between two or more people, things, or ideas kết nối
Ví dụ:
  • A long trail of evidence links cigarette smoking to lung cancer

literary /ˈlɪtəreri/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
connected with literature (Thuộc) Văn chương, (thuộc) văn học, có tính chất văn chương, có tính chất văn học
Ví dụ:
  • a literary critic
  • literary prizes
  • a literary style

literature /ˈlɪt̬. ɚ. ə. tʃɚ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
all the information relating to a subject, especially information written by experts Tài liệu (về một vấn đề hoặc một bộ môn khoa học).
Ví dụ:
  • It's important to keep up-to-date with the literature in your field.
  • There is very little literature on the disease.

litter /ˈlɪtər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
small pieces of rubbish that have been left lying on the ground in public places Rác rưởi
Ví dụ:
  • About two percent of fast-food packaging ends up as litter
  • There will be fines for people who drop litter.

living expenses UK US

Định nghĩa:
the money you have to spend as you live (chi phí sinh hoạt)

local /ˈloʊkl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
from, existing in, serving, or responsible for a small area, especially of a country địa phương
Ví dụ:
  • Our children go to the local school
  • local radio (= a radio station that broadcasts to one area only)

log /lɔːɡ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a thick piece of tree trunk or branch, especially one cut for burning on a fire Khúc gỗ mới đốn, khúc gỗ mới xẻ
Ví dụ:
  • When I lifted the log, there were lots of beetles skittering about/around under it.
  • Running along the beach, she stumbled on a log and fell on the sand.

long-term /ˌlɔːŋ ˈtɜːrm/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
continuing a long time into the future Dài hạn, dài ngày, lâu dài
Ví dụ:
  • Requited love is not enough to sustain a long-term relationship.
  • What this country needs is a long-term policy for investment in science and technology.

low /loʊ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a low level or point; a low figure mức thấp, con số thấp
Ví dụ:
  • The yen has fallen to an all-time low against the dollar.
  • The temperature reached a record low in London last night.
  • The government's popularity has hit a new low

luggage /ˈlʌɡɪdʒ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
bags, cases, etc that contain somebody’s clothes and things when they are travelling Hành lý.
Ví dụ:
  • There's room for one more piece of luggage.
  • You stay there with the luggage while I find a cab.

lunar /ˈluːnər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
connected with the moon (Thuộc) Mặt trăng.
Ví dụ:
  • a lunar eclipse/landscape
  • the lunarsurface

luxurious /lʌɡˈʒʊriəs/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
very comfortable; containing expensive and enjoyable things [synonym] sumptuous Sang trọng, lộng lẫy; xa hoa, xa xỉ. Ưa khoái lạc; thích xa hoa, thích xa xỉ (người).
Ví dụ:
  • They have a very luxurious house
  • We spent a luxurious weekend at a country hotel.

magnitude /ˈmæɡnɪtuːd/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the large size or importance of something Tầm lớn, độ lớn, lượng Tầm quan trọng, tính chất trọng đại.
Ví dụ:
  • They don't seem to grasp the magnitude of the problem

mainstream /ˈmeɪnstriːm/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the ideas and opinions that are thought to be normal because they are shared by most people; the people whose ideas and opinions are most accepted Xu hướng chủ đạo, xu thế chủ đạo. Thị hiếu đại chúng.
Ví dụ:
  • His radical views place him outside the mainstream of American politics.
  • He was never part of the literary mainstream as a writer.

maintain /meɪnˈteɪn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to make something continue at the same level, standard, etc. Giữ, duy trì, bảo vệ, bảo quản.
Ví dụ:
  • Security during the president's visit must be maintained at all costs.

major /ˈmeɪdʒər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
very large or important Lớn (hơn), nhiều (hơn), trọng đại, chủ yếu
Ví dụ:
  • All of her major plays have been translated into English.
  • Sugar is a major cause of tooth decay.

make a living UK US

Định nghĩa:
to earn enough money to buy the things you need (kiếm sống)
Ví dụ:
  • Everyone has to make a living
  • You can make a good living (= earn a lot of money) in sales if you have the right attitude.

make-believe /ˈmeɪk bɪliːv/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
believing or imagining things that appear to be attractive or exciting, but are not real Sự giả vờ, sự giả cách, sự giả bộ.
Ví dụ:
  • ‘Let's play make-believe,’ said Sam

mall /mɔːl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a large building or covered area that has many shops/stores, restaurants, etc inside it
Ví dụ:
  • Let's go to the mall.
  • Some teenagers were hanging out at the mall.

mammal /ˈmæml/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
any animal of which the female feeds her young on milk from her own body (Động vật học) Loài thú, loài động vật có vú
Ví dụ:
  • Humans, dogs, elephants, and dolphins are all mammals, but birds, fish, and crocodiles are not

manage /ˈmænɪdʒ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to succeed in doing or dealing with something, especially something difficult Đạt kết quả, đạt mục đích, xoay sở được, tìm được cách
Ví dụ:
  • I only just managed to finish on time
  • How did you manage to persuade him?

management /ˈmænɪdʒmənt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the act of running and controlling a business or similar organization Sự trông nom, sự quản lý. Sự điều khiển.
Ví dụ:
  • The company has suffered from several years of bad management.
  • There is a need for stricter financial management.
  • a management training programme

mango /ˈmæŋɡoʊ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
an oval tropical fruit with a smooth skin, orange-yellow flesh, and a large, hard seed in the middle Quả xoài. (Thực vật học) Cây xoài.

manned /mænd/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
có người lái, có người điều khiển
Ví dụ:
  • manned space flight

manually /ˈmænjuəli/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
doneby hand rather than automatically or using electricity, etc directly by a human being rather than by a machine Được điều khiển bằng tay. Một cách thủ công.
Ví dụ:
  • Few of the machines are operated manually
  • Tickets are checked manually at peak times.

manual work /ˈmænjuəlwɜːrk/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
work involving the hands, as opposed to an office job, for example công việc lao động chân tay
Ví dụ:
  • manual labour/jobs/skills
  • manual and non-manual workers

manufacturer /ˌmænjuˈfæktʃərər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a person or company that produces goods in large quantities [synonym] maker nhà sản xuất
Ví dụ:
  • Always follow the manufacturer's instructions.
  • Faulty goods should be returned to the manufacturers.

manure /məˈnʊr/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the waste matter from animals that is spread over or mixed with the soil to help plants and crops grow [synonym] dung Phân bón có nguồn gốc từ chất thải động vật
Ví dụ:
  • Dig plenty of well-rotted manure into the soil.
  • Work in plenty of well-rotted manure.
  • the best time to spread manure on the fields

maple /ˈmeɪpl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a tall tree with leaves that have five points and turn bright red or yellow in the autumn/fall Maples grow in northern countries (Thực vật học) Cây thích, cây phong
Ví dụ:
  • a maple leaf
  • maple trees

marble /ˈmɑːrbl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a type of very hard rock that has a pattern of lines going through it, feels cold, and can be polished to become smooth and shiny Đá hoa cương, cẩm thạch.
Ví dụ:
  • a marble floor/statue

marginal /ˈmɑːrdʒɪnl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
very small in amount or effect rất nhỏ, gần như không đáng kể
Ví dụ:
  • The report suggests that there has only been a marginal improvement in women's pay over the past few years

marine /məˈriːn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
connected with the sea and the creatures and plants that live there (liên quan đến) biển, sinh vật biển
Ví dụ:
  • marine life
  • a marine biologist (= a scientist who studies life in the sea)

marital /ˈmærɪtl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
connected with marriage (Thuộc, liên quan đến) Hôn nhân.
Ví dụ:
  • your marital status

market /ˈmɑːrkɪt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the people who might want to buy something, or a part of the world where something is sold Thị trường, nơi tiêu thụ; khách hàng
Ví dụ:
  • Are you sure there's a market for the product?
  • We estimate the potential market for the new phones to be around one million people in this country alone.

marketing /ˈmɑːrkɪtɪŋ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the activity of presenting, advertising and selling a company’s products or services in the best possible way Sự tiếp thị
Ví dụ:
  • Our marketing people have come up with a great idea for the launch of the new model.
  • Persuasion is one of the most valuable skills in marketing.

masculine /ˈmæskjəlɪn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
having characteristics that are traditionally thought to be typical of or suitable for men nam tính
Ví dụ:
  • He was handsome and strong, and very masculine.
  • That suit makes her look very masculine.

masculinity /ˌmæskjuˈlɪnəti/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the characteristics that are traditionally thought to be typical of or suitable for men vẻ nam tính
Ví dụ:
  • It’s a cliché to say that science is associated with masculinity and the arts with femininity.
  • She found herself attracted to his aggressive masculinity.

Master's /ˈmæs. tɚz/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a second university degree bằng thạc sĩ (học vị cấp cho người tốt nghiệp cao học)
Ví dụ:
  • He has a Master's in Business Administration

material /məˈtɪriəl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a physical substance that things can be made from Chất, tài liệu, nguyên liệu, vật liệu
Ví dụ:
  • building materials, such as stone
  • Crude oil is used as the raw (= basic) material for making plastics.

maternal /məˈtɜːrnl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
connected with being a mother having feelings that are typical of a caring mother towards a child[only before noun] related through the mother’s side of the family (Thuộc) Mẹ; của người mẹ; về phía mẹ;
Ví dụ:
  • Maternal age affects the baby's survival rate.
  • the effects of maternal smoking during pregnancy
  • maternal loveI'm not very maternal
  • She didn't have any maternal instincts.

mathematical /ˌmæθəˈmætɪkl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
connected with or involving mathematics liên quan đến toán học
Ví dụ:
  • mathematical calculations/problems/models
  • to assess children’s mathematical ability

mathematician /ˌmæθəməˈtɪʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
someone who studies, teaches, or is an expert in mathematics Nhà toán học
Ví dụ:
  • one of the greatest mathematicians of all time

mathematics /ˌmæθəˈmætɪks/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
= maths Môn toán, toán học.
Ví dụ:
  • the school mathematics curriculum

mature /məˈtʃʊr/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
behave like an adult, or in a way that shows you are well developed emotionally Chín, thành thực, trưởng thành. Cẩn thận, chín chắn, kỹ càng.
Ví dụ:
  • Jane is very mature for her age.
  • a mature and sensible attitude

mayor /ˈmeɪər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a person who is elected or chosen to lead the group who governs a town or city Thị trưởng
Ví dụ:
  • We need a mayor who is tough enough to clean up this town.
  • The mayor has promised to cleanse the city of drug dealers.

measurement /ˈmeʒərmənt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the act or the process of finding the size, quantity or degree of something việc đo đạc, phép đo đạc
Ví dụ:
  • the metric system of measurement
  • Accurate measurement is very important in science.
  • The test is based on the measurement of blood levels
  • The machine makes thousands of measurements every day.

mechanism /ˈmekənɪzəm/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a way of doing something that is planned or part of a system cơ chế cơ chế hoạt động
Ví dụ:
  • mechanisms for dealing with complaints from the general public
  • The college has established an effective student support mechanism.

meddle /ˈmedl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to become involved in something that does not concern you [synonym] interfere to touch something in a careless way, especially when it is not yours or when you do not know how to use it correctly Xen vào, dính vào, can thiệp vào. Động vào, xờ vào
Ví dụ:
  • He had no right to meddle in her affairs
  • Somebody had been meddling with her computer.

medication /ˌmedɪˈkeɪʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a drug or another form of medicine that you take to prevent or to treat an illness thuốc, dược phẩm
Ví dụ:
  • to be on medication
  • Are you currently taking any medication?

medieval /ˌmediˈiːvl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
related to the Middle Ages (= the period in European history from about AD 600 to AD (Thuộc) Thời Trung cổ; kiểu trung cổ
Ví dụ:
  • a medieval building/painting/town
  • a medieval manuscript

medium /ˈmiːdiəm/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a way of communicating information, etc to people một cách, một phương tiện để truyền thông tin, v v cho người khác
Ví dụ:
  • the medium of radio/television
  • They told the story through the medium of dance.
  • A T-shirt can be an excellent medium for getting your message across.
  • The plural in this meaning is usually media.

melon /ˈmelən/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a large, round fruit with hard yellow or green skin, sweet flesh, and a lot of seeds Dưa tây, dưa lưới
Ví dụ:
  • a slice of melon

memorial /məˈmɔːriəl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
an object, often large and made of stone, that has been built to honour a famous person or event Đài kỷ niệm, tượng kỷ niệm; vật kỷ niệm
Ví dụ:
  • a war memorial
  • The statue was erected as a memorial to those who died in the war.

memorize /ˈmeməraɪz/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to learn something carefully so that you can remember it exactly Ghi nhớ, ghi chép Nhớ, thuộc, thuộc lòng.
Ví dụ:
  • to memorize a poem

mental /ˈmentl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
relating to the mind, or involving the process of thinking (Thuộc) Tâm thần, (thuộc) tinh thần. (Thuộc) Trí tuệ, (thuộc) trí óc.
Ví dụ:
  • the mental process of remembering
  • Do you have a mental picture of what it will look like?
  • I made a mental note to talk to her about it.
  • He has a complete mental block (= difficulty in understanding or remembering) when it comes to physics.

mentality /menˈtæləti/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a person's particular way of thinking about things lối tư duy, cách suy nghĩ
Ví dụ:
  • I can't understand the mentality of people who hurt animals.
  • He hopes that closer links between Britain and the rest of Europe will change the British mentality towards foreigners.

merge /mɜːrdʒ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to combine or make two or more things combine to form a single thing kết hợp, sát nhập, hợp nhất
Ví dụ:
  • They decided to merge the two companies into one
  • The country's two biggest banks are planning to merge.

mesh /meʃ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(specialist) (of parts of a machine) to fit together as they move Khớp nhau (bánh xe răng )
Ví dụ:
  • If the cogs don't mesh correctly, the gears will keep slipping

meteor /ˈmiːtiər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a piece of rock or other matter from space that produces a bright light as it travels through the atmosphere Sao sa, sao băng
Ví dụ:
  • a meteor shower

meteoric /ˌmiːtiˈɔːrɪk/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
relating to or caused by a meteor (Thuộc) Sao băng, như sao băng.
Ví dụ:
  • The sudden flash of light in the night sky was caused by a meteoric fireball
  • meteoric craters

microwave /ˈmaɪkrəweɪv/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a type of oven that cooks or heats food very quickly using electromagnetic waves rather than heat lò vi sóng
Ví dụ:
  • Reheat the soup in the microwave.
  • microwave cookery/meals

migrate /ˈmaɪɡreɪt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(of a lot of people) to move from one town, country, etc to go and live and/or work in another Di trú, di cư; ra nước ngoài.
Ví dụ:
  • Thousands were forced to migrate from rural to urban areas in search of work.
  • Mexican farm workers migrate into the US each year to find work at harvest time.

milestone /ˈmaɪlstoʊn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
an important event in the development or history of something or in someone's life (Nghĩa bóng) Sự kiện quan trọng, mốc lịch sử, giai đoạn quan trọng (trong đời ai).
Ví dụ:
  • She felt that moving out of her parents' home was a real milestone in her life.
  • Today we have passed another milestone on the road towards peace.

millennia /mɪˈleniə/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
plural form of "millennium" dạng số nhiều của "millennium"
Ví dụ:
  • For millennia, it was accepted that the earth was at the centre of the universe
  • The book is a history of the last two millennia.

millennium /mɪˈleniəm/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a period of 1 000 years Thiên niên kỷ, nghìn năm, mười thế kỷ.
Ví dụ:
  • Imagine what the world will be like at the end of the next millennium

mimic /ˈmɪmɪk/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to copy the way in which a particular person usually speaks and moves, usually in order to make people laugh Nhại (ai) Bắt chước.
Ví dụ:
  • She's always mimicking the teachers.
  • He mimicked her southern accent.

minor /ˈmaɪnər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
not very large, important or serious Nhỏ nhặt, không quan trọng, thứ yếu
Ví dụ:
  • It's only a minor problem
  • There's been an increase in minor offences, such as traffic violations and petty theft
  • She suffered only minor injuries
  • It requires a few minor adjustments.

minute /maɪˈnuːt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
extremely small Nhỏ, vụn vặt. Kỹ lưỡng, chi ly, cặn kẽ, tỉ mỉ.
Ví dụ:
  • a minute amount/quantity
  • I've never seen a man with such tiny hands - they're minute!
  • The documentary showed an eye operation in minute detail (= showing every small detail).

missile /ˈmɪsl/. /ˈmɪsaɪl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a weapon that is sent through the air and that explodes when it hits the thing that it is aimed at Tên lửa.
Ví dụ:
  • nuclear missiles
  • Missile attacks on the capital resumed at dawn.

mixed /mɪkst/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
schoolsfor both males and females trường cho cả nam lẫn nữ
Ví dụ:
  • Our children go to a mixed school

model /ˈmɑːdl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to create a copy of an activity, a situation, etc so that you can study it before dealing with the real thing [synonym] simulate mô phỏng, bắt chước
Ví dụ:
  • The program can model a typical home page for you
  • The whole car can be modelled on a computer before a single component is made.

moderate /ˈmɑːdərət/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
neither small nor large in size, amount, degree, or strength Vừa phải; phải chăng, có mức độ; điều độ. Ôn hoà, không quá khích.
Ví dụ:
  • students of moderate ability
  • Even moderate amounts of the drug can be fatal.
  • The team enjoyed only moderate success last season.
  • Cook over a moderate heat.

modern /ˈmɑːdərn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
designed and made using the most recent ideas and methods: Hiện đại
Ví dụ:
  • One by one the old buildings in the city have been demolished and replaced with modern tower blocks.
  • Space travel is one of the marvels/wonders of modern science.

modernization /ˌmɑːdərnəˈzeɪʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the process of making a system, methods, etc more modern and more suitable for use at the present time Sự hiện đại hoá; sự đổi mới
Ví dụ:
  • The modernization of the 100-year-old sewage and water systems will cost millions of pounds.
  • The property is basically sound, but in need of modernization.

modify /ˈmɑːdɪfaɪ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to change something slightly, especially in order to make it more suitable for a particular purpose [synonym] adapt Sửa đổi, thay đổi
Ví dụ:
  • The software we use has been modified for us.
  • Patients are taught how to modify their diet.
  • We found it cheaper to modify existing equipment rather than buy new.

monitor /ˈmɑːnɪtər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a computer screen or a device with a screen on which words or pictures can be shown màn hình
Ví dụ:
  • a computer monitor
  • a TV monitor
  • Doctors watched the old man's heartbeat on a monitor.

monopoly /məˈnɑːpəli/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(an organization or group that has) complete control of something, especially an area of business, so that others have no share sự độc quyền trong kinh doanh, cung cấp dịch vụ
Ví dụ:
  • In the past central government had a monopoly on television broadcasting.
  • Electricity, gas and water were considered to be natural monopolies.

monotonous /məˈnɑːtənəs/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
never changing and therefore boring [synonym] dull, repetitious Đều đều, đơn điệu; buồn tẻ
Ví dụ:
  • a monotonous joba monotonous voiceThe music became monotonous after a while.

mood /muːd/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the way you feel at a particular time Tâm trạng
Ví dụ:
  • She's in a good/bad mood.
  • Her mood seemed to change during the course of the conversation.

moon /muːn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the round object that moves in the sky around the earth and can be seen at night Mặt trăng
Ví dụ:
  • Neil Armstrong was the first person to set foot on the surface of the moon
  • With a good telescope, you can see craters on the moon.

motherhood /ˈmʌðərhʊd/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the state or time of being a mother việc làm mẹ, cương vị làm mẹ, thời gian làm mẹ
Ví dụ:
  • Motherhood suits her.
  • She’s struggling to combine motherhood and a career as a lawyer.

motive /ˈmoʊtɪv/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a reason for doing something Cớ, lý do, động cơ (của một hành động)
Ví dụ:
  • Why would she have killed him? She has no motive.
  • Does he have a motive for lying about where he was?
  • What is the motive behind (= the reason for) the bombing?
  • I think you should examine/question their motives in offering to lend you the money.

mount /maʊnt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to gradually increase, rise, or get bigger Tăng lên
Ví dụ:
  • The children's excitement is mounting as Christmas gets nearer
  • Pressure is mounting on the government to change the law.

mountainous /ˈmaʊntənəs/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(of an area) having a lot of mountains (khu vực) nhiều đồi núi
Ví dụ:
  • a mountainous region

multicultural /ˌmʌltiˈkʌltʃərəl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
for or including people of several different races, religions, languages and traditions đa văn hoá khác nhau
Ví dụ:
  • We live in a multicultural society.
  • a multicultural approach to education

multiculturalism /ˌmʌltiˈkʌltʃərəlɪzəm/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the belief that different cultures within a society should all be given importance sự đa văn hoá, sự khuyến khích đa văn hoá

multinational /ˌmʌltiˈnæʃnəl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(of a business) producing and selling goods in several different countries (Công ty) đa quốc gia (kinh doanh ở nhiều nước khác nhau)
Ví dụ:
  • a major multinational food company

mundane /mʌnˈdeɪn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
very ordinary and therefore not interesting tầm thường, bình thường, không có gì đặc sắc
Ví dụ:
  • Mundane matters such as paying bills and shopping for food do not interest her
  • On a more mundane level, can we talk about the timetable for next week?

murder /ˈmɜːrdər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the crime of killing somebody deliberately [synonym] homicide Tội giết người, tội ám sát
Ví dụ:
  • He was found guilty of murder.
  • She has been charged with the attempted murder of her husband.
  • to commit (a) murder

murderer /ˈmɜːrdərər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a person who has killed somebody deliberately and illegally [synonym] killer Kẻ giết người
Ví dụ:
  • a convicted murderer
  • a mass murderer (= who has killed a lot of people)

muscle /ˈmʌsl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
one of many tissues in the body that can tighten and relax to produce movement Cơ bắp (Nghĩa bóng) Sức lực.
Ví dụ:
  • This exercise will work the muscles of the lower back.
  • She tried to relax her tense muscles.

musician /mjuˈzɪʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
someone who is skilled in playing music, usually as a job nhạc công
Ví dụ:
  • The concert features dancers and musicians of all nationalities
  • The famous jazz musician, Duke Ellington, was a composer, arranger and pianist.

myth /mɪθ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
something that many people believe but that does not exist or is false [synonym] fallacy một điều được tin rộng rãi, nhưng không có cơ sở khoa học
Ví dụ:
  • Contrary to popular myth, women are not worse drivers than men
  • Statistics disprove the myth that women are worse drivers than men.

narrate /ˈnæreɪt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to tell a story, often by reading aloud from a text, or to describe events as they happen Kể lại, thuật lại
Ví dụ:
  • Documentaries are often narrated by well-known actors.
  • One by one the witnesses narrated the sequence of events which led up to the disaster.

narrative /ˈnærətɪv/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a story or a description of a series of events [synonym] story Chuyện kể, bài tường thuật
Ví dụ:
  • a gripping narrative of their journey up the Amazon
  • It's a moving narrative of wartime adventure
  • a first-person/third-person narrativea gripping/compelling narrative

narrow /ˈner. oʊ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to make a number or list of things smaller, by removing the things that are least important, necessary, or suitable thu hẹp danh sách (bằng cách loại bỏ những thứ không quan trọng, không phù hợp)
Ví dụ:
  • We narrowed the list of candidates down from ten to three

nascent /ˈnæsnt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
beginning to exist; not yet fully developed Mới sinh, mới mọc, còn non trẻ
Ví dụ:
  • a nascent industry
  • a nascent democracy

nation /ˈneɪʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a country Dân tộc. Nước, quốc gia.
Ví dụ:
  • All the nations of the world will be represented at the conference.
  • The Germans, as a nation, are often thought to be well organized.
  • Practically the whole nation watched the ceremony on television.

national /ˈnæʃnəl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
relating to or typical of a whole country and its people, rather than to part of that country or to other countries (Thuộc) Dân tộc. (Thuộc) Quốc gia.
Ví dụ:
  • a national holiday
  • Britain has more than ten national newspapers.
  • The company's national headquarters is in Rome.
  • The children were wearing traditional national costume/dress.

nationality /ˌnæʃəˈnæləti/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the official right to belong to a particular country Quốc tịch
Ví dụ:
  • She has British nationality.
  • What nationality are you?
  • All applicants will be considered regardless of age, sex, religion or nationality.
  • She has dual nationality (= is a citizen of two countries).

native /ˈneɪtɪv/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
relating to or describing someone's country or place of birth (liên quan đến) nơi sinh, bản xứ, bản quán (của một ai đó)
Ví dụ:
  • your native land/country/city
  • Her native language is Korean.

native speaker /ˌneɪtɪv ˈspiːkər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a person who speaks a language as their first language người bản xứ
Ví dụ:
  • All our teachers are native speakers of English

natural selection /ˌnætrəl sɪˈlekʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the process by which plants, animals, etc that can adapt to their environment survive and reproduce, while the others disappear sự chọn lọc tự nhiên
Ví dụ:
  • The process of natural selection allows the fittest creatures to survive and continue to reproduce.

nature /ˈneɪtʃər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the usual way that a person or an animal behaves that is part of their character tính, bản chất, bản tính (tự nhiên, vốn đã thế)
Ví dụ:
  • It's not in his nature to be unkind.
  • She is very sensitive by nature.
  • We appealed to his better nature (= his kindness).

necessity /nəˈsesəti/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
something that you need, especially in order to live Những thứ cần thiết, những thứ cần dùng
Ví dụ:
  • Many people cannot even afford basic necessities such as food and clothing.
  • Air-conditioning is an absolute necessity in this climate.

needlessly /ˈniːdləsli/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
in a way that is not necessary because it could have been avoided [synonym] unnecessarily Thừa, vô ích Một cách không cần thiết
Ví dụ:
  • She'd worried needlessly about whether there would be enough food
  • The process was needlessly slow.

neglect /nɪˈɡlekt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to not give enough care or attention to people or things that are your responsibility Sao lãng, không chú ý. Bỏ bê, bỏ mặc. Thờ ơ, hờ hững.
Ví dụ:
  • He neglects that poor dog - he never takes him for walks or gives him any attention.
  • She's been neglecting her studies this semester.

neighbouring /ˈneɪbərɪŋ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
lân cận, bên cạnh
Ví dụ:
  • neighbouring countries/states
  • She married a man from the neighbouring village.

neurological /ˌnʊrəˈlɑːdʒɪkl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
relating to nerves (Thuộc) Thần kinh, (thuộc) hệ thần kinh
Ví dụ:
  • neurological disease/damage
  • Alzheimer's disease is a neurological disorder.

neuroscientist /ˈnʊroʊsaɪəntɪst/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a scientist who studies the nervous system and the brain nhà khoa học thần kinh,nhà thần kinh học
Ví dụ:
  • Neuroscientists are able to record the firing of a single nerve cell

niche /niːʃ/ or/nɪtʃ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(business) an opportunity to sell a particular product to a particular group of people một phân khúc nhỏ, cụ thể trên thị trường (thị trường ngách)
Ví dụ:
  • They spotted a niche in the market, with no serious competition.
  • a niche market
  • the development of niche marketing (= aiming products at particular groups)

non-renewable /ˌnɑːn rɪˈnuːəbl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(of natural resources such as gas or oil) that cannot be replaced after use (năng lượng, tài nguyên) không thể tái tạo được
Ví dụ:
  • Oil, natural gas, and coal are non-renewable fuels.
  • Fossil fuels are non-renewable and rapidly running out.

nostalgia /nɑːˈstældʒə/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a feeling of sadness mixed with pleasure and affection when you think of happy times in the past cảm giác bồi hồi, xúc động khi nhớ về những kỷ niệm đẹp trong quá khứ
Ví dụ:
  • a sense/wave/pang of nostalgia
  • She is filled with nostalgia for her own college days.

nostalgic /nɑːˈstældʒɪk/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
feeling happy and also slightly sad when you think about things that happened in the past cảm thấy/khiến ai đó cảm thấy bồi hồi, xúc động khi nhớ về những kỷ niệm đẹp trong quá khứ
Ví dụ:
  • Talking about our old family holidays has made me feel all nostalgic.
  • We'll take a nostalgic look at the musical hits of the 60s.

notorious /noʊˈtɔːriəs/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
well known for being bad Khét tiếng (Thường, nghĩa xấu) Nổi danh, nổi tiếng; có tiếng xấu.
Ví dụ:
  • one of Mexico's most notorious criminals
  • The company is notorious for paying its bills late.

nought /nɔːt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the number 0 or zero (Toán học) Số không.
Ví dụ:
  • He said it was only worth £10, but really you could add a couple of noughts to that (= it is really worth £1,

nowadays /ˈnaʊədeɪz/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
at the present time, in contrast with the past Ngày nay, đời nay, thời buổi này
Ví dụ:
  • Nowadays most kids prefer watching TV to reading.
  • Nowadays, I bake my own bread rather than buy it.

nuclear energy /ˌnuːkliər ˈpaʊər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a powerful form of energy produced by converting matter into energy by splitting atoms năng lượng hạt nhân

numerous /ˈnuːmərəs/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
existing in large numbers [synonym] many Đông, đông đảo, nhiều
Ví dụ:
  • He has been late on numerous occasions.
  • The advantages of this system are too numerous to mention.
  • Numerous studies have shown this to be true.

nursery /ˈnɜːrsəri/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a place where young children and babies are taken care of while their parents are at work Nhà trẻ.
Ví dụ:
  • Her youngest child is at nursery now.
  • The children are at nursery three days a week.

nutrient /ˈnuːtriənt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
any substance that plants or animals need in order to live and grow Chất dinh dưỡng, chất nuôi dưỡng.
Ví dụ:
  • A healthy diet should provide all your essential nutrients
