oak /oʊk/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a large tree that is common in northern countries, or the hard wood of this tree (Thực vật học) Cây sồi
Ví dụ:
  • a mighty oak
  • The timbers of those old sailing ships were mostly oak.
  • an oak table/cupboard

obey /əˈbeɪ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to do what you are told or expected to do Vâng lời nghe lời, tuân theo, tuân lệnh
Ví dụ:
  • to obey a command/an order/rules/the law
  • He had always obeyed his parents without question.
  • (figurative) I tried to run but my legs just wouldn't obey me.
  • ‘Sit down!’ Meekly, she obeyed.

observation /ˌɑːbzərˈveɪʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the act of observing something or someone Sự quan sát, sự để ý, sự chú ý, sự theo dõi Lời nhận xét, điều quan sát được, điều nhận thấy.
Ví dụ:
  • results based on scientific observations
  • The suspect is being kept under observation (= watched closely by the police).

observe /əbˈzɜːrv/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to see or notice somebody/something Quan sát, nhận xét, theo dõi
Ví dụ:
  • Have you observed any changes lately?
  • I want you to observe all the details.

obsessed /əbˈsest/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
unable to stop thinking about something; too interested in or worried about something bị ám ảnh bởi cái gì đấy
Ví dụ:
  • Why are people so obsessed with money?
  • He's obsessed with Barbra Streisand and collects anything and everything connected with her.

obsession /əbˈseʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the state in which a person’s mind is completely filled with thoughts of one particular thing or person in a way that is not normal Sự ảm ảnh; tình trạng bị ám ảnh Điều ám ảnh.
Ví dụ:
  • He has an obsession with cleanliness
  • Her fear of flying is becoming an obsession.

obstacle /ˈɑːbstəkl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a situation, an event, etc that makes it difficult for you to do or achieve something Vật chướng ngại, trở lực. Sự cản trở, sự trở ngại.
Ví dụ:
  • The biggest obstacle in our way was a tree trunk in the road.
  • A lack of qualifications can be a major obstacle to finding a job.

obtain /əbˈteɪn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to get something, especially by making an effort Đạt được, thu được, giành được, kiếm được, lấy về.
Ví dụ:
  • I finally managed to obtain a copy of the report.
  • Further details can be obtained by writing to the above address.

occasionally /əˈkeɪʒnəli/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
sometimes but not often Thỉnh thoảng, thảng hoặc; từng thời kỳ.
Ví dụ:
  • We occasionally meet for a drink after work.
  • This type of allergy can very occasionally be fatal.

occupation /ˌɑːkjuˈpeɪʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
[countable] a job or profession Nghề nghiệp; công việc, việc làm
Ví dụ:
  • Please state your name, age and occupation below.
  • In the space marked "occupation" she wrote "police officer".

occupy /ˈɑːkjupaɪ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to keep someone busy or interested
Ví dụ:
  • a game that will occupy the kids for hours

occur /əˈkɜːr/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(especially of accidents and other unexpected events) to happen Xảy ra, xảy đến.
Ví dụ:
  • An accident involving over ten vehicles has occurred in the east-bound lane

offence /əˈfens/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
an illegal act [synonym] crime Sự phạm tội; tội, lỗi Sự vi phạm luật lệ, sự vi phạm nội quy.
Ví dụ:
  • Driving without a licence is an offence
  • He committed several serious offences
  • It's the third time that he's been convicted of a drug offence.

offend /əˈfend/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(formal) to commit a crime or crimes Phạm tội, làm điều lầm lỗi; vi phạm
Ví dụ:
  • He started offending at the age of 16.
  • What is the best way to stop someone who has offended from repeating the offence?

offensive /əˈfensɪv/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
rude in a way that causes you to feel upset, insulted or annoyed Gây xúc phạm, làm mất lòng; làm nhục, sỉ nhục
Ví dụ:
  • The programme contains language which some viewers may find offensive.
  • His comments were deeply offensive to a large number of single mothers.

officer /ˈɔːfɪsər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a member of the police force Cảnh sát
Ví dụ:
  • the officer in charge of the case
  • the investigating officer
  • Yes, officer, I saw what happened.

offset /ˈɔːfset/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to balance one influence against an opposing influence, so that there is no great difference as a result Bù lại, đền bù, bù đắp
Ví dụ:
  • Prices have risen in order to offset the increased cost of materials
  • The extra cost of travelling to work is offset by the lower price of houses here.

old-fashioned /ˌoʊld ˈfæʃnd/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
not modern; belonging to or typical of a time in the past Cũ, không hợp thời trang. Nệ cổ, lạc hậu, hủ lậu (người).
Ví dụ:
  • old-fashioned clothes/ideas/furniture
  • She's very old-fashioned in her outlook.

omit /əˈmɪt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to not include something/somebody, either deliberately or because you have forgotten it/them [synonym] leave somebody/something out Bỏ sót, bỏ quên, bỏ đi (một từ )
Ví dụ:
  • If you are a student, you can omit questions 16–18.
  • People were surprised that Smith was omitted from the team.

omnipresent /ˌɑːmnɪˈpreznt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
present everywhere Có mặt ở khắp nơi
Ví dụ:
  • These days the media are omnipresent.
  • The singer became an omnipresent icon of style and beauty.
  • They believe that God is omnipresent.

once in a lifetime UK US

Định nghĩa:
used to describe something special that is not likely to happen to you again
Ví dụ:
  • An opportunity like this comes once in a lifetime
  • a once-in-a-lifetime experience

one-sided /ˌwʌn ˈsaɪdɪd/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(disapproving) (of an argument, opinion, etc ) showing only one side of the situation; not balanced [synonym] biased Một chiều, phiến diện. Không công bằng, thiên vị.
Ví dụ:
  • The press were accused of presenting a very one-sided picture of the issue
  • They blamed their defeat on the media's one-sided reporting of the election.

onset /ˈɔːnset/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the beginning of something, especially something unpleasant Lúc bắt đầu.
Ví dụ:
  • the onset of winter

opera /ˈɑːprə/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a musical play in which most of the words are sung, or plays and music of this type Ca kịch, nhạc kịch
Ví dụ:
  • "Carmen" is my favourite opera.
  • I've never been a huge fan of opera.

operate /ˈɑːpəreɪt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to use or control a machine or make it work Làm cho hoạt động, cho chạy (máy ); thao tác
Ví dụ:
  • What skills are needed to operate this machinery?

opposition /ˌɑːpəˈzɪʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
strong disagreement Sự chống lại, sự chống cự, sự phản đối
Ví dụ:
  • There is a lot of opposition to the proposed changes.
  • The unions are in opposition to the government over the issue of increasing the minimum wage.

optical fibre /ˌɑːptɪkl ˈfaɪbər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a thin glass thread through which light can be transmitted (= sent) sợi quang học, cáp quang

optimist /ˈɑːptɪmɪst/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
someone who always believes that good things will happen (người luôn lạc quan)
Ví dụ:
  • An optimist looks at the glass and says its half full.

optimistic /ˌɑːptɪˈmɪstɪk/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
hoping or believing that good things will happen in the future (lạc quan, đầy hy vọng)
Ví dụ:
  • The doctor said she was optimistic about the outcome of the operation

oral /ˈɔːrəl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
of, taken by, or done to the mouth (Giải phẫu) (thuộc) miệng.
Ví dụ:
  • oral hygiene
  • oral surgery

orange /ˈɔːrɪndʒ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a round sweet fruit that has a thick orange skin and an orange centre divided into many parts Quả cam. Cây cam.
Ví dụ:
  • a glass of orange juice
  • Vitamin C is found in oranges and other citrus fruit.

orangutan /əˈræŋətæn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a large ape (= an animal like a large monkey with no tail) with long arms and reddish hair, that lives in Borneo and Sumatra Đười ươi hay còn gọi là dã nhân hay người rừng

orbit /ˈɔːrbɪt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the curved path through which objects in space move around a planet or star Quỹ đạo
Ví dụ:
  • The satellite is now in a stable orbit.
  • Once in space, the spacecraft will go into orbit around Earth.

orbital /ˈɔːrbɪtl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
connected with the orbit of a planet or object in space (Thuộc) Quỹ đạo
Ví dụ:
  • an orbital space station

orchestra /ˈɔːrkɪstrə/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a large group of musicians who play many different instruments together and are led by a conductor Ban nhạc, dàn nhạc
Ví dụ:
  • She's a cellist in the City of Birmingham Symphony Orchestra
  • She plays the flute in the school orchestra.

ordinary /ˈɔːrdneri/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
not unusual or different in any way Thường, thông thường, bình thường, tầm thường
Ví dụ:
  • an ordinary sort of day
  • ordinary people like you and me
  • an ordinary neighbourhood
  • Readers of the magazine said they wanted more stories about ordinary people and fewer stories about the rich and famous.

organize /ˈɔːrɡənaɪz/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to arrange something or the parts of something into a particular order or structure
Ví dụ:
  • The books were organized on the shelves according to their size

ornate /ɔːrˈneɪt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
having a lot of complicated decoration Trang trí công phu, trang sức lộng lẫy.
Ví dụ:
  • a room with an ornate ceiling and gold mirrors
  • This style is a little too ornate for my taste.

ostrich /ˈɔːstrɪtʃ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a very large bird from Africa that cannot fly (Động vật học) Đà điểu Châu phi
Ví dụ:
  • The ostrich is the fastest animal on two legs

outer /ˈaʊtər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
on the outside of something [synonym] external Ở phía ngoài, ở xa hơn
Ví dụ:
  • the outer space — vũ trụ, khoảng không ngoài quyển khíthe outer world — thế giới vật chất bên ngoài, xã hội bên ngoài

outlet /outlet/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(business) a shop/store or an organization that sells goods made by a particular company or of a particular type cửa hàng tiêu thụ, cửa hàng đại lý (của một hãng).
Ví dụ:
  • The business has 34 retail outlets in this state alone.
  • a fast-food outleta retail outlet

outweigh /ˌaʊtˈweɪ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to be greater or more important than something Có nhiều tác dụng hơn, có nhiều giá trị hơn, có nhiều ảnh hưởng hơn
Ví dụ:
  • The advantages far outweigh the disadvantages.
  • The benefits would surely far outweigh the risks.

overcome /ˌoʊvərˈkʌm/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to succeed in dealing with or controlling a problem that has been preventing you from achieving something vượt qua, chiến thắng
Ví dụ:
  • She overcame injury to win the Olympic gold medal.
  • Eventually she managed to overcome her shyness in class.

overdo /ˌoʊvərˈduː/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to do something too much; to exaggerate something Làm quá trớn, làm quá Làm mất tác dụng vì quá cường điệu, cường điệu hoá hỏng. Nấu quá nhừ.
Ví dụ:
  • Don't overdo the salt in the food.
  • Use illustrations where appropriate but don't overdo it.

overeating /ˌoʊvərˈiːtɪŋ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the act of eating more than you need or more than is healthy Ăn quá nhiều, ăn quá mức.
Ví dụ:
  • She went through periods of compulsive overeating

overgrazing /ˌəʊ. vəˈɡreɪ. zɪŋ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a situation in which there are too many cows or other animals eating grass in an area, which damages the environment Chăn thả quá mức
Ví dụ:
  • Another problem is erosion of stream banks caused by overgrazing

overlook /ˌoʊvərˈlʊk/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to fail to notice or consider something or someone Không nhận thấy, không chú ý tới.
Ví dụ:
  • He seems to have overlooked one important fact.
  • In my hurry to finish the exam I had overlooked part of one of the questions.

overpopulation /ˌoʊvərˌpɑːpjuˈleɪʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the fact of a country or city having too many people living in it Sự đông dân quá mức
Ví dụ:
  • the problems of overpopulation

overpriced /ˌoʊvərˈpraɪst/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
too expensive; costing more than it is worth có giá cao quá mức
Ví dụ:
  • These shoes are very nice, but they're really overpriced
  • ridiculously overpriced designer clothes

overprotective /ˌoʊvərprəˈtektɪv/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
wishing to protect someone, especially a child, too much Bảo vệ quá mức cần thiết.
Ví dụ:
  • overprotective parents
  • The children of overprotective parents often do not develop the skills they need to take care of themselves when they leave home.

overriding /ˌoʊvərˈraɪdɪŋ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
more important than anything else in a particular situation Quan trọng hơn bất cứ nhận định nào khác
Ví dụ:
  • the overriding factor/consideration/concern
  • Their overriding aim was to keep costs low.
  • Time was of overriding importance.

overseas /ˌoʊvərˈsiːz/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
in, from, or to other countries ngoài nước, hải ngoại
Ví dụ:
  • There are a lot of overseas students studying at our college.
  • My brother is a student overseas.
  • Many more people go/travel/live/work overseas these days.

overtime /ˈoʊvərtaɪm/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
time that you spend working at your job after you have worked the normal hours Giờ làm thêm
Ví dụ:
  • They're doing/working overtime to get the job done on time
  • Everyone is on overtime (= being paid extra for working after the usual time) this weekend.

overweight /ˌoʊvərˈweɪt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(of people) too heavy and fat [opposite] underweight (Từ mỹ,nghĩa mỹ) Béo quá.
Ví dụ:
  • She was only a few pounds overweight

overwhelmed /ˌoʊvərˈwelm/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to give too much of a thing to a person giao cho ai đó quá nhiều việc, làm quá tải ai đó
Ví dụ:
  • We were overwhelmed by requests for information.

pace /peɪs/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the speed at which someone or something moves, or with which something happens or changes Bước chân, bước Bước đi; nhịp đi; tốc độ đi, tốc độ chạy. Nhịp độ tiến triển, tốc độ tiến triển.
Ví dụ:
  • a slow/fast pace
  • When she thought she heard someone following her, she quickened her pace.
  • Could you slow down - I can't keep pace with (= walk or run as fast as) you.

packaging /ˈpækɪdʒɪŋ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
materials used to wrap or protect goods that are sold in shops/stores bao bì
Ví dụ:
  • Attractive packaging can help to sell products

paddock /ˈpædək/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a field of any size that is used for farming Mảnh ruộng, mảnh đất

painkiller /ˈpeɪnkɪlər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a drug that reduces pain thuốc giảm đau
Ví dụ:
  • The body produces chemicals that are natural painkillers
  • She's on (= taking) painkillers.

painting /ˈpeɪntɪŋ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a picture made using paint the act or art of using paint to produce pictures Hội hoạ. Bức vẽ, bức tranh.
Ví dụ:
  • The walls are covered in oil paintings.
  • Her hobbies include music and painting.

palm /pɑːm/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a tree that grows in hot countries and has a tall trunk with a mass of long pointed leaves at the top (Thực vật học) Cây cọ, cây họ cau dừa
Ví dụ:
  • date palms
  • palm fronds
  • The island has long golden beaches fringed by palm trees.

paparazzi /ˌpæpəˈrætsi/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the photographers who follow famous people everywhere they go in order to take photographs of them for newspapers and magazines những tay săn ảnh chuyên theo dõi người nổi tiếng để chụp ảnh bán lại cho báo chí

paradise /ˈpærədaɪs/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a place or condition of great happiness where everything is exactly as you would like it to be Thiên đường, nơi cực lạc
Ví dụ:
  • a tropical paradise
  • His idea of paradise is to spend the day lying on the beach.
  • This mall is a shopper's paradise.

parent /ˈperənt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a person’s father or mother Cha; mẹ
Ví dụ:
  • He's still living with his parents.
  • her adoptive parents
  • Sue and Ben have recently become parents.
  • It can be difficult to be a good parent.

parental /pəˈrentl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
connected with a parent or parents (Thuộc) Cha mẹ (Liên quan đến) cha mẹ
Ví dụ:
  • parental responsibility/rights
  • parental choice in education
  • parental advice/influenceThe government repeatedly stressed its support for parental choice in the selection of a child's school.

partial /ˈpɑːrʃl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
not complete or whole Bộ phận; cục bộ, một phần, bán phần
Ví dụ:
  • It was only a partial solution to the problem.
  • a partial eclipse of the sun

particular /pərˈtɪkjələr/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
used to emphasize that you are referring to a specific person, thing or type of thing and not others cụ thể, đặc biệt, đặc thù
Ví dụ:
  • There is one particular patient I'd like you to see.
  • Is there a particular type of book he enjoys?

particularly /pərˈtɪkjələrli/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
especially, or more than usual Đặc biệt là, nhất là, cụ thể là.
Ví dụ:
  • Traffic is bad, particularly in the city centre

pass /pæs/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
[law/proposal]to accept a proposal, law, etc by voting Phê duyệt, thông qua, chấp nhận (dự luật, đề xuất)
Ví dụ:
  • The bill was passed by 360 votes to 280
  • The government passed a law to restrict the sale of guns
  • The food supplement had been passed as safe for human consumption.

passenger /ˈpæsɪndʒər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a person who is travelling in a vehicle but is not driving it, flying it, or working on it Hành khách (đi tàu xe )
Ví dụ:
  • airline/rail/train/car passengers

pastureland /ˈpæstʃərlænd/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
land where animals can feed on grass đất để trồng cỏ chăn thả gia súc
Ví dụ:
  • To raise one cow requires an acre of rich pastureland

patent /ˈpætnt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
an official right to be the only person to make, use or sell a product or an invention; a document that proves this Bằng sáng chế đặc quyền chế tạo, đặc quyền phân phối một phát minh, một sản phẩm nào đó
Ví dụ:
  • In 1880 Alexander Graham Bell was granted a patent on an apparatus for signalling and communicating called a Photophone.
  • to apply for/obtain a patent on an inventionThe device was protected by patent.

pattern /ˈpætərn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
any regularly repeated arrangement, especially a design made from repeated lines, shapes, or colours on a surface Mẫu vẽ, họa tiết lặp đi lặp lại (trên vải, hảm, rèm che cửa ).
Ví dụ:
  • Look, the frost has made a beautiful pattern on the window.
  • The curtains had a floral pattern.

paw /pɔː/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the foot of an animal that has claws or nails, such as a cat, dog, or bear chân (có vuốt của mèo, hổ )
Ví dụ:
  • I found paw prints in the kitchen

pawnbroker /ˈpɔːnbroʊkər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a person who lends money in exchange for objects that he or she can sell if the person leaving the objects does not pay an agreed amount of money in an agreed time Chủ hiệu cầm đồ
Ví dụ:
  • at the pawnbroker's — đang đem cầm, đang ở hiệu cầm đồ (đồ)

pawnshop /ˈpɔːnʃɑːp/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a shop where a pawnbroker operates his or her business Hiệu cầm đồ

peaceful /ˈpiːsfl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
quiet and calm yên ổn, thanh bình
Ví dụ:
  • a peaceful afternoon/place

peak /piːk/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the highest, strongest, or best point, value đỉnh cao nhất, tột đỉnh, cao điểm
Ví dụ:
  • Prices reach a peak during August

peer /pɪr/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a person who is the same age or who has the same social status as you Người cùng tuổi, cùng địa vị xã hội, người ngang hàng, người tương đương.
Ví dụ:
  • Do you think it's true that teenage girls are less self-confident than their male peers?
  • He wasn't a great scholar, but as a teacher he had few peers (= not as many people had the same ability as him).

pejorative /pɪˈdʒɑːrətɪv/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
expressing disapproval, or suggesting that something is not good or is of no importance Có nghĩa xấu (từ), có nghĩa phê phán
Ví dụ:
  • Make sure students realize that "fat" is a pejorative word.
  • I'm using the word ‘academic’ here in a pejorative sense.

perceive /pərˈsiːv/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to notice or become aware of something Thấy, trông thấy; nghe thấy, cảm thấy, ngửi thấy
Ví dụ:
  • perceive something in his behaviour.
  • She perceived that all was not well.

performer /pərˈfɔːrmər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a person who entertains people by acting, singing, dancing, or playing music Người biểu diễn
Ví dụ:
  • He's a brilliant performer

performing arts /pɚˌfɔːr. mɪŋ ˈɑːrts/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
arts such as music, dance, and drama that are performed for an audience Nghệ thuật biểu diễn (sử dụng cơ thể, tiếng nói và sự có mặt của chính nghệ sĩ làm phương tiện trình diễn trước công chúng)
Ví dụ:
  • Performing arts may include dance, music, opera, theatre and musical theatre, magic, illusion, mime, spoken word, puppetry, circus arts, performance art, recitation and public speaking
  • There is also a specialized form of fine art, in which the artists perform their work live to an audience

period /ˈpɪriəd/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a length of time thời kỳ, giai đoạn, thời gian.
Ví dụ:
  • Her work means that she spends long periods away from home.
  • Unemployment in the first half of the year was 2
  • 5 percent lower than in the same period the year before.

perish /ˈperɪʃ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to die, especially in an accident or by being killed, or to be destroyed Diệt vong; chết; bỏ mạng, bỏ mình. Tàn lụi, héo rụi; hỏng đi.
Ví dụ:
  • Three hundred people perished in the earthquake.
  • He believes that Europe must create closer ties or it will perish.

perishable /ˈperɪʃəbl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(especially of food) likely to decay or go bad quickly Dễ thối, dễ hỏng (rau, hoa quả )
Ví dụ:
  • perishable goods/foods
  • Many fresh foods are highly perishable.
  • It's important to store perishable food in a cool place.

perk /pɜːrk/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
[usually plural] something you receive as well as your wages for doing a particular job Bổng lộc, tiền thù lao thêm. Vật hưởng thừa.
Ví dụ:
  • Perks offered by the firm include a car and free health insurance.
  • A company car and a mobile phone are some of the perks that come with the job.
  • (figurative) Not having to get up early is just one of the perks of being retired.

perpetrate /ˈpɜːrpətreɪt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to commit a crime or do something wrong or evil Phạm, gây ra
Ví dụ:
  • to perpetrate a crime/fraud/massacre
  • In this country, half of all violent crime is perpetrated by people who have been drinking alcohol.

perquisite /ˈpɜːrkwɪzɪt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
formal form of "perks" dạng đầy đủ của từ "perks"
Ví dụ:
  • The perquisites of this job include health insurance and a performance bonus

persevere /ˌpɜːrsəˈvɪr/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to continue trying to do or achieve something despite difficulties (+ in, with) Kiên nhẫn, kiên trì; bền gan, bền chí.
Ví dụ:
  • Despite a number of setbacks, they persevered in their attempts to fly around the world in a balloon
  • She persevered with her violin lessons.

persistent /pərˈsɪstənt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
lasting for a long time or difficult to get rid of Dai dẳng, mãi không khỏi.
Ví dụ:
  • Symptoms of the illness include a high temperature and a persistent dry cough

personality /ˌpɜːrsəˈnæləti/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a famous person Nhân vật, người nổi tiếng (nhất là trong giới văn nghệ, giới thể thao)
Ví dụ:
  • The show is hosted by a popular TV personality.

persuade /pərˈsweɪd/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to make somebody do something by giving them good reasons for doing it Làm cho tin; thuyết phục.
Ví dụ:
  • If she doesn't want to go, nothing you can say will persuade her.
  • He is trying to persuade local and foreign businesses to invest in the project.

pervasive /pərˈveɪsɪv/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
existing in all parts of a place or thing; spreading gradually to affect all parts of a place or thing Toả khắp. Lan tràn khắp, thâm nhập khắp.
Ví dụ:
  • The influence of Freud is pervasive in her books.
  • a pervasive smell of diesel
  • Reforms are being undermined by the all-pervasive corruption in the country.

pessimist /ˈpesɪmɪst/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a person who always expects bad things to happen (người bi quan)
Ví dụ:
  • A pessimist looks at the glass and says its half empty.

pessimistic /ˌpesɪˈmɪstɪk/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
thinking that bad things are more likely to happen or emphasizing the bad part of a situation (bi quan, sầu não)
Ví dụ:
  • The doctors are pessimistic (= not hopeful) about his chances of recovery.

pest /pest/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
an insect or animal that destroys plants, food, etc động vật, côn trùng làm hại mùa màng
Ví dụ:
  • pest control
  • common pests such as rats, mice, or cockroaches

pesticide /ˈpestɪsaɪd/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a chemical used for killing pests, especially insects Thuốc trừ vật hại (sâu chuột làm hại hoa màu)
Ví dụ:
  • vegetables grown without the use of pesticides
  • crops sprayed with pesticide

petal /ˈpetl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
any of the usually brightly coloured parts that together form most of a flower (Thực vật học) Cánh hoa
Ví dụ:
  • rose petals

petrol /ˈpetrəl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a liquid obtained from petroleum, used as fuel in car engines, etc xăng
Ví dụ:
  • to fill a car up with petrol
  • to run out of petrol
  • the petrol tank of a car
  • an increase in petrol prices

pharmacist /ˈfɑːrməsɪst/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a person who is trained to prepare and give out medicines in a hospital or shop dược sĩ
Ví dụ:
  • We had to wait for the pharmacist to make up her prescription

phase /feɪz/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a stage in a process of change or development thời kỳ (phát triển, biến đổi).
Ví dụ:
  • he project is only in its initial phase as yet, but it's looking quite promising.
  • We're entering a new phase in international relations.

PhD /ˌpiː eɪtʃ ˈdiː/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the abbreviation for [‘Doctor of Philosophy’ ](a university degree of a very high level that is given to somebody who has done research in a particular subject) bằng tiến sĩ, học vị tiến sĩ
Ví dụ:
  • a PhD student/thesis
  • Susannah has a PhD in Italian literature.
  • She's a PhD.

phenomena /fəˈnɑːmɪnə/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the plural form of "phenomenon" (các) hiện tượng
Ví dụ:
  • cultural/natural/social phenomena
  • Early retirement is a relatively new phenomenon in Britain.

phenomenon /fəˈnɑːmɪnən/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
something that exists and can be seen, felt, tasted, etc , especially something unusual or interesting Hiện tượng
Ví dụ:
  • Gravity is a natural phenomenon.

physical /ˈfɪzɪkl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
relating to the body (Thuộc) Thân thể, (thuộc) cơ thể, của thân thể.
Ví dụ:
  • physical exercise/fitness/strength/disabilities
  • I'm not a very physical sort of person (= I don't enjoy physical activities).

physician /fɪˈzɪʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a doctor, especially one who is a specialist in general medicine and not surgery Thầy thuốc

pickpocket /ˈpɪkpɑːkɪt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a person who steals money, etc from other people’s pockets, especially in crowded places Kẻ móc túi
Ví dụ:
  • Watch out for pickpockets, especially at the train station

pilot /ˈpaɪlət/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a person who operates the controls of an aircraft, especially as a job (Hàng không) Người lái (máy bay), phi công
Ví dụ:
  • an airline pilot
  • a fighter pilot
  • The accident was caused by pilot error.

pine /paɪn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
an evergreen forest tree with leaves like needles (Thực vật học) Cây thông.
Ví dụ:
  • pine forests
  • pine needles

pioneer /ˌpaɪəˈnɪr/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a person who is one of the first people to do something Người đi tiên phong, người đi đầu (trong một công cuộc gì); nhà thám hiểm đầu tiên
Ví dụ:
  • one of the pioneers of modern science
  • a pioneer in the field of microsurgery

plague /pleɪɡ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to cause pain or trouble to somebody/something over a period of time [synonym] trouble Gây bệnh dịch cho Gây tai hoạ cho, gây tai hại cho, gây tệ hại cho
Ví dụ:
  • Financial problems have been plaguing their new business partners.
  • My shoulder's been plaguing me all week.

plait /plæt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to twist three or more long pieces of hair, rope, etc together to make one long piece Tết, bện
Ví dụ:
  • She plaited the horse's tail.
  • a plaited leather bracelet/belt

plant /plænt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a factory or place where power is produced or an industrial process takes place nhà máy
Ví dụ:
  • a nuclear reprocessing plant
  • Japanese car plants
  • a chemical plant

platform /ˈplætfɔːrm/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a flat raised area or structure Nền, bục, bệ

play /pleɪ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a piece of writing that is intended to be acted in a theatre or on radio or television Kịch, vở kịch, vở tuồng
Ví dụ:
  • a radio play
  • "Did you see the play (= the performance of the play) on Thursday?" "No, I went on Wednesday night
  • "

plough /plaʊ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to dig and turn over a field or other area of land witha large farming tool Cày (một thửa ruộng, một luống cày). Xới (một đường).
Ví dụ:
  • Farmers start ploughing in the spring.
  • We're going to plough the top field next week.
  • Large areas of grazing land have been ploughed up to grow wheat.

poach /poʊtʃ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to catch and kill animals without permission on someone else's land Săn trộm, câu trộm
Ví dụ:
  • The farmer claimed that he shot the men because they were poaching on his land
  • to poach hares — săn trộm thỏ rừng

poacher /ˈpoʊtʃər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
someone who catches and kills animals illegally Người săn trộm, người câu trộm
Ví dụ:
  • The measures are designed to protect the fish from poachers

pocket money /ˈpɑːkɪt mʌni/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(especially British English) (also [allowance] especially in North American English) a small amount of money that parents give their children, usually every week or every month tiền bỏ túi, tiền tiêu vặt
Ví dụ:
  • My dad gives me £5 a week pocket money

pointless /ˈpɔɪntləs/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
having no purpose; not worth doing vô nghĩa, vô dụng
Ví dụ:
  • We searched until we knew it would be pointless to continue.
  • Trying to foresee the future is a pointless exercise.

poisonous /ˈpɔɪzənəs/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
causing death or illness if swallowed or absorbed into the body [synonym] toxic Độc, có chất độc
Ví dụ:
  • poisonous chemicals/plants
  • This gas is highly poisonous.
  • The leaves of certain trees are poisonous to cattle.

polar bear /ˈpoʊlər ber/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a white bear that lives near the North Pole gấu trắng (sống gần Bắc Cực)

pole /poʊl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a long, thin stick of wood or metal, often used standing straight up in the ground to support things cột, sào, cọc chống
Ví dụ:
  • a telegraph/electricity pole
  • A flag fluttered from a 40-foot pole.

pollutant /pəˈluːtənt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a substance that pollutes something, especially air and water Chất gây ô nhiễm (do xe cộ, động cơ thải ra)
Ví dụ:
  • Sulphur dioxide is one of several pollutants that are released into the atmosphere by coal-fired power stations

pollute /pəˈluːt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to add dirty or harmful substances to land, air, water, etc so that it is no longer pleasant or safe to use làm ô nhiễm, gây nhiễm bẩn (nguồn nước, bầu không khí, )
Ví dụ:
  • the exhaust fumes that are polluting our cities
  • The river has been polluted with toxic waste from local factories.

pollution /pəˈluːʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the process of making air, water, soil, etc dirty; the state of being dirty sự ô nhiễm
Ví dụ:
  • air/water pollution
  • to reduce levels of environmental pollution

pomelo /ˈpɑːməloʊ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a fruit similar to a grapefruit but larger and sweeter, with pale green or yellow skin and white flesh Quả bưởi

pond /pɑːnd/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a small area of still water, especially one that is artificial ao
Ví dụ:
  • a fish pond

ponder /ˈpɑːndər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to think about something carefully for a period of time synonym consider suy nghĩ,cân nhắc.
Ví dụ:
  • She sat back for a minute to ponder her next move in the game
  • We intend to ponder all the alternatives before acting
  • They are pondering whether the money could be better used elsewhere
  • ‘I wonder why,’ she pondered aloud.

portable /ˈpɔːrtəbl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
that is easy to carry or to move Có thể mang theo, xách tay Di động.
Ví dụ:
  • a portable TV
  • The equipment is lightweight, portable and easy to store.

portion /ˈpɔːrʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
an amount of food that is large enough for one person Phần, phần chia Phần thức ăn (đựng ở đĩa đem lên cho khách, ở quán ăn).
Ví dụ:
  • She cut the cake into six small portions.
  • You should eat several portions of fruit a day.

portrait /ˈpɔːrtrət/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a painting, photograph, drawing, etc of a person or, less commonly, of a group of people Chân dung, ảnh
Ví dụ:
  • She's commissioned an artist to paint her portrait/paint a portrait of her.
  • He had his portrait painted in uniform.

possibility /ˌpɑːsəˈbɪləti/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a chance that something may happen or be true Sự có thể, tình trạng có thể, khả năng
Ví dụ:
  • It's not likely to happen but I wouldn't rule out the possibility.
  • The forecast said that there's a possibility of snow tonight.

post /poʊst/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a vertical stick or pole stuck into the ground, usually to support something or show a position Cột trụ.
Ví dụ:
  • corner posts (= that mark the corners of a sports field)
  • The team’s ‘net’ was a piece of string tied to two posts.

postgraduate /ˌpoʊstˈɡrædʒuət/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a student who has already received one degree and is studying at a university for a more advanced degree Nghiên cứu sinh (người đang học sau đại học).
Ví dụ:
  • postgraduate students
  • a postgraduate course

postwar /ˈpoʊst. wɔːr/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
happening or existing in the period after a war, especially the First or Second World War Hậu chiến; tồn tại sau chiến tranh, xảy ra sau chiến tranh
Ví dụ:
  • the postwar period of economic expansion — thời kỳ khuếch trương kinh tế sau chiến tranhpostwar developments in industry — những phát triển về công nghiệp thời hậu chiến

potential /pəˈtenʃl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
that can develop into something or be developed in the future [synonym] possible Tiềm tàng
Ví dụ:
  • potential customers
  • First we need to identify actual and potential problems.

poverty /ˈpɑːvərti/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the condition of being extremely poor Sự nghèo nàn; cảnh nghèo nàn, cảnh bần cùng
Ví dụ:
  • He emigrated to Australia to escape the grinding (= very great) poverty of his birthplace.
  • Helping to alleviate poverty in developing countries also helps to reduce environmental destruction.

power /ˈpaʊər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to supply a machine or vehicle with the energy that makes it work Cung cấp lực (cho máy )
Ví dụ:
  • The aircraft is powered by a jet engine.
  • The plant generates enough energy to power a town of 6 000 people.
  • The mill’s machinery is powered by waterwheels.

power plant /ˈpaʊər plænt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a building or group of buildings where electricity is produced nhà máy sản xuất điện

precede /prɪˈsiːd/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to happen before something or come before something/somebody in order Đi trước; đứng trước; đặt trước; ở trước; có trước, đến trước.
Ví dụ:
  • Kofi Annan preceded Ban Ki-moon as the Secretary-General of the UN.
  • It would be helpful if you were to precede the report with an introduction.

predate /ˌpriːˈdeɪt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to have existed or happened before another thing có trước một thứ gì đó khác
Ví dụ:
  • Few of the town's fine buildings predate the earthquake of 1755

predator /ˈpredətər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
an animal that hunts, kills, and eats other animals Thú ăn mồi sống, thú ăn thịt.
Ví dụ:
  • lions, wolves, and other predators

predict /prɪˈdɪkt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to say that something will happen in the future [synonym] forecast Nói trước; đoán trước, dự đoán
Ví dụ:
  • a reliable method of predicting earthquakes
  • Nobody could predict the outcome.

predisposition /ˌpriːdɪspəˈzɪʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the state of being likely to behave in a particular way or to suffer from a particular disease Tình trạng dễ thiên về, khuynh hướng thiên về. (Y học) Tố bẩm (dễ mắc bệnh gì).
Ví dụ:
  • These are parents with a predisposition to worry

prefabricated /ˌpriːˈfæbrɪkeɪtɪd/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
Được làm sẵn, được đúc sẵn
Ví dụ:
  • a prefabricated house
  • Prefabricated houses were quickly put up after the war

prefer /prɪˈfɜːr/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to like one thing or person better than another; to choose one thing rather than something else because you like it better thích hơn, ưa hơn
Ví dụ:
  • ‘Coffee or tea?’ ‘I'd prefer tea, thanks
  • ’
  • The donor prefers to remain anonymous.

prehistoric /ˌpriːhɪˈstɔːrɪk/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
connected with the time in history before information was written down (thuộc} Tiền sử.
Ví dụ:
  • prehistoric man/humans/animals

prejudice /ˈpredʒudɪs/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
an unfair and unreasonable opinion or feeling, especially when formed without enough thought or knowledge Định kiến, thành kiến, thiên kiến
Ví dụ:
  • Their decision was based on ignorance and prejudice
  • I must admit to a prejudice in favour of British universities.

premise /ˈprem. ɪs/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
​to base a theory, argument, etc on an idea, thought, or belief lấy cơ sở cho lời nói, lý thuyết, ý tưởng, của mình dựa trên cái gì đó
Ví dụ:
  • He premised his argument on several incorrect assumptions

prescribe /prɪˈskraɪb/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(of a doctor) to say what medical treatment someone should have (Y học) Cho, kê (đơn )
Ví dụ:
  • I've been prescribed painkillers
  • The doctor prescribed some pills.

prescription /prɪˈskrɪpʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a piece of paper on which a doctor writes the details of the medicine or drugs that someone needs (Y học) Sự cho đơn; đơn thuốc
Ví dụ:
  • The doctor gave me a prescription for antibiotics
  • These drugs are only available on prescription (= with a prescription from a doctor).

presence /ˈprezns/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the fact that someone or something is in a place Sự có mặt
Ví dụ:
  • He hardly seemed to notice my presence.
  • Her presence during the crisis had a calming effect.
  • She was overawed by the presence of so many people.

present /ˈpreznt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(of a person) being in a particular place opposite absent Có mặt, hiện diện.
Ví dụ:
  • Most fathers wish to be present at the birth of their child.
  • There were 200 people present at the meeting.
  • The mistake was obvious to all those present.
  • I wasn’t present when the doctor examined him.

preserve /prɪˈzɜːrv/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to keep something as it is, especially in order to prevent it from decaying or being damaged or destroyed Giữ, giữ gìn, bảo quản, bảo tồn, duy trì
Ví dụ:
  • Carefully follow instructions to preserve foods safely
  • He was anxious to preserve his reputation.

press /pres/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
newspapers and magazines, and those parts of television and radio that broadcast news, or reporters and photographers who work for them Báo chí
Ví dụ:
  • The story was reported in the press and on television.
  • the freedom of the Press/press freedom (= the freedom to report any events and express opinions)

pressing /ˈpresɪŋ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
needing to be dealt with immediately [synonym] urgent Thúc bách, cấp bách, cấp thiết gấp
Ví dụ:
  • I'm afraid I have some pressing business to attend to.
  • The government seems to think that international problems are more pressing than domestic ones.

previously /ˈpriːviəsli/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
at a time before the time that you are talking about Trước, trước đây.
Ví dụ:
  • The building had previously been used as a hotel
  • I had visited them three days previously.

prey /preɪ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
an animal that is hunted and killed for food by another animal động vật bị ăn thịt; con mồi
Ví dụ:
  • A hawk hovered in the air before swooping on its prey

primarily /praɪˈmerəli/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
mainly [synonym] chiefly Trước hết, đầu tiên. Chủ yếu, chính.
Ví dụ:
  • a course designed primarily for specialists
  • The problem is not primarily a financial one.

primary /ˈpraɪmeri/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
main; most important; basic Chủ yếu, chính, bậc nhất.
Ví dụ:
  • The money I earn is extra, my husband's job is our primary source of income

primitive /ˈprɪmətɪv/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
belonging to an early stage in the development of humans or animals Nguyên thuỷ, ban sơ Thô sơ, cổ xưa.
Ví dụ:
  • primitive man

principal /ˈprɪnsəpl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
most important; main Chính, chủ yếu
Ví dụ:
  • Iraq's principal export is oil.
  • He was principal dancer at the Dance Theatre of Harlem.
  • That was my principal reason for moving.

prior /ˈpraɪər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
before a particular time or event trước khi
Ví dụ:
  • the weekprior to her death

prioritize /praɪˈɔːrətaɪz/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to decide which of a group of things are the most important so that you can deal with them first Dành ưu tiên
Ví dụ:
  • You must learn to prioritize your work
  • You should make a list of all the jobs you have to do and prioritize them.

priority /praɪˈɔːrəti/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
something that you think is more important than other things and should be dealt with first Sự ưu tiên; điều được xét trước hết
Ví dụ:
  • Education is a top priority
  • My first/top priority is to find somewhere to live.

prison /ˈprɪzn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a building where people are kept as a punishment for a crime they have committed, or while they are waiting for trial [synonym] jail Nhà tù, nhà lao, nhà giam
Ví dụ:
  • He was sent to prison for five years.
  • She is in prison, awaiting trial.

prisoner /ˈprɪznər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a person who is kept in prison as a punishment, or while they are waiting for trial Người bị giam giữ, người tù; con vật bị nhốt.
Ví dụ:
  • The number of prisoners serving life sentences has fallen.
  • They are demanding the release of all political prisoners.

pristine /ˈprɪstiːn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
fresh and clean, as if new đẹp như mới, nguyên vẹn (đồ vật) sạch tinh khiết (nước)
Ví dụ:
  • The car is in pristine condition.
  • a pristine white tablecloth

privacy /ˈpraɪvəsi/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the state of being alone and not watched or disturbed by other people the state of being free from the attention of the public Sự riêng tư
Ví dụ:
  • The new law is designed to protect people's privacy
  • I hate sharing a bedroom - I never get any privacy.
  • You can close this curtain to give you a little more privacy.

private school /ˈpraɪvət skuːl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a school that receives no money from the government and where the education of the students is paid for by their parents trường tư (học sinh phải tự trả toàn bộ tiền học phí)

probable /ˈprɑːbəbl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
likely to happen, to exist or to be true Có thể có, có khả năng xảy ra, chắc hẳn, có lễ đúng, có lẽ thật
Ví dụ:
  • The probable cause of death was heart failure.
  • An election in June seems increasingly probable.

produce /ˈprɑːduːs/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
food or any other substance or material that is grown or obtained through farming nông sản
Ví dụ:
  • farm produce
  • The shop sells only fresh local produce.

productive /prəˈdʌktɪv/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
doing or achieving a lot [synonym] fruitful làm được nhiều, sản xuất được nhiều, năng suất cao
Ví dụ:
  • In order to turn the deserts into fertile and productive land, engineers built an 800-mile canal.
  • He had an amazingly productive five years in which he managed to write four novels.

profession /prəˈfeʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
any type of work that needs special training or a particular skill, often one that is respected because it involves a high level of education bất kỳ loại công việc nào cần đào tạo đặc biệt hoặc một kỹ năng đặc biệt, thường là được tôn trọng vì nó yêu cầutrình độ học vấn cao
Ví dụ:
  • He left the teaching profession in 1965 to start his own business.
  • The report notes that 40 percent of lawyers entering the profession are women.
  • Teaching as a profession is very underpaid.
  • He's a doctor by profession.

profound /prəˈfaʊnd/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
felt or experienced very strongly or in an extreme way Sâu sắc, hết sức, hoàn toàn
Ví dụ:
  • profound changes in the earth’s climate
  • My father's death had a profound effect on us all.
  • The news came as a profound shock.

progress /prəˈɡres/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to improve or develop over a period of time; to make progress [synonym] advance Tiến tới; tiến bộ; tiến triển, phát triển
Ví dụ:
  • The course allows students to progress at their own speed.
  • Work on the new road is progressing slowly.

projection /prəˈdʒekʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a calculation or guess about the future based on information that you have (Kinh tế học) Sự dự tính, sự dự đoán
Ví dụ:
  • to make forward/backward projections of population figures
  • Sales have exceeded our projections.

prolong /prəˈlɑːŋ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to make something last longer [synonym] extend Kéo dài; nối dài; gia hạn
Ví dụ:
  • The operation could prolong his life by two or three years.
  • We were having such a good time that we decided to prolong our stay by another week.

prominent /ˈprɑːmɪnənt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
easily seen [synonym] noticeable dễ thấy, nổi bật
Ví dụ:
  • The church tower was a prominent feature in the landscape.
  • The story was given a prominent position on the front page.

promote /prəˈmoʊt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to help something to happen or develop Làm tăng tiến, đẩy mạnh, xúc tiến, khuyến khích.
Ví dụ:
  • policies to promote economic growth

propel /prəˈpel/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to push or move something somewhere, often with a lot of force Đẩy đi, đẩy tới ((nghĩa đen) & (nghĩa bóng))
Ví dụ:
  • a rocket propelled through space
  • The Kon-Tiki sailed across the Pacific Ocean propelled by wind power.

property /ˈprɑːpərti/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(formal) a quality or characteristic that something has Đặc tính, thuộc tính, tính chất
Ví dụ:
  • a plant with medicinal properties
  • One of the properties of copper is that it conducts heat and electricity very well.

proportion /prəˈpɔːrʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the number, amount, or level of one thing when compared to another Tỷ lệ
Ví dụ:
  • The proportion of women to men at my college was about five to one
  • Water covers a large proportion of the earth's surface.

proposal /prəˈpoʊzl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a suggestion, sometimes a written one Sự đề nghị, sự đề xuất. Điều đề nghị, dự kiến đề nghị, kế hoạch đề xuất.
Ví dụ:
  • to submit/consider/accept/reject a proposal
  • a proposal to build more office accommodation

propose /prəˈpoʊz/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to offer or suggest a possible plan or action for other people to consider Đề nghị, đề xuất, đưa ra
Ví dụ:
  • I propose that we wait until the budget has been announced before committing ourselves to any expenditure
  • He proposed dealing directly with the suppliers.

proposition /ˌprɑːpəˈzɪʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
an offer or suggestion, usually in business Lời đề nghị, kế hoạch, đề xuất, dự kiến đề ra
Ví dụ:
  • He wrote to me last week regarding a business proposition he thought might interest me.
  • I've put my proposition to the company director for his consideratio

prosecutor /ˈprɑːsɪkjuːtər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a legal official who accuses someone of committing a crime, especially in a law court Công tố viên; kiểm sát viên
Ví dụ:
  • The tape recordings provided prosecutors with the evidence they needed to prove he'd been involved in the conspiracy.
  • a public/state prosecutor

prospect /ˈprɑːspekt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the possibility that something will happen Cảnh, toàn cảnh, viễn cảnh Hy vọng ở tương lai, triển vọng tương lai, tiền đồ.
Ví dụ:
  • Is there any prospect of the weather improving?There seems little prospect of an end to the dispute
  • + that There's not much prospect that this war will be over soon
  • There's every prospect of success.

protest /prəˈtest/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to show that you disagree with something by standing somewhere, shouting, carrying signs, etc : biểu tình
Ví dụ:
  • A big crowd of demonstrators were protesting against cuts in health spending.
  • Outside, a group of students were protesting research cuts.

prototype /ˈproʊtətaɪp/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the first design of something from which other forms are copied or developed mẫu thiết kế đầu tiên, nguyên mẫu
Ví dụ:
  • the prototype of the modern bicycle
  • Scientists have developed a working prototype for a voice translation machine.

provoke /prəˈvoʊk/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to cause a particular reaction or have a particular effect Kích thích, khêu gợi, gây
Ví dụ:
  • The announcement provoked a storm of protest.
  • The article was intended to provoke discussion.
  • Dairy products may provoke allergic reactions in some people.

proximity /prɑːkˈsɪməti/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(to somebody/something) (formal) the state of being near somebody/something in distance or time Trạng thái gần (về không gian, thời gian ))
Ví dụ:
  • a house in the proximity of (= near) the motorway
  • The proximity of the college to London makes it very popular.
  • The area has a number of schools in close proximity to each other
  • The site is in close proximity to an airport

publication /ˌpʌblɪˈkeɪʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a book, magazine, newspaper, or document in which information or stories are published ấn bản, sách báo xuất bản
Ví dụ:
  • Our latest publication is a magazine for health enthusiasts

publicity /pʌbˈlɪsəti/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the activity of making certain that someone or something attracts a lot of interest or attention from many people the attention that is given to somebody/something by newspapers, television, etc. sự quảng bá, sự quảng cáo, sự công bố rộng rãi sự chú ý của báo, đài, truyền thông; sự bàn tán rộng rãi của quần chúng
Ví dụ:
  • He’s in charge of the publicity for next year’s festival
  • He attracted a lot of adverse/bad publicity with his speech about unmarried mothers.

publicize /ˈpʌblɪsaɪz/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to make information about something generally available Đưa ra công khai; làm cho thiên hạ biết đến. Quảng cáo, làm cho mọi người biết.
Ví dụ:
  • He was in London publicizing his new biography of Kennedy.
  • The event was well publicized all over town.
  • The work of the charity has been widely publicized throughout the media.

public school /ˌpʌblɪk ˈskuːl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a free local school paid for by the government trường công (học phí được chính phủ hỗ trợ, hoặc miễn phí)

public transport /ˌpʌblɪk ˈtrænspɔːrt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the system of buses, trains, etc provided by the government or by companies, which people use to travel from one place to another phương tiện giao thông công cộng
Ví dụ:
  • to travel on/by public transport
  • Most of us use public transport to get to work.

publish /ˈpʌblɪʃ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to make information available to people, especially in a book, magazine, or newspaper, or to produce and sell a book, magazine, or newspaper Công bố Xuất bản (sách ).
Ví dụ:
  • The names of the winners of the competition will be published in June.
  • She was only 19 when her first novel was published.

publisher /ˈpʌblɪʃər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a person or company that prepares and prints books, magazines, newspapers or electronic products and makes them available to the public Người xuất bản, nhà xuất bản (sách báo )
Ví dụ:
  • Several publishers are competing in the same market

pumpkin /ˈpʌmpkɪn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a large, round vegetable with hard, yellow or orange flesh Quả bí ngô
Ví dụ:
  • pumpkin pie

punctual /ˈpʌŋktʃuəl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
arriving, doing something, or happening at the expected, correct time; not late Đúng giờ (không chậm trễ).
Ví dụ:
  • He's fairly punctual (= he usually arrives on time)
  • She has been reliable and punctual.
  • Always be punctual for an interview.

punctuality /ˌpʌŋktʃuˈæləti/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the fact of happening or doing something at the agreed or correct time and not being late sự đúng giờ, tính đúng giờ
Ví dụ:
  • There is a bonus scheme for employees who show good performance and punctuality
  • He insists on regular attendance and punctuality.

puncture /ˈpʌŋktʃər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to make a small hole in something; to get a small hole Đâm thủng, châm thủng, chích thủng
Ví dụ:
  • to puncture a tyre
  • She had used a screwdriver to puncture two holes in the lid

punish /ˈpʌnɪʃ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to cause someone who has done something wrong or committed a crime to suffer, by hurting them, forcing them to pay money, sending them to prison, etc. Phạt, trừng phạt, trừng trị
Ví dụ:
  • Those responsible for these crimes must be brought to court and punished.
  • He punished the class by giving them extra work.
  • The oil company was found guilty on ten counts of pollution, and was punished with a $250 million fine.

punishable /ˈpʌnɪʃəbl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(of a crime) that can be punished, especially by law Có thể bị trừng phạt, trừng phạt, đáng trừng trị
Ví dụ:
  • a crime punishable by/with imprisonment
  • Giving false information to the police is a punishable offence.

punishment /ˈpʌnɪʃmənt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the act of punishing someone Sự phạt, sự trừng phạt, sự trừng trị.
Ví dụ:
  • Many people think that the death penalty is too severe a punishment for any crime.
  • It was always our father who administered/meted out punishments.
  • Drink-driving is one case in which severe punishment seems to work as a deterrent

purchase /ˈpɜːrtʃəs/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the act of buying something something that you buy Sự mua, sự tậu được; vật mua được, vật tậu được
Ví dụ:
  • A house is the most expensive purchase that most people ever make
  • How do you wish to pay for your purchases?

pyramid /ˈpɪrəmɪd/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a large building with a square or triangular base and sloping sides that meet in a point at the top The ancient Egyptians built stone pyramids as places to bury their kings and queens kim tự tháp (Ai-cập) (Toán học) Hình chóp.

quaint /kweɪnt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
attractive because of being unusual and especially old-fashioned Có vẻ cổ cổ là lạ; nhìn hay hay là lạ.
Ví dụ:
  • a quaint seaside village

qualification /ˌkwɑːlɪfɪˈkeɪʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
an official record showing that you have finished a training course or have the necessary skills, etc bằng cấp, chứng chỉ
Ví dụ:
  • You'll never get a good job if you don't have any qualifications.
  • Do you have any teaching/academic qualifications?

qualify /ˈkwɑːlɪfaɪ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to reach the standard of ability or knowledge needed to do a particular job (+ for) Có đủ tư cách, có đủ khả năng, có đủ tiêu chuẩn. Qua kỳ thi sát hạch, qua kỳ thi tuyển lựa, tuyên thệ (để đảm nhiệm chức vụ gì ).
Ví dụ:
  • He qualified as a doctor last year
  • She hopes to qualify (as a lawyer) at the end of the year
  • This course qualifies you to teach in any secondary school.

quantify /ˈkwɑːntɪfaɪ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to measure or judge the size or amount of something Xác định số lượng.
Ví dụ:
  • It's difficult to quantify how many people will be affected by the change
  • The risks to health are impossible to quantify.

quantity /ˈkwɑːntəti/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
an amount or a number of something Lượng, số lượng, đại lượng
Ví dụ:
  • a large/small quantity of something
  • enormous/vast/huge quantities of food
  • a product that is cheap to produce in large quantities
  • Is it available in sufficient quantity?

quarry /ˈkwɑːri/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a place where large amounts of stone, etc are dug out of the ground Nơi lấy đá, mỏ đá.
Ví dụ:
  • a granite/limestone/marble/slate quarry

quest /kwest/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a long search for something that is difficult to find, or an attempt to achieve something difficult sự tìm kiếm, theo đuổi, đặc biệt là một thứ khó đạt được, khó tìm thấy
Ví dụ:
  • Nothing will stop them in their quest for truth.
  • + to infinitive She does aerobics four times a week in her quest to achieve the perfect body.

questionable /ˈkwestʃənəbl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
that you have doubts about because you think it is not accurate or correct [synonym] debatable Đáng ngờ, thiếu chắc chắn
Ví dụ:
  • The conclusions that they come to are highly questionable.
  • It is questionable whether this is a good way of solving the problem.

queue /kjuː/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
line of people, cars, etc waiting for something or to do something Hàng (người, xe ô tô ở ngã tư khi có đèn đỏ ) xếp nối đuôi
Ví dụ:
  • There was a long queue of traffic stretching down the road
  • If you want tickets you'll have to join the queue
  • disapproving It makes me mad when someone jumps the queue (= goes straight to the front).

radiation /ˌreɪdiˈeɪʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
powerful and very dangerous rays that are sent out from radioactive substances bức xạ, phóng xạ
Ví dụ:
  • The radiation leak has had a disastrous effect on the environment.
  • It is feared that people living near the power station may have been exposed to radiation.

rapidly /ˈræpɪdli/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
very quickly; at a great rate Nhanh, nhanh chóng, mau lẹ
Ví dụ:
  • a rapidly growing economy
  • Crime figures are rising rapidly

ratchet /ˈrætʃɪt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a wheel or bar with teeth along the edge and a metal piece that fits between the teeth, allowing movement in one direction only bánh cóc

raw /rɔː/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(of materials) in its natural state; not yet changed, used or made into something else Thô, chưa tinh chế, còn nguyên chất, sống
Ví dụ:
  • Oil is an important raw material that can be processed into many different products, including plastics.

realist /ˈriːəlɪst/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a person who accepts and deals with a situation as it really is and does not try to pretend that it is different (người có óc thực tế )
Ví dụ:
  • I'm a realist - I knew there was no way I could win, so I swam for a good finish, for points.

realistic /ˌriːəˈlɪstɪk/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
accepting things as they are in fact and not making decisions based on unlikely hopes for the future (có óc thực tế)
Ví dụ:
  • We have to be realistic about our chances of winning

reality /riˈæləti/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the true situation and the problems that actually exist in life, in contrast to how you would like life to be Sự thực, thực tế, thực tại; sự vật có thực.
Ví dụ:
  • The reality is that there is not enough money to pay for this project.
  • They seemed to have the perfect marriage but the reality was very different.

reality TV /riˌæləti ˌtiː ˈviː/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
television shows that are based on real people (not actors) in real situations, presented as entertainment truyền hình thực tế

rebel /rɪˈbel/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to refuse to obey rules or people in authority Chống đối.
Ví dụ:
  • Jacob rebelled against his parents' plans for him and left school at the age of 16.
  • If you are too strict with teenagers, they often rebel.

rebellious /rɪˈbeljəs/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
unwilling to obey rules or accept normal standards of behaviour, dress, etc Chống đối, hay chống đối. Bất trị, khó trị
Ví dụ:
  • rebellious teenagers
  • Her teachers regard her as a rebellious, trouble-making girl.

recall /rɪˈkɔːl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to remember something [synonym] recollect Nhớ, nhớ lại
Ví dụ:
  • She could not recall his name
  • If I recall correctly, he lives in Luton.
  • "As I recall," he said with some irritation, "you still owe me €150
  • "

recap /ˈriːkæp/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to repeat the main points of an explanation or description Tóm lại, tóm tắt lại
Ví dụ:
  • Finally, the teacher recapped the main points of the lesson.
  • To recap, our main aim is to increase sales by 15 percent this year.

recent /ˈriːsnt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
that happened or began only a short time ago Gần đây, xảy ra gần đây, mới đây, mới xảy ra
Ví dụ:
  • a recent development/discovery/event
  • his most recent visit to Poland
  • There have been many changes in recent years.

receptionist /rɪˈsepʃənɪst/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a person who works in a place such as a hotel, office, or hospital, who welcomes and helps visitors and answers the phone người tiếp tân, người lễ tân

rechargeable /ˌriːˈtʃɑːrdʒəbl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(of a battery) that can be filled again with electrical power Có thể nạp lại
Ví dụ:
  • rechargeable batteries

reckless /ˈrekləs/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
doing something dangerous and not worrying about the risks and the possible results Thiếu thận trọng, khinh suất, liều lĩnh, táo bạo
Ví dụ:
  • He was found guilty of reckless driving
  • He had always been reckless with money.

recklessness /ˈrekləsnəs/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
behaviour that shows a lack of care about danger and the possible results of your actions Tính không lo lắng, tính không để ý tới; tính coi thường Tính thiếu thận trọng, tính khinh suất, tính liều lĩnh, tính táo bạo.
Ví dụ:
  • He was full of boyish recklessness and irresponsibility.

recognition /ˌrekəɡˈnɪʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the act of accepting that something exists, is true or is official Sự công nhận, sự thừa nhận
Ví dụ:
  • a growing recognition that older people have potential too

recollection /ˌrekəˈlekʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the ability to remember something; the act of remembering something [synonym] memory những kỷ niệm, những điều nhớ lại; hồi ký Sự nhớ lại, sự hồi tưởng lại; ký ức, hồi ức.
Ví dụ:
  • I have many pleasant recollections of the time we spent together
  • His powers of recollection are extraordinary.

recommendation /ˌrekəmenˈdeɪʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
advice telling someone what the best thing to do is Sự giới thiệu, sự tiến cử. Sự khuyên nhủ, sự dặn bảo.
Ví dụ:
  • We chose the hotel on their recommendation (= because they recommended it)

reconstruct /ˌriːkənˈstrʌkt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to build or make something again that has been damaged or that no longer exists Xây dựng lại, kiến thiết lại
Ví dụ:
  • Old London Bridge was bought by an American and reconstructed in the US.
  • They have tried to reconstruct the settlement as it would have been in Iron Age times.

recount /rɪˈkaʊnt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to describe how something happened, or to tell a story Thuật kỹ lại, kể lại chi tiết
Ví dụ:
  • He recounted his adventures since he had left home.
  • He was fond of recounting how he had played professional football when he was 19.

recover /rɪˈkʌvər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to become completely well again after an illness or injury to become successful or normal again after being damaged or having problems hồi phục, bình phục, trở lại bình thường
Ví dụ:
  • It took her a long time to recover from/after her heart operation
  • It took a long time for the economy to recover after the slump.

recreation /ˌriːkriˈeɪʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(a way of) enjoying yourself when you are not working Sự giải lao, sự giải trí, sự tiêu khiển.
Ví dụ:
  • His recreations include golf, football and shooting.
  • Emma's only form of recreation seems to be shopping.

recreational /ˌrekriˈeɪʃənl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
connected with activities that people do for enjoyment when they are not working (Thuộc) Sự giải trí, (thuộc) sự tiêu khiển; có tính chất giải trí, có tính chất tiêu khiển.
Ví dụ:
  • recreational activities/facilities
  • These areas are set aside for public recreational use.

recyclable /ˌriːˈsaɪkləbl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
able to be recycled có thể tái chế được
Ví dụ:
  • Glass products are completely recyclable.
  • Paper is easily recyclable.

reduction /rɪˈdʌkʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
an act of making something less or smaller; the state of being made less or smaller Sự thu nhỏ, sự giảm bớt
Ví dụ:
  • a 33% reduction in the number of hospital beds available
  • The report recommends further reductions in air and noise emissions.

redundant /rɪˈdʌndənt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
unnecessary because it isnot needed or useful Thừa, dư
Ví dụ:
  • There’s a lot of redundant information that you could cut out here
  • The picture has too much redundant detail.

refer /rɪˈfɜːr/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to mention or speak about somebody/something Ám chỉ, nói đến, kể đến, nhắc đến
Ví dụ:
  • You know who I'm referring to.
  • She always referred to Ben as ‘that nice man’.
  • The victims were not referred to by name.
  • I promised not to refer to the matter again.

reference /ˈrefrəns/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a mention of something Sự ám chỉ, sự nói đến, sự nhắc đến
Ví dụ:
  • Knowing what had happened, I avoided making any reference to (= mentioning) weddings
  • He made several references to his time in France.

reflect /rɪˈflekt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to show the image of somebody/something on the surface of something such as a mirror, water or glass Phản chiếu, phản xạ, dội lại Phản ánh.
Ví dụ:
  • His face was reflected in the mirror.
  • She could see herself reflected in his eyes.

reflection /rɪˈflekʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
careful thought about something, sometimes over a long period of time Sự suy nghĩ, sự ngẫm nghĩ; snh những ý nghĩ
Ví dụ:
  • She decided on reflection to accept his offer after all.
  • A week off would give him time for reflection.

reform /rɪˈfɔːrm/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to improve a system, an organization, a law, etc by making changes to it Cải cách, cải thiện, cải tạo, cải tổ
Ví dụ:
  • Who will reform our unfair electoral system?
  • He was credited with having reformed the education system.

refuse /ˈrefjuːs/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
waste material that has been thrown away [synonym] rubbish Đồ thừa, đồ thải, đồ bỏ đi; rác rưởi
Ví dụ:
  • domestic/household refuse
  • the city refuse dump
  • refuse collection/disposal

regular /ˈreɡjələr/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
following a pattern, especially with the same time or space in between each thing and the next Đều đều, không thay đổi; thường lệ.
Ví dụ:
  • Her heartbeat was regular.
  • The gardeners planted the trees at regular intervals.
  • I suggest that we have regular meetings/meet on a regular basis.

regulation /ˌreɡjuˈleɪʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
an official rule made by a government or some other authority Điều quy định, quy tắc, điều lệ
Ví dụ:
  • Under the new regulations spending on office equipment will be strictly controlled.
  • the strict regulations governing the sale of weapons

relate /rɪˈleɪt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(formal) to give a spoken or written report of something; to tell a story Kể lại, thuật lại
Ví dụ:
  • She relates her childhood experiences in the first chapters
  • The story relates that an angel appeared and told him to sing.

relation /rɪˈleɪʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a person who is in the same family as somebody else (= relative) Người bà con, họ hàng, thân thuộc
Ví dụ:
  • a close/near/distant relation of mine
  • a relation by marriage
  • a party for friends and relations
  • He's called Brady too, but we're no relation (= not related).

relationship /rɪˈleɪʃnʃɪp/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the way in which two or more things are connected Mối quan hệ, mối liên hệ.
Ví dụ:
  • a father-son relationship
  • I'm not sure of the exact relationship between them—I think they're cousins.

relative /ˈrelətɪv/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a person who is in the same family as somebody else [synonym] relation Bà con thân thuộc, người có họ.
Ví dụ:
  • I don't have many blood relatives (= people related to me by birth rather than by marriage)
  • All her close/distant relatives came to the wedding.

release /rɪˈliːs/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to allow a substance to flow out from somewhere (Hoá học) Làm bay ra, làm thoát ra (hơi)
Ví dụ:
  • Coal power stations release sulphur dioxide into the atmosphere.
  • Hormones are released from glands into the bloodstream.

relegate /ˈrelɪɡeɪt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to put someone or something into a lower or less important rank or position Loại bỏ, bỏ xó, bỏ riêng ra Đẩy xuống vị trí thấp hơn, ít quan trọng hơn.
Ví dụ:
  • She resigned when she was relegated to a desk job.
  • The story was relegated to the middle pages of the paper.

relevant /ˈreləvənt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
connected with what is happening or being discussed Thích đáng, thích hợp; xác đáng.
Ví dụ:
  • Education should be relevant to the child's needs
  • Send me all the relevant information.

reliant /rɪˈlaɪənt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
needing somebody/something in order to survive, be successful, etc. [synonym] dependenton/upon something dựa chủ yếu vào, phụ thuộc vào
Ví dụ:
  • Businesses have become increasingly reliant on complicated computing systems.
  • The service has become heavily reliant on government support.

religion /rɪˈlɪdʒən/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the belief in and worship of a god or gods, or any such system of belief and worship Tôn giáo, đạo; tín ngưỡng
Ví dụ:
  • the Christian religion

remain /rɪˈmeɪn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to still be present after the other parts have been removed, used, etc ; to continue to exist Còn lại
Ví dụ:
  • Very little of the house remained after the fire.
  • Only about half of the original workforce remains.
  • There were only ten minutes remaining.

remedy /ˈremədi/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a successful way of curing an illness Thuốc, phương thuốc; cách điều trị
Ví dụ:
  • an effective herbal remedy for headaches
  • an excellent home remedy for sore throats

reminisce /ˌremɪˈnɪs/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to think, talk or write about a happy time in your past Hồi tưởng, nhớ lại, ôn lại.
Ví dụ:
  • We spent a happy evening reminiscing about the past

remote /rɪˈmoʊt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
far away from places where other people live [synonym] isolated xa xôi, hẻo lánh
Ví dụ:
  • a remote beach
  • one of the remotest areas of the world

remote control /rɪˌmoʊt kənˈtroʊl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a piece of equipment that you hold in your hand and use to control a television, DVD player, etc cái điều khiển từ xa
Ví dụ:
  • Have you seen the remote control for the TV anywhere?

render /ˈrendər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
] (formal) to cause somebody/something to be in a particular state or condition [synonym] make khiến cho thứ gì đó trở nên
Ví dụ:
  • to render something harmless/useless/ineffective
  • Hundreds of people were rendered homeless by the earthquake.
  • His rudeness rendered me speechless
  • New technology has rendered my old computer obsolete.

renewable /rɪˈnuːəbl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(of energy and natural resources) that is replaced naturally or controlled carefully and can therefore be used without the risk of finishing it all (năng lượng) có thể hồi phục lại, có thể tái tạo lại
Ví dụ:
  • renewable sources of energy such as wind and solar power

renovate /ˈrenəveɪt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to repair and improve something, especially a building Làm mới lại, đổi mới; cải tiến, sửa chữa lại. (Kiến trúc) Sửa sang.
Ví dụ:
  • the newly renovated church
  • They spent the summer renovating a farmhouse in Kent.
  • He renovates old houses and sells them at a profit.

repairable /rɪˈperəbl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
that can be repaired [opposite] irreparable Có thể sửa chữa, có thể tu sửa

repercussion /ˌriːpərˈkʌʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
an indirect and usually bad result of an action or event that may happen some time afterwards [synonym] consequence (Nghĩa bóng) Tác động trở lại; hậu quả (Nghĩa đen) Sự dội lại (âm thanh); âm vang, tiếng vọng.
Ví dụ:
  • The collapse of the company will have repercussions for the whole industry
  • Any decrease in tourism could have serious repercussions for the local economy
  • President Kennedy's assassination had far-reaching repercussions.

represent /ˌreprɪˈzent/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to be a sign or symbol of something: Miêu tả, hình dung, thể hiện
Ví dụ:
  • To many people the White House represents the identity of the United States

representation /ˌreprɪzenˈteɪʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the way that someone or something is shown or described a sign, picture, model, etc of something Sự miêu tả, sự hình dung
Ví dụ:
  • He gave a talk on the representation of women in 19th-century art.
  • This statue is a representation of Hercules.

representative /ˌreprɪˈzentətɪv/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a person who has been chosen to speak or vote for somebody else or on behalf of a group Người đại biểu, người đại diện.
Ví dụ:
  • a representative of the UN
  • The committee includes representatives from industry.

reptile /ˈreptaɪl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
any animal that has cold blood and skin covered in scales, and that lays eggs (Động vật học) Loài bò sát
Ví dụ:
  • Snakes, crocodiles and tortoises are all reptiles
  • There was a fashion for keeping reptiles as pets.

reputation /ˌrepjuˈteɪʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the opinion that people have about what somebody/something is like, based on what has happened in the past Tiếng (xấu, tốt ) Thanh danh, danh tiếng.
Ví dụ:
  • The company has a worldwide reputation for quality.
  • She has the reputation of being a good doctor.
  • His reputation was destroyed when he was caught stealing some money
  • The hotel has a bad/good reputation.

research /rɪˈsɜːrtʃ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to study something carefully and try to discover new facts about it Nghiên cứu.
Ví dụ:
  • They're researching into ways of improving people's diet

resemblance /rɪˈzembləns/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the fact of being or looking similar to somebody/something [synonym] likeness Sự giống nhau.
Ví dụ:
  • a striking/close/strong resemblance
  • family resemblances
  • resemblance to somebody/something She bears an uncanny resemblance to Dido.
  • The movie bears little resemblance to the original novel.

resent /rɪˈzent/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to feel bitter or angry about something, especially because you feel it is unfair Phẫn uất, oán giận Phật ý, không bằng lòng, bực bội.
Ví dụ:
  • I deeply resented her criticism.
  • The children resented the new woman in their father’s life.
  • He bitterly resents being treated like a child.
  • She resented him making all the decisions.

reservation /ˌrezərˈveɪʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a feeling of doubt about a plan or an idea sự hoài nghi, sự ngờ vực, sự không chắc chắn
Ví dụ:
  • I have serious reservations about his ability to do the job.
  • Workers and employees shared deep reservations about the wisdom of the government's plans for the industry
  • He accepted my advice without reservation.

reserve /rɪˈzɜːrv/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to ask for a seat, table, room, etc to be available for you or somebody else at a future time [synonym] book Dành trước, giữ trước
Ví dụ:
  • I'd like to reserve a table for three for eight o'clock.
  • I've reserved a room in the name of Jones.

residence /ˈrezɪdəns/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
officially staying or living somewhere ở, cư trú, trú ngụ
Ví dụ:
  • The Queen is in residence at the Palace this week
  • The flag flies when the Queen is in residence.

resist /rɪˈzɪst/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to refuse to accept something and try to stop it from happening [synonym] oppose Kháng cự, chống lại Chịu đựng được, chịu được. Cưỡng lại, không mắc phải.
Ví dụ:
  • to resist change
  • I found the temptation to miss the class too hard to resist.
  • Eric couldn’t resist a smile when she finally agreed.

resistant /rɪˈzɪstənt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
not affected by something; able to resist something Chống cự, kháng cự, đề kháng. Có sức chịu đựng, có sức bền, bền.
Ví dụ:
  • plants that are resistant to disease
  • Mosquitoes are becoming resistant to insecticides.

resolution /ˌrezəˈluːʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the act of [resolving] or ending a problem or difficulty Sự giải quyết (vấn đề, mối nghi ngờ)
Ví dụ:
  • a successful resolution to the crisis
  • The government is pressing for an early resolution of the dispute.

resolve /rɪˈzɔːlv/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to solve or end a problem or difficulty Giải quyết (khó khăn, vấn đề, mối nghi ngờ )
Ví dụ:
  • Have you resolved the problem of transport yet?
  • The couple resolved their differences and made an effort to get along.

respond /rɪˈspɑːnd/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to say or do something as a reaction to something that has been said or done Phản ứng lại. Đáp lại, hưởng ứng (lời kêu gọi, sự đối xử tốt ).
Ví dụ:
  • To every question, he responded "I don't know
  • "
  • I asked her what the time was, but she didn't respond.
  • He responded by marching off and slamming the door behind him.

restrict /rɪˈstrɪkt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to limit the size, amount or range of something Hạn chế, giới hạn, thu hẹp
Ví dụ:
  • Speed is restricted to 30 mph in towns.
  • We restrict the number of students per class to 10.
  • Fog severely restricted visibility
  • Having small children tends to restrict your freedom.

retail /ˈriːteɪl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the activity of selling goods to the public, usually in shops Bán lẻ
Ví dụ:
  • The job is open to applicants with over two years' experience in retail.
  • The clothing company has six retail outlets (= shops) in Perth.
  • $13 off the manufacturer's recommended retail price

retain /rɪˈteɪn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to keep something; to continue to have something [synonym] preserve duy trì, lưu giữ
Ví dụ:
  • The sea retains the sun's warmth longer than the land

retire /rɪˈtaɪər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to stop doing your job, especially because you have reached a particular age or because you are ill/sick; to tell somebody they must stop doing their job Thôi việc; về hưu
Ví dụ:
  • My dream is to retire to a villa in France.
  • He is retiring next year after 30 years with the company.
  • The company's official retiring age is 65.

retirement /rɪˈtaɪərmənt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the act of leaving your job and stopping working, usually because you are old Hưu trí, về hưu, sự thôi (làm việc kinh doanh )
Ví dụ:
  • At 60, he was now approaching retirement.
  • Susan is going to take early retirement (= retire before the usual age).

retract /rɪˈtrækt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to pull something back or in Rụt vào, thụt vào, co vào
Ví dụ:
  • The wheels retract after the aircraft takes off.
  • The cat retracted its claws.

reveal /rɪˈviːl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to make known or show something that is surprising or that was previously secret hé lộ, tiết lộ (bí mật)
Ví dụ:
  • Her biography revealed that she was not as rich as everyone thought
  • He would not reveal where he had hidden her chocolate eggs.

revegetate /rēˈvejəˌtāt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
produce a new growth of vegetation on (disturbed or barren ground) Lại mọc lại, lại sinh trưởng (cây) Lại trồng lại, tái phủ xanh (đồi trọc, đất cằn)
Ví dụ:
  • each spring we revegetate acre after acre with pine seedlings

revelation /ˌrevəˈleɪʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the act of making something known that was secret, or a fact that is made known Sự để lộ, sự tiết lộ, sự phát giác, sự khám phá (vật bị giấu, điều bí mật )
Ví dụ:
  • His wife divorced him after the revelation that he was having an affair.
  • Shocking revelations about their private life appeared in the papers.

reverse /rɪˈvɜːrs/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to change something completely so that it is the opposite of what it was before Đảo ngược, lộn ngược, lật ngượclại
Ví dụ:
  • The new manager hoped to reverse the decline in the company's fortunes.
  • Now that you have a job and I don't, our situations are reversed.

reversible /rɪˈvɜːrsəbl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
có thể đảo ngược được, có thể làm cho trở lại như cũ được
Ví dụ:
  • He believes that climate change may still be reversible.
  • The surgery is not reversible.

review /rɪˈvjuː/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to look again at something you have studied, especially in order to prepare for an exam
Ví dụ:
  • We will be reviewing all the topics covered this semester.

revise /rɪˈvaɪz/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
UK (US review) to study again something you have already learned, in preparation for an exam (xem lại, đọc lại sách hoặc vở, đặc biệt là để ôn tập)
Ví dụ:
  • I spent the weekend revising for my exam.
  • I can't come out tonight
  • I have to revise.

revolution /ˌrevəˈluːʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
one complete circular movement of something, for example a wheel Vòng, tua
Ví dụ:
  • the revolution of the earth around the sun

revolutionize /ˌrevəˈluːʃənaɪz/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to completely change the way that something is done Cách mạng hoá Tạo ra những bước đột phá Tạo ra những thay đổi mang tính cách mạng
Ví dụ:
  • Aerial photography has revolutionized the study of archaeology
  • Newton's discoveries revolutionized physics.
