revolve /rɪˈvɔːlv/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to move or cause something to move around a central point or line Quay tròn, xoay quanh (bánh xe )
Ví dụ:
  • The earth revolves around the sun.
  • The gun turret revolved until the gun was aimed at the advancing soldiers.

rewarding /rɪˈwɔːrdɪŋ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(of an activity, etc ) worth doing; that makes you happy because you think it is useful or important (trải nghiệm, công việc, etc ) đáng giá, đáng làm, không bõ công để làm vì lợi ích mà mình được nhận lại quá xứng đáng
Ví dụ:
  • a rewarding experience/job

rhinoceros /raɪˈnɑːsərəs/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a very large, thick-skinned animal from Africa or Asia that has one or two horns on its nose (Động vật học) Con tê giác
Ví dụ:
  • a population of black/white rhinoceros

rhythm /ˈrɪðəm/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a strong regular repeated pattern of sounds or movements Nhịp điệu (trong thơ nhạc). Sự nhịp nhàng (của động tác ).
Ví dụ:
  • to dance to the rhythm of the music
  • music with a fast/slow/steady rhythm
  • jazz rhythms

rhythmic /ˈrɪðmɪk/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
having a regular pattern of sounds, movements or events Có nhịp điệu. Nhịp nhàng.
Ví dụ:
  • music with a fast, rhythmic beat
  • Do the exercises with slow, rhythmic movements.
  • the rhythmic ticking of the clock

ridiculous /rɪˈdɪkjələs/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
very silly or unreasonable [synonym] absurd, ludicrous Buồn cười, tức cười, lố bịch, lố lăng
Ví dụ:
  • I look ridiculous in this hat.
  • Don't be ridiculous! You can't pay £50 for a T-shirt!

risk /rɪsk/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the possibility of something bad happening (sự rủi ro, sự nguy hiểm)
Ví dụ:
  • There is still a risk that the whole deal will fall through

risk-taker UK US

Định nghĩa:
someone who often takes risks (người hay chơi liều, hay chấp nhận rủi ro để thắng lớn)
Ví dụ:
  • They are risk-takers who either make a lot of money or lose a lot.

rivalry /ˈraɪvlri/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a state in which two people, companies, etc are competing for the same thing Sự cạnh tranh, sự kình địch, sự ganh đua, sự tranh tài, sự đua tài.
Ví dụ:
  • sibling rivalry (= between brothers and sisters)
  • rivalry (with somebody/something) (for something) a fierce rivalry for world supremacy
  • rivalry (between A and B) (for something) There is a certain amount of friendly rivalry between the teams.
  • political rivalries

robotics /roʊˈbɑːtɪks/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the science of designing and operating robots Người máy học; khoa nghiên cứu việc sử dụng người máy (trong (công nghiệp) chế tạo).

rodent /ˈroʊdnt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
any of various small mammals with large, sharp front teeth, such as mice and rats (Động vật học) Loài gặm nhấm

root /ruːt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the part of a plant that grows down into the earth to get water and food and holds the plant firm in the ground Rễ (cây)
Ví dụ:
  • He took hold of the plant's root and pulled.
  • The tree's roots go down three metres.

rosy /ˈroʊzi/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
likely to be good or successful [synonym] hopeful (viễn cảnh) lạc quan, tươi sáng, phủ đầy hoa hồng
Ví dụ:
  • The future is looking very rosy for our company.
  • She painted a rosy picture of their life together in Italy (= made it appear to be very good and perhaps better than it really was).

rotate /ˈroʊteɪt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to move or turn around a central fixed point; to make something do this Quay, xoay quanh
Ví dụ:
  • to move or turn around a central fixed point; to make something do this
  • winds rotating around the eye of a hurricane

rotation /roʊˈteɪʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the action of an object moving in a circle around a central fixed point Sự quay, sự xoay vòng
Ví dụ:
  • the daily rotation of the earth on its axis

rote learning /roʊt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the process of learning something by repeating it until you remember it, rather than by understanding the meaning of it học vẹt, học bằng cách nhắc đi nhắc lại cho đến khi thuộc, thay vì cố gắng hiểu bài
Ví dụ:
  • to learn by rote
  • rote learning

routine /ruːˈtiːn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the normal order and way in which you regularly do things Lề thói hằng ngày; công việc thường làm hằng ngày.
Ví dụ:
  • Make exercise a part of your daily routine
  • We are trying to get the baby into a routine for feeding and sleeping.

run off UK US

Định nghĩa:
(of a liquid) to flow out of a container chảy đi, chảy khỏi

rural /ˈrʊrəl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
connected with or like the countryside liên quan đến nông thôn, thôn dã
Ví dụ:
  • She's carrying out a comparative study of health in inner cities and rural areas.
  • In the rural areas, illiteracy is widespread.

rush /rʌʃ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to move or to do something with great speed, often too fast Vội vã đi gấp.
Ví dụ:
  • Don't rush - take as long as you like.
  • I was rushing along with my head down when I cannoned into an old lady walking the other way.

rush hour /ˈrʌʃ aʊər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the time, usually twice a day, when the roads are full of traffic and trains are crowded because people are travelling to or from work (Giao thông) Giờ cao điểm.
Ví dụ:
  • the morning/evening rush hour
  • Don’t travel at rush hour/in the rush hour.
  • rush-hour traffic

safeguard /ˈseɪfɡɑːrd/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
something that is designed to protect people from harm, risk or danger một thứ được thiết kế để bảo vệ con người/cái gì đó khỏi bị nguy hiểm
Ví dụ:
  • Stronger legal safeguards are needed to protect the consumer.
  • The measures have been introduced as a safeguard against fraud.
  • The disk has built-in safeguards to prevent certain errors.

salary /ˈsæləri/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
money that employees receive for doing their job, especially professional employees or people working in an office, usually paid every month Tiền mà nhân viên nhận được để làm công việc của họ, đặc biệt là nhân viên chuyên nghiệp hoặc những người làm việc trong văn phòng, thường được trả trực tiếp vào tài khoản ngân hàng của họ mỗi tháng
Ví dụ:
  • an annual salary of $40 000
  • a 9% salary increase
  • He gets a basic salary plus commission.

saliva /səˈlaɪvə/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the liquid produced in your mouth to keep the mouth wet and to help to prepare food to be digested Nước bọt, nước dãi

salvage /ˈsælvɪdʒ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to save goods from damage or destruction, especially from a ship that has sunk or been damaged or a building that has been damaged by fire or a flood cứu hàng hoá khỏi bị hư hỏng hoặc bị phá hủy, đặc biệt là từ một chiếc tàu đã bị chìm hoặc từ một tòa nhà đang bị lũ lụt/hoả hoạn
Ví dụ:
  • gold coins salvaged from a shipwreck
  • After the fire, there wasn't much furniture left worth salvaging.

sanction /ˈsæŋkʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a strong action taken in order to make people obey a law or rule, or a punishment given when they do not obey Hình phạt
Ví dụ:
  • Without realistic sanctions, some teachers have difficulty keeping order in the classroom
  • The ultimate sanction will be the closure of the restaurant
  • We now have an effective sanction against the killing of whales.

sane /seɪn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
having a normal healthy mind; not mentally ill [synonym] sound có đầu óc bình thương
Ví dụ:
  • No sane person would do that.
  • Being able to get out of the city at the weekend keeps me sane.

save up UK US

Định nghĩa:
gradually collect money by spending less than you get, usually in order to buy something that you want dành dụm, tích góp tiền bạc, thường là để mua thứ gì đó mình muốn
Ví dụ:
  • It took me months to save up enough money to go travelling.
  • She's saving up for a new bike.

scale /skeɪl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
one of the many very small, flat pieces that cover the skin of fish, snakes, etc Vảy (cá, rắn, cánh sâu bọ)
Ví dụ:
  • The beast was a dragon, with great purple and green scales

scarce /skers/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
Khan hiếm, ít có, thiếu, khó tìm
Ví dụ:
  • Food and clean water were becoming scarce.
  • scarce resources

scenery /ˈsiːnəri/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the general appearance of the natural environment, especially when it is beautiful phong cảnh, cảnh vật
Ví dụ:
  • They stopped at the top of the hill to admire the scenery.

scenic /ˈsiːnɪk/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
having beautiful natural scenery nhiều cảnh vật đẹp đẽ
Ví dụ:
  • an area of outstanding scenic beauty
  • They took the scenic route back to the hotel.

scent /sent/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a pleasant natural smell a smell produced by an animal that acts as a signal to other animals Mùi, mùi thơm, hương thơm Mùi hơi (của thú vật).
Ví dụ:
  • the scent of roses
  • The hounds had lost the scent of the fox near the river.

scheme /skiːm/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a plan or system for doing or organizing something Kế hoạch; âm mưu; mưu đồ; ý đồ
Ví dụ:
  • a local scheme for recycling newspapers
  • o introduce/operate a scheme to improve links between schools and industryUnder the new scheme only successful schools will be given extra funding.

scholarship /ˈskɑːlərʃɪp/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
an amount of money given by a school, college, university, or other organization to pay for the studies of a person with great ability but little money Học bổng.
Ví dụ:
  • He got/won a scholarship to Harvard

science /ˈsaɪəns/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
Khoa học
Ví dụ:
  • new developments in science and technology

science fiction /ˌsaɪəns ˈfɪkʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a type of book, film/movie, etc that is based on imagined scientific discoveries of the future, and often deals with space travel and life on other planets khoa học viễn tưởng

scientific /ˌsaɪənˈtɪfɪk/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
relating to science, or using the organized methods of science liên quan đến khoa học một cách khoa học, có tổ chức
Ví dụ:
  • a scientific discoveryscientific knowledge

scientist /ˈsaɪəntɪst/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a person who studies one or more of the natural sciences (= for example, physics, chemistry and biology) Nhà khoa học; người giỏi về khoa học tự nhiên.
Ví dụ:
  • a research scientist
  • nuclear scientists
  • scientists and engineers

scope /skoʊp/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the range of things that a subject, an organization, an activity, etc deals with Phạm vi, tầm xa (kiến thức)
Ví dụ:
  • I'm afraid that problem is beyond/outside the scope of my lecture.
  • Oil painting does not come within the scope of a course of this kind.

screw /skruː/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a thin, pointed piece of metal with a raised edge twisting round along its length and a flat top with a cut in it, used to join things together, especially pieces of wood Đinh vít, đinh ốc

screwdriver /ˈskruːdraɪvər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a tool with a narrow blade that is specially shaped at the end, used for turning screws cái tua vít

scuba diving /ˈskuːbə daɪvɪŋ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the sport of swimming underwater with special breathing equipment lặn có bình lặn
Ví dụ:
  • to go scuba-diving

sculptor /ˈskʌlptər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
someone who creates sculptures Nhà điêu khắc; thợ chạm
Ví dụ:
  • The sculptor Giovanni Marliano was a native of the city; and some of his works are preserved in the cathedral.

sculpture /ˈskʌlptʃər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a work of art that is a solid figure or object made by carving or shaping wood, stone, clay, metal, etc Công trình điêu khắc
Ví dụ:
  • a marble sculpture of Venus
  • He collects modern sculpture.

secondary school /ˈsekənderi skuːl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a school for young people between the ages of 11 and 18

seek /siːk/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to try to do something [synonym] attempt Mưu cầu, theo đuổi, nhằm vào, cố gắng
Ví dụ:
  • They quickly sought to distance themselves from the protesters
  • They sought to reassure the public.

segment /ˈseɡmənt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a part of something that is separate from the other parts or can be considered separately một khúc, một phân đoạn, một phần
Ví dụ:
  • She cleaned a small segment of the painting.
  • The changes will affect only a small segment of the population.

seldom /ˈseldəm/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
almost never Ít khi, hiếm khi
Ví dụ:
  • Now that we have a baby, we seldom get the chance to go to the cinema.
  • Seldom do we receive any apology when mistakes are made.

self-conscious /ˌself ˈkɑːnʃəs/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
nervous or uncomfortable because you are worried about what people think about you or your actions Ngượng ngùng, e thẹn, lúng túng (trước những người khác).
Ví dụ:
  • He's always been self-conscious about being so short.
  • She was a shy, self-conscious girl.

self-indulgence /ˌself ɪnˈdʌldʒəns/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the quality of allowing yourself to have or do things that you like, especially when you do this too much or too often Sự nuông chiều bản thân quá độ Sự bê tha (thú vui vật chất), sự đam mê lạc thú.
Ví dụ:
  • the self-indulgence of the wealthy middle classes

semi /ˈsemi/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(in adjectives and nouns) half; partly Một nửa Nửa chừng; giữa một thời kỳ. Một phần,Phần nào. Có một vài đặc điểm của.
Ví dụ:
  • semiellipse — nửa enlip
  • semi-annual — nửa năm
  • semi-independent — bán độc lập
  • semi-darkness — sự tối nhá nhem

semi-arid /ˌsemi ˈærɪd/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(of land or climate) dry; with little rain bán hoang mạc, nửa khô hạn

senior /ˈsiːniər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
high or higher in rank;older and more experienced Nhiều tuổi hơn, cao cấp hơn, lâu năm hơn, ở trình độ cao hơn; ở trình độ cao nhất.
Ví dụ:
  • Junior nurses usually work alongside more senior nurses
  • The meeting should be chaired by the most senior person present.

sensational /senˈseɪʃənl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(disapproving) (of a newspaper, etc ) trying to get your interest by presenting facts or events as worse or more shocking than they really are Gây xúc động mạnh làm náo động dư luận, giật gân
Ví dụ:
  • sensational news stories
  • Some of the more sensational newspapers have given a lot of coverage to the scandal.

sensationalist /senˈseɪʃənəlɪst/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
getting people's interest by using shocking words or by presenting facts and events as worse or more shocking than they really are (tính từ) thu hút sự chú ý bằng cách sử dụng từ ngữ gây sốc, hoặc thổi phồng, phóng đại sự việc
Ví dụ:
  • sensationalist headlines

sensationalize /senˈseɪʃənəlaɪz/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(disapproving) to exaggerate a story so that it seems more exciting or shocking than it really is giật tít, phóng đại, bịa đặt, thổi phồng để khiến tin tức giật gân hơn, gây sốc hơn thực tế

serving /ˈsɜːrvɪŋ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
an amount of one type of food that is given to one person Một phần nhỏ thức ăn, thức uống.
Ví dụ:
  • This recipe should be enough for four servings

setback /ˈsetbæk/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a difficulty or problem that delays or prevents something, or makes a situation worse Một trở ngại, khó khăn, thụt lùi
Ví dụ:
  • The team suffered a major setback when their best player was injured.
  • There has been a slight/temporary setback in our plans.

shaft /ʃæft/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(often in compounds) a long, narrow, usually vertical passage in a building or underground, used especially for a lift/elevator or as a way of allowing air in or out Ống thông (hơi, khí); đường thông (cho thang máy qua các tầng gác )
Ví dụ:
  • a lift/elevator shaft
  • a mineshaft
  • a ventilation shaft

shallow /ˈʃæloʊ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
having only a short distance from the top to the bottom disapproving not showing serious or careful thought Nông, cạn Nông cạn, hời hợt.
Ví dụ:
  • The stream was fairly shallow so we were able to walk across it
  • I thought the film was pretty shallow
  • He's physically attractive, but shallow.

share /ʃer/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
one of the equal parts that the ownership of a company is divided into, and that can be bought by members of the public cổ phần
Ví dụ:
  • The value of my shares has risen/fallen by eight percent
  • We have some shares in Apple
  • He invests in stocks and shares
  • share prices

shelf-stacker /ˈʃelf stækər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a person whose job is to fill shelves with goods to be sold, especially in a supermarket Một người mà công việc của họ là xếp hàng, bày hàng lên các kệ để bán, đặc biệt là trong siêu thị
Ví dụ:
  • She got herself a weekend job as a shelf stacker in the local supermarket

shield /ʃiːld/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to protect someone or something Che chở. Bao che, che đậy, lấp liếm.
Ví dụ:
  • She held her hand above her eyes to shield them from the sun
  • The ozone layer shields the earth from the sun's ultraviolet rays.

shift /ʃɪft/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a period of time worked by a group of workers who start work as another group finishes Ca, kíp
Ví dụ:
  • to work an eight-hour shift
  • As the night shift leave/leaves, the day shift arrive/arrives
  • Are you on the night shift or the day shift? (= Do you work during the night period or the day period?)
  • shift workers/work

short-sighted /ˌʃɔːrt ˈsaɪtɪd/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
not thinking carefully about the possible effects of something or what might happen in the future Thiển cận
Ví dụ:
  • It's very short-sighted of the government not to invest in technological research
  • a short-sighted policy

short-term /ˌʃɔːrt ˈtɜːrm/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
lasting a short time; designed only for a short period of time in the future Ngắn hạn, ngắn kỳ (tiền cho vay )
Ví dụ:
  • a short-term loan
  • a short-term solution to the problem

showcase /ˈʃoʊkeɪs/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to show the best qualities or parts of something Jack found a film role that showcased all his talents. giới thiệu, trưng ra, bày ra, thể hiện hết ra
Ví dụ:
  • The main aim of the exhibition is to showcase British design

shuttle /ˈʃʌtl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a vehicle or aircraft that travels regularly between two places xe buýt nhỏ tàu con thoi
Ví dụ:
  • To get across town, you can take the shuttle from Times Square to Grand Central.
  • The American (space) shuttle was able to be used many times to put payloads in space.

sibling /ˈsɪblɪŋ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a brother or sister Anh (chị, em) ruột.
Ví dụ:
  • squabbles between siblings
  • sibling rivalry (= competition between brothers and sisters)
  • The younger children were badly treated by older siblings.
  • poor relationships between siblings

sift /sɪft/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to put flour, sugar, etc through a sieve (= wire net shaped like a bowl) to break up large pieces Giần, sàng, rây
Ví dụ:
  • Sift the flour into a bowl

signify /ˈsɪɡnɪfaɪ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to be a sign of something; to mean là dấu hiệu cho thấy, có nghĩa là
Ví dụ:
  • The white belt signifies that he's an absolute beginner
  • Nobody really knows what the marks on the ancient stones signify

simulate /ˈsɪmjuleɪt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to do or make something that looks real but is not real mô phỏng; dựa theo đội lốt; bắt chước,
Ví dụ:
  • In cheap furniture, plastic is often used to simulate wood
  • The computer simulates (= represents) different road conditions for new drivers to practise on.

simulator /ˈsɪmjuleɪtər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a piece of equipment that is designed to represent real conditions, for example in an aircraft or spacecraft thiết bị mô phỏng
Ví dụ:
  • People learning to fly often practise on a flight simulator

simultaneous /ˌsaɪmlˈteɪniəs/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
happening or done at the same time as something else Đồng thời, cùng một lúc
Ví dụ:
  • There were simultaneous cheers from several parts of the crowd
  • Two children answered the teacher's question simultaneously.

single-sex /ˌsɪŋ. ɡəlˈseks/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
schoolsfor either girls or boys, but not both trường chỉ dành cho một giới (nam hoặc nữ)
Ví dụ:
  • I went to a single-sex school

sizeable /ˈsaɪzəbl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
fairly large [synonym] considerable To, lớn, đáng kể
Ví dụ:
  • The town has a sizeable Sikh population.
  • Income from tourism accounts for a sizeable proportion of the area’s total income.

skeptical /ˈskeptɪkl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
having doubts that a claim or statement is true or that something will happen Hoài nghi, đa nghi, hay ngờ vực
Ví dụ:
  • I am skeptical about his chances of winning.
  • The public remain skeptical of these claims.
  • She looked highly skeptical.

sketch /sketʃ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to make a quick drawing of somebody/something Vẽ phác, phác hoạ (+ out) to give a general description of something, giving only the basic facts phác thảo sơ bộ
Ví dụ:
  • He quickly sketched the view from the window
  • She sketched out her plan for tackling the problem.

skincare /ˈskɪnker/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
things that you do and use to keep your skin healthy and attractive sản phẩm dưỡng da, chăm sóc da
Ví dụ:
  • Spending on hair care and skincare grew 42 percent.
  • a skincare product/regime

skipping meals UK US

Định nghĩa:
to miss a meal (breakfast, lunch, or dinner)

skull /skʌl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the bones of the head that surround the brain and give the head its shape Sọ, đầu lâu.
Ví dụ:
  • She fractured her skull in the accident.
  • The ancient skull of Peking Man has been pieced together from fragments.

skyscraper /ˈskaɪskreɪpər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a very tall building in a city nhà chọc trời (toà nhà hiện đại rất cao ở thành thị)
Ví dụ:
  • He found himself approaching a forest of skyscrapers.
  • On all sides, skyscrapers rose like jagged teeth.

skywards /ˈskaɪwərdz/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
towards the sky; up into the sky Lên trời, hướng về phía bầu trời.
Ví dụ:
  • She pointed skywards.
  • The rocket soared skywards.

slack /slæk/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
not stretched tight [synonym] loose Chùng, lỏng
Ví dụ:
  • These tent ropes are too slack - they need tightening

slate /sleɪt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a dark grey rock that can be easily divided into thin pieces, or a small, thin piece of this used to cover a roof Đá bảng, đá.
Ví dụ:
  • a slate quarry
  • The sea was the colour of slate.

sleepy /ˈsliːpi/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
thanh bình, tĩnh lặng, tẻ nhạt
Ví dụ:
  • They retired to a sleepy little town in the south of Italy

slum /slʌm/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
an area of a city that is very poor and where the houses are dirty and in bad condition Khu nhà ổ chuột
Ví dụ:
  • an inner-city slum
  • She was brought up in the slums of Lima.

smuggler /ˈsmʌɡlər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a person who takes goods into or out of a country illegally Người buôn lậu
Ví dụ:
  • a drug smuggler

smuggling /ˈsmʌɡlɪŋ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the crime of taking, sending or bringing goods secretly and illegally into or out of a country Sự buôn lậu.
Ví dụ:
  • drug smuggling

snorkelling /ˈsnɔːrkəlɪŋ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the activity of swimming while using a snorkel lặn dùng ống thở
Ví dụ:
  • We went snorkelling along the Great Barrier Reef

sobering /ˈsoʊbərɪŋ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
making you feel serious and think carefully Làm bạn cảm thấy nghiêm túc hơn và suy nghĩ cẩn thận hơn
Ví dụ:
  • Surviving a car accident is a sobering experience.
  • It is sobering to realize that this is not a new problem.

so-called /ˌsoʊ ˈkɔːld/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
used to show that you do not think that the word or phrase that is being used to describe somebody/something is appropriate Cái gọi là (dùng để chỉ ra rằng bạn không nghĩ rằng từ hoặc cụm từ đang được sử dụng để mô tả ai đó / cái gì đó là thích hợp)
Ví dụ:
  • the opinion of a so-called ‘expert’
  • How have these so-called 'improvements' helped the local community?
  • t was one of his so-called friends who supplied him with the drugs that killed him.

social /ˈsoʊʃl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
relating to activities in which you meet and spend time with other people and that happen during the time when you are not working Liên quan đến sự giao tiếp giữa người và người; thuộc xã hội.
Ví dụ:
  • Team sports help to develop a child's social skills (= the ability to talk easily to other people and do things in a group).
  • Join a social club to make new friends.

soft drink /ˌsɔːft ˈdrɪŋk/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a cold drink that does not contain alcohol nước uống ngọt không có chứa rượu
Ví dụ:
  • Worldwide, the soft drinks market is totally dominated by just one or two big companies.

solar /ˈsoʊlər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
of or connected with the sun (Thuộc) Mặt Trời, (thuộc) thái dương
Ví dụ:
  • a solar eclipse
  • a solar cell/panel
  • They are searching for intelligent life forms in other solar systems.

solar energy /ˌsoʊ. lɚ ˈen. ɚ. dʒi/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
energy that uses the power of the sun to produce electricity năng lượng mặt trời

solid /ˈsɑːlɪd/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
completely hard or firm all through an object, or without any spaces or holes Rắn, đặc Vững chắc, rắn chắc, chắc nịch.
Ví dụ:
  • The planet Jupiter may have no solid surface at all.
  • The boat bumped against a solid object.

solitary /ˈsɑːləteri/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(of a person or an animal) enjoying being alone; frequently spending time alone thích sống một mình, đơn độc Một mình, cô độc, cô đơn; hiu quạnh, vắng vẻ.
Ví dụ:
  • (of a person or an animal) enjoying being alone; frequently spending time alone

solvent /ˈsɑːlvənt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a substance, especially a liquid, that can dissolve another substance Dung môi
Ví dụ:
  • industrial solvents for removing oil
  • solvent cleaners

sophisticated /səˈfɪstɪkeɪtɪd/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(of a machine, system, etc ) clever and complicated in the way that it works or is presented Tinh vi, phức tạp, rắc rối.
Ví dụ:
  • highly sophisticated computer systems
  • Medical techniques are becoming more sophisticated all the time.

sore /sɔːr/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
painful and uncomfortable because of injury, infection, or too much use Đau, đau đớn
Ví dụ:
  • All the dust has made my eyes sore.
  • I've got a sore back.
  • My feet were sore with all the walking

sound /saʊnd/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
not broken or damaged; healthy; in good condition lành lặn, vững chãi, an toàn
Ví dụ:
  • It's an old building but it's still structurally sound.
  • Considering his age, his body is surprisingly sound.
  • Was she of sound mind (= not mentally ill) at the time of the incident?

soybean /ˈsɔɪˌbin/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a type of bean grown esp in Asia and the US, used as a food for people and animals đậu nành, đậu tương

spacecraft /ˈspeɪskræft/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a vehicle used for travel in space Thiết bị vũ trụ, tàu vũ trụ, phi thuyền không gian
Ví dụ:
  • a manned/unmanned spacecraft (= with/without people inside)

spacious /ˈspeɪʃəs/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(of a room or building) large and with plenty of space for people to move around in [synonym] roomy Rộng lớn, rộng rãi
Ví dụ:
  • The hotel rooms are spacious and comfortable

span /spæn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to last all through a period of time or to cover the whole of it kéo dài trong suốt năm
Ví dụ:
  • His acting career spanned 55 years
  • Tennis has a history spanning several centuries.
  • Her acting career spanned almost six decades.

spare /sper/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
that is not being used or is not needed at the present time Thừa, dư, có để dành. Để thay thế (đồ phụ tùng).
Ví dụ:
  • a spare key/tyre
  • We have a spare room if you want to stay overnight with us.

specialization /ˌspeʃələˈzeɪʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a particular area of knowledge or the process of becoming an expert in a particular area Sự chuyên môn hoá, sự chuyên khoa.
Ví dụ:
  • Specialization (= limiting study or work to one particular area) usually doesn't occur until PhD level.
  • The lawyer said that he was unable to help us because our case fell outside his specialization.

species /ˈspiːʃiːz/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a set of animals or plants in which the members have similar characteristics to each other and can breed with each other (Sinh vật học) Loài
Ví dụ:
  • Mountain gorillas are an endangered species.
  • Over a hundred species of insect are found in this area.

spectacular /spekˈtækjələr/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
very exciting to look at đẹp mắt, ngoạn mục
Ví dụ:
  • a spectacular view
  • He scored a spectacular goal in the second half.
  • There was a spectacular sunset last night.

speculate /ˈspekjuleɪt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to guess possible answers to a question when you do not have enough information to be certain Suy đoán, đưa ra ý kiến này ý kiến nọ về, ước đoán
Ví dụ:
  • I don't know why she did it - I'm just speculating
  • The newspapers have speculated that they will get married next year.

speculation /ˌspekjuˈleɪʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the activity of guessing possible answers to a question without having enough information to be certain Sự suy đoán, sự ước đoán
Ví dụ:
  • Rumours that they are about to marry have been dismissed as pure speculation.
  • News of the president's illness fuelled/prompted speculation that an election will be held later in the year.

spill /spɪl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(especially of liquid) to flow over the edge of a container by accident; to make liquid do this làm tràn, làm đổ, đánh đổ (chất lỏng)
Ví dụ:
  • Water had spilled out of the bucket onto the floor.
  • He startled her and made her spill her drink.

spontaneously /spɑːnˈteɪniəsli/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
happening or done in a natural, often sudden way, without any planning or being forced Tự động, tự ý Tự phát, tự sinh.
Ví dụ:
  • We spontaneously started to dance

spring /sprɪŋ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a piece of curved or bent metal that can be pressed into a smaller space but then returns to its usual shape Lò xo
Ví dụ:
  • bed springsThe springs in the sofa have gone (= they no longer return to their original position)
  • She's full of energy, like a coiled spring.

squeak /skwiːk/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to make a short high sound that is not very loud Tiếng rúc rích, tiếng chít chít (chuột). Tiếng cọt kẹt, tiếng cót két.
Ví dụ:
  • My new shoes squeak.
  • The mouse ran away, squeaking with fear.
  • One wheel makes a horrible squeaking noise.

stable /ˈsteɪbl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
firmly fixed; not likely to move, change or fail [synonym] steady Cân bằng, vững vàng, ổn định (người) Kiên định, kiên quyết.
Ví dụ:
  • stable prices
  • a stable relationship
  • This ladder doesn't seem very stable.
  • The patient's condition is stable (= it is not getting worse).

stadium /ˈsteɪdiəm/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a large sports ground surrounded by rows of seats and usually other buildings sân vận động
Ví dụ:
  • Thousands of fans packed into the stadium to watch the match.
  • the opening of a new national stadium (= where a country's team plays its home games)

staff /stæf/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
all the workers employed in an organization considered as a group Toàn thể cán bộ nhân viên giúp việc, biên chế; bộ phận
Ví dụ:
  • teaching staff
  • We have 20 part-time members of staff.

stage /steɪdʒ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a part of an activity or a period of development Giai đoạn.
Ví dụ:
  • The project is in its final stages and should be completed by August.

staggering /ˈstæɡərɪŋ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
so great, shocking or surprising that it is difficult to believe [synonym] astounding đáng kinh ngạc, gây sốc
Ví dụ:
  • They paid a staggering £5 million for the house
  • It costs a staggering $50,000 per week to keep the museum open to the public.

staircase /ˈsterkeɪs/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a set of stairs inside a building, usually with a bar fixed on the wall or onto vertical poles at the side for you to hold on to Cầu thang
Ví dụ:
  • a marble/stone/wooden staircase
  • She descended the sweeping (= long and wide) staircase into the crowd of photographers and journalists.

standard /ˈstændərd/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
average or normal rather than having special or unusual features Tiêu chuẩn, chuẩn, mẫu
Ví dụ:
  • Televisions are a standard feature in most hotel rooms
  • White is the standard colour for this model of refrigerator.

standard of living /ˌstæn. dɚd əv ˈlɪv. ɪŋ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the amount of money and comfort people have in a particular society
Ví dụ:
  • The standard of living in many developing countries is low.

star /stɑːr/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a very large ball of burning gas in space that is usually seen from the earth as a point of light in the sky at night Sao, ngôi sao, tinh tú
Ví dụ:
  • Stars twinkled above them as they lay on the hill
  • We could see hundreds of stars in the clear desert sky.

stark /stɑːrk/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
very different to something in a way that is easy to see [synonym] clear (Từ mỹ,nghĩa mỹ) Lộ rõ hẳn ra, nổi bật ra
Ví dụ:
  • the differences between rural and urban areaare very stark.
  • The good weather was in stark contrast to the storms of previous weeks.

state /steɪt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to say or write something, especially clearly and carefully Phát biểu, nói rõ, tuyên bố
Ví dụ:
  • Union members stated (that) they were unhappy with the proposal
  • Please state why you wish to apply for this grant.

state-of-the-art /ˌsteɪt əv ði ˈɑːrt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
using the most modern or advanced techniques or methods; as good as it can be at the present time tối tân, hiện đại
Ví dụ:
  • The system was state of the art.
  • a state-of-the-art system
  • The Physics Department has state of the art facilities.

stationary /ˈsteɪʃəneri/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
not moving; not intended to be moved Đứng ở một chỗ, không di chuyển, tĩnh lại, dừng
Ví dụ:
  • I remained stationary
  • a stationary exercise bike
  • Some of the larger birds can remain stationary in the air for several minutes.

statistics /stəˈtɪs·tɪks/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a collection of numerical facts or measurements, as about people, business conditions, or weather số liệu điều tra, số liệu thống kê
Ví dụ:
  • The statistics show that, in general, women live longer than men.

statue /ˈstætʃuː/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
an object made from a hard material, especially stone or metal, to look like a person or animal tượng
Ví dụ:
  • a statue of a boy
  • They planned to put up/erect a statue to the president.

steel /stiːl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a strong metal that is a mixture of iron and carbon, used for making things that need a strong structure, especially vehicles and buildings thép
Ví dụ:
  • The concrete is strengthened with steel rods
  • The gates were locked with a padlock and a heavy steel chain.

steep /stiːp/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(of a slope) rising or falling at a sharp angle dốc
Ví dụ:
  • a steep slope
  • It's a steep climb to the top of the mountain, but the view is worth it.
  • The castle is set on a steep hill/hillside.

stellar /ˈstelər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(specialist) connected with the stars (Thuộc) Sao, (thuộc) tinh tú
Ví dụ:
  • a stellar explosion
  • stellar light

stick /stɪk/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to continue doing something despite difficulties to continue doing or using something and not want to change it Kiên trì, bám vào (cái gì)
Ví dụ:
  • She finds it impossible to stick to a diet
  • He promised to help us and he stuck to his word (= he did as he had promised)
  • ‘Shall we meet on Friday this week?’ ‘No, let's stick to Saturday
  • ’

stimulate /ˈstɪmjuleɪt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to encourage something to grow, develop, or become active Kích thích, khuyến khích.
Ví dụ:
  • Good teachers should ask questions that stimulate students to think

stimulating /ˈstɪmjuleɪtɪŋ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
full of interesting or exciting ideas; making people feel enthusiastic [synonym] inspiring Kích thích, khuyến khích
Ví dụ:
  • The college offers a challenging and stimulating environment in which to study.
  • a stimulating discussionThe classes look attractive and stimulating.

stimulus /ˈstɪmjələs/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
something that produces a reaction in a human, an animal or a plant Sự kích thích; tác dụng kích khích
Ví dụ:
  • sensory/verbal/visual stimuli
  • The animals were conditioned to respond to auditory stimuli (= sounds).

stone /stoʊn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the hard, solid substance found in the ground that is often used for building, or a piece of this Đá, hòn đá, cục đá
Ví dụ:
  • Most of the houses are built of stone.
  • stone walls
  • a stone floor
  • a flight of stone steps

storage /ˈstɔːrɪdʒ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the process of putting and keeping of things in a special place for use in the future Sự xếp vào kho. Kho; khu vực kho.
Ví dụ:
  • We've had to build some cupboards to give us more storage space
  • tables that fold flat for storage

store /stɔːr/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to keep information or facts in a computer or in your brain lưu trữ (thông tin)
Ví dụ:
  • Thousands of pieces of data are stored in a computer's memory

storey /ˈstɔːri/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a level of a building; a floor Tầng, tầng gác.
Ví dụ:
  • (especially US English story)
  • a three-storey houseTheir new house has four storeys including the attic

storytelling /ˈstɔːritelɪŋ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the art of telling stories nghệ thuật kể chuyện
Ví dụ:
  • The celebration will include dance, song, and storytelling
  • She has a gift for storytelling
  • storytelling sessions

straightforward /ˌstreɪtˈfɔːrwərd/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
easy to do or to understand; not complicated Không phức tạp, không rắc rối (nhiệm vụ ).
Ví dụ:
  • Just follow the signs to Bradford - it's very straightforward
  • It's quite straightforward to get here.

strain /streɪn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
pressure on somebody/something because they have too much to do or manage, or something very difficult to deal with the problems, worry or anxiety that this produces gánh nặng, sự căng thẳng, áp lực lớn
Ví dụ:
  • These repayments are putting a strain on our finances
  • The transport service cannot cope with the strain of so many additional passengers.

strategy /ˈstrætədʒi/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a plan that is intended to achieve a particular purpose Chiến lược Kế hoạch.
Ví dụ:
  • to develop a strategy for dealing with unemployment
  • It's all part of an overall strategy to gain promotion.

stretch /stretʃ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a continuous area of land or water quãng (đường); dải, khoảng (đất)
Ví dụ:
  • This particular stretch of coast is especially popular with hikers.
  • Traffic is at a standstill along a five-mile stretch of the ring-road.
  • Some very rare birds inhabit our stretch of the river.

strict /strɪkt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
[of rules, regulations]that must be obeyed exactly Nghiêm ngặt, nghiêm khắc; nghiêm chỉnh
Ví dụ:
  • strict rules/regulations/discipline
  • There are strict guidelines on how the work is to be carried out.
  • She's on a very strict diet.
  • My parents were very strict with me when I was young

striking /ˈstraɪkɪŋ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
very unusual or easily noticed, and therefore attracting a lot of attentio Nổi bật, gây ấn tượng sâu sắc, đập vào mắt
Ví dụ:
  • She bears a striking resemblance to her mother.
  • There's a striking contrast between what he does and what he says he does.

studious /ˈstuːdiəs/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
Enjoy studying or spend a lot of time studying (chăm học, siêng học)
Ví dụ:
  • She was a studious child, happiest when reading

stutter /ˈstʌtər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to have difficulty speaking because you cannot stop yourself from repeating the first sound of some words several times Nói lắp
Ví dụ:
  • ‘W-w-what?’ he stuttered
  • She stutters a little, so be patient and let her finish what she's saying.

subsequent /ˈsʌbsɪkwənt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
happening or coming after something else [opposite] previous Đến sau, theo sau, xảy ra sau
Ví dụ:
  • The book discusses his illness and subsequent resignation from politics.
  • Those explosions must have been subsequent to our departure, because we didn't hear anything.

subsequently /ˈsʌbsɪkwəntli/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
afterwards; later; after something else has happened Rồi thì, rồi sau đó.
Ví dụ:
  • The original interview notes were subsequently lost.
  • Subsequently, new guidelines were issued to all employees.
  • He subsequently became chairman of the party.

substance /ˈsʌbstəns/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a type of solid, liquid or gas that has particular qualities Chất, vật chất
Ví dụ:
  • a chemical/radioactive, etc
  • substance
  • banned/illegal substances (= drugs)
  • a sticky substance

succession /səkˈseʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
happening one after another kế tiếp; liên tiếp
Ví dụ:
  • She had her first three children in rapid succession
  • This is the seventh year in succession that they've won the tournament.

suffer /ˈsʌfər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to experience physical or mental pain Chịu, bị.
Ví dụ:
  • He suffered a massive heart attack

sufficient /səˈfɪʃnt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
enough for a particular purpose; as much as you need Đủ
Ví dụ:
  • Allow sufficient time to get there
  • Our budget is hardly sufficient to pay people, let alone buy any new equipment.

suicide /ˈsuːɪsaɪd/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the act of killing yourself intentionally, or a person who has done this Sự tự sát, sự tự tử, sự tự vẫn.
Ví dụ:
  • The suicide rate among men between the ages of 16 and 25 has risen alarmingly

summarise /ˈsʌməraɪz/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to give a summary of something (= a statement of the main points) Tóm tắt, tổng kết
Ví dụ:
  • The results of the research are summarized at the end of the chapter

sumptuous /ˈsʌmptʃuəs/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
luxurious and showing that you are rich Xa hoa, xa xỉ. Lộng lẫy.
Ví dụ:
  • a sumptuous meal
  • We dined in sumptuous surroundings.
  • The celebrity guests turned up dressed in sumptuous evening gowns.

sun /sʌn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the star that provides light and heat for the earth and around which the earth moves Mặt trời, vừng thái dương. Ánh nắng, ánh mặt trời.
Ví dụ:
  • The sun rises in the east and sets in the west.
  • The sun's rays are at their most powerful at midday.
  • We thought we'd go out for a walk while the sun was shining.

superb /suːˈpɜːrb/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
excellent; of very good quality tuyệt vời, tuyệt hảo, hoàn mỹ
Ví dụ:
  • The car's in superb condition.
  • His performance was absolutely superb.

superficial /ˌsuːpərˈfɪʃl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(often disapproving) not studying or looking at something thoroughly; seeing only what is obvious Nông cạn, hời hợt, thiển cận
Ví dụ:
  • I thought that article was written at a very superficial level
  • The documentary's treatment/analysis of the issues was very superficial
  • I only have a superficial (= slight) knowledge of French.

supply /səˈplaɪ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
an amount of something that is provided or available to be used nguồn cung, nguồn dự trữ, nguồn có sẵn
Ví dụ:
  • The water supply is unsafe.
  • Supplies of food are almost exhausted.

support /səˈpɔːrt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to hold something firmly or carry its weight, especially from below to stop it from falling Chống, đỡ
Ví dụ:
  • The church dome is supported by/on marble pillars.
  • My ankle is weak, so I always put a bandage on it to support it when I play tennis.

suppose /səˈpoʊz/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to think that something is likely to be true cho rằng, tin, nghĩ rằng
Ví dụ:
  • Getting a visa isn't as simple as you might suppose.
  • Prices will go up, I suppose.

surf /sɜːrf/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
large waves in the sea or ocean, and the white foam that they produce as they fall on the beach, on rocks, etc sóng nhào
Ví dụ:
  • the sound of surf breaking on the beach
  • Sydney, surf capital of the world (= where the sport of surfing is very popular)

surface /ˈsɜːrfɪs/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the outside or top layer of something Mặt, mặt ngoài, bề mặt
Ví dụ:
  • an uneven road surface
  • We'll need a flat surface to play the game on.
  • a broad leaf with a large surface area

surfing /ˈsɜːrfɪŋ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the sport of riding on a wave on a special board môn lướt sóng
Ví dụ:
  • to go surfing

surpass /sərˈpæs/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to do or be better than somebody/something Hơn, vượt, trội hơn, vượt qua, vượt mặt
Ví dụ:
  • His time for the 100 metres surpassed the previous world record by one hundredth of a second
  • The book's success has surpassed everyone's expectations
  • The director has really surpassed himself (= done better than he has done before) with this new film.

surround /səˈraʊnd/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to be everywhere around something Bao quanh, vây quanh
Ví dụ:
  • Snow-capped mountains surround the city.
  • Gwen sat at her desk, surrounded by books and papers.

suspect /səˈspekt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to have an idea that something is probably true or likely to happen, especially something bad, but without having definite proof Nghi, ngờ, nghi ngờ, hoài nghi
Ví dụ:
  • If you suspect a gas leak, do not strike a match or even turn on an electric light.
  • Suspecting nothing, he walked right into the trap.

sustain /səˈsteɪn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to cause or allow something to continue for a period of time to keep alive giữ cho ai đó/thứ gì đó sống, cung cấp đủ điều kiện sống/hoạt động cho thứ gì đó
Ví dụ:
  • Which planets can sustain life?
  • The soil in this part of the world is not rich enough to sustain a large population.

sustainable /səˈsteɪnəbl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
that can continue or be continued for a long time có thể duy trì lâu dài được, có thể phát triển lâu bền được
Ví dụ:
  • sustainable economic growth
  • That sort of extreme diet is not sustainable over a long period.

swearing /ˈswerɪŋ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the act of usingrude or offensive language, especially when angry tội nói tục, chửi thề

sweet potato /ˈswiːt pəteɪtoʊ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a pink vegetable that looks like a potato and has yellow or white flesh and a sweet taste khoai lang

switch /swɪtʃ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a change from one thing to another, especially when this is sudden and complete chuyển hẳn sang cái gì đó
Ví dụ:
  • a switch of priorities
  • She made the switch from full-time to part-time work when her first child was born.

syllabus /ˈsɪləbəs/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(a plan showing) the subjects or books to be studied in a particular course Đề cương bài giảng; đề cương khoá học Kế hoạch học tập.
Ví dụ:
  • Which books are on the syllabus this year?

synthetic /sɪnˈθetɪk/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
artificial; made by combining chemical substances rather than being produced naturally by plants or animals synonym man-made Giả tạo, nhân tạo Tổng hợp, hoá hợp.
Ví dụ:
  • synthetic drugs/fabrics
  • synthetic dyes

tabloid /ˈtæblɔɪd/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
newspapers have small pages and short articles with a lot of pictures and stories about famous people, and are often thought of as less serious than other newspapers (nghĩa đen) báo khổ nhỏ (nghĩa bóng) báo chí lá cải, chỉ chuyên đưa tin giật gân, tin về đời tư người nổi tiếng
Ví dụ:
  • a tabloid newspaper
  • the tabloid press
  • tabloid journalists

tackle /ˈtækl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to try to deal with something or someone Xử trí, tìm cách giải quyết (một vấn đề, một công việc)
Ví dụ:
  • There are many ways of tackling this problem.
  • The government is determined to tackle inflation.

take off UK US

Định nghĩa:
(of an aircraft, etc ) to leave the ground and begin to fly cất cánh
Ví dụ:
  • The plane took off at 8
  • 30 a
  • m

takeover /ˈteɪkoʊvər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
an act of taking control of a company by buying most of its shares thương vụ mua lại một công ty khác
Ví dụ:
  • They were involved in a takeover last year

talon /ˈtælən/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a sharp nail on the foot of a bird that it uses when hunting animals Móng, vuốt (chim mồi)

tame /teɪm/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to make a wild animaleasy to control Dạy cho thuần, thuần hoá; làm cho không sợ người, làm cho dạn
Ví dụ:
  • Lions can never be completely tamed
  • Tiger is hard to tame — hổ khó dạy cho thuần

tanker /ˈtæŋkər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a ship or lorry/truck that carries oil, gas or petrol/gas in large quantities Tàu chở dầu, xe tải chở dầu/gas
Ví dụ:
  • an oil tanker

tantrum /ˈtæntrəm/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a sudden period of uncontrolled anger like a young child's Cơn giận, cơn thịnh nộ, cơn tam bành; ăn vạ (trẻ con)
Ví dụ:
  • to have/throw a tantrum
  • Children often have temper tantrums at the age of two or thereabouts.

taxing /ˈtæksɪŋ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
needing a great amount of physical or mental effort [synonym] demanding Gây mệt mỏi; đòi hỏi cố gắng
Ví dụ:
  • a taxing job
  • This shouldn't be too taxing for you.
  • There was nothing intellectually taxing about the exercise.

teenager /ˈtiːneɪdʒər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a person who is between 13 and 19 years old Thiếu niên, thiếu nữ.
Ví dụ:
  • a magazine aimed at teenagers

telegraph /ˈtelɪɡræf/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a method of sending messages over long distances, using wires that carry electrical signals điện báo
Ví dụ:
  • The news came by telegraph
  • telegraph wires

temperament /ˈtemprəmənt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the part of your character that affects your moods and the way you behave Khí chất, tính khí, tính.
Ví dụ:
  • a fiery temperament

tempt /tempt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to be attracted by somebody or something, even if you know it is wrong Cám dỗ, quyến rũ, nhử, làm thèm, gợi thèm. Xúi, xúi giục.
Ví dụ:
  • I was tempted by the dessert menu.
  • Don't tempt thieves by leaving valuables clearly visible.
  • I was tempted to take the day off.

tend /tend/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to be likely to behave in a particular way or have a particular characteristic Có khuynh hướng.
Ví dụ:
  • Women tend to live longer than men

tension /ˈtenʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a feeling of anxiety and stress that makes it impossible to relax stress, lo lắng
Ví dụ:
  • You could feel the tension in the room as we waited for our exam results

terminate /ˈtɜːrmɪneɪt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to end; to make something end Xong, kết thúc, chấm dứt, kết cục, kết liễu
Ví dụ:
  • Your contract of employment terminates in December.
  • The agreement was terminated immediately.

terrestrial /təˈrestriəl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
relating to the Earth (Thuộc) Đất, (thuộc) trái đất. Ở trên mặt đất, ở thế gian.
Ví dụ:
  • a terrestrial habitat
  • terrestrial life

terrific /təˈrɪfɪk/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(informal) excellent; wonderful tốt, tuyệt vời
Ví dụ:
  • I feel absolutely terrific today!
  • That’s terrific news!

thatched /θætʃt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(of a building) having the roof covered with straw or reeds Có mái rạ, có mái tranh, có mái lá; lợp tranh, lợp rạ, lợp lá
Ví dụ:
  • They live in an idyllic country/thatched cottage, with roses around the door

the accused /əˈkjuːzd/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the person who is on trial in a law court Bị cáo
Ví dụ:
  • The accused protested her innocence.
  • The accused were all found guilty

the cost of living UK US

Định nghĩa:
the amount of money you need in order to pay for basic things such as food, clothes, shelter, heating, and transport (chi phí sinh hoạt)

the masses /mæs/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the ordinary people in society who are not leaders or who are considered to be not very well educated quảng đại quần chúng (đặc biệt là những người có trình độ học thức nói chung là không cao)
Ví dụ:
  • government attempts to suppress dissatisfaction among the masses
  • a TV programme that brings science to the masses

the media /ˈmiːdiə/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the main ways that large numbers of people receive information and entertainment, that is television, radio, newspapers and the Internet Hệ thống truyền thông
Ví dụ:
  • the local/national media
  • media attention/coverage/hype/reports
  • The issue has been much discussed in the media.

theme park /ˈθiːm pɑːrk/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a large park where people go to enjoy themselves, for example by riding on large machines such as roller coasters, and where much of the entertainment is connected with one subject or idea công viên giải trí
Ví dụ:
  • a western-style theme park

theoretically /ˌθiːəˈretɪkli/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
in a way that obeys some rules but is not likely Về mặt lý thuyết thì có thể, nhưng ít có khả năng hoạt động được trong thực tế
Ví dụ:
  • It is theoretically possible

therapeutic /ˌθerəˈpjuːtɪk/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
designed to help treat an illness (Y học) (thuộc) phép chữa bệnh
Ví dụ:
  • the therapeutic properties of herbs

thesis /ˈθiːsɪs/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a long piece of writing on a particular subject, especially one that is done for a higher college or university degree Luận văn, luận án.
Ví dụ:
  • Students must submit a thesis on an agreed subject within four years

thorn /θɔːrn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a small, sharp pointed growth on the stem of a plant Gai

threaten /ˈθretn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to be likely to cause harm or damage to something or someone Doạ, đe doạ, hăm doạ ((nghĩa đen) & (nghĩa bóng)).
Ví dụ:
  • A storm was threatening

thrill /θrɪl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a feeling of extreme excitement, usually caused by something pleasant Sự run lên, sự rộn lên, sự rộn ràng (vì sung sướng); sự rùng mình (kinh sợ)
Ví dụ:
  • the thrill of winning a competition
  • It gave me a big thrill to meet my favourite author in person.
  • the thrill of catching a really big fish

throng /θrɔːŋ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(literary) a crowd of people Đám đông
Ví dụ:
  • We pushed our way through the throng.
  • He was met by a throng of journalists and photographers.
  • A huge throng had gathered around the speaker.

thunderstorms /ˈθʌndərstɔːrm/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a storm with thunder and lightning and usually very heavy rain Bão tố có sấm sét
Ví dụ:
  • He slept well, unaware of the thunderstorms which filled the night.
  • The church was struck by lightning during a violent thunderstorm.

thus /ðʌs/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
as a result of something just mentioned [synonym] hence, therefore Vì vậy, vì thế, vậy thì
Ví dụ:
  • He is the eldest son and thus heir to the title.
  • We do not own the building
  • Thus, it would be impossible for us to make any major changes to it.

tidy /ˈtaɪdi/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to make something look neat by putting things in the place where they belong làm cho sạch sẽ, dọn dẹp, sắp xếp gọn gàng, xếp sắp ngăn nắp
Ví dụ:
  • I spent all morning cleaning and tidying.
  • When you cook, could you please tidy up after yourself.

ties /taɪ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
[usually plural] a strong connection between people or organizations (Nghĩa bóng) Mối ràng buộc, quan hệ.
Ví dụ:
  • family ties
  • the ties of friendship
  • economic ties
  • The firm has close ties with an American corporation.

timber /ˈtɪmbər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a long heavy piece of wood used in building a house or ship trees that are grown to be used in building or for making things Cây gỗ Gỗ làm nhà, gỗ kiến trúc, gỗ.
Ví dụ:
  • a timber forest
  • The house has exposed oak timbers.

time-consuming /ˈtaɪm kənsuːmɪŋ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
taking or needing a lot of time Tốn nhiều thời gian, đòi hỏi nhiều thời gian, cần nhiều thời gian.
Ví dụ:
  • a difficult and time-consuming process
  • It’s quite time-consuming having to check all the labels individually.

tingle /ˈtɪŋɡl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to have a feeling as if a lot of sharp points are being put quickly and lightly into your body Có cảm giác ngứa ran, ngứa như có kiến bò Bị kích động, bị kích thích, náo nức, rộn lên.
Ví dụ:
  • My fingers and toes are tingling with the cold.
  • There's a line in that poem that makes my spine tingle every time I read it.
  • She tingled with fear as she entered the dark alleyway.

toddler /ˈtɑːdlər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a child who has only recently learnt to walk Đứa bé đi chập chững.

toiletries /ˈtɔɪlətriz/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
things such as soap or toothpaste that you use for washing, cleaning your teeth, etc. Các vật dụng dùng khi tắm rửa (xà phòng, bàn chải )
Ví dụ:
  • Inside the bag were shampoo and other toiletries.

tolerant /ˈtɑːlərənt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
able to accept what other people say or do even if you do not agree with it Khoan dung, hay tha thứ Kiên nhẫn.
Ví dụ:
  • He has a very tolerant attitude towards other religions

tolerate /ˈtɑːləreɪt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to deal with something unpleasant or annoying, or to continue existing despite bad or difficult conditions Chịu đựng (sự đau đớn, nóng, lạnh )
Ví dụ:
  • These ants can tolerate temperatures that would kill other species
  • Few plants will tolerate sudden changes in temperature.

toll /toʊl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
money that you pay to use a particular road or bridge Thuế qua đường, thuế qua cầu; thuế đậu bến; thuế chỗ ngồi (ở chợ )
Ví dụ:
  • motorway tolls
  • a toll road/bridge

toothache /ˈtuːθeɪk/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a pain in your teeth or in one tooth Đau răng
Ví dụ:
  • I have terribletoothache

tooth decay UK US

Định nghĩa:
Damage that occurs when germs (bacteria) in your mouth make acids that eat away at a tooth Sâu răng

totem pole /ˈtoʊ. t̬əm ˌpoʊl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a tall wooden pole that has symbols and pictures carved or painted on it, traditionally made by Native Americans Cột gỗ cao, khắc hoặc vẽ một loạt các biểu tượng vật tổ

tough /tʌf/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
demanding that particular rules be obeyed and showing a lack of sympathy for any problems or suffering that this may cause nghiêm khắc
Ví dụ:
  • Don't be too tough on him—he was only trying to help.
  • It's about time teachers started to get tough with bullies.

tower /ˈtaʊər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to be much higher or taller than the people or things that are near Vượt hẳn lên, cao hơn
Ví dụ:
  • The new hotel towers over the Shanghai skyline.
  • Although he's only twelve, Davidtowerd over his classmates.

towering /ˈtaʊərɪŋ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
extremely tall or high and therefore impressive Cao, cao ngất, cao vượt hẳn lên
Ví dụ:
  • towering cliffs

trace /treɪs/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to find someone or something that was lost to find the origin of something lần ra dấu vết, theo dấu
Ví dụ:
  • The police are trying to trace the mother of a newborn baby found abandoned outside a hospital
  • The phone company was unable to trace the call
  • No one has yet been able to trace the source of the rumour.

trade /treɪd/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the activity of buying and selling or of exchanging goods or services between people or countries Ngành buôn bán; những người trong ngành buôn bán Thương nghiệp, thương mại, sự buôn bán, mậu dịch.
Ví dụ:
  • Trade between the two countries has increased.
  • the international trade in oil

transaction /trænˈzækʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a piece of business that is done between people, especially an act of buying or selling [synonym] deal Sự quản lý kinh doanh; công việc kinh doanh; sự giao dịch
Ví dụ:
  • financial transactions between companies
  • commercial transactions

transcend /trænˈsend/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to go further, rise above, or be more important or better than something, especially a limit Vượt quá, hơn
Ví dụ:
  • The best films are those which transcend national or cultural barriers.
  • The underlying message of the film is that love transcends everything else.
  • His works by far transcend anything that has gone before
  • What we felt for each other transcended all other emotions.

transform /trænsˈfɔːrm/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to change completely the appearance or character of something or someone, especially so that that thing or person is improved Thay đổi, biến đổi hoàn toàn
Ví dụ:
  • A new colour scheme will transform your bedroom.
  • It was an event that would transform my life.

transition /trænˈzɪʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the process or a period of changing from one state or condition to another Sự chuyển tiếp, sự quá độ.
Ví dụ:
  • the transition from school to full-time work
  • We need to ensure a smooth transition between the old system and the new one.

translate /trænsˈleɪt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to change words into a different language dịch, phiên dịch
Ví dụ:
  • Her books have been translated into 24 languages

translation /trænsˈleɪʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
something that is translated, or the process of translating something sự dịch; bản (bài) dịch
Ví dụ:
  • Students will do one Spanish translation a week

translator /trænsˈleɪtər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a person who translates writing or speech into a different language người dịch, người phiên dịch, người thông dịch
Ví dụ:
  • She works as a translator of technical texts.

treacherous /ˈtretʃərəs/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
hiểm trở, nguy hiểm
Ví dụ:
  • Snow and ice have left many roads treacherous, and drivers are warned to use caution

treadmill /ˈtredmɪl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
an exercise machine that has a moving surface that you can walk or run on while remaining in the same place máy chạy bộ
Ví dụ:
  • I try to do half an hour’s exercise on the treadmill every morning

treatment /ˈtriːtmənt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the use of drugs, exercises, etc to cure a person of an illness or injury (Y học) Sự điều trị; phép trị bệnh
Ví dụ:
  • There are various treatments available for this condition.
  • Guests at the health spa receive a range of beauty treatments.

trend /trend/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a general direction in which a situation is changing or developing khuynh hướng, xu hướng, chiều hướng
Ví dụ:
  • There's been a downward/upward trend in sales in the last few years.

tricky /ˈtrɪki/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(rather informal) difficult to do or deal with Phức tạp, rắc rối (công việc )
Ví dụ:
  • It's tricky to learn to ride a skateboard, but you never forget how.
  • I'm in a tricky situation - whatever I do I'll offend someone.

trigger /ˈtrɪɡər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to make something happen suddenly, to cause something to start gây ra, gây nên.
Ví dụ:
  • Nuts can trigger off a violent allergic reaction
  • to trigger an alarm

tropical /ˈtrɑːpɪkl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
coming from, found in or typical of the tropics (Thuộc) Nhiệt đới
Ví dụ:
  • tropical fish
  • tropical Africa
  • a tropical island

trough /trɔːf/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a low point in a regular series of high and low points điểm thấp
Ví dụ:
  • Investing small amounts regularly is a good way of smoothing out the peaks and troughs of the stock market

trunk /trʌŋk/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the thick main stem of a tree Thân cây
Ví dụ:
  • This tree trunk sounds hollow.
  • The biggest obstacle in our way was a tree trunk in the road.

tumble dryer /ˌtʌmbl ˈdraɪər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a machine that uses hot air to dry clothes after they have been washed máy sấy quần áo

turbine /ˈtɜːrbaɪn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a type of machine through which liquid or gas flows and turns a special wheel with blades in order to produce power (Kỹ thuật) Tuabin, tuốc bin
Ví dụ:
  • a steam turbine
  • a turbine engine

turmoil /ˈtɜːrmɔɪl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a state of great anxiety and confusion [synonym] confusion Sự náo động, sự rối loạn
Ví dụ:
  • Her mind was in (a) turmoil.
  • The country is in a state of political turmoil.

twig /twɪɡ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a small very thin branch that grows out of a larger branch on a bush or tree Cành cây con, nhành cây
Ví dụ:
  • We collected dry twigs to start the fire

tyre /ˈtaɪər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a thick rubber ring that fits around the edge of a wheel of a car, bicycle, etc lốp xe
Ví dụ:
  • a front tyrea back/rear tyreto pump up a tyrea flat/burst/punctured tyre

ubiquitous /juːˈbɪkwɪtəs/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
seeming to be everywhere or in several places at the same time; very common Ở đâu cũng có; hiện diện khắp mọi nơi
Ví dụ:
  • Leather is very much in fashion this season, as is the ubiquitous denim.
  • The mobile phone, that most ubiquitous of consumer-electronic appliances, is about to enter a new age.

ulterior /ʌlˈtɪriər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a secret purpose or reason for doing something (mục đích, động cơ, lý do) giấu kín, không nói ra
Ví dụ:
  • He claims he just wants to help Lisa but I suspect he has an ulterior motive
  • She must have some ulterior motive for being nice to me—what does she really want?

ultimately /ˈʌltɪmətli/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
in the end; finally Cuối cùng, sau cùng, sau rốt
Ví dụ:
  • Ultimately, you'll have to make the decision yourself.
  • A poor diet will ultimately lead to illness.
  • The campaign was ultimately successful.

unassisted /ˌʌnəˈsɪstɪd/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
without being helped by anyone or anything Không được giúp đỡ.
Ví dụ:
  • When will my baby stand unassisted?She decided on an unassisted birth at home
  • unassisted steering

unattainable /ˌʌnəˈteɪnəbl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
impossible to achieve or reach Không thể tới được, không thể đạt được
Ví dụ:
  • an unattainable goal
  • Setting unattainable goals will only lead to frustration.

unbiased /ʌnˈbaɪəst/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
able to judge fairly because you are not influenced by your own opinions [synonym] impartial Không thành kiến. Không thiên vị.
Ví dụ:
  • unbiased advice
  • an unbiased judge
  • opposite biased

uncover /ʌnˈkʌvər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to discover something secret or hidden or remove something covering something else hé lộ, lật tẩy, khám phá ra
Ví dụ:
  • Police have uncovered a plot to kidnap the President's son.
  • The investigation uncovered evidence of a large-scale illegal trade in wild birds.

undertake /ˌʌndərˈteɪk/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to make yourself responsible for something and start doing it Đảm nhiệm, nhận làm, cam kết, kiêm nhiệm
Ví dụ:
  • Students are required to undertake simple experiments
  • University professors both teach and undertake research.

unearth /ʌnˈɜːrθ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to find something in the ground by digging Đào lên, khai quật, bới ra
Ví dụ:
  • Building at the site was halted after ancient artefacts were unearthed earlier this month
  • Police have unearthed a human skeleton.

unfeasible /ʌnˈfiːzəbl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
not possible to do or achieve Không thể thực hành được, không thể thực hiện được, không thể làm được.
Ví dụ:
  • The teachers’ demands were economically unfeasible.

unfold /ʌnˈfoʊld/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
trở nên rõ ràng, trở nên được biết đến
Ví dụ:
  • The audience watched as the story unfolded before their eyes.
  • Dramatic events were about to unfold.

unfortunately /ʌnˈfɔːrtʃənətli/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
used to say that something is sad, disappointing, or has a bad effect (+for sombody) Một cách đáng tiếc, không may
Ví dụ:
  • Unfortunately, I didn't have my credit card with me, or else I would have bought it
  • Unfortunately for him, the police had been informed and were waiting outside.

uninhabitable /ˌʌnɪnˈhæbɪtəbl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
not fit to live in; impossible to live in Không thể ở được, không trú ngụ được, không cư trú được
Ví dụ:
  • The building was totally uninhabitable.
  • houses made uninhabitable by radioactive contamination

uninhabited /ˌʌnɪnˈhæbɪtɪd/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
with no people living there Không có người ở, bỏ không
Ví dụ:
  • an uninhabited island
  • The area is largely uninhabited.
  • They landed on an uninhabited island off the Newfoundland coast.

unintentional /ˌʌnɪnˈtenʃənl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
not done deliberately, but happening by accident Không cố ý, không chủ tâm
Ví dụ:
  • Perhaps I misled you, but it was quite unintentional (= I did not mean to).
  • opposite intentional

universal /ˌjuːnɪˈvɜːrsl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
existing everywhere or involving everyone Thuộc vũ trụ, thuộc thế giới, thuộc vạn vật Toàn bộ, toàn thể, tất cả, chung, phổ thông, phổ biến; vạn năng.
Ví dụ:
  • a universal truth
  • Love and relationships will always be a topic of universal interest
  • Music is often thought of as a universal language.

universe /ˈjuːnɪvɜːrs/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the whole of space and everything in it, including the earth, the planets and the stars Vũ trụ, vạn vật; thế giới, thiên hạ, thế gian
Ví dụ:
  • There are many theories of how the universe began
  • Is there intelligent life elsewhere in the universe?

unleaded petrol /ˌʌnˈledɪd/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(of petrol/gas) not containing lead2 ( and therefore less harmful to the environment (xăng) không pha chì
Ví dụ:
  • Cars these days all use unleaded petrol

unmanned /ˌʌnˈmænd/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
không có người lái
Ví dụ:
  • an unmanned spacecraft
  • an unmanned mission to the planet Mars

unparalleled /ʌnˈpærəleld/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
having no equal; better or greater than any other Vô song, không thể sánh kịp, không thể bì kịp, không gì bằng Chưa hề có, chưa từng có.
Ví dụ:
  • They enjoyed success on a scale unparalleled by any previous rock band

unpleasant /ʌnˈpleznt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
not enjoyable or pleasant Khó ưa, xấu, khó chịu, đáng ghét
Ví dụ:
  • an unpleasant experience
  • The minerals in the water made it unpleasant to drink.

unprecedented /ʌnˈpresɪdentɪd/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
that has never happened, been done or been known before Không hề có; chưa hề thấy, chưa từng nghe thấy; vô tiền khoáng hậu
Ví dụ:
  • The situation is unprecedented in modern times.
  • This century has witnessed environmental destruction on an unprecedented scale.

unproblematic /ˌʌnˌprɑːbləˈmætɪk/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
not having or causing problems không gây rắc rối, không tạo ra vấn đề hay khó khăn gì

unrealistic /ˌʌnriːəˈlɪstɪk/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
having a wrong idea of what is likely to happen or of what you can really do; not based on facts thiếu thực tế, không tưởng
Ví dụ:
  • I think she had unrealistic expectations of motherhood.
  • Expecting four year old children to sit quietly for a whole hour is just completely unrealistic.

unreasonable /ʌnˈriːznəbl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
not fair; expecting too much Vô lý, đòi hỏi quá mức
Ví dụ:
  • The job was beginning to make unreasonable demands on his free time.
  • The fees they charge are not unreasonable.

unrelated /ˌʌnrɪˈleɪtɪd/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
not connected; not related to something else [synonym] unconnected Không có liên quan
Ví dụ:
  • The two events were totally unrelated.
  • In my free time I like to do things that are unrelated to my work.

unresolved /ˌʌnrɪˈzɔːlvd/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(of a problem or question) not yet solved or answered; not having been resolved Chưa được giải quyết (vấn đề), chưa được giải đáp (thắc mắc).
Ví dụ:
  • These unresolved issues must be addressed

unskilled /ˌʌnˈskɪld/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
not having or needing special skills or training không có chuyên môn, không có kỹ thuật (công nhân)
Ví dụ:
  • unskilled manual workers
  • unskilled work
  • opposite skilled

unspoiled /ˌʌnˈspɔɪld/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(of a place) beautiful because it has not been changed or built on (cảnh quan) vẫn còn giữ nguyên vẻ đẹp tự nhiên, chưa bị tác động bởi con người
Ví dụ:
  • unspoiled countryside
  • It’s a country of stunning landscapes and unspoiled beaches.

unsustainable /ˌʌnsəˈsteɪnəbl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
that cannot be continued at the same level, rate, etc [opposite] sustainable không bền vững, không thể duy trì lâu dài được
Ví dụ:
  • unsustainable growth

upbringing /ˈʌpbrɪŋɪŋ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the way in which a child is cared for and taught how to behave while it is growing up Sự giáo dục, sự dạy dỗ (trẻ con).
Ví dụ:
  • to have had a stable upbringing
  • Is it right to say all the crimes he committed were simply the result of his upbringing?

urban /ˈɜːrbən/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
connected with a town or city (liên quan đến) thành phố, đô thị
Ví dụ:
  • damage to both urban and rural environments
  • urban development (= the process of building towns and cities or making them larger)

urbanisation /ˌɜːrbənəˈzeɪʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the process in which towns, streets, factories, etc are built where there was once countryside Sự thành thị hoá
Ví dụ:
  • a time of rapid urbanization and industrialization

urbanization /ˌɜːrbənəˈzeɪʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the process in which towns, streets, factories, etc are built where there was once countryside the process in which more and more people start to live and work in towns and cities rather than in the country sự đô thị hoá
Ví dụ:
  • a time of rapid urbanization and industrialization
  • the increasing urbanization of Africans

urge /ɜːrdʒ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to strongly advise or try to persuade someone to do a particular thing Thúc, thúc giục, giục giã Cố nài, cố gắng thuyết phục.
Ví dụ:
  • She urged him to stay.
  • Police are urging anyone who saw the accident to contact them immediately.

user-friendly /ˌjuːzər ˈfrendli/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
easy for people who are not experts to use or understand Dễ sử dụng cho những người không chuyên môn; không khó, không gây e ngại (nhất là về máy tính, phần mềm của nó )
Ví dụ:
  • What can we do to make the museum more user-friendly?
  • You’ll find this program very user-friendly.

utopian /juːˈtoʊpiən/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
relating to or aiming for a perfect society in which everyone works well with each other and is happy xã hội lý tưởng, xã hội hoàn hảo, xã hội không tưởng
Ví dụ:
  • utopian idealsa utopian society

valid /ˈvælɪd/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
based on what is logical or true Vững chắc, có căn cứ
Ví dụ:
  • She had valid reasons for not supporting the proposals.
  • The point you make is perfectly valid.

valley /ˈvæli/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
an area of low land between hills or mountains, often with a river running through it thung lũng
Ví dụ:
  • a small town set in a valley
  • a wooded valley

value /ˈvæljuː/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to think that somebody/something is important Trọng, chuộng, quý, coi trọng
Ví dụ:
  • I've always valued her advice
  • I really value him as a friend.

vandal /ˈvændl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a person who deliberately destroys or damages public property Người cố tình phá hoại tài sản công hoặc tài sản của người khác
Ví dụ:
  • Vandals smashed windows and overturned cars in the downtown shopping district

vandalism /ˈvændəlɪzəm/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the crime of intentionally damaging property belonging to other people tội cố tình phá hoại tài sản của người khác hoặc phá hoại của công
Ví dụ:
  • Beset by violence and vandalism, this is one of the most unpleasant areas in the city.
  • These schools are known to be vulnerable to vandalism.

vandalize /ˈvændəlaɪz/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to intentionally damage property belonging to other people phá hoại của công / phá hoại tài sản của người khác một cách có chủ ý
Ví dụ:
  • When I got back, my car had been vandalized.
  • Bored teenagers went around vandalizing phoneboxes.

vapour /ˈveɪpər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
gas or extremely small drops of liquid that result from the heating of a liquid or solid Hơi, hơi nước
Ví dụ:
  • water vapour
  • The hollow glass tank contains hot mercury vapour
  • Poisonous vapours burst out of the factory during the accident.

variation /ˌveriˈeɪʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a change, especially in the amount or level of something Sự biến đổi, sự thay đổi Sự khác nhau, sự sai nhau.
Ví dụ:
  • The dial records very slight variations in pressure.
  • A mother's ears are attuned to even the slightest variation in her baby's breathing.

varied /ˈverid/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
containing or changing between several different things or types Lắm vẻ; đầy những đổi thay.
Ví dụ:
  • varied opinions
  • a wide and varied selection of cheeses
  • With its varied climate, the country attracts both winter and summer sports enthusiasts.

variety /vəˈraɪəti/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
several different sorts of the same thing nhiều thứ đa dạng, mớ, vài
Ví dụ:
  • There is a wide variety of patterns to choose from

vegetation /ˌvedʒəˈteɪʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
plants in general, or plants that are found in a particular area Cây cối, cây cỏ, thực vật
Ví dụ:
  • The railway track will have to be cleared of vegetation if it is to be used again.
  • Much of the region's native vegetation has been damaged by developers who are building hotels along the coast.

vehicle /ˈviːəkl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
(rather formal) a thing that is used for transporting people or goods from one place to another, such as a car or lorry/truck Xe, xe cộ. Phương tiện giao thông và vận tải (nói chung)
Ví dụ:
  • motor vehicles (= cars, buses, lorries/trucks, etc
  • )
  • Are you the driver of this vehicle?
  • rows of parked vehicles

venture /ˈventʃər/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a business project or activity, especially one that involves taking risks thương vụ, phi vụ làm ăn (đặc biệt là những thương vụ có yếu tố mạo hiểm)
Ví dụ:
  • A disastrous business venture lost him thousands of dollars
  • There are many joint ventures between American and Japanese companies.

venue /ˈvenjuː/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the place where a public event or meeting happens nơi tổ chức, địa điểm tổ chức sự kiện
Ví dụ:
  • The band will be playing at 20 different venues on their UK tour
  • Please note the change of venue for this event.

verbalise /ˈvɜːrbəlaɪz/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to express your feelings or ideas in words Phát biểu bằng lời nói
Ví dụ:
  • He's a real genius but he has difficulty verbalizing his ideas.
  • She likes verbalizing about art.

verification /ˌverɪfɪˈkeɪʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the act of showing or checking that something is true or accurate [synonym] confirmation Sự thẩm tra. Sự xác minh.
Ví dụ:
  • I've never asked for verification of his resume

verify /ˈverɪfaɪ/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to check that something is true or accurate Thẩm tra, kiểm tra lại Xác minh (lời nói, sự kiện).
Ví dụ:
  • We have no way of verifying his story.
  • Please verify that there is sufficient memory available before loading the program

vermin /ˈvɜːrmɪn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
wild animals or birds that destroy plants or food, or attack farm animals and birds Sâu; vật hại (chồn, chuột )
Ví dụ:
  • On farms the fox is considered vermin and treated as such

vertical /ˈvɜːrtɪkl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
going straight up or down from a level surface or from top to bottom in a picture, etc Thẳng đứng, đứng
Ví dụ:
  • the vertical axis of the graph
  • The cliff was almost vertical.
  • There was a vertical drop to the ocean.

veterinarian /ˌvetərɪˈneriən/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
= vet :a person who has been trained in the science of animal medicine, whose job is to treat animals who are sick or injured bác sĩ thú y
Ví dụ:
  • We had to take the dog to the local vet (veterinarian)
  • The farmer called the vet out to treat a sick cow.
  • The cat injured her paw, so I took her to the vet.

viable /ˈvaɪəbl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
that can be done; that will be successful [synonym] feasible Có thể thành tựu được (kế hoạch)
Ví dụ:
  • In order to make the company viable, it will unfortunately be necessary to reduce staffing levels.
  • I am afraid your plan is not commercially/economically/financially/politically viable.

victim /ˈvɪktɪm/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
a person who has been attacked, injured or killed as the result of a crime, a disease, an accident, etc nạn nhân
Ví dụ:
  • victims of crime
  • She was the innocent victim of an arson attack.

violate /ˈvaɪəleɪt/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
to go against or refuse to obey a law, an agreement, etc. [synonym] flout Vi phạm, xâm phạm
Ví dụ:
  • to violate international law
  • They were charged with violating federal law.

violation /ˌvaɪəˈleɪʃn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the act of going against or refusing to obey a law, an agreement, etc Sự vi phạm, sự xâm phạm; sự làm trái
Ví dụ:
  • She's claiming that her detention by the police was a violation of her human rights.
  • He acted in violation of the law.

virtual /ˈvɜːrtʃuəl/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
made to appear to exist by the use of computer software, for example on the Internet (máy tính) Ảo, chỉ có thể được nhìn thấy qua máy tính
Ví dụ:
  • New technology has enabled development of an online ‘virtual library’
  • virtual shopping

vision /ˈvɪʒn/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
an idea or a picture in your imagination Viễn cảnh, hình ảnh muốn thấy trong tương lai
Ví dụ:
  • He had a vision of a world in which there would be no wars

visual arts /ˌvɪʒ. u. əl ˈɑːrts/ UK US

Định nghĩa:
the arts of painting and sculpture, rather than literature and music [Nghệ thuật thị giác] hay [Nghệ thuật trực quan] - hình thức nghệ thuật tạo ra các sản phẩm bắt nguồn tự nhiên, chủ yếu tác động vào thị giác như đồ gốm, ký họa, hội họa, điêu khắc, kiến trúc, đồ họa in ấn và các nghệ thuật thị giác hiện đại (nhiếp ảnh, phim video và làm phim), thiết kế và thủ công mĩ nghệ
Ví dụ:
  • The visual arts are art forms such as ceramics, drawing, painting, sculpture, printmaking, design, crafts, photography, video, filmmaking, and architecture
  • Many artistic disciplines (performing arts, conceptual art, textile arts) involve aspects of the visual arts as well as arts of other types
